author: {'steamid': '76561198130780248', 'num_games_owned': 378, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1663264444}
review:
[h1] Великолепная игра, [strike] ужасный, отвратный, хуевый [/strike] ЭТО ВООБЩЕ ПОРТ?! [/h1]

Я давно хотел ознакомиться с этой игрой, еще когда лазил по магазину Xbox Live Store в поисках интересных игр и по возможности скачать демку. Скриншоты очень интриговали, очень хотелось поиграть, да вот только ни демки нет, ни как купить не знал (мелкий слишком был для такого). Теперь на дворе 2022 год, и я прошел игру на ПК, перед прохождением имея представление, что меня будет ожидать плохой порт, НО НЕ НА СТОЛЬКО ЖЕ ПЛОХОЙ!

Игру я рекомендую к прохождению - не смотря на просто отвратные анимации (как тел, так и лиц, туда же и хреновый липсинк), одну из самых худших физик машин, с которыми мне приходилось сталкиваться, [b] очень длинные [/b] расстояния между локациями и многие другие агрехи - игра офигенная. Много контента и активностей, классный сюжет, захватывающий и не отпускающий до самого конца, юмор, эмоции и черти что еще - просто классно! Если нравятся детективные истории с примесью паранормальщины (стоит еще учесть, что она тут тоже своеобразная, игру японцы делали как-никак), и хотите, чтоб вы прям ахнули, то очень рекомендую к прохождению.

[h1] НО ОГРОМНОЕ "НО"! ПК-ВЕРСИЮ ПРОХОДИТЬ ТОЛЬКО НА СВОЙ СТРАХ И РИСК![/h1]

Игре почти 10 лет на данный момент, но ее не патчили с НОЯБРЯ 2013 ГОДА! ВОТ ВЫ СЕРЬЕЗНО?! ПОРТ ВООБЩЕ, КАЖЕТСЯ, НЕ ТЕСТИЛИ! 
Стоит запустить игру, так проблемы сразу встречают - когда пререндеренные заставки идут отлично, сама игра люто лагает. Почитал руководства, решается путем включения режима совместимости с Windows XP и установкой на лаунчер галочки, чтоб всегда запускался только от имени администратора - и это сработало, однако вызвало другую проблему...

Камера прицеливания в режиме совместимости с XP [b] очень [/b] ограниченная, ты не можешь прицелиться выше твоей головы или взглянуть на пол (как во всех нормальных играх с механикой стрельбы от третьего лица). Я думал, что так и задумано разработчиками и прошел так больше половины игры, все сильнее и сильнее понимая, что что-то тут не так... В итоге в определенный момент у меня совсем кончилось терпения, ибо это совершенно отвратно. Вновь взглянул на руководства - пишут, что нужно включить совместимость с Windows 98, да вот только с ней у меня вновь фпс уходит в ноль. Писали также, что помогает перезагрузка, но я до последнего не верил в это. Я игру-то иногда сразу запускал после включения компьютера, считай, и так перезагружен... И знаете что? ПЕРЕЗАГРУЗКА ПРОСТО БЛЯТЬ МАГИЧЕСКИЙ БУБЕН КАКОЙ-ТО ДЛЯ ЭТОЙ ИГРЫ - и проблему с прицеливанием исцелила, и игра у меня больше не крашилась с ошибкой вижуала... Это как вообще понимать?

Также игра может крашиться после заставок, но от этого спасает механика с пропуском времени при помощи курения сигарет перед тем, как запустить заставку - прокурил часок игрового времени и вуаля - краша больше не будет. Это я вообще не знаю как комментировать, магия японских сломанных портов начала десятых годов, видимо.

И это те технические проблемы, с которыми столкнулся лично я.  У кого-то могло быть и хуже. Об этом говорит глобальная статистика достижений в стиме - дальше пролога, а то и первого эпизода прошли совсем немногие, а до конца добрались лишь избранные.

Игру к прохождению рекомендую, [b] но не на ПК [/b]. Я максимально серьезно. Пожалеете свои нервы и получите гораздо меньше негативных впечатлений от игры. Игра есть на свиче, но насчет качества порта на него не знаю - если на порт на ПК с 2013 года не обновляли, что можно ожидать от порта 2019 года? Сыграйте лучше в версию на PS3 или Xbox 360 - версии на них гораздо лучше в техническом плане, насколько я знаю. 

[i]Одна из самых офигенных игр, в которые я играл. Наверное, самый худший порт, с которым пришлось столкнуться.[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198402018262', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1513, 'last_played': 1626895582}
review:
[h1] Just call me York, that's what everyone calls me. [/h1]

You'll either love this game or hate it. There is seriously no inbetween. It really depends on your primary expectations from a video game and the things that you're willing to turn your eyes away from. Albeit the story constructs itself around an eerie murder mystery and a bunch of tiny bizarre events and personas, the game does not treat itself that seriously so, at times, neither should you. It's not going to be the most no-nonsense experience, I assure you. You might spot so many details that don't make any sense about the world of this game or the characters that you build a companionship with. Normally, even the awfully odd character designs would be a tip off for me but I won't lie, this game somehow got me hooked after an hour or so. Having played yet another Hidetaka Suehiro murder mystery game beforehand, which was Dark Dreams Don't Die, I figured this experience was probably going to be similarly weird and captivating, so I got even more intrigued. The story has a few holes and some bad apple cliches that honestly spoil the game's complete potential. The mechanics and the interface, and the logic behind them are beyond me as a player and possibly the most impractical I've ever seen. The port itself is a complete wreck and I doubt you'll be able to get this game to work on your first try without editing some files and yada yada yada... I guess the roasting has to end at some point, so I want to say that I'd recommend this game regardless of its shortcomings and poorly designed mechanics because it. Is. Such a thrilling experience. With all of its cinematographical allure, insanely well-written characters and a solid, tempting story, it's just as easy to completely overlook the errors. Ignoring all of its mechanical problems and tiny plot holes here and there, it tells a really capturing 'whodunit' tale that might even stay with you for a while after completion since the tension keeps rising up and down throughout the game. It's a roller coaster, but in the best way possible! Assuming you were victorious in your efforts to get this god-awful port to work properly, (you are one of the selected few) I'd definitely urge you to give this bizarre little game a chance and I hope you enjoy it and cringe along as much as I did. Happy gaming!

review: Having just beaten the game I feel like I can finally give this thing a fair review. First of all, it was a NIGHTMARE getting this thing to run. After a lot of trial and error, I had to use these fixes (https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1957819200) and run the game in windowed mode. Proper windowed mode too, not borderless windowed mode. After finally being able to play for more than about an hour at a time the ball got rolling more smoothly. Overall the story was interesting but the combat was...not so much. I started just ignoring as many enemies as possible about halfway through the game and ignoring combat-related side-missions because they were boring. Still, if you can make it through that, the game is certainly...an experience to be sure. Hard to say just good or bad, but know you're in for some jank and some laughs.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994020145', 'num_games_owned': 1583, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1658260137}
review:
Deadly Premonition is about as close as someone can get to "Twin Peaks: The Video Game" without outright infringing on a copyright. Most reviews are going to mention this fact, and that's because there was no attempt to be subtle about what inspired the game. Many people often place this game into the same "it's so bad, it's good!" box as The Room, but I genuinely believe this game is more than that. The narrative is truly entertaining to watch play out. The writing for every character makes cutscenes a treat to watch. Sidequest dialogue helps further flesh out characters. The soundtrack, albeit limited, adds a lot of charm to the world, including the overly compressed, poorly mixed racing music. Characters are on a schedule, meaning you see them working their jobs, driving around, at their homes, or at bars; something that helps make things feel alive. And while some areas of the game are visually a disaster (because it's a terrible port and was supposed to be a PS2 game with a different name), it's obvious the team really cared about this project.

Now, for as much praise I can give this game, I could also make a giant list with much more talking about what's wrong with the port of this game, but I'll keep it short: Deadly Premonition is one of the worst PC ports on the market. Those low-effort Games for Windows Live ports from over a decade ago don't hold a candle to this. It's impressive how broken this port is and how much people have done to try and get it working so others can enjoy this wonderful game.

Signing up to play the PC port of Deadly Premonition is a lesson in patience. You might as well bookmark PCGamingWiki or one of the numerous Steam troubleshooting guides for this game. It will require you to mess with compatibility settings in-between missions because the game randomly decides to crash while running on your OS, but not when running in compatibility mode for Windows XP or 98. You will need to patch the EXE to increase its memory usage. You will likely need a community profile from the Steam input menu to fix the camera going up or down if you move the analog left or right and vice versa. And you will have to install DPfix, which is basically a mod that tries to fix as much of this game as possible to stop it from crashing every five minutes. And if all of that wasn't ridiculous enough, sometimes you will need to switch to windowed mode because a crash related to a specific thing only happens when in fullscreen. If you don't want to deal with how busted this port is, you have the option of emulating the PS3 or Switch version. It's hilarious and feels almost on-brand that people can run emulated versions of this game with little to no problems.

Everything aside, Deadly Premonition is often on sale for dirt cheap, and even if it's not on sale when you decide to check it out, it is worth every penny. Whether painstakingly getting this port to work or emulating it, everyone owes it to themselves to experience this game at least once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009106252', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1656512664}
review:
[h1] A game best described with the saying 
"An ugly face only a mother could love" [/h1]

[u] Pre-requisites to playing this game [/u]
1. An open mind
2. A strong sense of patience
3. A love for B-Movie and B-movie tropes
4. A particular taste for good biscuits and coffee

[u] Why it's good [/u]
- The plot is amazing
- The characters are fantastic
- Nothing makes sense
- The spooky atmosphere is always present

 [u] Why it's bad [/u]
- Combat is crap
- Game is clunky
- Hell lot of bugs (fixable)

[u] In conclusion[/u]

Deadly Premonition is understandably known as a cult classic in the video game world due to its bad but good aspect.
If you can go through the head-scratch inducing, confusion of the first act. You will greatly appreciate the charm that this small game can offer.

[b] Totally recommended 10/10 [/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198097365246', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 95, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 95, 'last_played': 1656453914}
review:
i don't write reviews usually, so just the fact that I'm going through the hassle of doing one for this porting should give you a hint on how much outraged I am.

This is, by far, the worst pc porting of all time. Literally NOTHING works.

When you open it for the first time, you are welcomed with a window with a small art of the game and the settings, in the style of 2000 games. That is the first red flag you get aside from the "mixed" reviews on Steam.
When you press "play", the game will just crash instead of starting, because apparently you need to give the .exe admin permissions (lol). 
Even after that:
-The game doesn't adequately support controllers: I have a wireless one, if it turns off during a cutscene, the game won't pick it up when I turn it on again
-The maximum resolution is 720p
-Audio is completely fucked up if you have 5.1 or 7.1 surround
-You cannot change control inputs from inside the game, you have to exit and restart to do so
-The game randomly crashes
-Full of bugs
-If you alt-tab it literally freezes the screen
-If you start it from the steam library it freezes steam and sometimes make it crash

This porting is a glorious dumpster fire. Don't even bother buying it on sale.

I ended up uninstalling it because it was ruining the whole gaming experience. I had to buy it again on Nintendo Switch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052360295', 'num_games_owned': 381, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1138, 'last_played': 1656252487}
review:
[h1][b]Вступ[/b][/h1] 
Особлива гра, яку можна рекомендувати ігровим авантюристам. Лише вони зможуть проковтувати це гі*но заради унікальності. Ти згоден, Зак?
                                  	
[h1][b]✨ Здивувало[/b][/h1] 
[list]
[*][b]Надзвичайний сюжет[/b]
Це ігровий атмосферний «Твін Пікс», але більш шалений. Детективна частина гри – одна з найоригінальніших в цьому медіа. Розслідування вбивства дівчини в тихому місті зачаровує сміливими натяками на вбивцю, таємничістю історії та емоційним підґрунтям сценарію. Закінчується сюжет одночасно очікувано та неочікувано, глобально та локально. Але скажу одне – такого ви ніде більше не бачили. 

[*][b]Неповторні персонажі[/b]
Вони – головна родзинка всієї гри. Головний герой – дуже і дуже цікава, кумедна, розумна та просто крута особистість, про яку хочеш бачити повноцінний серіал. Всі інші персонажи також мають свої незвичні примхи та якості, за які їх легко запям’ятовуешь і закохуєшься. Cаме вони роблять детективну історію настільки інтригуючою, в кожного з героїв віриш. 

[*][b]Чарівна музика[/b]
Це щось нереальне. Саундтрек – дуже яскравий та виразний. І навіть кумедний, бо бадьорі треки можуть вставити в зовсім дивні сцени; я, наприклад, завжди покачував від радощів головою вліво-вправо, коли вмикали Life is Beautiful (веселе таке насвистування). Серйозні треки теж дивують своїм вмінням дістати потрібні емоції зі сцени та гравця, сильно занурюють в ігрові ситуації. 


[/list]
[h1][b]❌ Засмутило[/b][/h1]
[list]	
[*][b]Часті вильоти[/b]
Їх дуже багато. Вони, звичайно ж, бісять, а один у мене був взагалі вічно на одному моменті. Щоб його виправити прийшлося йти на сторінку гри в PCGamingWiki, де я знайшов рішення – «покури три-чотири години в кафе, перед тим як активувати кат-сцену». Геніально. Підбадьорює одне – зберігатися дають доволі часто.   

[*][b]Ніякий екшн[/b]
Він лише на рівнях з потойбічним світом і всі ці рівні – це дійсно якесь пекло для гравця. Мені вічно здавалися непотрібними ці затягнуті бігання по коридорам з кривою стрільбою в однакових зомбі. Після проходження гри я в мережі знайшов причину цієї нісенітниці. Виявляється, все це додали в останню чергу після прохання видавцю, який хвилювався, що через відсутність екшну гравці в США не оцінюють гру…

[/list]
[h1][b]Висновок[/b][/h1]
Дивовижна пригода, яку портить страшезний техн. стан. Але потворні анімації та інші проблеми маркнуть на тлі блискучих діалогів, гумору та драми.

І так, щоб гра інколи нормально працювала потрібна ставити фанатський збірник патчів з “посібників” Steam ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

★★★☆☆

author: {'steamid': '76561198017986736', 'num_games_owned': 2317, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1656145141}
review:
Drakengard is a weird thing to exist, man.

The gameplay is terrible. The music is terrible. The characters are terrible and terribly written, as is the plot. By all accounts the game should have nothing going for it whether you’re a pure gamer or after some kind of story-telling experience.

But people don’t remember Drakengard for what it wasn’t, that being good; people remember Drakengard for what it was, that being COMPLETELY INSANE.

Everyone in Drakengard is a dick. EVERYONE. You play as a mass murderer psychically linked with a misanthropic dragon. Your sister’s a passive waif and your best friend’s a moron who trades away his singing voice for his own dragon from a 6-year-old little girl who is actually possessed by a god. You hang out with a cannibal, a pedophile, an immortal runt, and an alarmingly racist member of the clergy. By the end of it you’ve racked up about as many kills as the sum of the first world war SINGLE-HANDEDLY, so much so that the evil empire can’t even one up you by inventing nuclear weapons (which they do) and drop them (which they do) from their flying continental fortress (which they have) before they summon pan-dimensional space babies (which exist) to kill everyone (which they accomplish).

The final battle has you hurling an alien deity through a rip in the fabric of space time to engage them in a rhythm battle over a monochromatic Tokyo, after which you get shot down by the Japanese air force and proceed to infect the entire world (our world) with magical aids that either kills you or turns you into a bloodthirsty salt giant. Yes, really.

Drakengard is a terrible game, but it is nonetheless a compellingly bizarre thing to exist.

The voice acting is terrible, i'm talking pulling people in off the street terrible.

There are random sounds that make absolutely no sense such as squirrels screaming like chimpanzees in a cut scene at the very start of the game.

review:
Sí, recomiendo Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut, la versión de PC. Sí está rota, pero es la que posee el mejor framerate de entre todas las versiones, sobre todo si la comparamos con la de PS3, la cuál es horrible y hasta el día de hoy siento los mareos que me dieron esos tremendos bajones. Existen numerosos parches creados por la comunidad que harán que este juego funcione mejor.

Ahora, hablando de la obra en sí misma, es un juego que está fuertemente inspirado en Twin Peaks, una de mis series favoritas, y la cantidad de referencias a esta me hace lucir una sonrisa muy a menudo, pero este juego no es una copia descarada al trabajo de David Lynch, puesto que posee una enorme cantidad de elementos que lo vuelven un trabajo único en su clase, si estás dispuesto a lidiar con las animaciones tan extrañas que tiene junto con el atroz diseño de sonido.

Su precio me parece muy razonable para lo que es: un paquete bastante grande que ha sobrevivido al borde de la cancelación hasta el momento de su lanzamiento, así que no hay pierde.

Sin más que decir, adelante, Zach. Ha llegado el momento de resolver el misterio que se oculta en las profundidades de este título. ¡Bienvenido a Greenvale!

review:
I am unable to move the protagonist from his place. I enter the menu and, at the slightest touch, the inventory scan shoots out uncontrollably. I exit the menu and I still can't move the character, who wobbles at the start as if he was groggy. All this while the game runs at 14fps on a computer capable of running modern titles like silk.

There are old games with clunky controls that I love. There are also indies and austere games that I love, and even poor games. But this is not even a broken game. I cannot control the character and having searched for a FIX that supposedly solves these details has not helped.

Please try to play it on Xbox360 or PS3. Right now I'm looking for a way to refund the game. I think I'll have to watch its gameplay on YouTube to find out why it's so popular.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071567735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1654383421}
review:
I understand some people say this game is unique on its own and is a parody of horror games. Barely anything was hilarious in this game tbh. It was interesting but not worth playing through.

Pros:
-Unique gameplay and story. Character too. Really weird.
-Lots of characters to check out. Some interesting ones here and there.
-Gameplay is just passable.
-Puzzles are just okay. Easy to figure out.
-Animations are a bit funky and character expressions are hilarious.

Cons:
-Enemies can just shoot you even while staggered and the gun isn't pointed at you. Real dumb.
-Most likely Windows 10 issue but performance along with bugs makes this game a huge pain. Need to apply patches and stuff to make it playable. And there are still crashes.
-Make sure to limit the game to 60fps. Animations and missions get kinda screwed if you don't.

Game constantly had crashes so I stopped playing now. Decided to just check out a full playthrough on youtube instead...

author: {'steamid': '76561198444229048', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 1746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1746, 'last_played': 1653908854}
review:
Zach, ¿Cómo hago para recomendar este juegazo?

No puedo, simplemente no puedo. Se me crasheo muchas veces, tuve que recurrir a reiniciar la Pc a cada rato,  guardar constantemente y recurrir a la "solución" de poner al personaje a fumar antes del momento que el juego crasheara y aún así tuve que perderme la mitad de dos capítulos y usar archivos de guardado de otros jugadores ya que era imposible avanzar sin eso. Tuve que prescindir de las misiones secundarias y solo enfocarme en la historia principal...

Y luego pasa que la historia de este juego es demasiado buena y prácticamente carrea todo el juego. No quiero hacer spoiler, por ende diré que el juego presenta una excelente historia de terror, misterio y hasta momentos de humor te mete por ahí. Le sienta muy bien la influencia de la gran serie Twin Peaks.

Okay dejamos eso de lado. Pero es que el gameplay del juego es mediocre, pero por algún motivo te acostumbras y lo empiezas a disfrutar.  Luego vienen mas problemas técnicos, los malos gráficos, la pobre optimización, los problemas con los efectos sonoros. Y con todo eso, de alguna manera le vas encontrando un encanto al juego aún con todos estos defectos.

Es que creo que soy masoquista porque pese a todo esto disfrute demasiado del juego, de su historia, sus personajes, su terror, su humor, su música, hasta de su gameplay... En conclusión un juego tan de culto, tan de autor como este, con un montón de defectos que harán que mas de alguno no quiera seguir jugando, no me es posible recomendarlo... ¿O quizás si? ¿Qué opinas Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198016954277', 'num_games_owned': 401, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1660399954}
review:
At first, the DP PC port's technical issues made me :(
but after hours of troubleshooting, I discovered how to make this port "stable" in "4" "easy" steps. I haven't had any crashes or instability in a while :)

[h1]0) This should come pre-installed with the game at this point[/h1]
Download DPfix by Durante and install in the Deadly Premonition folder, we are never launching this through steam. DPfix.ini is the only way to have graphics options

[h1]1) Compatibility mode[/h1]
Before playing the game, set DP.exe and DPlauncher.exe to run as administrator. Check if the game can launch.
If no; set DPfix.ini to have the game run windowed (not fullscreen or borderless windowed). Check if the game can launch
If no; launch DP.exe directly
If no; set both DP.exe and DPlauncher.exe in compatibility mode for: Windows 8 -> 7 -> XP (breaks aiming, toggle lock-on to fix) -> 98/ME (sets the game to run on 1 core, how exciting!), try launching both from the launcher and DP.exe directly
If still no; it ends here, I'm sorry.

[h1]2) This game crashes when it uses >2GB of RAM[/h1]
Download CFF Explorer, part of the Explorer Suite by NTcore.
Make a copy of DP.exe and save for backup. Open the original DP.exe in CFF Explorer.
On the left side; click File Header
Right side; click "Click Here" in the Characteristics row. In the pop-up window, tick "This app can handle >2gb address space"
Close the pop-up, then click File > Save.

[b]This fixes a vast majority of crashes relating to cutscenes and scene transitions[/b]

[h1]3) Controls[/h1]
If you play on KB+M, attempt to play the game! If not:

[h1]3 - Prefix)[/h1]
Deadly Premonition's PC port reversed the X and Y axis on its controller support. Meaning that up/down = left/right respectively. It's really awesome and in the spirit of the game's programming typos, since Coffee (Black) costs 31.50 while Coffee (Milk) costs 13.50

[h1]3 - 0)[/h1]
Steam -> Settings -> Controller -> General Controller Settings
Tick "Xbox Configuration Support"

DPlauncher.exe -> Setting -> tick "Controller". Map your controls here as well when done setting up

[h1]3a) Xbox controllers:[/h1]
I have not found a remapper yet that lets you *remap analog directions*, only ones that let you invert controls or swap L/R stick functions

launch DP.exe and open steam overlay, then click Controller Configuration.

Search for the "Deadly Premonition Controller+" config by theraineydaze
Unfortunately, it turns the right analog stick into a binary input, so it's either no input or maximum input. But you get used to it :)

[h1]3b) DS4/5 controllers:[/h1]
Download DS4windows and make a new profile emulating a 360 controller
Bind right analog stick to:
Up = Left (-X)
Down = Right (+X)
Left = Up (-Y)
Right = Down (+Y)

Save and make sure DS4windows is running (it says "Stop" in the lower right of the window if it is)

Open the windows control panel -> Hardware and Sound -> Devices and Printers -> Right click a controller and click "Game Controller Settings" -> Advanced -> Set "Preferred Device" to the 360 controller

You can use a steam preset still if you want, but this way lets you have full right stick analog control

[h1]4) Cut your CPU in half*[/h1]
[b]Disable hyperthreading / simultaneous multithreading (SMT) in your BIOS.[/b]
Look up the steps how to do so for your motherboard.

Deadly Premonition does NOT know how to handle threading at all and a HUGE amount of glitches result from this, such as falling through the world while drving, having the world stop loading, randomly freezing and hard crashing your PC, etc.
Essentially, the PC port likes to bit-flip [i]its self[/i]

Also disable steam overlay after setting up your controller if applicable. This game is held together with wishes and prayers, any amount of potential instability should be avoided.

*disabling Hyperthreading/SMT does not actually cut your CPU in half. Recommended to disable this feature anyway both due to a potential exploit using your CPU cache when it's enabled, and for stability with a lot of x32/x84 applications and running things like BlueStacks

[h1]Screeching Cars[/h1]
There's severe incompatibilities with any audio set up besides Stereo and Windows' default audio driver.
If you have screeching cars, blown out audio coming from different speakers, and/or constant footsteps behind you, try:

1) Set Windows audio to stereo

2) Disable any non-windows audio software (such as a virtual audio cable, or motherboard specific programs like Sonic Studio with Asus)

3) Unplug your extra speakers, if applicable.

4) Restart your PC if still not fixed.

5) Reinstall Deadly Premonition as a last resort.

[h1]Do I actually recommend the PC port when you have to do this?[/h1]
No.
These steps don't even fix all the bcrashes. You still need to smoke a cigarette after interrogating Nick to avoid crashing when leaving the diner (save before talking to Olivia), and there's still some random crashes like going to the graveyard at certain times of day (?). But there's no more runtime errors, so it makes the game [i]playable[/i]

edit: forgot to actually review the game. It's a very uncanny, light hearted, "Horror" game, with a protagonist that is equally full of "Facts and Logic" as he is "Insanity," in a world that can't take its self seriously. A murder scene gets upstaged by "Life is Beautiful", and York recalling the case where a guy used human skulls as cups is immediately overshadowed by the fact he's comparing this to shoplifting and bar brawls.

The PC port, all things considered, also has the best audio mixing. For example, the 360 version has no directional audio, only left and right.

If you're a fan of Twin Peaks, you are probably going to find things to enjoy here. It's also very reminiscent of "Mizurna Falls" for the PSX if you're a fan of obscure Japan-only games, just in a post-RE4 world.

Сюжет про ритуальные жертвоприношения людей,  серийного убийцу и паранормальщину постоянно разбавляется веселой музыкой и шутеечками.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033452755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 3860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3860, 'last_played': 1651169871}
review:
Это очень странная игра. Почему? Например, вы играете за детектива с раздвоением личности, который постоянно разговаривает со своим альтер-эго и всем окружающим на это в принципе наплевать. И это только один из многих десятков приколов.

Игра, на самом деле, всем своим видом говорит - я треш. Дешево, нелепо, смешно, убого. Но интересно и сделано не на отвали - этим игра не дает себя причислить просто к трешу, но остается на него похожа.

Графика довольно слабая, но местами симпатичная. Главный герой приятный на вид, Эмили милашка, остальные персонажи в целом норм. Музыка неплохая, но не цепляющая, даже композиции с голосами как-то не зашли, хотя я обычно такое очень люблю. 

Геймплей с одной стороны разнообразный: вы путешествуете по довольно большому городу с кучей НПС, многие из которых дают вам свои квесты. Периодически продвигаетесь по сюжету, убивая всякую нечисть, которая появляется в “потустороннем мире”. Также вы едите, спите, меняете костюмы, бреетесь, катаетесь на тачках и играете в мини-игры. С другой стороны это разнообразие быстро приедается, потому что процессы начинают очень часто повторяться без какой-либо для этого необходимости. Например, когда вы ищите улики, вы должны сделать так называемое профилирование - столько раз, сколько улик. В итоге вы 3-4 раза повторяете одну и туже сцену, каждый раз когда находите очередную улику. Зачем? Создатели решили, что это интересно. Спойлер: нет. 

Отдельно расскажу про квесты. Они также повторяются - вам нужно 4 или 5 раз возить сумасшедшую бабульку и в итоге вы так и не узнаете, что скрывается в ее кастрюле (скорее всего ее мозги). Три раза будете передвигать ящики. Ну и т.д. Есть конечно интересные квесты, но им также часто не хватает логики. Из хорошего могу отметить историю Генерала (несмотря на также повторяющиеся квесты), историю Ника и его жены, ну и несколько других. Самое худшее в выполнении этих квестов - они часто привязаны ко времени и к определенным главам, поэтому если вы хотите их выполнить - не идите дальше по сюжету, пока их не завершите. Вы можете игнорировать время, отведенное на решение сюжетного задания и выполнить его на следующий день. Просто сосредоточьтесь на второстепенном квесте. А условия для его выполнения вам придется угадывать самостоятельно. Во сколько часов прийти в какую локацию - думаете вам скажут или хотя бы дадут подсказку? Нет, угадывайте сами или смотрите спойлеры. Я в основном справился со всем сам, несколько квестов пропустил, а к нескольким все же посмотрел подсказки.

Тем не менее, геймплей поначалу затягивал, хотя под конец настолько стал бесить, что мне даже не хотелось выполнять последние квесты (свою роль сыграла и сюжетная развязка о которой расскажу чуть дальше). Про геймплей скажу только еще, что враги безумно однообразны - всю игру одни зомбаки 3-4 видов, выбор оружия также довольно скуден (хотя более-менее), а управление самое ужасное в истории геймдейва. Например, последнего босса убить НЕВОЗМОЖНО было не установив совместимость с Windows98, так как камера не поворачивалась под нужным для его убийства углом. А еще ненавистные и бесконечные QTE, настолько неинтересные, настолько навязчивые и настолько частые, что я бы сказал, что Deadly Premonition является игрой с самыми убогими QTE, которые мне довелось увидеть. Чудовищно унылые сцены с чуваком в красном дождевике (чье поведение очень сильно похоже на пирамидоголового) это еще цветочки. Ягодки будут в финале. Все это превращает геймплей в настоящую пытку. 

Атмосфера в игре достаточно странная. Из-за огромного количества условностей и повторений проникнуться ей довольно сложно, но она все же присутствует.

Сюжет также очень специфичен. Несмотря на кровавое убийство с которого игра начинается, первая половина довольно забавная и веселая. Но ближе к последней четверти игры начинается полная жесть и, поверьте, лучше вам этого не видеть. Выбор? Забудьте. Возможность не совершить чудовищную глупость? Нет. Получить в финале полный трындец? Так оно и будет. Наслаждайтесь, если любите пострадать, этого удовольствия там будет сполна. Не могу сказать, что я очень переживал за героев, но… все же мне было неприятно от того, как сценаристы с ними обошлись. Я люблю драмы, но тут… я не увидел необходимости в том, чтобы делать именно такой сюжет и достаточной логики в нем. Скорее, было похоже просто на какое-то извращение. 

Резюме:
Графика 6/10
Музыка 6/10
Геймплей 4/10
Сюжет 7/10
Атмосфера 6/10
Итог 6/10

Трешня из которой могла бы получиться классная игра, если бы руки разработчиков росли из нужного места.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013194190', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1652553866}
review:
tl;dr: This game makes any EA launch title look like the Mona Lisa.

Remember in Metal Gear Solid when the game deliberately starts to glitch out and act like you just bricked your console? This game feels exactly like that from start to finish. 

Sometimes I can't tell if the game is bugging out on me or if it's part of the cryptic environment it's trying to portray. A few examples:

[list]
[*]Are the colors intentionally washing out on my screen or is it the stamina mechanic telling me I need to stop to catch my breath? 
[*]Why is this joyful tune that sounds like taken out of a Blue's Clues episode playing while I'm in a morgue investigating a murder victim? -- Did I leave YouTube open in the background again?
[*]Did that enemy just just clip through the floor and sent my car flying like a rocket or is it one of its offensive abilities?[/list] 

The game clearly draws a lot of inspiration from Twin Peaks; Not just in an Alan Wake type of inspiration, but literally copy/pasting some of the peculiar characters that made Twin Peaks so great. I.e. The oddball FBI agent with a fascination for coffee? Check. The shy and clumsy police officer? Check. The log lady? Check. A town with a backstory of lumber mills? Check. A red room in your dreams? Check. 

Swery, the director, took the Twin Peaks blueprint (too literally at times) and applied Phil Swift's Flex Tape on it in order to tell a new and unique story, and you can't help but wonder if they had to pay royalties for the source material or if it's a case of blatant plagiarism.

If you lived under a rock and were told that Deadly Premonition was the officially licensed Twin Peaks videogame, you'd have a hard time disputing that claim.

This feeling of "inspiration" (read: outright rip off) goes beyond just Twin Peaks. I.e. For some reason the female deputy sheriff you meet during the first few minutes of the game, Emily Wyatt, looks exactly like Naomi Watts, but the latter is never credited in the game.

Whether by accident or not, this game is truly a masterful experience.

EDIT 1: 
I ended up playing it on a Switch, as it turns out, these were not intended game mechanics; I kinda miss some of these flavorful glitches tho.

EDIT 2: 
The Switch version also crashes (albeit less often) and it has the same bug where windows on non-interactive buildings shine completely white (like a missing texture). The framerate is also crazy and sinks into the low 10's making it almost unplayable.

EDIT 3:
I briefly tried the Xbone version, but it has tank controls. I can't in good conscience play this game with such outdated controls.

EDIT 4: 
I ended up going back to the PC version since I can at least run it at locked 144 Hz (the darts mini-game bugs out at high framerates so I had to temporarily switch it back to 60 FPS).

EDIT 4.1 (appendix):
Things that bug out at 144 Hz:
[list]
[*]Driving: Your car goes faster than usual (which is arguably a good thing; I actually used this "glitch" to easily win all the racing side missions)
[*]The mission where you have to tail a car. Said car simply comes to a halt when going through a small slope, preventing you from completing the mission
[*]The darts minigame (the reticle does not match with where the dart lands)
[*]The mission where you have to follow an NPC (the NPC will get stuck in lamp posts and/or mailboxes)
[*] During cutscenes, York's cigarette will get stuck in his mouth while a duplicate cigarette stays in his hand. At first I thought that the protagonist simply had a crippling case of tobacco addiction, but this doesn't happen at 60 FPS.
[*]The spider-like monsters that crawl out of vents. These will stay permanently cloaked, clip through the walls and disappear. It doesn't sound so bad on paper, but defeating these monsters will often trigger a door or a cutscene so they must be defeated in order to advance to the next area.[/list] 

EDIT 5: 
I managed to get past the infamous Chapter 9 on PC so I feel like I have crossed the Rubicon. 

So far the game has crashed at least a couple dozen times and I have had to switch between "Windows XP SP3" and "Windows Vista" compatibility mode from time to time; Some sections appear to work better with either setting so it's a 50/50 bet. Also, opening the "Missions" menu soft-locks the game and forces you to Alt-F4, so you have to remember not to open that sub-menu.

The crashes mostly happen during fast-travel sequences, so I've resorted to ignoring the fast-travel mechanic and instead hauling my ass  from place to place in my in-game vehicle... it kinda adds realism and the town isn't that big to begin with so it's a good compromise.

FINAL EDIT:
I've finally beaten the game. This is an exercise of endurance and patience. I feel I've aged a decade, but the story was worth the hassle.

Other than that, there's actually an amazing game and an excellent story hidden behind all these glitches.

review: I remember this game from when I had first played it on xbox. The graphics are crap but the story is beautifully immersive. I will say this version would be quite a disappointment if I hadn't bought it while on sale. Even if you take the time to modify files so that the game can play without crashing every 5 minutes, the loading screen times are irritating even for a patient person. If you are the type of person that enjoys a thorough tragic story with flawless story telling and fun scares, then this would be a wonderful game for you if you also have a bit of patience. Even though the graphics are just as crappy as they were years ago, the story itself is still there and that is why I wished to play this game again. There are no other games quite like this one.

The director should be ashamed, & if this is supposed to be a special edition, the regular one must be a big steaming pile of cat turds.

review:
[h1]Eğer bu oyunu oynamayı başarabilirseniz, 'iyi ki oynamışım' diyeceksiniz..[/h1]

Evet oyun çok sorunlu, aşırı kötü bir port (keşke yapılmasaymış da Xbox' a özel kalsaymış diyor insan), bir sürü fix kurduğunuzda çalışmaması da mümkün, gayet güzel oynuyorken birden bire crash vermesi de. Araç kontrolleri berbat, hele ki açık dünya bir oyunda bir yerden bir yere gitmek için sürekli araç kullanmak zorundaysak bu sorun bazen çileden çıkartabiliyor. Oyunda seslerde de sorunlar mevcut, demolardaki sesler çok yüksek çıkarken, oyun içi demolarda ise seslendirmeler aşırı kısık geliyor. [u]Buna rağmen tavsiye ediyorum evet, eğer imkanınız var ise pc de değil de Xbox ya da Ps3' de kesinlikle deneyimlemelisiniz.[/u] Evet pc' de oynanması ve katlanılması zor bir oyun ama eğer katlanabilirseniz... Önünüzde muhteşem bir oyun olduğunu yavaş yavaş anlamaya başlıyorsunuz.

2010 yılında piyasaya çıkan açık dünya hayatta kalma-korku türündeki Deadly Premonition, eski tarz Playstation 2 görüntüleri ve tank karakter yönetimiyle bizi tamamen eski tip oyun havasına sokan bir oyun. Hani ben görüntü isterim, kazık gibi bir combat istemem derseniz oyun hiç size göre değil.

Greenvale kasabasında gerçekleşen gizemli bir cinayeti çözmek üzere gönderilen FBI ajanı Francis York Morgan olarak oyuna dahil oluyoruz. Oyunun şüphelileri araştırıp katili bulmaya çalıştığımız hikâyesi klişe gibi görünse de, karakterlerle konuştukça ve kasabada gezdikçe içimizde bir merak uyandırıyor. York' un hayali arkadaşı olan Zack ile diyalogları ve kasabadaki karakterlerle olan diyalogların ise değişik bir mizahı var, eğer Twin Peaks izlediyseniz zaten oyun size çok aşina gelecektir.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2773688924

Kasabamız oldukça büyük ve oyunda fast travel yok, bu yüzden bir yere gitmek için araba kullanmak zorundayız. Araba kullanımında ise benzin göstergesi ve hasar göstergesi mevcut, kasabada bir tane benzinci bulunduğundan bir yere gitmeye karar vermeden önce size önerim depoyu doldurmalısınız. Kasabadaki  evler, çiftlikler, malikaneler, dükkanlar vs. serbestçe dolaşılabiliyor, ancak oyunun oldukça yavaş akan bir 24 saati, hava durumu gibi gerçek zamanlı detayları var ve bazı mekanlar saat ve havaya göre açılıp kapanıyor. Mesela yağmurlu havada hiçbir mekan açık olmadığı için yan görevleri de ona göre ayarlamak gerekiyor, herkes evinde olduğundan belirli saatlerde gidip evde görevleri tamamlamak gerekebiliyor, mesela silahçı dükkanı gece 20.00-06.00 saatleri arası açık olduğundan alışverişinizi ona göre ayarlamalısınız. Oyundaki karakterlerin yerlerini anlık olarak görebildiğimiz canlı bir harita sistemi var oyunda. Yani kısacası önümüzde yaşayan bir kasaba var,  kasabadakiler günlük işleri için oradan oraya hareket ediyor ve bunları takip etmek mümkün. Gece saat 12' den sonra ise kasabada dolaşmak ise biraz sıkıntılı. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2785472196

Oyunun ana görev sistemi ise saat odaklı, mesela saat 13.00-15.00 arası bir mekanda olmanız gerekiyorsa ve saatleri kaçırdıysanız görev ertesi güne kalıyor, o zamana kadar da ister yan görevleri tamamlayıp, isterseniz de uyuyarak vakit geçirebilirsiniz. Yan görevler ise tamamen hava durumuna ve oyunun bölümlerine bağlı, bazı görevler yağmurlu havada alınabilirken bazıları sadece güneşli havada alınabiliyor ya da sadece belirli bölümlerde alınıp yapılabilen görevler var. Peki bir kişide görev olup olmadığını nasıl anlıyoruz derseniz, harita menüsünde side quest sekmesinde görevin hangi bölümlerde kimden alınabildiği listelenmiş durumda ama hava durumu işine internetten bakmanız gerekebilir. Oyun 26 bölümden oluşuyor ve oldukça uzun, ana görevin yanı sıra 50 tane de yan görev bulunmakta. Yan görev ödülleri de oldukça cezbedici, bazısı sınırsız mermili bir silah verirken, bazısı da güzel takım elbiseler verebiliyor.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2775169013

Genel olarak FBI ajanımız York' un uyuma, yeme-içme ve temizlik düzeniyle de ilgileniyoruz oyunda, satın aldığımız ya da bulduğumuz sandviç, konserve yiyecekler vs ile açlığımızı giderebilir, ayna karşısına geçip traş olarak ve takım elbisemizi değiştirip kirlenen elbiseyi de kuru temizlemeye göndererek temizlik düzenimizi de kontrol etmemiz mümkün.

[h1]Sonuç olarak;[/h1] Sorunları göz ardı edip (oyunun da çalıştığını varsayarsak) oyunu oynamayı başarabilirseniz sizi çok güzel bir hikaye bekliyor.  Acaba katil kim? Bütün kasabadan şüphe duymaya başladığınızda işte sizi oyuna bağlayan tek soru...

author: {'steamid': '76561198049689075', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1648993190}
review:
[h1]  Terrible, tedious, nonsensical, broken, and f*cking beautiful. [/h1]

[i] “In life, when we are in love with someone, we are actually in love with both the good and the bad sides of that person. We’re in love with that unique blend.” [/i]

Director Hidetaka Suehiro’s quote about the design philosophy of Deadly Premonition’s characters from GDC 2011 I think is also amazingly apropos to the relationship I and many others have to this inconceivable product- this unforeseen amalgamation of genuine creative passion and utter bamboozlement of what lies behind a conventionally 'good' game.

DP, at first sight, doesn’t only shamelessly steal whole concepts from shows like Twin Peaks and games like Silent Hill 2, it also manages to blunder almost every single facet of its own gameplay. The vehicle driving is stiff. The shooting mechanics are stilted. The enemies are trivially easy to beat, resulting in virtually no genuine challenge for the player to overcome as they explore the ominous otherworlds of different locations around town, which are really nothing more than sets of hallways stapled together in unstimulating cheap knock-offs of those from the game series it borrows from. The hunger and sleep mechanics act as an unsuccessful attempt to add definition to the rest of the game outside the corridor-shooter sections, proving too easy to fulfill. The salary system whereby you earn your funds to purchase items and weapons is [i] completely [/i] unrestrained, offering you thousands upon thousands of dollars for completion of each chapter, disallowing careful decision-making over how to effectively use your money. The sound design is cliche- full of the cheapest, most bafflingly atmosphere-destructive things that make you question if this game is supposed to be a genuine attempt at a horror videogame or instead a satirical masterpiece.

Not to mention how absolutely broken this PC port is. I had to download DPFix, which is pretty much required to run the game at any reliable measure to avoid unplayably-choppy framerate and the inevitable, innumerable, [b] near-intolerable [/b] amount of crashes. Even then, I had to download DP on ANOTHER computer after an unavoidable crash halfway through the game which rendered my original installation impossible to continue on. Backing up saves is a must. To put it simply, DP can suck big pee pee a lot of the time.

But note that I did not say [i] all  [/i] the time.

For as bug-ridden, and almost totally unplayable as a game could possibly be, Deadly Premonition is nevertheless one of the most charming and endearing videogames in existence. In the intermits of pain- caused by technical problems and irrevocably flawed design- the story and characters are what ultimately manage to glue everything together; the sole reason for the cult following and undying loyalty so many have to the game.

Playing as eccentric FBI agent, Francis “York” Morgan, you are brought to the northwestern town of Greenvale to investigate the mysterious murder of a local girl, following a trail of other killings involving strange red seeds. What follows from this simple premise is one of the most unpredictable, ridiculous, and downright silly video game narratives that has ever come out of the industry. The whole cast of unforgettably weird characters sticks in your mind long after playing, and as much as the [i] horror [/i] atmosphere is practically nonexistent, the atmosphere of the [i] town [/i] of Greenvale itself is likely one of the most accurate and true-to-life depictions of the American northwestern countryside you’ll see- no doubt one of the few true successes of the game due to the developers traveling and studying the real life landscapes in that part of the world.

The music too is surprisingly good. Magical and floating songs like the vocal version of Greenvale, or the happily relaxing Life is Beautiful that always seems to play at the most laughably tone-deaf moments, work towards a strong, if not characteristically motley mixture of identity. 

Even more unexpected is the fact that for how f*cking stupid DP’s narrative can get, there are moments of genuine poignancy that somehow work despite the general amount of insanity surrounding all else. The player’s emotional link to the protagonist by way of in-game portrayal as York’s imaginary friend, Zach, enables a genuine connection to the character that evolves through the course of the story. DP is oddly full of details that prove the game was legitimately developed with real ardor and effort, most notably in the mid-drive discussions of old movies, music, and previously solved cases that York has with you, Zach. By the time you get to the ending, you’ll not only have felt fulfilled from the conclusion of the case, you’ll also share a part of the feeling of bittersweet liberty with the goodbyes of the characters.

It is because of these things that make Deadly Premonition an inconceivable piece of art. To play through a gameplay and narrative that feels as if it were made by a child, yet at the same time get real enjoyment from the same things it fails so spectacularly at, through all odds, is incredibly inspiring and heartfelt, especially in recent times where the industry has really suffered from both an abundance of greed and loss of passion. A relic like this can remind you how stupid, fun, and sometimes touching games as an artistic medium can be.

If you can get DP on a console, [b] get it on a console. [/b] If not, well, good luck, and make sure to read guides on how best to get it running for PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198429074257', 'num_games_owned': 1448, 'num_reviews': 1328, 'playtime_forever': 1869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1869, 'last_played': 1647852202}
review:
An ambiguous project in the "horror" genre, whose passage was abandoned by more than 70% players for all 10 years of connecting games.

Yes, today we will talk about the first part of Deadly Premonition and we got our hands on the "improved" version for PC - The Director's Cut. In this version, we are waiting for clearer textures, several scenes that were not in the original version, and a more “revealed” plot.
But in fact, we are faced with the appearance of bugs, conventions, mysticism and innuendo in the plot.
Let's start with the main thing that catches your eye - it's graphics. Even for 2013 - the identification of statistical data. Here and there - we are met by invisible barriers - which interfere with the movement of the player and transport, rather soapy textures (even with HD improvements), problems with shadows and light (often the picture is very overexposed).
Achieve this with not the most successful control, both of the main character and the car, and you will get the game of 2006. What a small memory pool may remind you of, which is why objects appear right in front of the character while moving around the city.
But we are not here because of the graphics, but because of the mysticism and the plot! And that's enough here.
The plot for the game is written and implemented very well, although there are holes in it every now and then - no one tries to shut up or somehow explain. Mysticism comes down to the manifestation of the "other" world - in the fact that rather low and slow opponents are waiting for us. They are supposed to scare the player and be dangerous - but in fact, the bobbleheads are quickly destroyed at a distance and are not dangerous for the GG. The same can be said about highlights with bosses - which are also present in the game for show.

Fun fact - the main plot and additional quests, sex of different people. Therefore, the secondary tasks are not to delve into the ENT of the game in any way, but are entered simply in order to allow the player to complete "cards" and "weapons with endless ammo".
Also in the game, things with music are rather sadly repeated - there are literally a few tracks here - which constantly happen from time to time, during certain events. It's pretty sad =(

[b]Pros:[/b][list]
[*]+ Many additional tasks
[*]+ Lots of interesting story dialogues
[*]+ Interesting main story
[*]+ Presence of hunger and fatigue
[*]+ Change of costumes - clothes can get dirty
[*]+ The presence of hygiene - so that they don’t shy away from you, wash your face!
[*]+ Dynamic weather
[*]+ Trading cards for sale
[*]+ Abundance of achievements[/list]

[b]Minuses:[/b][list]
[*]- Driving a car
[*]- Enemies (and bosses) for show
[*]- Secondary tasks (the final quest to clean up the warehouse - the main character just hums for five minutes during the dialogue)
[*]- Quests that open only under certain conditions
[*]- Big but empty world
[*]- Clumsy QTEs[/list]

[b]Total:[/b]
In fact, this is not "horror" and not "survival". Before us is a 30 hour arthouse. Moving through the shelter, the player will spit and fight the urge to abandon the passage.
But if he still overcomes himself and reaches the final - despite a million minuses - he will recommend this game as a work of art xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198102129267', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2360, 'last_played': 1689461311}
review:
[h1] [b] Esto pudo haber sido un juegaso, ¿Verdad Zach? [/b] [/h1]

[h1] Mi historia con este juego (no hace falta leerla) [/h1]

Antes de decir el porque si recomiendo el juego, quiero contar la historia de como conocí este juego. A este juego le tengo un cariño de amor-odio. Todo empezó cuando estaba viendo un video de un canal llamado PiviGames. Pivi recomendaba como anuncio, al principio de su video, una página de keys y había un bundle u ofertas de 1 juego por solo 1 dólar. Confiaba en lo que me decía esta persona y "fuente" si se puede decir. Decido dar un vistaso y entre todos los juegos, estaba este. No recuerdo los otros. Vi el trailer, vi algunas fotos y dije, bueno vamos a probar. Por lo que vi, el juego tenía una pinta a Resident Evil y en ese entonces estaba un poquito atento a lo que era Sillent Hill y no, no estoy igualando la saga de terror psicológico con Deadly Premonition. Asi que sí, asi fue como obtuve el Deadly Premonition un 15 de Abril de 2021 por tan solo 1 dolar en una página que era desconocida para mi. Por eso no me arrepiento de haber pagado esos 168 pesos argentinos (que era lo que valía el dólar américano, más los impuestos, en ese momento).

[h1] Puntos positivos y negativos [/h1]

[i]Pros: [/i]
[list]

[*]Personajes interesantes. No me encariñe con todo el elenco, pero los más importantes les guardo cierto cariño. Quizás si hubiese completado todas las misiones secundarias hubiese conectado más con algunos y con otros no.

[*]Buena Banda Sonora Original, escúchenla por favor.

[*]Buena historia. No es una obra, tampoco para tanto pero no es un asco.

[*]Diferentes vehículos para coleccionar. [spoiler] Si lees esto, tranquilo, que vas a poder recuperar el coche de York. [/spoiler]

[*]Barra de sueño y hambre (básicamente pequeños detalles que afectan al personaje).

[*]La ropa que llevamos se ensucia pasado el tiempo, tenemos que cambiárnosla y encima lavar la que quedó sucia.

[*]El coche se puede romper y quedarse sin gasolina. Tanto para arreglarlo como para renovar el combustible, necesitamos hacer una parada en la única gasolinera del pueblo.

[*]Ciclos de día y noche, como también días nublados y algunos con lluvia (este último es muy importante con la historia y también el como afecta al mundo y juego). Podemos informarnos de esto viendo la televisión.

[*]Podemos afeitarnos. Sencillamente algo estético que no marca mucho, pero sirve para elegir la apariencia que mas nos guste para nuestro personaje.

[*]Asi como tiene ciclos de día y noche, los horarios juegan un papel importante en la rutina de todos los npc’s y de los lugares, haciendo que el mundo abierto se sienta bastante vivo.

[*]Podemos pescar, lo probé y no es la gran cosa, pero es una forma de poder lootear comida, armas y munición.

[*]Algo que mencionaré en las contras y es que, el juego parece una parodia, es como un abridged, arruinando momentos tristes, lúgubres, de cualquier calibre, poniendo la música no adecuada en dichos momentos. Música feliz mientras inspeccionamos un cadáver, el protagonista fumando y muy relajado, después o durante una situación de estrés que requiere mucho profesionalismo. Pero es algo que me gusta, no voy a mentir.
[/list]

[i]Contras: [/i]
[list]

[*]Bugs, crasheos, problemas técnicos en general.

[*]Dichos problemas técnicos se debe a un mal port de pc, que fue un copia y pega de la versión de consola (preferiblemente Xbox 360) pero sin poner una gota de sudor.

[*]Es un juego de terror, y, digamos que no es su fuerte, es una parodia y sátira de si misma.

[*]La acción es mala o aburrida porque, cada vez que empezamos a luchar con las “Sombras”, estos enemigos son molestos y solo hace que el jugador quiera terminar lo más rápido posible con ellos.

[*]Volviendo a la acción, no vamos a tener muchas armas al principio, son caras algunas. El apuntado es más incómodo que los primeros Resident Evil. Para mi no fue difícil acostumbrarme.

[*]Cuando matas a un enemigo (Sombra) este muere y donde murió, parece ser que “sigue ahí” ya que no nos dejará pasar por unos segundos. Sumado a que en algunas ocasiones los enemigos son infinitos y se genera un spawn donde murió, haciendo difícil y tedioso poder pasearse por las zonas.

[*]El detalle de que los personajes no jugables tengan una acción diferente en ciertos momentos del día, lo hace tedioso, ya que algunos cuando van a su casa, no te dejaran pasar. Esto es algo bastante negativo si querés hacer una misión secundaria por puro interés o si querés completar los logros del juego.

[*]Esto conecta con el punto mencionado anteriormente, y es que el mapa y mini mapa del juego, es un problema. Es difícil estar aprendiéndose todas las localizaciones ya que el zoom para alejar, es muy poco y encima el mapa del menu rota al igual que el minimapa, termina siendo frustrante. Esto es tedioso para cuando querés seguir a un personaje, importante, que se esta yendo y lo requerís para cierta misión, entregarle algo, recibir, etc.

[*]El sistema de conducción es horrible, los coches no pueden ir a altas velocidades por mucho tiempo porque pierden la estabilidad y derrapan mucho, lo suficiente para que a veces, puedan volcarse o chocar.

[*]No tiene mucha dificultad el juego, es realmente un paseo, solo que se alarga debido a errores con los enemigos que mencione anteriormente. Además que los rompecabezas son fáciles de resolver, quizás hay uno que te sea más difícil que otro como me paso a mi.

[*]Hay un par de misiones (no recuerdo alguna otra) que son aburridas, se trata de manejar o caminar/correr por un buen tiempo. Hace que te mueras del aburrimiento, pero muy garantizado.

[*]El jefe final es fácil también pero gracias a las limitaciones técnicas, se produce un problema a la hora de querer matarlo, por lo cual habrá que tener mucha paciencia, que no es imposible.

[*]Los gráficos son bastante regulares, no sé si muy malos (A mi este apartado es el que me da bastante igual, pero es un punto objetivamente negativo).
[/list]

¿Que decir? Me gusta el juego, los puntos negativos prevalecen sobre los positivos, pero fue tanto el amor que le tenía que aguante y lo jugué, eso quiere decir que realmente vale la pena. Para restar los problemas técnicos, [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=218647912] usé esta guía en español, recomendada si o si para los hispanoparlantes [/url] ya que el juego, en español, esta mal traducido. Ciertos caracteres como los signos de pregunta, de exclamación, tildes y la poderosísima Ñ no están y es una sopa de letras y garabatos los subtítulos. La verdad que un desastre lo que no han querido hacer los responsables del port y del juego en general. Gracias a la comunidad, sobre todo a ustedes: [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/fernandoesra] Esra [/url] y [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/raskaipika] Raskaipika [/url] y los que ayudaron con los parches, con el DPfix y SweetFX.

Como dije anteriormente en la sección de "Mi historia con el juego" lo compré a 1 dólar, pero por ese amor que le agarré, decidí comprar la música del juego, que se encuentra a modo de DLC.
No recomiendo comprarlo al precio en el que está. Hagan como yo, compren la key o esperen a rebajas. No sé si el juego suele estar de oferta cada tanto y no se cuando. Pero este juego debería estar barato por lo que ofrece.

[h1] Spoilers [/h1]

[spoiler] La pelea con el jefe final fue horrible, esta bugeadisima, literal para matarlo no podía apuntar al muñeco que llevaba en el bolsillo, osease, su punto debil. Me termine el boss con un mando en vez del teclado y mouse, pensando que sería una solución pero valga la rebundancia que el juego tiene problemas con el joystick derecho y es que el sentido vertical y horizontal estan al revés. (El vertical es el horizontal y viceversa). Bueno quería escribir algo más pero Steam me lo limita. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197981148806', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1485635023}
review:
I rate this game a Zach / Mindbreaking Car Audio Bug

On a serious note the game is good. Whilst the gameplay hasn't aged the best, the pure batshit insanity of the story will hook you immediately. This game is like if the movies Mulholland Drive and Seven had a baby, and that baby was bipolar.

Crucial story events are often accompanied by the most out of place jazz music. 

The sandbox elements and side quests add more flavor to games world and provide an insight into the motivations and background of various characters in a thought out way. The game does a good job of making you feel like a detective. 

The amount of surrealist humour in the game is unparalleled by any other game (or form of media) I have played. 

Everyone should experience this game, but get it on sale, as the bugs are annoying unless you download third party patches.

Oh, and watch out for the giant dog on the roads at night.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214493720', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 4935, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1845, 'last_played': 1647442393}
review:
This is one of the most unique games you'll ever play, between the storyline, the actual gameplay and the weird little moments therein.  I can't say too much without spoiling it, it's like the sims meets resident evil and then they all dropped acid and watched leave it to beaver.  You will feel totally safe, obnoxiously so one minute and then will be completely on your own and very unsafe, which is more unnerving than just a straight up horror game would be I think.  You need to play this game.

THAT said, it runs TERRIBLY on steam, first you'll have to download their controller schematic because the stick goes the wrong way ( left is right, etc ) and then you'll experience crashes, both at random times and at certain crucial intervals that will be game ending until you fix it.  What I did was ran it as an admin and on windows 98 compatibility mode and it fixed the major crashes, but ON 98 mode the load times are twice as long.  Also the aiming could be better.

GREAT game, def play it, but expect some problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198980284439', 'num_games_owned': 145, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1646081067}
review:
Прошёл игру на пиратке и после прохождения решил купить в стиме чтобы поддержать разработчика. Вот что могу сказать - это уникальная игра в своём жанре. Серьёзно, эта игра не похожа ни на одну другую игру, единственное только некоторые моменты могут отдалённо напоминать другие проекты. Это и глубокий сюжет, и временами вещи свойственные только японским играм, и японский юмор(который мне к слову зашёл, хоть я и не особо фанат такого). В общем красота.
В этой игре все персонажи по своему хороши, но скорее всего вам больше запомнится колоритный главный герой - Френсис Йорк Морган, агент ФБР, он будет обсуждать фильмы пока вы будете ехать на машине в какой-либо пункт назначения, неплохо шутить, даже в казалось бы патовых ситуациях. В общем, классный мужик=)
А вот насчёт технической составляющей игры... ох-хо-хо! Это самая неоптимизированная игра на пк в которую я играл(не считая первый дарк соулс), программисты этой игры так накасипорили в коде игры, что она у вас будет вылетать либо каждые 10 минут, либо стабильно каждые 2-3 часа как в моём случае, тут кому как повезёт, но это всё цветочки, ведь есть же неофициальный патч - DPfix, который и графику настроить позволяет(да, в игре даже такого нет, в лаунчере можно выбрать только полноэкранный режим или оконный, на этом графические настройки заканчиваются) и даже управление для геймпада, да и баги некоторые исправляет... И казалось бы, установил этот патч, и всё, жизнь сказкой становится. Но нееет, из-за этого патча у некоторых вылетов становилось гораздо больше, у некоторых уменьшался фпс, ну а в моём случае этот патч не позволял мне нормально и полноценно целиться, только ограниченная ось. Да и графика в этой игре для 2010 года выглядит мягко говоря не очень, так ещё разрабы решили что будет хорошей идеей ещё и прикрутить серый фильтр в режиссёрскую версию, которого не было в оригинальной версии, исправить это можно только путём установки SweetFX. 
А, и музыка, она хороша, просто хороша, некоторые композиции конечно повторяются, но тут настолько шикарный саундтрек, что грех жаловаться, да и он мне не надоел ни разу. 
Но в целом, мои мучения оправдались, игра мне в итоге понравилась. 
Стоит ли покупать эту игру или нет? Как по мне - стоит, но будьте готовы к танцами с бубном и прочими ритуалами.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051627501', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1645525054}
review:
A cult classic that is every bit uncanny as it is charming and funny. It's one of those games that I think everyone should play through at least once in their lifetime and is Swery's most seminal work out of entire his catalog. Think of the movie "The Room (2003)" had a baby with TV series "Twin Peaks", but a videogame. 

However this port is pretty god awful and is the definition of just "phoning it in". If you're willing to do a bunch of mod and config work beforehand to fix a majority of the issues in its vanilla state it is definitely worth a buy on sale. On the bright side this can probably run on a potato so it's also a good pick-up for someone who is at the moment stuck running lower spec hardware or even the Steam Deck since the native resolution for this game is 720p.

Regardless of all my rambling this is definitely worth playing through despite the really sad state of the port mainly due to vast community support to get the game in a very playable state. My negative review is a reflection of the PC port as is and not the game itself. (Also I've heard that DP2 has similar issues with another barebones port if you want to call it that which is really unfortunate, although I'm sure the community over time will fix that game too)

Sidenote: If you do buy this I recommend visiting [url=https://www.pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut]this page[/url] to help you get the game running in an acceptable state. Also here's some steps to fix the gamepad controls since they're messed up especially the axis for the analog sticks. Open Big Picture mode, search for Deadly Premonition -> Manage Game -> Controller Configuration -> Browse Configs (At the bottom) -> Select the Community Tab -> Choose the one that's labeled "Deadly Premonition Controller+". Hope this helps someone.

author: {'steamid': '76561199185920872', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 283, 'playtime_forever': 1711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1645297547}
review:
По факту:
Играл в оригинал на xbox 360.
Стимовская версия уступает во всём.
Не стоит своих денег, из-за кучи багов (игра вылетала около 150 раз), плохой совместимостью с геймпадом, ужасной совместимостью с современными видеокартами, которые придется долго настраивать, как и всю систему.
Тем, кто знаком с оригиналом , ни в коем случае не покупать! Ради двух 30 - секундных роликов Director's Cut страдать не нужно! 
Тем,кто не играл в этот консольный в первую очередь шедевр, помучаться с фиксом багов и настройкой всё-таки стоит. 
Deadly Premonition - это  уникальная история, запоминающиеся главные герои, и нереальная атмосфера, которая никогда не уйдёт из вашей жизни. Я серьезно, вы останетесь в этом городке навсегда. А саундтрек будет звенеть в ваших ушах всю жизнь! Как он великолепен!
Но, покупать только на скидках!!!
Спасибо за внимание.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991271982', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 570, 'playtime_forever': 3640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3640, 'last_played': 1572818089}
review:
[b]На эту игру невероятно сложно писать рекомендацию, т.к. одна часть игры вопит о её исключительной ценности, в то время как другая содержит в себе самые источник самых неприятных эмоций.[/b]

[u]Начну с хорошего:[/u]

Сюжет и персонажи - это то, что несомненно удалось (особенно учитывая его полноценную логическую завершённость). Игроизация по сути Твин Пикса в версии второго сезона с щепоткой фирменного японского шарма, которая умело закручивает интригу, раскрывает многочисленных жителей городка (которые очаровательно эпатажны под стать первоисточнику), мотивирует пройти почти каждое побочное задание. И всё это под яркий и колоритный саундтрек, написанный как минимум  Японским Бадаламетти. А уж какое количество причудливых механик, грамотно вплетённой иронии и шуток, мелких деталей. Воистину Купер гордился бы!

[u]Но минусы всплывают всю дорогу с самого начала:[/u]

Игра попросту отвратительно портирована и без DPFix'а она будет вылетать ещё чаще, рендериться лишь в 720p и Ктулху знает что ещё (почти сразу заглянул на PCGamingWiki и накатил сей фанатский патч, чего и всем желаю). После этого предстоит столкнуться с крайне несбалансированным геймплеем и его сложностью, неудобным управлением (сломанным, отчего финального босса добить можно лишь проанализировав ролики таких же бедолаг в интернете), звуком лишь в стерео (в машине при ином позиционировании не завидую вашим ушам), пустейшим и большим открытым миром (возможность быстрого путешествия скрыта в награде за побочное задание, которое можно выполнить в определённых начальных главах) с постоянными поездками минут по 7-10 реального времени, частыми непредсказуемыми вылетами и возможностью в некоторых местах запороть сохранение (поэтому стоит прочесть гайд о всех замеченных ошибках и постоянно бекапить сейвы).

[b]А так да. Это одна из лучших и атмосфернейших игр вдохновлённых культовым сериалом из 90-х. Веселитесь, но до конца дойдут лишь самые стойкие и удачливые.[/b]

[u]P.S. То, что мне удалось выбить все достижение - на % 98 удача.[/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197972339779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2641, 'last_played': 1678764611}
review:
Ok. This is going to be a review of THIS version of the game.
Short story, this version of the game (The PC Version of Deadly Premonition Director's Cut) is BROKEN. 
I have a windows 10 PC with a modern nvidia graphics card and the game out of the box did not work. 
It would crash on opening. I've tried the community fix(es) which are either a weird combination of trying different compatibility settings on the exe itself and/or the DP Fix, which is a community fix that requires adding new files to the game's directory. The DP Fix does include some extra settings like graphical adjustments, the ability to change the resolution as well. You will still need to make an adjustment to the controller profile for this game because the right stick by default is mapped wrong (up and down is left and right and vice versa by default).

Honestly the DP Fix made my experience worse, causing the game to crash often. Whereas rolling back the changes and setting the game's exe to compatibility mode for windows xp allowed me to play longer but ultimately I had the same result. The game would crash before a chapter even early on in the story. I tried practically everything I could find but nothing would work. 

While its my understanding this game is buggy on practically every system that it was ever ported to, this version in particular is... a waste of money. It just doesn't work and if for some reason you can get to work then my hat's off to you. I cannot recommend this game as it is on steam and TBH, the way that it currently is should be pulled from steam. I plan on playing through this game at some point, as it has a good and quirky story but do not plan on doing so on the PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979222783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 4007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4007, 'last_played': 1641542779}
review:
Je passe les détails techniques, oui il faut faire 2-3 manipulations pour rendre le jeu jouable, oui il y a de meilleurs portages à n'en point douter, mais au-delà de cette couche superficielle un peu amer quel jeu !!! C'est comme suer à ouvrir un cadeau et dès qu'on peut en profiter c'est tout simplement excellent ! Deadly fait assurément partie de mes jeux préférés de part sa profondeur, le traitement de ses personnages, l'atmosphère qui s'en dégage, même ses égarements techniques en viennent à lui donner une touche culte et propre à son identité tant il est bon. C'est le genre de jeu qu'on aime ou pas du tout, mais une chose est sûre il ne laisse personne indifférent, au fond n'est-ce pas là la marque d'une oeuvre réalisée avec passion.
PS pour les soucis de démarrages qui peuvent en rebuter certains : 
- Pour les soucis de manette
Allez vous chercher un profil de manette (Le premier) en faisant clic droit sur le jeu dans votre bibliothèque, sélectionner le.
- Les soucis de framerate
Plusieurs solutions selon les cas (Testez plusieurs solutions, ou faites tout ce qui est listé ci-dessous) les 2 .exe avec droits admin cochés, comptabilité windows me (Pas besoin parfois), ensuite lorsque vous êtes sur le premier menu où vs avez le choix de lancer le jeu, faites gestionnaire tâches, détail, clic droit sur le .exe du jeu (DP je crois), priorité du jeu : forte, ensuite je ne sais plus quel onglet sur lequel cliquer mais cela vous va vous demander de sélectionner le nombre de coeurs du proc à utiliser, désélectionner ce qui est coché et cochez 0 et 1.
Avec cela ça devrait fonctionner, le jeu reste cependant très capricieux, random crash notamment, c'est embêtant mais redémarrer le jeu, s'ils se délenchent à répétition à l'enclenchement d'une scène : Le redémarrage du pc fonctionne plutôt bien.
Je précise que je n'utilise pas le mod qui existe pour résoudre les divers problèmes listés entre autres ci-dessus.
C'est une aide un peu à l'arrache donc désolé pour le format, j'y suis allé au feeling la plupart du temps à chaque problème rencontré et avec l'aide des différents sujets ouverts sur la comu sur steam (merci à eux).

review:
Not Unplayable but damn near close. You'll spend 2 minutes waiting for it to load, followed by several more minutes of unfun driving only to have it crash at a cut-scene and repeat the process. Without modding it you risk crashing and lengthy load times. Without a controller configuration you won't be able to aim. 

The only positive things I can say are there are quirky moments between characters making you think there will be some fun along the way. That gets snuffed out during lengthy do-nothing segments padded with running for the sake of running. So much time gets wasted to justify this being a game and not just a visual novel/movie. 

Play a port on a console if you really want to play this, but you'll waste more time than you will doing anything fun or interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025047133', 'num_games_owned': 2015, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1639386585}
review:
I finally bit the bullet in the last 90% off sales guy and, unbelievably, so worth it!

100% Twin Peaks vibes, pulled off in its own Japanese style. And I say that fully knowing how high a bar that is. This game hits that bar, and then goes and does its own thing later on. Combined with some lovely PS2 janky blocky open world gameplay with just enough icons on the map to keep you going. And plenty of "guess they ran out of budget here" hilarity that my partner enjoyed as well.

"this area into town looks a bit bare? we got any assets?"
"let me check... I have a bunch of 'Welcome to Greenvale' signs?"
"problem solved, plop 10 of those suckers next to each other, smokes lets go"

Yes, I installed DPfix to make it look nice, and then spent an evening grappling with the settings and Windows compatibility mode that would make the controller work. And it crashed occasionally. Save often. And I couldn't beat the last boss without revisiting all those settings (ok, this part was pretty infuriating). But I am glad I pulled through.

That said, if I wasn't playing this crap PC port I would have been keen to 100% it. But the crashing is too much to stomach that. With the story driving the game forward I happily looked past it. But I guess it is worth reiterating that the janky mess (which honestly is part of its charm) will impact your playtime.
