author: {'steamid': '76561198027207312', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4448, 'last_played': 1626724421}
review:
Думаю для начала сказать, что меня игра пленила надолго и навсегда осталась в моем сердце. Я внесла её в список впечатливших меня игр. Deadly Premonition проходила на стриме, а поэтому множество хороших и не очень слов уже было мной сказано. Игра настолько увлекла, что я прошла её полностью - основной сюжет, все дополнительные миссии и получила все ачивки. 
А теперь хочется подробнее рассказать чем игра смогла заслужить такое мое отношение.

   Сюжет. Диалоги.
Здесь игра заслуживает максимальной оценки. SWERY умело интригует и подбрасывает подсказки. Он втягивает игрока в круговорот событий очень незаметно и ты даже не успеваешь понять как тебя уже не оторвать от экрана. Автор изящно водит за нос и уже при втором прохождении ты понимаешь, что все лежало на поверхности. Но самым величайшим кайфом для меня было то, что игра заставила думать, строить теории и взывала к фантазии. И знаете что? В кое-чем я оказалась права, но такого финала я не ожидала! Для кого-то это наркомания, но я вижу в этом просто удивительную вселенную, в которую хочется периодически мысленно возвращаться. Что до второстепенных квестов, то они очень милы и для меня были интересны. Местами очень юморные.
Диалоги в игре под стать сюжету - не просты, а загадочны, но при этом точны и несущие всю необходимую суть.

   Персонажи.
По сути ключевых персонажей меньше, чем пальцев на одной руке, но то, как они прописаны, заставляет проникнуться ими. Безусловно самым любимым персонажем для меня является Фрэнсис Йорк Морган. Чудаковатый, умный, проницательный, харизматичный и даже симпатичный персонаж смог покорить мое сердце.

  Саундтрек. Атмосфера.
Безупречно. Некая тягучесть одних композиций очень хорошо передает загадочность. А динамичность других отлично контрастирует и побуждает к движению. Есть композиции трогательные и милые, а есть такие, что бьют в самое сердце и оседают в мозгу навсегда. Все выполнено со вкусом и ничего лишнего. (Выбрать любимую композицию сложно, но если выбирать, то это "York AND Zach")
Атмосфера в игре идеально передается авторами как саундтреком, так и визуально. Меня покорил параллельный мир кошмара. Он настолько затягивающий и загадочный. Тут ощущается хоррор. А в противовес этому мы видим реальный мир, который наполнен не просто зданиями с одинаковым наполнением - каждая квартира, дом и помещение обставлено под стать характера персонажа, как основного, так и даже самого мелкого второстепенного. Поразил размер городка - масштаб как города, так и зданий ощущается как настоящий. Это радует.

   Геймплей.
Меня предупреждали, что игра странная во многих отношениях. И в плане геймплея тоже. На удивление я быстро приспособилась и прохождение для меня было очень приятным за исключением багов, но о них скажу позже. Автор смог соединить механики совсем разных жанров и получилась отличная солянка. Тут и можно пострелять, и есть какая-то вариативность диалогов, есть миниигры, есть симулятор жизни. Но скажу, что есть недоработки и явно можно было сделать местами все поинтереснее. Например физика поведения автомобиля напрочь отсутствует.
Сложность в этом издании понизили, что стало для меня спасением. Данная сложность оптимальна для того, чтобы можно было насладиться сюжетом, но и не пробежать игру на скорости света.

   Баги
Как выяснилось, большинство багов вызваны костюмами из дополнений. Видимо их анимация в роликах приводит к вылету. [u]Поэтому рекомендую наплевать на плюшки и проходить игру в двух оригинальных костюмах[/u]. А другие баги тоже оказалось возможным обойти. 

[i]Я могу писать бесконечно, но придется углубляться уже описывая конкретные моменты, где не обойдется без спойлеров. Поэтому скажу так:[/i]
Игра не только заслуживает хорошей оценки, заниженной за счет недочетов игры в плане геймплея, забагованности и пары недостатков в плане дизайна, но и должна находиться в библиотеке любого человека, который ценит глубокие оригинальные специфические игры, которые по сути и просто играми не назвать. Это не развлечение, а скорее замечательная книга, переложенная на язык игры. Явление, которое если пережить, то планка требовательности к сюжетным играм может резко возрасти.

review:
Una piccola chicca del trash.
Consigliato su console con forte sconto e tanta pazienza. 

Il gameplay è atroce, graficamente era vecchio già 10 anni fa.
Ma i personaggi assurdi, le atmosfere estranianti ed il caso misterioso ti invogliano a continuare.

PRO: Alienante quasi sempre in senso positivo. 

CONTRO:
-Dura uno sfacelo
-Sound design da galera
-Finale delirante (non in bene), ridondante e frustrante
-Pessimo game design 
-Tediosi spostamento in auto (ovviabili ottenendo la radio in una delle prime side quest) 
-Pochi crash ma in momenti cruciali, salvataggi corrotti, achievement buggati.  
-Caricamenti infiniti e frequenti (anche su SSD). 

Che gran peccato. 


Ringrazio un paio di santi nella comunità di Steam che spiegano come moddare il gioco (per rimappare i comandi e ridurre -non evitare- i crash).

author: {'steamid': '76561198007607324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1703383107}
review:
Эта игра — одно большое признание в любви к сериалу «Твин Пикс» за авторством Дейвида Линча, Калеба Дешанеля, Марка и Скотта Фростов, Харли Пейтона Джерри Стала и Бэрри Пульмана. Да, не один Линч работал над сериалом, то что делает Линч в одиночку, вы можете наблюдать по продолжению 17-го года. Сцены изобилуют отсылками и автор (Swery65, он же Хидетака Суехиро) регулярно превозносит кино и сериалы 90-х. Если вы пробьетесь через устаревшую графику, кривое управление и рудиментарный геймплей то игра наградит вас отличной музыкой и великолепным сюжетом. И все это — в непередаваемой атмосфере мистического детектива в маленьком американском городке (как его видит иностранец). Как и в оригинальном сериале, отсылкой к которому является игра, здесь есть место ярким персонажам и чудоковатому юмору, который нужен чтобы мрачная и жестокая история побольнее ударила вам в спину когда вы расслабитесь. И последнее — играйте в оконном режиме, иначе вы дропнете игру на старте от постоянных вылетов. И потеряете очень многое. Для меня это однозначный шедевр, из тех что запоминаются до конца жизни. 
P.S. — вторую часть даже не смотрите. Она лишь бледная и кривая тень этого шедевра, еще и эксклюзив свича, созданный лишь для того чтобы подоить фанатов. Можете посмотреть на ютубе ради сцен допроса главгероя но умоляю, не покупайте вторую часть. Забудьте про то что она есть. Пусть эта история останется такой. Завершенной, прекрасной и непорочной как лесная богиня.

review:
I love the atmosphere to this game, the lighting and stuff feels like a dream, the characters are interesting, especially the main character York. The combat is simple but pretty fun and gets the job done. It isn't very hard but the fact that you have infinite ammo makes it simple and sorta mindless fun. The game does feel weirdly immersive despite it's dated graphics. Sadly though after the art gallery section my game has been repeatedly crashing even after restarting my PC,, soo,, yeah it was interesting while it lasted, but I think I'm gonna call it quits here.

I'd recommend playing it just to see what it's like. I had a good time despite the game abruptly ending via constant crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062494286', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2651, 'last_played': 1620556156}
review:
Сегодняшний день даёт нам слишком много и отбирает самое ценное. Каждый из нас хочет найти нечто, что бы затронуло его сухую и очерствевшую в пучине современного массового контента душу, что-то своё. Найти то, что создаст ту самую химию внутри нас и вновь пробудит девятилетнего ребенка полного удивления и восхищения.

Ни для кого не секрет, мы имеем тенденцию фанатеть и создавать культ вокруг вещей, которые слишком хороши, чтобы оставаться на сером фоне. И будем честны, многие из них стали предметом поклонения далеко не благодаря своей ординарности. Мы не влюбляемся в симметричные идеалы, мы любим те вещи, которых не находим в других, их особенности, их самобытность, их странность, их шероховатости и даже недостатки. Мы влюбляемся в то, что выделяется, и Deadly Premonition выделяется слишком во многих аспектах, чтобы остаться просто игрой.

Японцы короли самобытности. Для многих из нас Япония стоит выше статуса просто страны, эти черти заслужили в нашей культуре звание своей маленькой вселенной.  Своим своеобразием японская культура во многом будто стоит особняком от всего остального мира, им удается абстрагироваться от всех остальных и сохранять собственную культуру в своей особой форме, но ее исключительность и значимость на фоне всего мира остается фактом. Я люблю японский геймдев, он, что называется, ебал в рот весь запад с их выстроенными за многие годы принципами создания игр, геймдизайном, киношностью, подходом к подаче сюжета, юмором и устоявшимися механиками. Японцы почти всегда остаются на своей волне, работают по-своему и это делает их произведения особенными (к слову о том, что резидент начиная с 7 части начал смотреть на запад и похоронил тем самым серию, но сейчас не об этом), Deadly Premonition лишь один из таких примеров, но, пожалуй, один из самых ярких. Примером того, как можно положить болт на то, как надо, и делать то, как будет круто. Как будет круто и здорово по мнение одного определенного челика. 

Хидетака Шухиро (Swery65) сценарист и главный директор, а так же дизайнер DP. Для кого-то он гений, способный конкурировать с Кодзимой по уровню своеобразия своих взглядов на игры, для кого-то недоделанный киношник, который не умеет ни туда, ни туда. У Swery есть стиль и он не боится его показать. Он, как и Хидео, рос на кино и, более того, на крутом кино.

Твин Пикс Дэвида Линча в своё время произвел фурор и зародил целое поколение фанатов, оно и понятно почему. Все знают Линча, все понимают, КАКИЕ фильмы он снимает. Линч делает не просто авторское кино, он делает артхаус, у него есть свои подходы и взгляды, из-за чего его фильмы сильно отличаются от привычного и приобретают чёткий авторский окрас. Твин Пикс не самое его изощренное произведение, но самое массовое, его крутили в 90х по тв, а не в кино. С соавторством Линча сериал не просто стал технической и художественной революцией того времени, но и приобрёл ту самую недостающую изюминку, которую он добавлял в свои авторские фильмы при их создании. 

А теперь, наконец-наконец, представьте, что будет, если взять самый странный массовый и культовый сериал 90х со всей его неповторимой ни до ни после атмосферой, полить это соусом японского подхода к созданию художественных произведений и сделать из этого игру.

Deadly Premonition это не просто игра, это предмет исторического достояния. Она сломана, она имеет массу технических проблем: низкий фреймрейт, непомерное количество вылетов и багов, устаревшая графика, плохая анимация, неудобное управление, софтлок моменты, наедающие пройти игру без дополнительных манипуляций. И все это не только проблемы порта на пк, большая часть проблем есть и на консольных прародителях. Напомню, что игра вышла в 2010, выглядит и играется как продукты периода пс2, и переиздание 2013 года не исправило ничего из вышесказанного. Так почему же DP любят и продолжают обожать?

В Deadly Premonition есть та особая атмосферу, которую давал нам Твин Пикс, уникальный геймплей и механики, которые дают только японские игры, и незабываемый опыт, единственный в своем роде. DP принято хвалить за сюжет, и с этим трудно не согласится, он хорош, а включая собственноручное знакомство с городом и его персонажами по мере выполнения сайдквестов игра дарит нам одну из самых лучших историй. Город, что погружает в себя, и может не отпустить вас пока не закончите сюжетку и все сайдквесты. Но не одним хлебом едины, игра также предлагает увлекательный геймплей. 

По сути DP делится на 26 сюжетных миссий, в перерыве между которыми вам даётся полная свобода в изучении города и знакомства с персонажами путём выполнения дополнительных заданий, коих тут 50. За квесты иногда дают очень даже полезные предметы, такие как рация-фасттелепорт, быстрая машина или бесконечное оружие. Но, конечно, никто не заставляет, и можно идти просто по сюжету и насладится расследованием, как крутым сериалом. Часть сюжетных заданий представляют собой несложные пробежки с тиром от третьего лица, а другая часть это недурные загадки, что являются скорее прелюдией к сюжетным катсценам. На этом основы игры заканчиваются, теперь можете покупать и приступать к прохождению, а я тут просто поднимаю рейтинг игре в стиме.

Играйте, если вы:
- любите жесткие детективы (настоящий детектив и твин пикс вам как референс) 
- любите японские игры или готовы к новым и нестандартным
- готовы смириться и любить человека со всеми его недостатками
- готовы подарить себе незабываемый экспириенс, полный боли и страданий

Немножко подсказок от себя:
- любую главу можно переиграть для прохождения сайдов, но придется доиграть эпизод до конца т.к. там нет сейвов, весь прогресс и предметы сохранятся и перенесутся в главный сейв
- в игре есть фантомные сигареты, позволяющие скипать время
- в игре есть фасттревел, который можно получить после выполнения второго квеста джорджа с безымянным цветком 
- самый простой способ вызвать дождь до специальной куклы, увы, - только спать. Есть не обязательно, сон не требует быть сытым, но не забудьте поесть как закончите в бесконечным отсыпом. Сам же дождь появляется в случайные дни, но если менять каждый день костюм и бриться, вероятность его появления, почему-то, повышается

Решения тех проблем которые помогли лично мне:
- в сети можно без проблем найти «dpfix», который оптимизирует фпс в игре до 60, добовляет высокое разрешение и массу других исправлений. Ставится простым копированием файлов в папку с игрой и перезапуском пк при необходимости
- проблема с невозможностью целиться наверх и вниз, которая будет в некоторых моментах необходима, исправляется альттабом игры туда обратно, но с «dpfix» игра не сможет развернуться, так что придется перемещать его файлы из папки на это время 
- игра может систематически вылетать в некоторых моментах, например после взятия сайдквеста, в таких случая рекомендую сохраниться, перезапустить игру (сам exe файл, не лаунчер) с совместимостью windows95 и правами администратора, пройти момент до ближайшего сохранения и поменять обратно
- геймпад у меня просто не работал, сдайтесь

review:
I was scared to buy the PC version because I have heard plenty of bad things, but I have had no issues so far. I only crashed once after 13 hrs straight of playing. I am not using any mods and using the regular Steam download version.
I do own, and have beaten the game on Nintendo Switch, but I honestly prefer this version better. Its faster than the switch and the Directors Cut items make the weak parts far less annoying/

My only real complaint about the game itself are the contextual button press boss fights. Maybe I drink too much, or smoke too much, but the timing windows are way too small.
The game itself felt like the funny side quests of Yakuza or Dead Rising mixed with the worst parts of Resident Evil 4 combat, when it tries to sprinkle in combat every here and there.

For what it is, it really does manage to hit the same area as Twin Peaks level insane

author: {'steamid': '76561198137065718', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4228, 'last_played': 1620784490}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a masterpiece!  A perfect blend of mystery, comedy, horror and life simulator for the Twin Peaks enthusiast or just anyone looking for a good time.  The soundtrack is one of the best--I  listen to it all the time.  The characters are odd and memorable.  The town is huge fun to explore.  Best of all is the murder mystery told with a seamless mixture of the very contrasting elements of absurd silliness and grotesque bloodshed.  One of the only "Lynchian" games ever to succeed at emulating the surreal style of that director.
Its buggy, yes there's no getting around that.  Get ready for crashes.  The combat sections are often insipid or dull.  But don't let it stop you from enjoying one of the best games of the decade.  If "predictable" is something you hate in games than try Deadly Premonition for a truly novel experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025997105', 'num_games_owned': 456, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1726, 'last_played': 1525003804}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198028605964', 'num_games_owned': 1767, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2076, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2076, 'last_played': 1620517299}
review:
• The launcher doesn't work without elevated privileges.
• The game itself doesn't work without elevated privileges.
• Without dpfix, resolution is locked to 1280 x 720.
• Alt + Tabbing out of the game either halves the game's effective framerate or crashes it entirely.	
• Sometimes starting the game will permanently tank the framerate for no reason. Normally running at 60 FPS, the game will instead start at 22 FPS and continue to drop as play continues (I stopped at 8 FPS before it could get any worse).
• Quick time events don't register inputs properly if the framerate drops too much. In these instances, trying to complete the QTEs associated with the Raincoat Killer becomes effectively impossible, resulting in an immediate game over until the framerate issues are fixed.
• With dpfix, the launcher no longer works, requiring a manual startup from the DP.exe itself.
• Occasionally, starting the game from DP.exe crashes the game.
• Steam Overlay crashes the game.
• After using dpfix, the game's language keeps changing to French for some reason.
• Setting the game to fullscreen using the launcher causes the game to run windowed, and vice versa.
• Saving at the wrong time permanently crashes the game when trying to reload the save file, rendering the save completely unusable (this has happened in Episode 1 - Chapter 05, Episode 2 - Chapter 09 & Chapter 12).
• The art gallery cutscene crashes the game, at the point where Forrest is seen speaking with Diane.
• Being in the wrong place at the wrong time (such as outside the police station, or a nondescript patch of grass) crashes the game.
• Smoking at the wrong time crashes the game.
• Not smoking at the right time crashes the game.
• Driving on the wrong part of a road crashes the game.
• Driving the wrong car crashes the game.
• Using flares to get a car that won't crash the game at the wrong time locks the game, rendering it unplayable.
• Going near the gas station crashes the game.
• The leg bone's connected to the -- crashed game.
• Opening the game days later to play it again crashes the game.
• Running the game in the 'wrong' compatibility mode will sometimes prevent the game opening altogether, even when it had worked previously.
• Trying to eat big dinner crashes the game.
• Walking near Emily's police truck during the stakeout crashes the game.
• Virtually every time the game is saved the game will crash shortly after.
• Helping the general with his junk crashes the game.
• Trying to collect specific trading cards (No. 30 - Gina) crashes the game.
• Getting the [Lollipop] tooltip on loading screens will sometimes crash the game.
• When tailing Nick's car in Episode 2 - Chapter 12, there are occasions where his car will be unable to gain enough speed to move up inclines, preventing the mission from proceeding and resulting in an automatic failure (the only way to fix this issue was to cap my framerate at 60 and ensure I was more than 100 yards away from him as his car went up the hill).
• Going down a ladder in a cutscene crashes the game.
• Going into a highlighted area the game expects you to go to (just outside the hotel) crashes the game.
• Trying to enter the diner through the back door crashes the game.
• Going near the police truck parked on the grass next to the diner crashes the game.
• Talking to Gina at the gas station crashes the game.
• In one instance while driving, York said to himself "...Hm? Nothing, just my imagination." followed by the immediate explosion of the car he was driving, treating me to an unceremonious game over (my car was at 33% durability at the time).
• Going near stairs during one of the final segments crashes the game.
• Completing a QTE during the final boss in a way the game seemingly does not like crashes the game.
• Doing a twirl during the final boss crashes the game.

Total playtime on Steam at the time of review: 34.6 hours
Actual playtime: 14.25 hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198203700957', 'num_games_owned': 515, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1385, 'last_played': 1619259586}
review:
Технически - ГОВНО РЕДКОСТНОЕ , заставляющее относительно топовое (2017г) железо RX580 пыхтеть и показывать 60 фпс (если мод поставить) . геймплейно - ССАНИНА НЕВИДАННАЯ (прицеливание) 
Но при этом это ЛУЧШЕЕ детективное расследование, которое пока что существует. (в расчёт не идут Бигби из Теллтейла и бетмены)
Хоть игра и была выпущена сначала на пс3 , но на комп её портировали безобразно : графон мыльный и холодных оттенков. Русского языка нет , о боже что же делать (нет,лексика не шибко сложная)
Сюжет 11/10 , про него нечего сказать, но могу отметить,что игра пропитана АТМОСФЕРОЙ , которая заставляла меня терпеть эту технически нестабильную Паrussiu , Особенно обожаю когда в игре долгие катсцены или диалоги, а во время загрузки игра вылеает. И напоследок : перезапускать игру надо каждые полтора часа, я не знаю как это объяснить,но игре "не нравится",когда в неё играют долго , она делает с 60 фпс до 15 и всё
P.S. в игре есть подобие зомби,которые идут на тебя в позе "мостик"/вперёд выгибаемой спиной - именно в такой позе люди, которые были в ответе за порт , занимались своим делом . Несмотря на всё,что я написал выше,я КРАЙНЕ РЕКОМЕНДУЮ пройти эту игру. [на ютубе]

author: {'steamid': '76561198894923826', 'num_games_owned': 440, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3074, 'last_played': 1619282203}
review:
Представьте себе друга, с которым вы не разлей вода. Он выглядит не всегда красиво, порой может тормозить, падать в обморок, водить кругами и даже иногда склонен выкручивать вам руки и пальцы. 
Однако, вместе с тем это весьма умная личность с хорошим чувством юмора и вкуса. Его просто приятно слушать и ждать, какая фраза будет следующей.  Также ему нравятся небольшие американские города в лесах, перемены в погоде, мистика и детективы. 
И всё это будет яркий потрет данной игры.

P.S. Если вторая часть на ПК не будет нормально отполирована, то я просто ударю разработчиков альбомом со всеми 64 коллекционными картами из игры.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052749928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2755, 'last_played': 1603485207}
review:
Крайне противоречивая игра.
Ты можешь любить ее за интересный, по-хорошему странный сюжет и хорошо переданную атмосферу затерянного в лесах провинциального американского городка.
И в то же время ненавидеть за постоянные вылеты.
Наслаждаться кат сценами (многие из них очень хороши).
И рвать на голове волосы от того, что игра испортила файл сохранения, запоров твой прогресс.
Игра ОЧЕНЬ не для всех. 
Но поиграть в нее стоит. Самобытная игра с интересным авторским стилем.
Если вы фанат сериала Twin Peaks (да и творчества Линча в целом), вам точно стоит ее оценить.

review:
С технической стороны игра очень хромает + из рук вон плохое управление заставило меня сильно ругаться. 
Игру перепроходила второй раз, спустя несколько лет, уже после просмотра сериала "Твин Пикс", так как в игре встречаются некоторые параллели и даже похожие персонажи. Второй такой игры я ещё не видела, она уникальна и понравится тем, кто ценит всё нестандартное. Финал заставил всплакнуть и забыть про все бесячие моменты в управлении и т.д. Чтобы разобраться в местном колорите, решила выбить все ачивки, сначала казалось, что это неимоверно сложно, т.к. полно всяких мелочей, о которых можно узнать только прочитав гайд, но потом втянулась и просто наслаждалась процессом, хотя порой это было сложновато. 
И вот наиграно 100 часов и все достижения уже получены, а мне вдруг стало жалко отпускать эту игру, настолько я привыкла к ней.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203299588', 'num_games_owned': 630, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 554, 'last_played': 1693322262}
review:
Edit: If you have Window's 10, this will run just fine without any issues unless you have hardware issues. Just be sure if you are going to play with a controller you use a custom configuration for the controller from the Community, since for some odd reason the game has a X axis issue. If you get both of those, YES THE GAME IS WORTH IT. If you have windows 11 read below.

Let me start this off by saying if you can get this game on sale for anywhere under $5 it is absolutely worth the price on Steam... But with that being said if it IS NOT on sale STAY AWAY from this version i do not know why any developer would port games from console to PC without trying to test it and fix there issues. The PC version is pretty awful, nothing to do with the frame rate on my Nvidia 1050 you can get 60fps without any real trouble, my issues come in the form of two VERY BIG problems, One being that for some reason randomly my game will just minimize for absolutely no reason, Not Close but it will just Minimize and that gets irritating if you are either getting immersed or having fun playing the game, and i have not been able to fix that. and Number Two being the lack of the controller support functioning correctly even with downloaded custom patches that say (IT WORKS) spoiler alert IT DOESN'T. The PS3 Version has shit framerate at most times but i can still finish that version without it crashing. If you REALLY WANT to play this game, the main version is backwards compatible on Xbox One and it runs very smooth, it is a fantastic experience and the game is one of a kind, yes it can be very weird, yes the gameplay can get repetitive, but if you haven't been spoiled on the story of this game it is a fantastic time from start to finish, never have i once got bored with the games story (although there are occasional [Follow this character] Missions that do get real annoying killing the speed you wish to go) But the Xbox 360 Version of Deadly Premonition is your best bet if you want the best overall experience, if you want to see the new Directors Cut scenes just look them up on YouTube, you aren't missing much there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059754051', 'num_games_owned': 1382, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 1241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1618082013}
review:
The love child of Resident Evil and The X-Files, Deadly Premonition is a wonderful game with a tremendous surreal detective story that will leave you in awe. As FBI agent Francis York Morgan, your task is to travel to the small town of Greenvale and find out what supernatural forces are sowing sorrow among the citizens. The plot is one of the most captivating video game stories I've seen - it has a great setting, very developed and unique characters with professional voice-acting, as well as many tasteful plot twists. And while it could be classified as a horror game, many of its moments are intentionally humorous. One would doubt how such a combo could ever work but amazingly it does here. All the emotions, all the tone changes are also felt through the brilliant soundtrack. It all created an experience where the more I played, the more I wanted the game to never end.

Sadly there are also plenty weak points in Deadly Premonition. You can see everywhere that this was a budget title - the graphics (almost terrible), the UI (counterintuitive, outdated and clumsy), the controls (god the atrocious controls...), the animations (wooden and repeated), the world design (a huge map with forced long journeys in cars that barely handle), the scandalous achievements (their descriptions are pure spoilers, who in their right mind would do that?) and don't get me started about the technical problems the PC port has... In order to run this game and make it playable, one needs to apply a handful of fixes/patches and then some (look up Steam guides - there are a few good fix collections packed in one place for you to download). Once you get it running it will crash every once in a while - some of these crashes you'll overcome by relaunching the game whereas some other crashes may corrupt your save data and you'll need to download a savegame made after that point to continue the story. I'm sure I missed some, but in any case this problematic side is hell.

When you sum up the downsides it may seem like this game is not even worth trying due to its issues, but I assure you - it's perfectly playable with a little effort. And I encourage all who love a good supernatural mystery to give Deadly Premonition a shot -  it's a most enjoyable, spooky and fun experience that had me thinking about it long after I'd turned it off.

P.S. Deadly Premonition 2 is coming to Steam. I'm afraid I'll buy it as soon as it hits the shelves. And I never ever do that with games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198894571788', 'num_games_owned': 685, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1618438803}
review:
Guten Morgen zusammen^^

Was soll ich sagen, das Game ist ein Phänomen. Vor langer Zeit, ich glaube ich habe grad sprechen gelernt, das Spiel fürn Appel und nen Ei geschossen. Mich gefreut wegen der Screenshots, Beschreibung...Musste ich mir nach dem Starten erstmal meine kleinen roten Augen reiben " Hab ich da noch Staub vom Sandmann auf der Linse?!?" Das ist doch nicht das Spiel was ich mir geholt habe "Scam!!!!" ;-) Instantly closed und runter von der Platte.

Und doch.. Irgendwas hat mich ja zum Kauf bewogen, Story hört sich doch not so bad an.... Hmmmmm.... Aber da wa doch was mit der Steuerung zuätzlicher zur PS1 Grafik...
Ach, guck ma da... Gibt ja neue Patches...

Selfunderstandable... Van Gogh konnte sich sein Ohr nichtmehr annähen, egal wie hübsch sein Absinthrausch war... Und nur weil ich zu meiner Handvoll Valium nen Apfel esse, wird aus nem Grobmotoriker kein Kunstflugpilot...

Aber was soll ich sagen. Es läuft, ich bin gefessselt und werds jetzt zocken. (ich glaub ich hab das Spiel sogar in der Bibliothek zeitweise versteckt, um nicht aus Versehen diesen Trash zu installieren.....

So kanns gehn.... Ich geb nen Thumb Up! Eine Empfehlung generell mag ich erst nach dem Durchspielen geben.
Aber, yeah! Appel und Ei waren doch nicht nur für Kompost.

In diesem Sinne... Bleibt mir alle gesund !

review:
[This review was made after multiple playthroughs on Xbox 360]

Want a bit of japanese-styled David Lynch experience? Then this is it. This game may have wonky controls, PS2-era graphics  and a pretty shaby intro, but what makes this game a one of a kind are the characters and the writing. Francis York Morgan became one of my favorite video game protagonist with all his movie talks and his weird personality and every residents of Greenvale had a unique side of them which made them charming. This is like a budget cross-over between Silent Hill and Resident Evil 4, but this game still had a lasting impact on me when I first played it in 2010. Thank you York for taking me with you on your case about Greenvale. This was a hell of a ride, isn't that right, Zack?

review:
I've played it on PS3 and had to get it on PC for the mods. YOU SHOULD INSTALL THE MODS LISTED IN THE COMMUNITY TAB TO GET BETTER QUALITY AND SO THAT IT WON'T CRASH ON YOU KTHX :o)

If you haven't seen Twin Peaks (First of all, WHAT ARE YOU DOING?!), it's an older show from the late 80s/early 90s that was on normal cable TV despite it being "surreal, horrifying, gory, yet wholesome and hammy". This game is what would happen if Twin Peaks happened in another universe. The feel is there. It feels as if the developers got a hold of David Lynch and he said, "Yeah, that looks like Naomi Watts! I'll make sure to put her in Season 3 of Twin Peaks in 2017." (And he did)

There's something beautiful here. Lots of absurd comedy and lovey dovey moments mixed with violence, creepiness, and rich in mystery. And oh yeah, make sure you download the DPfix files so it will run better and look prettier.  

10 out of 10 damn good cups of coffee.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044265623', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1199, 'last_played': 1617150993}
review:
This game is one of the most suspenseful and scary games I have played in years. You never know if you will get to the save point because if you don’t and it crashes, you have to go through a walk/running segment all over again. I was naive and thought that other players just weren’t willing to go out of their way to fix the game with constant bugs. I thought “Wow, I can just install this fan patch and deal with some minor crashes here and there. It will be easy.”

No I was wrong, very very wrong. This game crashed on nearly every end of every chapter. I was even hard stuck on chapter 16 and had to get another save file. It is unbelievable to me how bad of a state this game is on PC. Buyers seriously beware, if you do not want to tinker and try to fix things with this game then don’t bother. It REALLY is as bad as others and I say.

However, if you get past that. This game is incredible. Being an FBI detective with an imaginary friend creates wonderful dialog along with the other oddities that happen throughout the town. About 80% of the cutscenes have something to have a giggle at. Whether that be writing, delivery, sound mixing, graphical bugs, physics with the game. It’s just great. As for gameplay, it is honestly quite bad. It is even worse than a poor mans Resident Evil 4. Enemies are barely a threat, you have a pistol with unlimited ammo, and you just shoot stuff until it dies. If they get too close just hold your breath and they will not attack you. Most melee weapons can only be used on enemies about 10 times before breaking. You can get unnecessary points for doing “things” around town and also collect them. There are side quest and trading cards however I didn’t try hard to get them due to being afraid of the game crashing (maybe some day). Puzzles are hardly even there. The answer is always a straight line with absolutely nothing puzzling.

But even then, with all these complaints and all of these crashes. I could not put this game down. It was a hilarious ride and I loved it all. There is something charming and lovable with all the characters. This game really is all about its story, universe, and soundtrack. However, admittedly, if I would ever do this again I would buy the switch version. This port is truly terrible something to behold. That’s why even though I really loved the game, I cannot recommend it in good conscience. If it ever gets a patch, you best believe this is getting flipped to a recommendation.

Here are random fixes that may help you get past a crash.
-Smoke to past the time to a certain time of day
-Lower the refresh rate
-Run the game as Admin
-Run the game in various versions of windows through compatibility mode
-Press escape on black screens (this is when cutscenes don’t trigger properly)
-Download another save from someone else
-Disable steam overlay

Good luck if you end up trying to run with it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987490467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1616915970}
review:
This is a buggy, awful, mess of a PC port that feels like it's held together with paper clips. However, I have gotten more enjoyment out of 1 hour of this game than I have many of the recent AAA blockbuster titles. I honestly can't tell how much of this game was meant to be absurd and how much of it is unintentional. This game is something of a happy accident, and I now finally understand why it has something of a cult following.

While I think this game is absolutely worth checking out, I cannot in good conscience give it a recommendation due to its state on PC. If you can get a hold of the Xbox360 version; play that instead. If you can't, then this version is probably worth 5-10 bucks if you are willing to fiddle with it and deal with random crashing.

PS: For those who decide to take the plunge on PC and are on Windows 10, I will give you a tip and save you some time. Right click the game executable, go to properties, then compatibility tab, and set it to Windows XP SP 3 mode or else the game will run like a slide show. Also I have had the best luck just running it windows, as painful as that sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561199124299081', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1674558079}
review:
История разработки этой игры так же удивительна, как и то что вышло в результате. Если вкратце, то она разрабатывалась с 10 года для playstation 2, поэтому когда она вышла на 3, а потом и ПК, геймплей и графика были невероятно устаревшими(хотя будем откровенны это утверждение касалось и первоначальной версии для PS2). 
Долгое время всех интересовал вопрос - как же так вышло? Давление со стороны издательства, недостаток бюджета? Выход второй части расставил все по своим местам - swery(создатель игры) был просто никудышным геймдизайнером, за годы умудрился стать ещё хуже. Вот только 1 и 2 часть отличает самое главное - в те далёкие времена он был хорошим сценаристом...

Сразу оговорюсь, наверное нет смысла рассматривать как-либо геймплей. Он плох - кривые анимации, стрельба, убогий открытый мир и такая же графика. Ты либо принимаешь это, либо нет. Другое дело что для сюжета это нужно, так как в формате интерактивного кино игра бы попросту не работала. Пройдя через борьбу буквально со всем содержимым игры, ты больше веришь в это безумие и сюрреализм что преследует персонажей и главного героя. А они тут просто прекрасны.

Диалоги и химия между персонажами прописаны просто на высоте, даже разговоры о кино с Заком во время бесконечных поездок весьма доставляют и привносят своей атмосферы. Большинство действующих лиц не раз сменяют свою амплуа и раскрываются с новых сторон, более того, сам главный герой весьма харизматичен и за ним интересно наблюдать, даже любовная линия не кажется ненужной и вызывает какие-то эмоции. Ну а истинное происхождение  Зака - это отдельная причина для прохождения.

Про сюжет многие говорили что он вдохновлён Твин Пиксом, я его не смотрел, так что поверю на слово, мне же больше показалось что это Сайлент хилл, наполненный японским юмором. Сам сюжет радует неожиданными поворотами и постоянной балансировкой между оккультизмом/реализмом, в конце же все окончательно скатывается в классическое японское безумие.

Сложно поставить игре оценку, большинство людей ее выключат ее после часа или вступительных 15 минут, но если это ваше - то осознание этого придет в те же 15 минут. Стоит ли потраченное время и борьба с механиками того? Безусловно да, так как это одно из тех произведений которое точно вам запомнится на долгие годы. 
Сюжет 8/10
Геймплей 0/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198182887811', 'num_games_owned': 607, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1658202303}
review:
Deadly Premonition 
This is a game i would recommend but NOT on steam if you're looking for a stable port

Deadly Premonition is a game i first picked up back in college for the Xbox 360. I asked a staff member if they'd recommend any games on a certain shelf (cheapish) and Deadly Premonition was the first one
On the 360 i loved the game, it took me a few hours to really get into it but once the story started coming together i was really enjoying the game and wanted more.
I figured out pretty well who the killer was before the ending of the game although the last few chapters did mislead me and make me question my prediction 

So, this port the main issue's are the game crashes, the game will randomly at any point shut itself down and leave you feeling like a virgin being stood up
i have had numerous crashes so far, there are some help guides online which i've used and running the DPlauncher as admin helped a bit but the crashes are still happening. It's a shame as this game is really good and underrated. If you play this be sure to safe extremely often as you might find yourself having to repeat any story from your last save.

As for controls i couldn't find a way to get the controller to work even though it says controller is supported but i'm happy using Mouse/KB so no loss for me. Shooting is a little clunky but free roam with a mouse is better and is near enough the same as the 360 version and easy to use. The weapons you get are multiple blunt/sharp objects and firearms which are good to switch into on different enemies

Driving is still as clunky as the 360 version, you kind of get used to it after a while but i find myself flipping more cars than i did when working in fast food, you can have your own car and different police cars and using  the sirens to go faster

I'm not sure if it's me but the colour seems to be very bland in comparison to the xbox version but that could be bad memory, it doesn't effect gameplay or cutscenes though

Graphics are dated but i've seen worse, there is the odd graphical glitch ere or there like a coat becoming intertwined with other clothing but again, nothing game breaking 

I know it may seem weird that i recommend the game but if you can stop the game crashing it's a great game, with a cool story, side quests to keep you busy, collectables to find and even fishing and races

One of my favourite things from Deadly Premonition though is definitely the unique soundtrack, it's a drawing point as i've not heard a soundtrack like it before but i love it.
Plenty of backstory for characters main and side and constant convo's with Zack to keep you in the loop of what's happening 

So, main story (no spoilers) You come to a small town in the middle of nowhere, there has been a murder and its' your job to solve it, the game does this very interestingly and makes each place unique with you finding clues in each locations giving you more and more leads, but with public getting in the way, who's the murderer?!

Great game, Fun story, easy combat, let down by bad stability in the port
Don't let yourself go without playing this!

review:
I should have heeded the warnings, but, I desperately wanted to play this game for myself and experience it's cliche's in all it's glory.  Sadly, I don't have the patience to deal with the game freezing up on cutscene's which happens frequently enough that it ruins the immersion of the game for me.

Yes, there are fixes out there, not sure if any can work for Windows 10 though (I use Windows 8).  But, I don't much like the idea of downloading some sketchy files onto my computer in order to get a game running smoothly and not be reassured 100% effectiveness anyway that these fixes are gonna work for me.  Instead I looked up other fixes (safer) that got me past one set of freezes only to be thwarted by more later on.

1. Install the DPfix which will help with the graphics

2. Apply the Large Address Aware modification to DP.exe and create a desktop shortcut directly to it (using the launcher made it crash for me), this will fix most crashes including the infamous chapter 9 ones
https://www.techpowerup.com/forums/threads/large-address-aware.112556/

3. Set DP.exe to compatibility mode with WinXP SP2 (some people recommended win 98 but that made it crash for me; your results may vary), this also helped with early crashes

author: {'steamid': '76561198038293797', 'num_games_owned': 651, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 3861, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3861, 'last_played': 1600593190}
review:
Overall, I would say that this would probably be considered one of the best survival horror games of all time had it been released a decade or so ago. As such, the game itself feels like a relic from another era.
In terms of presentation, the game is woefully outdated. The graphics would only be impressive if it was released on the Dreamcast or PS2. The mapping and guidance system, which is seemingly borrowed from GTA is just plain terrible, when you consider how big the map is. Also, there are maybe five or six character models for enemies throughout the game. Finally, the sound during the combat missions basically consists of the enemies muttering the same two phrases over and over again. That said, Deadly Premonition offers something downright inspiring for every one of its technical shortcomings. There's an ugly world thick with idiosyncrasies and history and a fascinating lead in Agent Francis York Morgan. Even though it reminded me of some other games, it's really a mixed bag and in a league of it's own. I didn't mind that it switched genres back and forth from a Resident Evil style survival horror, to a crime thriller, to a semi-open world with random quests and people to talk to. 
Throughout Deadly Premonition, you'll find yourself in very odd situations punctuated by Agent York. This is where the game absolutely shines; the surreal interaction between York and the townsfolk, as well as the interaction between York and himself can only be described as a work of art. In a town where crimes can be solved by shooting bird nests with shotguns, trees drop severed hands that can be used as doorknobs, and countless giant dogs fall out of the sky at midnight. The game contains an intangible, eccentric atmosphere which easily overshadows its many shortcomings. This is a game simply overflowing with a vivid personality and bizarre charm. I enjoyed the diversity of the characters and the atmosphere of the town.
Ultimately I enjoyed the game, If you're the kind of person who is willing to look past the flaws and see a game as a whole, you'll have a lot of fun. Irregardless, Deadly Premonition is one of the most incredible games ever made with it's unmatched characterisation and unique story that will have you guessing as to who the Raincoat Killer is until the very end. However, this game is not for everyone; some would find themselves unsatisfied with the somewhat repetitive combat and the confusing endgame twists involving certain characters. More still will find themselves unable to stomach the odd character animations or the excessively large map.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060039541', 'num_games_owned': 848, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1610251169}
review:
Played Deadly Premonition countless times before across Xbox and Switch, so I figured it was time to give the PC port the good old college try.

The intro cutscene ended with a watermark for free video re-encoding software, and performance drastically dropped after briefly alt-tabbing to Discord. I think that about sums up this port and that's a shame.

Deadly Premonition is absolutely a diamond in the rough. Flawed, but ambitious and full of heart with a gripping story to boot. It's a shame that all the ports made the diamond rougher, but its the PC version that carries the most issues thanks to its strange limitations and countless technical issues. It was bad enough for me to barely want to play further into the prologue.

If you're going to play Deadly Premonition - which I do recommend along with its sequel (and most Swery games) - play the Xbox version or Switch port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012635679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1595892438}
review:
J'avais très envie d'écrire ici une longue critique enthousiaste expliquant comment, plusieurs années après avoir tenté le jeu sur Xbox360 et l'avoir trouvé décevant, je l'avais repris sur PC en finissant happé par l'expérience.

Tout ce qui a été écrit de négatif sur le jeu est vrai : ses passages de tir peuvent être vus comme hors-sujet et cassant le rythme, ses graphismes étaient plus que datés à la sortie du jeu (même si c'est finalement assez peu important 10 ans après), les environnements sont vides, la boucle de gameplay est répétitive.

Mais il y a quelque chose qui fonctionne, dans son ambiance, dans ses personnages, dans l'ambition du titre qui permet de visiter une petite ville...
Enfin, je dis "fonctionne" mais je devrais dire "fonctionnait". Après environ 6 heures de jeu le jeu se met à crasher systématiquement quand je sors de ma chambre d’hôtel. Deadly Premonition est certes un jeu qu'on a envie de défendre malgré son côté fauché mais la version PC et ses bugs le rendant littéralement injouable le transforme en ma pire frustration vidéo-ludique de l'année 2020.

{'steamid': '76561197999307974', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 2154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1610241975}
review:
This game is good. In a bad-good way, [i]a la[/i] The Room. OK? OK.

I would also say it is bad-good in the same vein as Twin Peaks, but some people actually like that program? So take that how you will. There's numerous allusions and homage-stylings to Twin Peaks, and it's by far the strongest influence on the game, but what you have is that sort of a detective story - which already features an idiosyncratically bizarre protagonist, and a definitely-dementia-rattled director, [i]through the lens of a Japanese indie developer.[/i] That prospect alone is enough to sell the game, I think. 

More towards the point of a negative review, it is imperative that you are aware it is buggy as sh*t. 

Controllers don't work natively (or at least my 360 one doesn't); the game is liable to crash (I had about one every 5 hours, except for one reliable crash that mandated XP compatibility mode). If you're okay with installing 13+ pieces of remedial malware to get it to operate, that's great - and power to you! - but I think a positive review should be, as a low bar, predicated upon the game working "out of the box."

Beyond that, there's a number of frankly idiotic design choices. The game operates on an internal 24-hour clock, which is fine; the town often feels lively because of it. But all the mechanisms of interacting with it - sleeping and smoking - are painstakingly slow. Some events only happen at specific times, and both the game and the guide world are fairly quiet on this front - you've gotta tap into the logic of idiocy for it. There's also a weather system, which restricts some events, and enables others - this is fine; the game explores it in-universe - but once again it creates an [b]arbitrary block on accessibility of certain events.[/b] As far as I can tell, rain is a random (though frequent enough) occurence - but it [b]never improved my experience[/b] as a timing system. It was strictly questionable. Combine that with the knowledge that completionism, postgame, relies on infrequent saves (specifically, you lose the ability to save mid-game, and instead must finish the "chapter" you're playing to save - why? What the f*ck?). This compounds the issues of crashes with inaccessibility to create a very... unenjoyable environment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112854805', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1567923506}
review:
При всем том, что эта игра мне нравится и её схожесть с любимым сериалом Твин Пикс, закрывать глаза на проблемы нельзя. Первое, что я хотел упомянуть, это конечно же её технические проблемы. В неё просто нельзя спокойно играть. То она вылетает, то баги, из-за которых требуется загружать сохранения, то нужно переключать совместимость операционной системы и т.д. Второе, это просто слитые концовки в унитаз, которые портят впечатления об игре. Третье, это кривое управление к которому привыкнешь со временем, но все равно неприятно. Ну и конечно же разработчики, которые просто ничего не захотели исправлять и подумали, что и так сойдет. Так мало этого они еще и умудрились сделать вторую часть, которая вышла ХУЖЕ первой часть по всем параметрам.
Покупайте на свой страх и риск.

This will feel like it has "cult classic" status in the first 20 minutes of the game.  It's a diamond in the rough and the rough is the game itself.  Some of my favorite moments is the monologue (or is it dialogue??) in the car rides where you get neat factoids of famous movies. author: {'steamid': '76561198013866056', 'num_games_owned': 2627, 'num_reviews': 308, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1440734577}
review:
The greatest mess in gaming. Deadly Premonition is a mystery action adventure game with a town and characters inspired by media like Twin Peaks and a tone that can shift from brutal and bloody to light and absurdly humorous. 

Poor graphics, poor controls, poor driving, poor UI, annoying timed event system, bugs, dull and slow combat (though with some ok enemy designs), all dated in every way (even for when the game first released in 2010). But it is the story, characters, the town itself, the often catchy and good music, and the awkward dialogue and acting that all come together in a way that just works perfectly that makes the game worth playing even with all the other problems, at times even making some of those downsides almost charming. 

In many ways a terrible game, but even with the over 3,000 games I've played, Deadly Premonition is one of my favorites with one of the best settings and most memorable protagonists I've experienced.


Better played on one of the consoles for stability if you are able to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016843334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1606162937}
review:
I don’t even know how to describe my experience with this game. Deadly Premonition: Director’s Cut is one of the best AND worst games I have ever played. And I think that contradiction perfectly summarizes the experience.

Let’s talk about the (quite abundant) bad first: Tech and gameplay wise this is a terrible game, I had an awful experience playing it. The controls are abysmal (that camera control for Christ’s sake!), there are endless bugs in the open world, the NPCs AI and the physics engine are a smorgasbord of errors, the performance is hit and miss (I had rock solid 60fps sessions and sub-20fps ones, sometimes in the same area and chapter), and don’t even get me started with the stability. The game was a constant festival of crashes, and they seemed to happen at total random so I couldn’t see them coming. Sometimes it crashed indoors, sometimes outdoors, sometimes during a cutscene, a conversation, a loading screen… for me, this was the most nightmarish horror game because I played in a state of constant, increasing tension before I reached a new phone (not to save the game, but to be sure that the next crash wouldn’t restart me from too long ago).

The gameplay is also absolutely dated. The missions are boring as hell, the combat system is clunky, the enemy variety is non-existent and the very few boss battles have positively nothing special. Driving around Greenvale is a pain with almost every car in the game, the map confuses you instead of being of any assistance, and the music tracks, albeit quite fine, are very scarce and play over and over again... Also, during cutscenes, the voices are almost every time out of sync and the character animations rarely fit the tone of their dialogue, producing some unsettling feeling while you’re watching them.

But, you know what? I… actually enjoyed Deadly Premonition. I can definitely understand its ‘cult classic’ appeal.

The story is super interesting and always leaves you wanting to know more and more. The game world is very believable and the characters that inhabit in it are (at least the main ones) properly fleshed out (their voice acting is actually very good as well). Despite the obvious influence from David Lynch’s work, Deadly Premonition is able to find its own unique personality and direction, and it does it with an endless supply of charm and uniqueness. The story it tells is so engaging that you start overlooking its very obvious and painful flaws and just focus on moving forward as York continues to delve deeper and deeper in the mystery of the Raincoat Killer. Every new twist and turn keeps you on your toes and Swery even manages to save some surprises until the very end. The writing here is top-notch, a surprising gem.

I guess that’s where the love of its super hardcore fanbase comes from. Deadly Premonition is so good and unique at its core that you forgive its limitations and errors to a point in which they don’t even matter in your experience anymore, despite constituting 90% of it.

I screamed at the screen in frustration an infinite amount of times, I wanted to kill its creators over some god-awful design choices, or every time the game randomly crashed or made me close and restart my computer. However, I couldn’t stop playing; its weirdness captivates you like very few other games in existence, casting a spell over you that numbs your senses and good jugdgment, and in the end only good memories remain.


I can’t recommend this game to anyone, but I still had a memorable time with it.

review:
One of my all-time favorites, but not on PC. Think Twin Peaks if it was written by a Japanese man who only loosely watched the pilot episode, and just tried guessing the rest of the plot. Please play this game on any other system if that sounds even remotely up your alley.

I had to give up and play on console about 8 or so hours into my playthrough due to a known savegame corrupting bug. I now know there are workarounds and savegames online to maneuver around said corruption trigger, but that was the tipping point when combined with the PC exclusive bugs and constant crashes every 5-15 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083490861', 'num_games_owned': 1461, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1922, 'last_played': 1604064117}
review: This game is bad to look at and painful to play sometimes, I almost quit it since it was so buggy. My game would crash on me a bunch at some point. Even to this day I have no idea how it just fixed itself and it suddenly felt better, but I'm so happy I got to play it till the end of the stupidest boss battles I've ever played. The lore, the characters, the silly music with it's sound effects - I learned to love it more and more. I didn't take this game seriously right from the start, because I was under impression that it was just goofy and making fun of B-movies mostly. But as I got closer to the ending, I got more and more attached to little Greenvale and to its residents. This goofy game actually stirred up some feelings in me like a perfectly stirred up coffee with FK initials swimming in it. This game has a personality that a lot of other games are lacking. A real gem that people don't create anymore. It's all worth it for its amazing ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995373452', 'num_games_owned': 1492, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1491, 'last_played': 1604005075}
review:
Once you get past the rendering weirdness and the occasional crash, Deadly Premonition turns out to be an oddly charming little game.

Is it the best game? No. Is it a GOOD game? Arguable, for the following reasons:
-The controls are a little clumsy
-Vehicle physics are *weird*
-There's not a lot of enemy variety (I counted 3 types and 3 bosses)
-Weapons feel a little anaemic

But here's the thing... It's a really nice game all the same. What should have been downsides that would normally make me go 'no, it's bad, avoid' wound up being paired up with a really compelling story that just... charms you, and you find *everything* just adds up to be an honest and earnest attempt at making a really good story into a good game.

Definitely consider picking it up when on sale - and grab DPFix by Durante when you do so!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018941044', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1603729302}
review:
This title can be summed up in one word I feel.
>Trash<

But oh boy what kind of trash it is. It's probably one of the finest pieces of trash out there.
You know what they say. One mans trash is another mans treasure.

When you buy this you are spending your money on an elaborate hoax and even though you are probably aware that you are being hoaxed you cannot help but sit and watch in awe as the madness of this title unfolds.

"What the Fuck" is what you'll be saying more than once throughout your playtime here.
One weird ass cutscene is chasing another, connected by the jankiest gameplay you'll ever see.
And the soundtrack. It's on another level.

I cannot decide whether the developer is joking, creating some avant-garde art game or if it was a serious attempt at creating whatever the hell this is.

Again, it is serious jank, but it is the loveliest jank that I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038922945', 'num_games_owned': 1137, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1610251918}
review:
The game is worth playing. The shooting sections are fairly janky and sometimes drag on too long, but the story and general writing make it worth playing. The story is absolutely insane, and barely lost anything during my replay on this version. York is at least in the top 10 video game protagonists. Driving around town doing sidequests and interacting with its inhabitants also has its charm.

This Director's Cut port however, is not worth playing. It crashed at least once every hour, sometimes during critical story scenes, which just destroyed any momentum they had. Usually the crashes are random, sometimes they're consistent, requiring bizarre steps like having to smoke cigarettes for an (ingame) hour to bypass.  There's all sorts of strange hiccups like constant stuttering during driving, hyper sensitive controls during driving, and QTEs not triggering properly until I just mess with the games configuration files randomly until they make me pass. The lighting is blown out in many cutscenes and makes it look like the games in a supernova. Water shaders are broken during certain cutscenes making it look like a blue paint, making an already ugly game a real eyesore. Infamous save-destroying bugs from the original version are still here. This is all with Durante's fan-patch, which the port is only quasi-playable without it (no diss towards Durante, bless him).

The new content the Director's Cut adds isn't really worth it either, basically a few new interlude cutscenes that are so pointless they may as well not exist. The PS3 version runs at like 12 FPS for the entire game on top of most of the graphical issues above. Xbox 360 version has tank controls but is otherwise the most stable by far. If you have an Xbox 360 or Xbox One XSBBQ or whatever that has backwards compatibility, go with that version instead.

Having tried a go at this several times with DPFix and other community patches, the game still plays up with a controller, randomly crashes and is just unpleasant to experience on a Windows 10 PC. Very disappointed in how much effort and patience you need to see it to the end. Kudos to those that can tolerate all that as the game has a certain charm to it much like the Twin Peaks TV show.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094390914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1966, 'last_played': 1602781883}
review:
[b] tl;dr: definitely play this game, but avoid the PC version if at all possible [/b]

This feels kind of wrong, because DP is genuinely a great and unique game that doesn't really have anything that can compare to it, even ten years after its release. Unfortunately, this version of the game has a whole bunch of issues that keep me from being able to recommend it.

Some of the issues I experienced include:

- I couldn't get my 360 controller to work in any way other than in win98 compatibility mode which quadrupled load times and killed the frame rate
- I got run time errors every other hour without enabling more ram, and about every three hours with 4gb of ram enabled
- I had frequent physics glitches were the game sped up my character in and outside of cars
- at some point, I got weird visual glitches during the rain that I couldn't reproduce later
- the game got stuck in a black screen during a chapter transition (fortunately, rebooting my PC fixed this)

So, the bottom line is, if at all possible, get this game on the switch (along with the sequel), or on the PS3 or 360. If you do try your luck on this version, there is a very helpful guide in the community section that makes the game considerably more stable, but even using that, I still had most of the issues described above.

review:
This game is great. It has quirky dialog, colorful character, and a great horror mystery. However, this port specifically is terrible, and you have no one else to blame but Toybox, Inc. This is a port of the already bad Director's Cut for the Playstation 3. 

I have tried plenty of times to get this game to work properly with DPfix patches, and it almost worked, but the game still continues to crash constantly. It's frustrating doing the same segment more than 5 times only for it to crash at the exact same time. I've given up. Save yourself the headache by not supporting this horrible port.

If you would seriously like to enjoy this Japanese Twin Peaks fan fiction then I highly encourage you to seek out the Xbox 360 version because it's the only version of the game that is not a complete mess. Plus, it is backwards compatible with the Xbox One and the Series X.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024962947', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1676602587}
review:
Game is literally unplayable for me.  Tried multiple fixes and nothing I could do could get my Xbox controller working in a functional state.  The controls will maybe let me move an inch before I have to jerk it around to get even a step of movement.  of course, this is with the fixes applied.  I even went as far as to try multiple fixes to get this game to work.  Literaly nothing is making this game playable.

This might take the cake as the single worst PC port I have ever played.  It's so bad, I can't even get it to function.  Stick to literally any other version of the game.  After I get the Steam trading cards for this, it's uninstalled and never seeing the light of day on my computer again.

They should be ashamed of releasing such an unfisnished product and asking for money for it.  The amount of fan work gone into fixing it is insane too.

TLDR; awesome game, worst PC port you could possibly imagine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067387732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1608967525}
review:
Excelente juego, surrealista, divertido y un poco incómodo. Es como tener un sueño extraño que puede estar lleno de simbolismos o sencillamente consumiste más de lo debías

Pero es importante que sepas que es un desafío jugarlo de manera cómoda, si lo compras tienes que ser consciente que es muy probable que tengas que estar las primeras horas configurando y pasando rabias con el juego. Muy recomendable al empezar a jugarlo contabilizar las horas de juego de modo que no sobrepasen las dos horas, para que puedas pedir reembolso si no consigues jugar en condiciones

Resumo el camino que tuve que recorrer para jugarlo. Windows 10 64 bits pc gama media (RX 580)

- El juego parece ir bien, pero está capado a 720p

- En el segundo arrance del juego instala archivos (vaya, que extraño que no lo hiciera antes)

- El juego deja de arrancar

- Para que vuelva arrancar, al menos en windows 10, es necesario ir al directorio donde está instalado el juego, carpeta redist ("\SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut\redist") y abrir el archivo ejecutable "PhysX_SystemSoftware.exe" En este instalador bastaría con hacer click en "repair"

- Ahora el juego debería volver a funcionar pero estás en 720p y es muy probable que tengas problemas con el joystick o mando que quieras ocupar

- Existe un parche de la comunidad que ayuda, entre otras cosas, a cambiar la resolución. Se llama DPfix. En realidad tiene varias opciones gráficas, puedes sencillamente subirlo a 4k o 1080p con varios filtros y mejoras
http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/DPfix095.zip

- Solo falta el mando, yo tuve los problemas con mando de xbox one. Si bien era reconocido en el menú, en el momento de jugar el personaje no consigue moverse. Los pasos que seguí para poder ocupar el mando son los siguientes:

1 - Click en ajustes de steam, opción "Mando" y luego "Ajustes generales del mando" se abre una pantalla tipo Big Picture de steam y ahí marqué "Configuración mando Xbox" y "Configuración mando genérico". Si el personaje sigue sin poder moverse intenta dejar marcada solamente la opción de mando xbox o al revés, solamente dejar marcada la configuración mando genérico

2- Ahora el personaje debiera poder moverse al menos, no obstante el stick derecho tiene los ejes invertidos, vale decir mueves la palanca a la derecha y la cámara sube, tiras la palanca hacia arriba y la cámara se mueve a la izquierda (en este momento ya estaba al borde de las lágrimas, pero Miyazaki estaría decepcionado si me hubiera rendido xD)

3- La comunidad ha hecho un mapeado correcto para poder jugar el juego, para llegar a el mismo tienes que ir a tu biblioteca de steam, click derecho a Deadly Premonition, click en “Administrar” y luego “opciones de mando” (tienes que tener al menos un mando conectado al pc, si no tienes ningún mando conectado no aparece esta opción) luego tienes que ir a “explorar configuraciones” luego click en “comunidad” y finalmente aplicar la configuración “Deadly Premonition Controller +” de theraineydaze. En realidad este paso es opcional, podrías tu mismo mapear una configuración jugable pero es probable que a estas alturas quieras aplicar una configuración y que termine el sufrimiento

-Importante considerar que el juego NO cuenta con Steam Cloud, si quieres cambiar de pc o formatear y seguir jugando la partida tienes que respaldar manualmente los archivos de guardado

Tal vez alguien pregunte ¿Vale realmente la pena?
Yo francamente diría que sí, es realmente un buen juego. Aunque claro tal vez es mejor optar por alguna versión de consola y ahorrarse todo este dolor de cabeza

Voy a dejar la discusión abierta si alguien quiere agregar o corregir algo

author: {'steamid': '76561198128299093', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1597955010}
review:
This is a review of my first run-through of the game (~34 hours give or take). Considering my expectations of DP, which were fairly low to begin with, I thoroughly enjoyed the gameplay but would only recommend to purchase the PC port on sale. I actually did not expect to enjoy it as much as I did. Is the game perfect? Not by any stretch of the imagination. But it is a classic. 

[b] TLDR; Buy the shit out of this – but on sale!  [/b]

Here is a summary and rating (1-5) of my personal experiences with the game: 

[u] Interface/Port [/u] [b] (1) [/b]

Oh boy, where to start? Although the game provides you with the option to switch between keyboard and controller before game launch (and the default controls themselves I had no problem with), you have to pretty much jump through every hoop known to man to actually get the game to launch after the starting scene. The PC port leaves a lot to be desired and this is putting it very gently. I am one of the few lucky players who managed to find solutions around the plethora of Windows compatibility and driver issues and actually played the game through to the end. Simple achievements that are awarded for completing chapters range at 5-15% rates, which pretty much reflects how difficult it is to mould this game around your PC settings. I had to research various guides and discussion forums after experiencing a total of approximately 7 major game crashes. Buy at your own risk and if you’re prepared to spend at least some time researching fixes. 

[u] Gameplay [/u] [b] (5) [/b]

I personally loved the game. With all its technical faults, it is definitely charming. The characters are pretty well written and the chemistry between them is refreshing. I think the highlight of the game is definitely our protagonist detective Agent York, who has a very quirky and unusual method of investigating crime scenes. The backstories and plot twists in this game never end! And although the story is pretty linear, I will definitely be going back for a second run-through to enjoy any bonus side quests or content. I also found the option to listen to York chat about his favourite movie classics while you drive about to be a very nice touch and make the task much less tedious (you drive around quite a lot in this game!). Overall, even though I started playing this game for shits and giggles, it genuinely grew on me over time as an endearing storyline. 

[u] Pacing [/u] [b] (4) [/b]

I would say the game is pretty well paced, although you are often left to your own devices for hours at a time and it sometimes feels a little bit like an open world without much chance for true exploration. The game map is actually quite vast, however, so if you are looking to do side quests frequently I suppose the free time given is required. 

[u] In-game Bugs/Annoyances [/u] [b] (3) [/b]

I am actually quite surprised that this game is not as buggy as anticipated. That being said, my expectations set a pretty low bar! You will experience the occasional crash between scenes. The animations can also seem a little clunky. I have had enemies pretty much teleport on top of me before, though I think this was intended for jump-scare purposes. One of my biggest pet peeves is a buggy final boss scene and this game actually does have elements of this, though not to the point that it is unplayable. 

[u] Difficulty [/u] [b] (1) [/b]

I think my cat could probably play this. Extremely easy to pick up and play, especially if you’re a beginner. The game does have a “lock-on” aim option too, which makes it easy to get targets quickly and there is a variety of weapons to choose from. Controlling your car is also pretty straight-forward. DP is very forgiving in terms of most “quick react” scenes, as you are able to Continue on the spot and retry. The puzzles are very easy also.  I would say overall it’s a pretty casual game perfect for a Sunday afternoon. 

[u] Replayability [/u] [b] (2) [/b]

Although my score for this is rather low (as far as I am aware, this game does not have several endings to explore), I will very likely be going back to complete quests I could not do before as I thoroughly enjoyed the storyline. I have seen people with 400+ hours in game so I would say there is content to be found for sure. You are given the option to continue investigating the town even after you have finished the game. 

Note: PS3 version of the game may have additional endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983990340', 'num_games_owned': 804, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2825, 'last_played': 1619480280}
review:
Questo gioco è la definizione di "So bad, it's good".  Grafica da ps2, gameplay legnoso e gioco buggato.  Il porting pc è probabilmente il peggiore che mi sia mai capitato, soprattutto per via dei numerosi crash (a fine recensione elencherò gli accorgimenti che ho seguito io per avere un'esperienza decente). Quindi perché pollice su?  Perché è un gioco fuori dalle righe, con una trama che va dal trash al geniale, un'esperienza difficilmente classificabile. Memorabile il protagonista, sia per via del suo carattere unico che del suo aspetto a dir poco bizzarro. Insieme a lui sono ben delineati anche tutti gli strambi abitanti di Greenvale, il paese  nel quale saremo chiamati a risolvere il mistero dell'Assassino con l'impermeabile, sopravvivendo nel frattempo a momentanee incursioni in un mondo "da incubo" in stile Silent Hill. È possibile esplorare interamente la regione di Greenvale (sia a piedi che in auto), per scoprirne i segreti e conoscere meglio gli abitanti (ognuno dei quali caratterizzato da routine giornaliere), oltre a risolvere le varie missioni secondarie presenti (fin troppo difficili da scoprire senza l'aiuto di una guida).  Il tutto culminerà in un finale folle, carico di momenti toccanti e inquietanti. Menzione d'onore anche per le musiche, un mix eclettico e fuori di testa (anche se alcuni brani tendono ad essere ripetuti troppo spesso). Sicuramente non un gioco per tutti, ma riuscendo a passare oltre gli evidenti difetti si troverà un'esperienza che difficilmente sarà possibile dimenticare.

Di seguito, gli accorgimenti che ho seguito per stabilizzare il gioco (non garantisco che funzionino per tutti).

-Non installare il DPfix, questa mod necessaria per poter giocare a risoluzioni alte ha aumentato a dismisura il numero dei crash.
-Creare collegamenti sul desktop sia del launcher che dell'eseguibile e impostare la compatibilità con Windows 98/ME. Avviare il gioco dal launcher.
-In caso di crash durante una cutscene, riavviare prima il pc e poi il gioco. Consiglio in generale di iniziare a giocare subito dopo aver avviato il sistema, senza aprire nessuna applicazione (eccetto Steam ovviamente).
