review:
Это пздц товарищи!!! В общем в своё время забросил прохождение данного "Шедевра",  не смотря на вылеты и прочие технические проблемы игра нравилась, учитывая что нет поддершки стимклауда пришлось перепроходить, только проникся историей и тут после 8й главы 2го эпизода БАЦ! С*КА вылет, ну думаю ладно, перезапуск как всегда поможет. НЕТ! я такие танцы с бубном устраивал, и запускал с одним ядром процессора, менял совместимости, параметры запуска ярлыка, искал в интрнете советы( у меня 10ка). Потратил часа 3 и по итогу ничего не помогло. Скачал чужие сэйвы, но после такого даже желание проходить пропало.
Сама игра классная, подача истории, персонажи, атмосфера. Но после такой дичи я предпочту не вспоминать о существовании DP. Привык проходить игры до конца и только в редких случаях забрасывать и тут момент, когда я просто не смог исправить баг, который судя по некоторой информации может исправиться перестановкой винды на 7ку к примеру. 
Да идите НА**Й разрабы!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004388581', 'num_games_owned': 1237, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3213, 'last_played': 1595226580}
review:
Still broke as shit. But it's still got that mix of love and hate from me that encouraged me to go back and play this trash fire of a port. The story's unique, ludicrous, and has just the right elements of love that a developer has for a product that I can't put to words. It seems genuine. And that's what draws me back to this thing. 

Some tips: 

DPFix makes the game look better. It's pretty great. 
-Unconfirmed rumors however of DPFix causing more crashes so take this with a grain of salt.

If your game crashes and crashes consistently, restart your computer. 

If your game crashes at a specific cutscene when you're leaving the hospital, restart your computer and set the game to windowed mode.

For compatibility settings, right click BOTH the executable and the launcher and set them to Windows XP service pack 3. You'll have issues with aiming up while doing this, but, you can swap it off once the crashes have stopped.

For the tailing mission, if you're running it on windowed mode, swap it to full screen for just that mission then save immediately after it finishes. I don't know what it is, but I think the windows size actually influences the driving.

Get all of the bones, but don't turn them into the guy who wants them immediately. Let them get stolen. Find the bones. Turn them in. Suggest getting all the bones within the first two days before going to the community center.
Complete the spirit maps when you can.
Do the block pushing puzzle/store room stuff.  You'll thank me later. (Don't actually give the reward away.)
Bribe the gas station man. Do it as often as you can. 

Fishing is annoying.

The animations, while funny, are still really good compared to other games that came out during the time. (I'm looking at you, Oblivion.)

tl;dr: I really love this game. It's a garbage fire port, and if you're persistent you'll be rewarded with one of the oddest yet most engrossing stories in a video game I've seen to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017109350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1435, 'last_played': 1595454040}
review:
This is what you call a "diamond in the rough".

I've heard about this game from an old dropped let's play by a known lolcow around ten years ago. The low budget J-jank aesthetic has always intrigued me, and the interesting main character made me think that this has potential, so I had to try it. While initially a lot of things turned me off, this turned out to be an amazing experience, and a legitimate example of what well-written art is.

Although some things are annoying and deserve a warning (such as sound/music cutting out inappropriately, graphical glitches and limited animations, overly long animations every time you open a door or grab an item, terrible driving controls), they did not ruin the experience. In fact, the low budget jank strangely added to the eerie feel of the game. It continuously surprised me with its' great writing and lovable characters. The weirdness of it all, which, if you've seen Twin Peaks, will make you feel right at home. The soundtrack and voice acting, are pretty decent as well. But overall, the biggest strength is the writing and the characters, that hook you in and don't let go. The final few chapters have some extremely gripping moments, and despite an extremely long and annoying quick-time sequence, the end was very satisfying and unique. I'm sure you agree, Zach.

Anyway, tl;dr - this game is flawed, but brilliant, and if you enjoy weirdness and good story - give it a try. This is as close to a Twin Peaks game that you're going to get, people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025309409', 'num_games_owned': 14456, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 4336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4336, 'last_played': 1595135519}
review:
"Deadly Premonition" is an open-world murder mystery with horror elements. It features an interesting story with bizarre characters, action sequences that play like a slow third-person shooter, occasional easy puzzles. and a fairly large map to explore. Unfortunately the PC port is barely playable due to technical issues.

The game successfully creates a "US small-town" environment with many characters who have their own schedules, and have different things to say depending on the current state of affairs. The murder mystery is exceptionally well designed - lots of people are suspect in one way or another, but there is no obvious culprit. You always feel that there is more to the murders than you already know, and the story ends in a chain of revelations that definitely surprised me. The main plot is very linear, but the game also offers 50 side quests, and you are usually free to decide which tasks you tackle next. The side quests are, however, often completely nonsensical and feel tacked-on.

The FBI agent that you play, is a pretty interesting character (for example, he keeps talking to his partner that no one else can see, and uses his morning coffee as an oracle). However, he's also an arrogant jerk and a terrible chauvinist, he's very judgmental in his off-hand remarks about other people, and I didn't really feel comfortable playing him. I think he was intended to be a brilliant but emotionally challenged detective, but the writing was not good enough to pull that off. The writing - or perhaps rather the English translation - is unfortunately a problem for many characters and scenes throughout the game. Speakers often contradict themselves within just a few sentences, the flow of many conversations makes little sense, and it often feels as if lines were translated one by one without knowledge of the context. 

Apart from exploring the map and talking to people, a substantial part of the game takes place in a surrealistically warped version of the town's environment where zombie-like creatures try to kill you. You fight back with a variety of guns and melee weapons while also looking for clues and helpful items. The fights are fairly easy as most of the enemies move slowly and/or in predictable patterns, but they are successful in creating an eerie, creepy atmosphere. Occasionally you run into harder boss encounters with QTE elements and multiple phases.

The game provides ample room for exploration and generally rewards it with small amounts of money. There are also 65 collectibles to find.

Graphics looked already dated when the game was originally released in 2010. They look crude and primitive by today's standards, but were still good enough to not affect my enjoyment. Unfortunately the PC port is locked to a 720p resolution, which means that you can see each individual pixel on a large monitor. It also uses a washed-out color palette, which many people see as a negative compared to the original Xbox version, but I think it actually fits the atmosphere quite well.

Sound and music are competently done. The game contains some catchy, simple tunes that I liked, though they seemed much too upbeat for the atmosphere of the game. That said, they can be seen as providing welcome relaxation and relief between the more tense parts of the game. Much (but not all) of the dialogue is voiced, and the voice actors did a good job, though voice direction was clearly lacking - it's often obvious that the lines were delivered without knowledge of the context.

Usability features are a mixed bag with this game. You can rebind action keys, but that's not very useful because movement is fixed to WASD. You can invert the Y- and even X-axis separately, and you can choose different settings for camera movement and aiming, but there's no FOV slider. You can save manually, but only at dedicated save spots, and there's only one save slot.

The game's biggest problem by far are its technical issues. It kept crashing about once per 90 minutes on average, and while that can be mitigated by saving at each and every opportunity, that is a) not always possible, and b) detrimental to the experience when you keep worrying about finding a save spot rather than enjoying the story. One scene crashed every time it played, so I had to search forums for a workaround (which was, oddly enough, to let several hours of in-game time pass). Another problem is a perpetual loud screeching noise, accompanied by equally loud, high-pitched, frantic "blip" noises, whenever I was in a car (which amounts to many hours). Alt-tabbing out of the game caused it to freeze irrecoverably each and every time unless I was playing in windowed mode, but then I was limited to a 720p window. Two boss fights require you to turn off auto-aim (otherwise you _cannot_ hit your target), but auto-aim always gets automatically switched on whenever you draw a weapon, and turning it off requires a keypress that does not always work. There are community fixes for some of these issues, but they do not work for everyone. In short, this port is a terrible mess and it reflects badly on Rising Star games that they released this title in such a shoddy state without ever fixing it.

I recommend Deadly Premonition for its complex plot, immersive setting, and bizarre characters. It definitely deserves its status as a cult classic. That said, be prepared for many painful moments due to the game's technical issues. If you're not willing to accept frequent crashes and multiple other issues (like that loud screeching noise whenever you're driving), you probably won't be able to enjoy this game. The Steam achievements show that 42% of players finished the prologue, but only 12% made it through the first quarter of the game, and my guess is that most players will just decide that the technical issues are too annoying to put up with.

If you can get the game on Xbox, play it there, as all the ports have issues of some sort. If you get it on PC, wait for a steep sale and brace yourself for a rocky ride.

review: Игра отвратительный кусок говна. Это симулятор борьбы с багами. Начнем с того, что для изменения разрешения вам понадобиться скачать мод. Ну это еще куда ни шло для портов японских игр начала 10-х (Dark Souls на старте страдал тем же). Самый большой косяк это то, что игра постоянно крашится и вылетает. Я отключил оверлей steam, и выставил совместимость с Win XP SP2, вроде все норм играть можно. Но в этом куске говна есть место, где крашится сохранение, если вы не пропутите ролик, КАРЛ?! Это что блять такое? Ладно, я выкачал сохранение и поставил  стого самого места, где был краш. Но потом мне нужен был USB Порт в моем компе и я выткнул из него геймпад Xbox ONE и что я обнаружил по итогу? Игра стала выдавать 6 ФПС, не важно в каком режиме совместимости или без него я запускал этот кусок говна. Подключил обратно геймпад, стало опять 60 фпс. Как блядский геймпад влияет на ФПС в этой блядской игре? Но и это еще не все. Чтобы убить финального босса вам надо изъебнуться и хитро прицелиться и сделать последний выстрел. Но блядская игра не позволяет это сделать, если вы не в режиме совместимости с Win 7. НО в режиме совместимости с Win 7 помоги вам господь, если во время драки с финальным босом игра не зависнет. НЕ ПОКУПАЙТЕ. Все, кто говорят, что в этой игре атмосфера и сюжет тащит, на счет атмосферы соглашусь, но сюжет так себе, японская дичь. Ну и механика и геймплей тоже дерьмо, поэтому единственный плюс это атмосфера твин пикс, в остальном это мусор 2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198010906276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1605772087}
review:
This game is pure art. The gameplay is pretty mediocre, the graphics aren't the best, but the story and characters and setting just oozes so much personality, and it just feels like this game was made because of someone's weird idea(s) that they wanted to put out there for many people to see.

I played this back on the Xbox 360 waaay back in 2009 or so, I don't really remember. I just remember totally falling in love with everything so weird and quirky about it. The controls take a bit to get used to, but it's not horrible or unplayable by any means.

HOWEVER, I do not recommend this port. It's a terrible port imo, and many other people have agreed. I was only able to get a few hours into the Steam version, just because there are so many issues that I doubt will ever be fixed. Playing it with a controller seems to be hit-or-miss, at least for me. I was able to use my Xbox 360 controller plugged in for a while, but trying again recently has just been total failure. I'm not really a fan of the keyboard controls, but I guess it's better than nothing if nothing else will work. 

There's also a really annoying issue with when you're driving around, where this obnoxious screeching/breaking car noise just keeps happening over and over and over again. Apparently it has something to do with audio drivers or something, I have no idea. It's just something that I guess there is a fix(?) for, but as far as I know, and as far as my experience is, it does not work all the time. That particular bug/issue doesn't seem to happen when I play through my speakers, but that's just one of the many issues I've seen and/or heard about this port.

Once again, this game is a cult classic and definitely worth checking out, but I'd say get the Xbox 360 or the PS3 version if you can. The controls are always gonna be janky and bad, but it just takes a few hours of getting used to and they don't seem to be too much of a problem, at least the way I remember it.

...What did you think of that, Zach? Was that a good enough review?

review:
This game is weird, I mean super weird.

Protagonist is mad lad and other people surrounding him are little better than him, but only little.
Combat wise it is good to okay, downwards. Gun play is resident evil 4 style but it is not that satisfying. My favourite and satisfying weapon is pipe, seriously. It is fast and can take shadows with one or two hits. Then I unlocked unlimited weapons and my god they were god sent. Combat section was chore and many times I just run past shadows or mow them down with infinite ammo guns.
Story bit was so good. It was weird but fun. It had entertainment value and I loved it.
Bugs are annoying restarted game once because PCGamingWiki article stated one bug to break save game, and I skipped that bit of cutscene.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055854071', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1503796239}
review:
Es algo que le recomendaría a alguien que de verdad le gustan los videojuegos, no es un juego para cualquiera, no porque sea complejo, difícil, profundo, o qué sé yo. Simplemente es malísimo, pero dentro de lo poco que puedes rescatar de él, terminas viéndolo como una genialidad.

Quiero recalcar que este juego es pésimo, todo el aspecto técnico está muy mal hecho, tiene un sin fin de errores. Es más, la versión de PC es la menos recomendable. De hecho opté por dejar tirada esta versión y simplemente jugarlo en otra plataforma, lo jugué en Switch.

Dejando de lado lo horrible del apartado técnico y jugable, narrativamente es muy, pero muy bueno. Diría que es como una mala película, la mayoría de personajes rayan en lo cliché a propósito, pero pese a ello son terriblemente carismáticos. La historia junto con los protagonistas se desarrolla muy bien, los giros argumentales están muy bien hechos. Si bien en un principio el juego posee aspectos que detesto, como lo es la disonancia ludonarrativa, al final la mayoría de huecos terminan siendo explicados.
Deberás soportar todo por la historia, si te atrapa antes de las 2 horas, bien, juégalo porque te va a encantar, si no, reembolsa en ese mismo instante.

Pienso que hubiera funcionado mucho mejor como libro, película, o hasta como un juego de los de Quantic Dream. Si no, simplemente quitándole el 50% del gameplay hubiera quedado mejor, porque es tedioso.
Mi consejo es ir netamente por la historia, olvídate que es un mundo abierto.

review:
~ Noldoist TV Steam Küratör Sayfam: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32256332/ ~

Hidetaka 'Swery' Suehiro'nun yönetmeni olduğu Deadly Premonition'ın yeni oyunu 10 Temmuz'da Switch oyuncularıyla buluşacak. Polisiye, macera ve korku öğelerini kullanan ve oyuncuya sunduğu özgürlüklerle dikkat çeken bu yapım, Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut adıyla PS3 versiyonundan daha detaylı bir oynanışı ve içeriği de sunuyor. Francis York adlı detektifin 'kırmızı tohum cinayetleri'ni araştırdığı Deadly Premonition, David Lynch'in yönetmenliğini üstlendiği Twin Peaks'ten de oldukça esinlenmiştir. Gizem ve polisiye dolu bir macera arıyorsanız Deadly Premonition sizi memnun edecektir. Oyunun bütçesinin düşük olmasından ötürü oynanış açısından biraz zorlasa da, sonunda tatmin olacaksınız.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018833379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2269, 'last_played': 1594498230}
review:
Deadly premonition, el juego del 0 o el 10. Es dificil de analizar este juego de culto tan peculiar. Un juego que tiene un desastroso apartado gráfico, animaciones pésimas, físicas horribles, gameplay tosco y podría estar nombrando aspectos negativos sin parar pero que tiene una trama y personajes tan increíbles e inolvidables que para mucha gente fue una obra maestra, entre los que me incluyo.

El personaje Francis York Morgan y su alter ego Zach, transmiten un grandísimo carisma aunque también sus otros personajes. 

Un juego muy influenciado por la serie Twin Peaks del fantástico director de cine David Lynch. 

Una pena que su segunda parte sea, de momento, exclusiva de Nintendo Switch aunque parece que hay planes para portearlo a pc y demás consolas de actual generación.

Recomendado 100% aún sabiendo que es un juego muy de nicho pero que todo el mundo debe al menos probar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119674773', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3226, 'last_played': 1594577041}
review:
Психологический триллер с элементами мистики и детектива. Главный герой - Френсис Йорк Морган, агент ФБР и любитель кофе приехал в небольшой и тихий городок Гринвейл для расследования загадочного убийство девушки. У Френсиса есть воображаемый друг - Зак(это мы), с которым он обсуждает почти всё что увидит или услышит.

Геймплей поделен на две части:
 1) Повседневные будни где вы будете путешествовать в машине или без(не советую) по пустому и открытому миру заглядывая в местные закусочные, бары, магазины и чужие дома для общения с разными персонажами живущими в городе и выполняя второстепенные задания и мини-игры связанные с ними. Френсису также требуется употреблять еду, стирать одежду(а то вокруг вас разлетятся мухи), бриться(по желанию) и спать; 
2) Детективное расследование во время которого мы перемещаемся в потусторонний мир и отстреливаемся от мертвецов, девочек из звонка и убийцы в красном дождевике. Последнего кстати нельзя убить - от него нужно только убегать и прятаться. После нахождения каждой улики, Френсис производит в своей голове "Профилирования" для  раскрытия полной картины произошедшего.

Саундтрэк порадует вас - от жизнерадостных и успокаивающих до таинственных, мрачных и драматических композиций.

Интересная история с неожиданными поворотами и событиями, приятным саундтрэком, множеством харизматичных и странных(игра японская) персонажей - Ради этого в игру стоит сыграть. Но как игра - Это гoвнo. В игре плохо почти всё: Графика с анимацией пришли с 2004(игра вышла в 2010) года, пустой открытый мир, неудобное управление, конченная стрельба(одновременно стрелять и ходить Френсис не может) и плохая оптимизация(её просто нет).

Очень спорная и неоднозначная игра, но мне понравилось. История в данной игре стоит того что бы вытерпеть плохую в техническом плане игру.

★★★★☆ (Хорошо)

review: This is an open world mystery, and I could not be more pleased with it. The game play takes some getting used to, but you find your flow quickly. The characters are all strange and memorable. Having to take care of your character, making sure they eat and sleep and change clothes, is very grounding. It's easy to put many hours into solving the mystery, and even more exploring the town and meeting its residents. The farther you get into the game, the harder it becomes. Although there are a few bugs, and quick time events are literally killer, it's difficult but doable. It is one of my favorite games. There's a certain charm to it. Isn't that right, Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198139695778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1595213656}
review:
Controls and game play are janky; graphics aren't good; and the voice acting and sub-titles are often awkward. HOWEVER, the music is actually pretty interesting and entertaining. The dialogues, although awkward, can be funny and even deep at times. But the real selling point is the story. If you actually take the time to understand the ENTIRE story, it is a really good story with many dark twists and turns. Plus, if you play through a second time after understanding the story, you will be able to appreciate conversations and comments that at first seem bizarre and of no meaning. After my first play through and understanding of what is happening and why, I was pleasantly surprised  on my second play through to hear things people where saying actually make a ton of sense. This game is basically a cult classic that is worth playing if you have patience to deal with tanky controls and a weird story that all unfolds into a really interesting narrative.
Plus, DP2 is coming out July 10, 2020 so now is a great time to pick this game up and possibly get the 2nd to see how Zach/York continue on!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113758912', 'num_games_owned': 1731, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1593595884}
review:
Deadly Premonition: The Director’ s Cut — это тот самый волшебный второй шанс, редко какая игра его удостаивается.

Первое, что нужно обязательно сделать, садясь за Deadly Premonition — отбросить в сторону логику.

В Deadly Premonition непостижимым образом сочетаются очень жестокий психологический триллер в духе «Молчания ягнят», мистический детектив в лучших традициях «Твин Пикс» Дэвида Линча, насыщенная драма, вполне себе сайлент-хилльный хоррор и по-японски абсурдистская комедия. Второй такой игры больше нет. Это факт.

В отличие от многих других, Deadly Premonition не пытается ничем казаться. Она не пытается походить на кино, выдерживать чью-то атмосферу или использовать клише — это полностью законченное и самостоятельное произведение, чистый полет авторской мысли. 
Именно поэтому многим игра может видеться сумасшедшей, это не типично киношный детектив, как Heavy Rain, работающий по логике других детективов. 
Deadly Premonition не будет заботиться о том, чтобы вы все поняли, правильно восприняли и ушли довольным.

Так уж устроил SWERY свою игру, что все враги в ней — не опасность, но препятствие, а главный противник — время и ваше терпение. Однако затем, когда внутренняя логика станет ясна, откроется второе дно. А потом третье. И четвертое. А может, и пятое.

Как и многое другое, боевые сцены в Deadly Premonition следует воспринимать как данность, как препятствие на пути к решению загадки. 
Враги повторяются, надоедают, стрелять неудобно — всегда проще убежать, если есть возможность. 
Они тут в первую очередь для того, чтобы утомить, — чтобы игрок плюнул и выключил игру. Естественный фильтр, отсеивающий нетерпеливых.


Зато технических изменений побольше. Немного поправили графику (от чего кожа персонажей стала похожа на резиновую), управление сделали поудобнее, зачем-то прикрутили смешной 3D-режим, изменили дизайн интерфейса.

А вот то, что следовало бы поправить, не изменилось. Неудобная карта — по-прежнему отличный стимул, чтобы выучить Гринвейл наизусть, работа со звуками по-прежнему непрофессиональная, музыкальных тем удручающе мало. Добавились падения FPS, такое ощущение, что игра работает на 15 кадров в секунду. 
Не то что стрелять — путешествовать по Гринвейлу невозможно!

Плюсы:
+ Красота смерти; каждое убийство — арт-инсталляция;
+ Нестандартность всего и вся;
+ Сочетание несочетаемого;
+ Психодел;
+ Сюжет;
+ Диалоги;
+ Карточки и ачивки.

Минус:
- Всё остальное выполнено на довольном посредственном уровне, множественные технические косяки. В этой игре плохо абсолютно всё кроме самой истории, персонажей, сюжета и т. п.

Если оценивать Deadly Premonition по стандартным параметрам, много баллов она не получит. 
С точки зрения геймдизайна, это очень сырая и неудобная игра, местами откровенно неприятная. 
Но как произведение искусства она заслуживает 10 из 10 — это действительно гениальная (или безумная?), ни на что не похожая игра.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128230707', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1593212939}
review:
This game is wonderful, great world and characters, charming, silly, 10/10 bla bla bla but please for the love of god don't play it on PC. I must have had upwards of 20 crashes trying to play through this; couldn't get through the chapter 9 crashes no matter what i tried.

Best way to play this is the original 360 version (which you can play on XBOX One and Series). Most stable, best framerate (stable 30 iirc), best colours; it doesn't have the few extra bells and whistles and cutscenes of this version but those things don't really matter. I've been playing through the PS3 version of the Director's Cut and while the framerate is complete donkey cunt, as is the driving, I haven't experienced a single crash. Can't speak for the Switch version but it'd be impressive if it was any worse than this port. 

Makes me truly sad to say this, but unless you're willing to risk being unable to progress and struggling with crash after crash, do not buy :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198018130825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1395283381}
review:
A lot of respect is paid to intricately marvelous technical accomplishments in AAA blockbuster releases, but I expect a game with a budget to rival the GDP of a small nation to have a few tricks up its sleeves, to show us rope moving as we have never seen rope move before within a digital space. But it’s much more spectacular to find it here, in this game that seems as if it should not exist salvaged from an innocuously titled project called “Rainy Woods” and made on a budget similar to my annual cigarette purchasing expenses. In a AAA game, I will ooh and aah at a passing semblance of genuine physics expressed upon a wire. In Deadly Premonition, seeing the scene or two where York enacts a reasonably rendered facsimile of pulling a sheet over his bed-bound body seems like a miracle. It is finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow. It is seeing a unicorn on a walk through the woods. 

	So much of Deadly Premonition works on that level – the common refrain is that it is a bad game, possibly a game so bad that it’s good. But, let me tell you a secret, lean in close – it’s actually a good game. Just out and out, a good game. It looks bad, feels worse, sounds confused, likely smells funny, and now courtesy of a Switch release with a don’t-eat-this coating on the game card even tastes bad. But it’s a goddamn good game, because under an obfuscating morass of outdated gamemaking it is full of moments that reflect and even outshine modern games. And that, from a title that originally released 10 years ago. 

	There is, for example, a surprise after every meandering low-impact Resident Evil 4 inspired shooting sequence. Not a surprise as in a GOTCHA but a surprise as in a dramatically rendered murder scene that transcends Lynchian inspiration and becomes Fulleresque, reminiscent of the dramatic death tableaus of Hannibal that would populate network television three years after this game’s release. And even more dramatic than the visuals are the characters reacting to them, characters built in fits and starts in ways much more accomplished than many other games – Emily Wyatt, the traditional Woman Who Can’t Cook who is also the only big city transplant in Greenvale expressing unequivocal horror that something like this could happen here. Meek and effeminate Thomas Maclaine who treats the investigation to lunch on a daily basis, finding time to hone his cooking craft despite late nights tending bar at his sister’s place, eating lunch to be inevitably regurgitated. George Woodbridge, the handlebar mustachioed sheriff with dumbbells called Arnold and Sylvester and an ailing mother who is stricken by how impotent all his power, physical and institutional, seems to be in the face of such grisly crimes. 

	Each of these things are surprises. To feel such attachment and empathy for these characters is testament to how well the game captures its tone of a small town full of small people caught up in something awful and big. Outside of these big moments, life goes on in Greenvale like a quiet murmur punctuated with sudden shouts. There are 27 named characters, one for literally each letter of the alphabet (and two for I – twins Isaiah and Isaac, the cherubic manifestations of small town innocence in York’s dream sequences). Each of them have their own stories to varying degrees, ranging from the General Lysander’s veteran status haunting his graveyard to gas station owner Jack the Raging Bull who just wants bribes in the form of $100 bills to converse with. Lynch’s log lady here finds a sort of analogue in Wandering Sigourney who makes her way around town with a pot, its contents a mystery but always growing cold and necessitating York giving her a breakneck ride home to reveal...literally nothing. An amusing subversion of any Twin Peaks fan’s expectations. 

	I could talk all day about how bad those drives are, how the controls for vehicles feel like driving a Matchbox car down a waterslide and no passengers make any remarks as York careens into poles and shrubbery. I could talk about the weird pointlessness of the action sequences, evidently a publisher mandate to make a more salable game and actually quite decent considering that but superfluous nonetheless. I could talk about how when York goes fishing, he can catch anything from fish to trading cards to ammo and all but the first of those is represented with a big flat icon on the end of a hook in York’s hands rather than an actual object. 
	
	That’s missing the rainy woods for the trees when this game, more than absolutely any other, is greater than the sum of its parts. This is a game where the phrase “games as art” appears twice on its Wikipedia page – a full ¼ as many times as the phrase appears on the page “Video games as an art form.” That may be perhaps overselling it a bit – the tail end of the game has a sudden series of boss encounters that wouldn’t be out of place in a JRPG suggesting that the developers ran as fast and hard as they could to make art but the fact they were making a game still caught up with them. 

	Still, for most of the game’s 20ish hours it exceeds the expectations its own presentation brings on to provide a fascinating, often funny, sometimes frightening, consistently human take on small town America as filtered through a specific sort of American television. Agent Francis York Morgan – his friends call him York – is among gaming’s most memorable and idiosyncratic characters even as he functions perfectly within the narrative as an outsider to Greenvale on par with the player. And for most of the game, his asides to an unseen “Zach” seem like they might as well be whispers to whoever is on the other side of the screen. With York as a vessel into this plasticine pastoral world, this clearly mechanical simulation full of life, the player is led into one of the most remarkably unique games in the medium.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106422648', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3498, 'last_played': 1598736980}
review:
100% Completed!

(Please read "This Port" part too)

Deadly Premonition, in my opinion, it's a masterpiece. 
The first thing I want to mention are the characters, 
Each character is well thought out and each one is different from the other, and a lot of them are really weird too, and that makes it more fun. a lot of them also have interesting back stories, development and relationships, which can be seen during the main story and sidequests.
And the Main character, York, is just full of personality in his own way, and it's interesting to see how he holds up relationships with other characters because of his oddness. and there's also another character I felt very attached to, I was hoping that nothing would  happen to him/her in the story, because I really liked that character.

And then is the Town, Greenvale. is so full of personality, variety and things to do, it's like playing a real life simulator almost. you have a sleep meter and a hunger meter, and have to sleep the proper hours and eat the right amount, and you can shave if you want too and change or clean your suit. What's cool too, is that in this game there is a clock, where in every day each character has a routine that they follow and they are in different places or doing different things depending on the time, story placement and even if it's raining or not. This also applies in the different shops that are in town, having open and close times. This is an open world game after all, you can explore the town by walking or driving around, talk to people, enter places and do sidequests, which a lot of them can only be done at a specific time and/or at a specific episode, and they are also really great and keep adding lore to the characters and town. Sometimes it can be hard to know exactly when and where to meet a person to start a quest, but I can see past that when I actually do them, because they bring more story and interesting things to the game. You can still use a guide if you want though, here's one I used to know where to get some trading cards I was missing in the cards collection: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=775096779&insideModal=0&requirelogin=1


And with all this of course it comes the story. I think this is one of the best stories in any game, I don't wanna say too much but it keeps adding mysteries and clues to keep it entertaining, and having all the interesting characters in it makes it so much better, maybe you will feel attached to some of them like I did. The game also has emotional moments and some heartwarming ones, that make the connection with the player even better.

You will also start wondering who the killer may be, which is fun to speculate and see who you think it is changes throughout the story.
The dialogue and voice acting is really good too, and they mark the feeling or mood of the characters really well.

and then, the gameplay. Aside from the driving and open world of the game, there are  third person shooter sections, where you explore places and have to deal with zombie-like creatures, which I found to be ok, but nothing too special.
and it has some horror and suspense elements too, but if you are not into that kind of thing I think it's okay because it's nothing too crazy. (keep in mind this is a M rated game after all, and some other very impactful things happen)

and the music is really good too, there's one really catchy song I can't get out of my head!

Here I would like to mention some things that the game lacks, but I can see over them considering all the other stuff the game offers, but for some people this may be something to notice, and may be the reason why this game got mixed reviews.
The reviews sometimes say the game lacks with the graphics and animations, but I think the game looks pretty good for its time though, and in fact I found all the details and touches made in the character models and in all of Greenvale pretty nice.
The other thing is that the controls in the third person shooter segments may be a little weird and not as good as other games. And the last thing I wanted to mention is that you can't mark a place you want to go when you're driving, which bothered me a little at first, but then I got used to the town and unlocked a teleporting item to make things faster. It's mostly technical problems, but in my opinion they don't detract from the experience, because the game at its core is fantastic.

Getting that out of the way, lastly I would like to mention that the developers seem to have put a lot of details in the game, for example if you play side quests at the last chapter of the game that could be previously played in other chapters, some dialogues change, and it's cool because just a few people may notice this but the devs added the extra detail just for them.

Overall, I really recommend this game and is one of my favorites of all time, there is nothing out there quite like it, and you can tell it had a lot of heart put into it.


THIS PORT

However, I do not recommend this version of the game. 
unfortunately, this version is very likely to crash, and I also ran into some almost game breaking crashes, but I just kept trying and trying different ways until I got past it, and I luckily got past all of them, but it cost a lot of tries and time. I have also read online that some of the ones that I have experienced made people stop playing because they just couldn't get past it like I did, or maybe didn't want to keep trying different ways until it worked, which is understandable.
It's such a shame, because this is just a great game with a lot of heart and effort put into it, but its technical problems make a lot of players back off from this experience.
I hope someday they will fix it, but I recommend getting the PS3, Xbox 360 or Nintendo Switch version instead, to avoid any problems.

But if you want to stick with this version, I recommend following the instructions in this post, it makes the game look better and run better:
https://steamcommunity.com/app/247660/discussions/0/1290691937708333615/
And if you are playing with a controller, I recommend using the Deadly Premonition controller + setting from the steam community, it solves a problem with the camera movement and it also makes the controls better in my opinion

That's it for my review, thank you for reading! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202535136', 'num_games_owned': 1441, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1590608867}
review:
Objectively a bad game:
○ Terrible graphics, even for 2010 standards, characters lips don't even sync with what they are saying.
○ Lack of polish.
○ The "open world" map is difficult to orient yourself with, a lack of proper zoom out function and the fact that your map turns as your character tuns makes it rather confusing. Game's only saving grace is the fast travel mechanic which you can only get by doing the nameless flower side mission which you can only find the flower on a rainy day. I found that once I'd unlocked fast travel, I did not want to travel manually anymore. Ever.
○ Low budget.
○ PC version crashes semi regularly. If you're a completionist, don't even start this game, but if you must, SAVE OFTEN!
○ Side missions are terrible. Practically 50 fetch quests. No genuine thought put into any of them.
○ Original controller settings for camera control make this game unplayable. You will need an alternative controller config.
○ Lack of varied sountrack and sound effects. There's very few background tracks.
○ Combat is clunky, aiming is not great and enemy variety is lacking. 
○ 27 chapters, yet could have been condensed into a lot less and had the same impact. Some chapters only require talking to an NPC, finding some red seeds or the fishing "minigame".
○ Speaking of the fishing minigame, it's just terrible, the use of what seems to be PNG image files and the "slots" feel to it just feels cheap and unfinished.
○ Red vines are blockades but there's one in Harry's Mansion that was not programmed to stop you so you can easily walk through it.
○ Driving controls are clunky and buggy,
○ Tiredness and hunger mechanics don't fit in well. 1 min of game time =  1 min of real time... just does not work, even with the whole smoking to fast forward time mechanic.

Subjectively a good game:
○ Story and characters are great, this probably should have been a B movie though, not a game.
○There is a "charm" to this game. That's about as good as it gets though.

review: Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut это игра для мазохистов и для тех кто любит поплясать с бубном перед тем как сесть играть, чем больше ты играешь тем больше ты ненавидишь ее создателя, но сама история очень странная, не понятная, но в то же время очень интересная и все что есть в этой игре не дает тебе завершить ее прежде чем твой мозг взорвется от всех недостатков, в итоге получилась офигенная игра с отменным сюжетом, атмосферой, персонажами и саундтреком, но в ней очень много минусов корявый геймплей, устаревшая графика, просто куча багов которые к счастью можно решить с помощью многочисленных гайдов, и все что в ней хорошо - одновременно плохо)) очень плохая и странная игра, рекомендую!

review: A love letter to David Lynch, this is a flawed ride but one that's well worth taking. author: {'steamid': '76561198093433473', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1589879493}
review:
Buggy mess, the game will always freezes and crashes after you killed the 3 shotgun zombies on the hospital (episode 1 chapter 3). There's also another freeze and crash after you watch the cutscene in A&G Diner (episode 2 chapter 9). So terrible, they didn't resolve this bug in years maybe the developer didn't care about customers at all.
The graphics are total crap also, the textures are bad and even more you cannot play this game on FULL HD or better resolution, it's locked on 1280x720 resolution, framerate also locked at 30 fps.
To play this game on FULL HD or better and 60 fps you must use mod called DPFix. lol modder are way more smarter than these lazy a.s.s developers.
What a shame this game has a good story and interesting main character, it's hard to recommend this hidden gem because of these annoying bugs, there also many glitch that can cause some key items to disappear, if you save the game often also cause crash and glitch to appear more frequently, really an unfixed terrible mess. This is the most crappy experience that I ever experienced from a game lol
In order to get pass from that 2 bugs you must use a save data from pcgamingwiki.
I wonder if they fix these issues on the Nintendo Switch version (Deadly Premonition Origins), but I heard that Switch version is not based on this Director's Cut version but the original XBOX-360 game, if you play the Switch version I think you will miss a lot of things added in this version or the PS3 version.
FUNNY FACT: this game supposed to be the definitive edition or game of the year edition, but the bugs really ruins the game. If you want to play this game, beware of the bugs, glitches, and the game breaking bugs in chapter 3 & 9.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029842506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1838, 'last_played': 1588644521}
review:
ADJUNTO GUÍA DE POSIBLE SOLUCIÓN A LOS CRASHEOS Y PROBLEMAS EN EL APUNTADO
El juego es la hostia en cuanto a historia, ahora es ortopédico como él solo y es bastante rudimentario a la hora de jugarlo. No lo dejéis pasar es una joya oculta, dadle una oportunidad. 

CRASHEOS POSIBLE SOLUCIÓN
Para los que le crashean, yo lo pude jugar poniendo compatibilidad con windows xp service pack 2 tanto el launcher como el .exe de la carpeta de common de steamapps. Deshabilité la interfaz de steam desde las propiedades del juego (en la aplicación de steam en la biblioteca) y eliminé una librería dentro de la propia carpeta raíz del juego que se llama d3d9 (si no recuerdo mal) después de haber hecho esto, no solía crashear (algunas veces de manera random pero muy pocas veces). También me bajé la última versión del DPfix y lo único que cambié fue la resolución a pantalla completa y ventana a la de mi monitor, lo demás lo dejé por defecto. Lo único malo es que no saltan los logros pero bueno, al menos lo puedes jugar. 

PROBLEMA EN EL APUNTADO
A veces se quedaba como pillada la mirilla y no podía apuntar hacia arriba o hacia abajo (que unido al sistema rudimentario de apuntado era bastante latoso). Lo pude solucionar dando a la tecla windows o tabulando para acabar en el escritorio, luego volvía a seleccionar el juego abierto en la barra de tareas y al parecer al bloquearse los fps, o algo así he deducido, podía apuntar perfectamente en todas las direcciones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065306405', 'num_games_owned': 712, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2494, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2494, 'last_played': 1588018758}
review:
He jugado a este título porque soy muy fan de Lynch y de Twin Peaks. Al principio me pareció interesante el intento de copia de la serie unido a un intento de copia de Silent Hill con los cambios de escenarios y con mecánicas de mundo abierto entre GTA y Yakuza. Pero al final se queda en eso intentos.

La navegación por el mapa es tediosa, ya que no puedes ver el mapa completo en ningún momento y las carreteras no son precisamente intuitivas. Los zombis son una broma y en ningún momento se sienten amenazantes, menos aún cuando haciendo un par de secundarias tienes armas potentes con munición infinita. 

Los personajes intentan parecer esos anticlichés que Lynch utiliza, pero terminan siendo tropos que están para decorar. Por ejemplo tenemos a Sigurney, la señora del cazo, una copia barata de Margaret, la señora del leño de twin peaks. La segunda es un punto clave dentro de la resolución del misterio y forma parte del lore de la serie, la primera sólo sirve para unas misiones secundarias que sirven sólo para conseguir coleccionables y coches nuevos.

En cuanto a la imitación de Silent Hill, tenemos al asesino del impermeable, de nuevo un intento de crear su propio Pyramid Head. A diferencia de su inspiración, este señor del hacha sólo es amenazante porque el juego mecánicamente te hace imposible responder ante él y sus encuentros se reducen a hacer unos pocos quick time events que sólo son difíciles si te pillan por sorpresa.

Por último, el final del juego es bastante anticlimático. De repente el juego se cansa de ser un survival horror y se convierte en un devil may cry, pero con unas mecánicas que no están hechas para estos tipos de jefes, los cuales desentonan enormemente con lo que había sido el juego hasta ese momento. Además te enfrentas a una elección de la cual sólo hay una respuesta correcta, supongo que intentaron dar la ilusión de múltiples finales.

En definitiva, este juego intenta muchas cosas y consigue muy pocas. La intriga que me autogeneraba yo mientras hacía las secundarias ha sido bastante más potente de lo que el juego ha sido capaz de generar por sí mismo.

review:
I'm recommending this game because I managed to play it through. It has plenty of flaws, such as poor audio mixing, poor controls and annoying quick time event gameplay at times. The game also froze and crashed a few times, but not as often for me as other reviews made me think.

The plot is engaging enough to keep up my interest, but is a bit weird and could use some work on characterization. I get Twin Peaks vibes from the premise. The graphics are fine, not everything has to be realistic, but the world feels empty, the map could be smaller. The animation and lip-sync are a bit wonky and repetitive.

If you can buy this is a sale, it's an alright game.

review:
An awful port of a fun game. Really a pity. If you don't mind slogging through the crashes and if you get lucky and don't get a corrupted save it's sort of fun. Can't recommend it in this garbage state though.

Update: After suffering through a bit more, including what I thought was an inescapable crash loop, this game is too weird not to recommend. Yes, the port is absolute garbage. DPfix has helped me a bit, and when I get into a bad crash loop I find that restarting my PC will fix it. If you go into the experience knowing it is a technical disaster, perhaps you will be able to appreciate the super Japan flavored art that is this hideous gem. 

It is so bad that it is amazing. That goddamn music tho.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090857672', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 2918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2918, 'last_played': 1422653152}
review:
Die Bugs ... spielbrechend und zwingen einen zur Konsultation entsprechender Foren und Webseiten.  
Die Grafik ... antiquiert und PS2 würdig. 
Das Fahrgefühl ... erinnert mich - natürlich überspitzt formuliert - mehr an ein Stück rollendes Holz als ein Fahrzeug. 
Das Gameplay ... besitzt Reminiszenzen zu einem Spiel der frühen 2000er oder späten 90er, nicht aus 2010. 
Die Geschichte ... das vielleicht Einzigartigste, Denkwürdigste und Interessanteste was ich je erlebt habe. 
Der Soundtrack ... könnte direkt von Wolke 7 stammen. Ich habe kein Spiel davor und danach gekannt, das mich dermaßen mitgerissen hat TROTZ der Grafik.
Bossfights ... unerwartet und hart, aber machbar und sehr belohnend. 

Urteil: Für mich persönlich definitiv unter den Top 10 der Spiele des letzten Jahrzehnts, aber wisset die Bugs erfordern Eigeninitiative! Das Spiel ist mehr als ein digitales Produkt, es ist eine mitnehmende SURREALE ERFAHRUNG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007717593', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1051, 'last_played': 1586352374}
review:
This game is essentially Twin Peaks the video game: Full of cheesy dialogue and silly characters, this game is a fantastic tribute to campy murder mysteries.

However, despite the charming design of the game, the sheer amount of game breaking crashes bring everything down to a very frustrating experience. I have spent around 15 desperate hours just trying to play through the first 5 chapters over and over again.

I have tried a number of methods in an attempt to stabilise the game to no avail. The infrequent save points and inability to save the game when replaying chapters means you're constantly having to gamble between losing a ton of progress or trying to go for that 100% completion rate. 

It's incredibly disappointing that this port crumbles under it's own weight.

Play it on the 360, PS3, or Switch instead. The PC version is a steaming pile of horse manure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001938023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1418805619}
review: As a Twin Peaks fan I found the setting interesting enough to keep playing, but the pacing is an absolute mess. During the campaign you get nothing to challenge you except wave after wave of zombies, and then you get socked with FIVE boss fights at the end. I finished only three of those fights, because in keyboard mode the fourth one has quicktime events that, as far as I can tell, require you to mash two randomly chosen keys from the ENTIRE keyboard to avoid dying. This is not fair play, it's not good storytelling, and it's not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1584718121}
review: Oh, boy! Where to begin? Deadly Premonition easily fits the bill of crappiest good game I've ever played, or maybe best crappy game, take your pick. This survival horror Resident Evil meets Twin Peaks game certainly has ambition and is complete with an open world "sandbox", but gets so many things wrong, I won't bother listing them all. It's a 2013 "enhanced" version of a 2010 game, which somehow has the look and feel of a 2005 release. Graphics, controls, world interaction, driving and action are so outdated, it's almost funny at times. The story is the one thing which I found to have some merit and I was somewhat curious to see how it will turn out, which is what kept me going for a while. But the dialogue is so laughable and the cut-scenes laborious, that it lost its shine too. And forget about motivation to go out and explore the open world. Even just playing through the main story took every bit of my patience and turned out to be too much for me. I lasted 7 hours before giving up on this exercise in futility and I doubt I completed even 25% of the story. Really, couldn't care less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075061111', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1582992163}
review:
Game #88										1.3.2020.

[h1] There can be no disagreements about this game [/h1]

So, you know how you can get into an argument with another game-enthusiast about which game is best/worst? It seems that no matter which game you love, there will always be a person who will hate it with a passion and you will undoubtedly end up in a discussion with them, and vice-versa.

Not with Deadly Premonition. You can't do that with this game.

Observe:
“Deadly Premonition is a bad game”, “Yes, it is”, 
“Deadly Premonition is the best game ever made”, “Yes, it is”, 
“Deadly Premonition has the worst writing ever”, “Yes, it does”
“Deadly Premonition has the best writing ever”, “Yes, it does”.
Even as I’m wiring this, I’m surprised that all of these are actually true.

[h1] A horrible game that everyone loves? [/h1]

What is Deadly Premonition? In short: Deadly Premonition is a horrible game. It is also one of my favorite games of all time and many people share my opinion.

So what’s so good about Deadly Premonition? The story and the characters. But didn’t I just say that the story was bad? Yes, I did. It’s a bad story that’s extremely enjoyable filled with bad characters that are also extremely enjoyable.
So let’s start at the beginning: The game stars FBI Agent Francis York Morgan. York, as he likes to be called, is sent out to investigate a series of murders that occurred in a quiet little town surrounded by woods. 

[h1] The gameplay is a mess [/h1]

The first time you actually get control of the game, you realize that the game tries to replicate Resident Evil 4
https://store.steampowered.com/app/254700/resident_evil_4__
 or Dead Space
https://store.steampowered.com/app/17470/Dead_Space/

 with its controls, but it does so in the worst possible way. Everything that’s supposed to work, works in the worst possible way. The movement feels awkward, drawing your weapon feels awkward, aiming feels really awkward and even locking-on enemies’ feels awkward. It’s barely playable and it’s hilariously bad game design. Not to mention that the graphics look like crap. So once you get past the first “game” session you are thrown into this open-world forest town and that’s where the game actually begins (the good parts).

[h1] You want the story! Not the gameplay! The story sucks too! [/h1]

The cutscenes. That’s the reason most people adore this game. They aren’t well acted, well written nor do they make any sense most of the time but you get to watch all these characters speak and do their stuff which is where this game shines.
Take the main character, Agent York, for example. While he is generally an arrogant and rude person he is also particularly picky about his biscuits and coffee. Often during dialogue, he will pop a random smile that’s nothing short of creepy. He is also schizophrenic and will talk to his “imaginary friend” Zack. Since you get to answer the questions he asks Zack, that kinda makes you his alter ego… I guess. Surprisingly this is a very good way to get you engaged with the character. 

The other characters are a bunch of weirdos as well. You’ve got a millionaire tycoon who refuses to speak and wars a gas mask only talking through his butler in rhyme, a police officer who runs like a ballerina and bakes biscuits, an artist who is a nymphomaniac, an overweight gardener with a dark secret, the list just goes on and on. It’s the kind of weirdness you simply can’t predict. It’s like watching a murder mystery TV show where the detectives and the suspects are clowns. You laugh at how bad everything is but are also weirdly intrigued.

[h1] Lots of things to do in this game and most of them are poorly made [/h1]

While all that’s nice and good, what’s the gameplay like. The gameplay of this game is just bad. Everything about it is bad and I mean everything. I already mentioned how the controls are lousy and how the graphics look like they are from the 2000s but it just keeps getting worse. Since this is an open world game, you also have driving vehicles. The driving sucks. You also have free roaming where you do side quests and collect trading cards. All of these suck too. Then you have your stamina bar and your health that are mostly pointless because you rarely run out of health or stamina. You also have a sleep and eat meter which you have to replenish and by that I mean, do it once or twice during your entire playthrough. You also need to change your clothes and shave, otherwise flies start flying around you and you grow a beard and no, there isn’t really a penalty for not doing either of those.

[h1] We have to have zombies, right? [/h1]

While going through the investigation is fun and all, before every major location you will be forced to go through … uhhh…. A shooting section I guess. Basically, that’s where most of the gameplay is. While driving around, collecting cards and doing side quests is mostly optional, you have to go through shooting sections and they are easily the worst part of this game.

What happens is that every time York is alone, the atmosphere turns dark and weird zombie-like creatures start attacking him as he makes his way through the level. I use the term “attack” very loosely because these, while scary, are some of the worst enemies I have ever encountered. They are really slow, they can be ran past without any problems and when they do actually notice you and attack you, they bend backwards and do a crabwalk in order to get to you and even when they hit you it’s not a big deal. Needless to say, whenever I replay these sections, I always just want to get through them as quickly as possible so that I can enjoy the rest of the story. And YES, these have absolutely nothing to do with the game.

Sometimes, York will also encounter the raincoat killer (the main antagonist) of the game. During these sections, York will have to hide or run away from the killer. These again are really badly done and are laughable at best.

[h1] You must endure all the bad parts in order to get to the good parts [/h1]

Now, many people will tell you that this PC port is really bad and that you should avoid it at all costs unless you patch it heavily and even then it’s not worth it. This is all true. The game is locked at 30 fps, the resolution is locked, the graphics are far from perfect, the controls suck… basically… the game barely works… and, if you ask me, that’s just the way how this game should be played.

You don’t really want to play the zombie sections or the driving or anything, you want to watch the cutscenes and the story BUT in order to watch this hilariously bad story, you have to ENDURE the game. YES, I honestly think that you should play this PC port as it is just so you can pay an imaginary toll in order to get to the next cutscene. Why? Well, the Xbox 360 version (the original one) barely worked too, so it’s the way how the game was supposed to be played. 

So, yes, the game barely works and it will probably crash and stutter and run poorly, but if you are determined, you will get to those beautiful cutsences. Sure, you can patch the game and make it all nice and more playable but, honestly, it will still be a bad game just slightly more playable. So I don’t think these is much point.

[h1] Even though it makes no sense, I absolutely adore this game [/h1]

In conclusion, Deadly Premonition is a cluster-f***. It’s a horrible game where everything is horrible but it’s also horribly enjoyable and I wouldn’t have it any other way. The Xbox 360 disk of Deadly Premonition will forever sit proudly on my shelf and so will this Steam version.

Next game: Deadly Sins 2
https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198075061111/recommended/285420/

https://steamcommunity.com/groups/RevAMG [/h3]

Pick it up, play it and get yourself ready for the sequel coming out this year

author: {'steamid': '76561197985048152', 'num_games_owned': 1604, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 3035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3035, 'last_played': 1537212559}
review:
В маленьком американском городке Гринвейл зверски убивают девушку. Тот же почерк убийства и аналогичные улики уже находили на других местах преступления в разных частях США, поэтому расследовать дело приезжает специальный агент ФБР Фрэнсис Йорк Морган. По степени своей эксцентричности Йорк почти не уступает другим жителям городка, нормальными кажутся лишь шериф Джордж Вудман и помощник шерифа Эмили Уайатт. Не привыкшие к серьёзным преступлениям, провинциальные служители порядка во главе с Йорком расследуют невероятно жестокую и кровавую серию убийств, правда о которых перевернёт Гринвейл с ног на голову.

Deadly Premonition — это шутер от первого лица с отличным мистическим сюжетом, интересными персонажами и диалогами, открытым миром и головоломками. И всё это погребено под горой самых разных багов, подчас не дающих продвинуться дальше по сюжету.

Чтобы никто не питал напрасных надежд по поводу незначительности багов: на данный момент в Стиме опубликовано 38 руководств, и 21 из них касается решения [i]неизбежных[/i] технических проблем в игре. 21 из 38! У этой игры ОЧЕНЬ много проблем. Она может внезапно вылететь или зависнуть без возможности выйти на рабочий стол (придётся отключать её на ощупь через диспетчер задач), может так сильно лагать, что играть будет крайне неприятно, а ещё, говорят, может уничтожить ваши сохранения. Это то, что возможно преодолеть, если периодически переставлять совместимости и режимы игры и делать бэкапы сохранений. Но есть и то, чего избежать нельзя: неудобное использование карты, прицеливание и управление автомобилем, проблемы со звуком (иногда голоса звучат тише, чем надо, а музыка — громче), тонущие в асфальте машины, проходящие сквозь холмы олени, протыкающий Йорка насквозь галстук… в общем, много того, что не ломает игру, но способно в неожиданный момент разрушить для вас атмосферу.

Геймплей чётко делится на две чередующиеся части: в одной Йорк волен перемещаться по открытому миру — городу, общаться с NPC, ходить по магазинам и т.д.; другая часть представляет собой линейные уровни с призраками, от которых нужно отбиваться, чтобы пройти дальше по сюжету. Как в любом survival horror'е, эти уровни также содержат простейшие квесты (сходи в конец одного длинного коридора и возьми предмет, чтобы применить его в конце другого длинного коридора), а также напряжённые QTE-сцены с прятками от одного из злодеев игры.

Изначально уровней с призраками в том виде, в котором мы их видим сейчас, не планировалось, команда разработчиков хотела сделать лишь QTE и прятки по шкафам, но издатель сказал своё веское слово: сейчас в моде шутеры, будьте добры подогнать игру под шаблон. В итоге эти сцены выглядят вымученными, враги однообразны — их всего два вида, и второй встречается в игре от силы трижды, — а для тех, кто не любит шутеры и зашёл в игру ради сюжета и атмосферы, оставили имбу: бесконечный пистолет, который лежит в инвентаре Йорка с самого начала. Обладателям PC-версии сделали ещё больший подарок: из всех существующих на консолях уровней сложности оставили один: самый низкий. Благодаря этому встречи с призраками проходят легко и непринуждённо, если их не слишком много и они не зажимают героя в тесной комнате.

Побочных квестов, которые разбавляют сюжет и привносят любопытные штрихи в облик города, довольно много, и выполнять их интересно. Среди них загадки, поиск и доставка предметов, гонки, коллекционирование, тесты на знание медицины и реалий игры, дартс и даже сокобан.

Отдельный акцент сделан на самочувствии главного героя: ему нужно есть и спать, чтобы не умереть, и переодеваться, чтобы вокруг не начали летать мухи. Также герой может бриться или за несколько дней отрастить бороду. При этом предметы, восстанавливающие голод и усталость, встречаются порой в самых неожиданных местах: как вам, например, тарелка копчёного лосося, найденная в ржавом шкафу потустороннего мира? Там же, бывает, можно поспать и побриться — призраки подождут.

В связке с Deadly Premonition неустанно упоминают Twin Peaks, потому что в игре много отсылок, а то и украденных деталей из сериала. Разработчики этого и не скрывают. Агент ФБР приезжает в тихий маленький городок расследовать убийство — есть. Сцены, посвящённые кофе и еде, — есть. Странные персонажи, бессмысленные и ненужные детали — есть, и в избытке, ведь это Япония, страна крайностей и абсурда. Не забудьте о сильно выраженной мистической составляющей в обоих сюжетах — и вот готово представление о том, что Deadly Premonition — это японский Twin Peaks: с перекосами во все стороны и чёткими признаками хоррора.

Такого мощного и богатого сюжета не встретишь почти ни в одной другой игре. Местами это душераздирающая драма, местами придурковатая комедия, ну и, конечно, без ужасов не обошлось. Игра пугает без скримеров, а некоторые события сюжета могут выбить из колеи на несколько дней.

Ни одна сцена не существует просто «для галочки», каждая из них если не даёт нужную по сюжету информацию, то обязательно вызывает те или иные яркие эмоции. Чего стоит сцена, когда за обедом сотрудники департамента шерифа выпытывают у Йорка, какими были его расследования в большом городе, и получают такой прямой и детальный ответ, что у всех пропадает аппетит.

Работа режиссёра в катсценах на высоте, «оператор» часто выбирает необычные планы, которые отлично подходят для конкретных сцен и делают акцент на том, что в этот момент важно.

Подборка музыки необычна. Несколько мелодий так красивы и атмосферны, что чем глубже погружаешься в сюжет, тем больше от них захватывает дух, есть и удачный жуткий эмбиент, а есть глупейшие треки, использованные в игре для контраста. Включат одну из них посреди какой-нибудь кошмарной сцены, да сопроводят неожиданным глупым событием — и вы прочувствуете странный фирменный контраст этой игры.

Исследовать игровой мир интересно, замечать намеренно вставленные странности очень смешно, а весь глубокий многоплановый сюжет невозможно воспринять за один раз, слишком он концентрированный. Пусть игровые улицы Гринвейла и пусты, нельзя сказать, что в Deadly Premonition мало контента. Эта игра продумана до мелочей, есть даже подозрение, что всевозможные баги и недостатки тоже были оставлены намеренно, чтобы сделать игру более странной, оторванной от реальности, чтобы помимо всего остального она смешила тонущими в дороге машинами и тревожила прерванными катсценами.

Бесспорно, техническая сторона игры безобразна, так делать порты на PC нельзя. Но эти бесподобные сюжет и атмосфера оставляют впечатления на долгие годы. Хочется найти другие подобные игры, но их попросту нет и, скорее всего, не будет.

Чтобы пройти Deadly Premonition, придётся люто плясать с бубном, на это пойдёт далеко не каждый (и тот, кто не пойдёт, будет по-своему прав), но это возможно. Если вам нравятся ужасы, мистика и необычные игры, дайте ей шанс, и она отплатит вам отличным сюжетом.


Полный обзор со спойлерами и анализом сюжета можно прочитать [url=https://leeloo2525.wordpress.com/2019/09/08/heavy-stories-9-deadly-premonition] в моём блоге.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197974936987', 'num_games_owned': 1401, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 1454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1582256506}
review:
*Update since finishing the game*

Holy smokes, this was amazing! The entire game and story and everything felt so well done, besiiiiiiiiides the combat, BUT the elephant in the room is the crashes. If you're willing to put up with a LOT of crashes, scouring the internet for fixes, this is worth checking out, but it's a huge headache. There's a reason there's like... 12% people that have the chapter 2 complete achievement. If you're extremely patient, this version is worth a try, but I'd recommend any other port over this one. Even with DPFIX and compatibility modes, you're going to get crashes and lose progress and need other saves or backup saves. You've been warned.

**Original Review**

This has been a great game so far. The combat is lacking, but exploring and getting to know the town, soundtrack, the intrigue, dialogue, everything is great. But then it crashes. A lot. For no clear reason. And there are definitely fixes online for different issues, but that kind of postpones things until the next crash. Changing compatibility mode helps a bit, but its kind of a shot in the dark with how long it will help. I'm thankful the community is on this to try to get things working and people have save files to get past troublesome moments, but it's a bummer that the developer didn't fix these issues themselves after all these years. 

I do advise checking it out, but probably on any other version besides the PC unless you're will to put up with a lot of stuff. I plan on finishing it, but I know the game is going to fight me every step of the way :(

author: {'steamid': '76561197995200857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1470355804}
review:
So my introduction to this game was a little weird. You see my first name is Zach, and one day it showed up on the Steam front page and I had had no previous introduction to it, but a trailer started autoplaying where the main character starts talking to his other personality in such a way that it seems as though he's talking to the player, and he keeps calling him Zach.
I was shook. I thought for a second that the game had somehow figured out my name and automatically edited it into the trailer. It felt weird as fuck. And for the entire time I played this game, I felt like I was getting another layer of experience that regular players wouldn't because all of the dialogue directed at Zach really felt like the game was communicating with me directly.
I googled the game and realized how stupid that was, but everything I saw online about the game made it seem divisive.
This game has a definite cult following, but there's also a lot of people who just straight up hate it, and with good reason.
The game is unfinished, or maybe overly ambitious. It's too long with too many pointless systems, and the systems it does have aren't really executed that well.
That said though, this game is impressive in the scope of what it's trying to do.
It combines detective style gameplay reminiscent of LA Noire with the survival horror elements and gunplay from Resident Evil, all the while taking place in a persistent open world that you can explore and with a storyline that's a little too closely ripping off of Twin Peaks, but still manages to hold up on it's own.
Now, although all of that is incredibly ambitious and impressive, I'm sorry to say it doesn't really do any of those things very well. All the gameplay mechanics are at least a little bit clunky, and although it was the game director's ambition to have this open world, the driving and the shooting mechanics of the game could've been reduced or eliminated entirely and I wouldn't have felt that the game was missing out on much. Also, using the map or the overall UI in general is just such a needless hassle.
The real thing here is the story which is surprisingly deep and complex despite the surface similarities to Twin Peaks. Now, be warned though, the dialogue and voice acting is pretty bad (with the exception of York's voice actor who sounds amazing). I'm not sure if this is just a problem of a Japanese game being poorly translated to English, or if the dialogue was just meant to sound this hokey and weird, but regardless, if you can muscle past that, you might actually find yourself enjoying the characters here much more than expected.
Now, as I've said, this game has a lot of similarities to Twin Peaks, enough so, in fact, that I think they got sued over it. Regardless, I actually feel like these are mostly surface or purely aesthetic similarities. The themes the game deals with in it's story are different and the overall vibe is actually pretty different too. Everything feels a little surreal, and you're never quite sure if it's intentional on the part of the developer or just something wacky and stupid. The music often seems weirdly out of place too, but is still really nice to listen to.

Overall, I can't help but recommend this game, although I fully admit it can feel like a bit of a slog at times. I feel like if this game had been given a AAA budget and maybe come out a few years later we would be talking about it nowadays as one of the greatest games of all time. But as it is now it's a fun, but weird, attempt at something bigger and grander.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149336069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1664306923}
review:
you can get it running at 1080p 60fps with very few glitches

all it takes is
- installing dpfix
- configuring dpfix
- configuring the launcher to work with dpfix
- installing the 4gb patch
- disabling the steam overlay
- using the .exe file to launch instead of steam
- running it in compatibility mode
- uninstalling lav from your computer
- realizing the previous step is harder than it sounds
- finally uninstalling lav after like an hour
- editing the game with a hex editor
- installing a bunch of hd ui mods
- installing your appropriate controller prompts
- creating a savedata folder because the game doesn't create it itself and it needs it to save
- installing a bunch of fixes I didn't mention because it'll still crash anyway
- making a deal with the devil
- downloading five fresh installs because you'll mess up this process alot

and just like that, you have a working video game that you spent money on and you're also a licensed surgeon

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034710997', 'num_games_owned': 289, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1390769029}
review: Deadly Premonition ist ein sehr bizarres Spiel. Einige würden es vielleicht auch als trashig bezeichnen, aber es hat einen unglaublichen Charme. Es besitzt nicht die schönsten Texturen und ist auch relativ durchschnittlich bei der Steuerung, aber die Dinge um dieses Spiel herum, wie es aufgebaut ist und wie die Geschichte erzählt wird sind besonders und ganz anders, wie man es von anderen Spielen gewohnt ist. Mir gefällt die Story rund um York und seiner Detektivarbeit und wer Abseits der Norm nach etwas Abwechslung sucht, kann mit dem Spiel nicht viel falsch machen.
