author: {'steamid': '76561198140442560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 1497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1497, 'last_played': 1553216440}
review:
Deadly Premonition is ostensibly a mixture of RE4, Silent Hill, and GTA, with the tone and atmosphere of Twin Peaks. As FBI Detective Francis York Morgan, you are sent to Greenvale to investigate the murder of Anna Graham, a young and beloved teenager who met her end at the hands of someone known only as The Raincoat Killer. To say it borrows from Twin Peaks is an understatement- it has the same quirky tone, a large and likable/ interesting cast of characters that really grow on you, and more than several elements that border on plagerism, such as the fact that York (everyone calls him that, so you should call him that, too) speaks to someone the audience doesn't see named Zach and a mysterious room that seems to exist outside reality that york returns to regularly. You explore the town, interacting with the townsfolk, and can take the time to tread off the beaten path. There's an in game clock, and missions are only available during certain times, but the time frames are almost always generous enough to allow for exploration.

And here's the thing about this game. Or, rather,many things. The graphics are, speaking generously, dated as all hell. Animations, particularly facial ones, are laughable at best and leads to more than a few scenes of unintentional hilarity. The music, while actually really good in and of itself, is often used at horribly inappropriate times, particularly a very well known theme involving someone whistling. The "open world," such as it is, while containing a few places of interest throughout and packed with short side quests, still feels lifeless and barren. Almost no cars on the road, no one to just bump in to. The hunger and tiredness meters feel superfluous at best- they affect the game so little since finding food and sleep is easy as hell that I wonder why they were even put in the game at all. The driving is incredibly wonky. More often than not, you'll flip your car hilariously over on its roof by bumping into absolutely nothing. Or you might just flip it turning a bend. In one instance, I glitched through the ground a millimeter and this resulted in all of my car's health instantly falling to 0. The combat is RE4 if RE4 fell down some stairs. Extremely basic and imprecise over the shoulder angle that is only challenging because aiming feels so floaty and tough to nail down. The overall sound design outside of the music and voice acting (which is for the most part rock solid, particularly York) is incredibly weak, with guns sounding like someone shooting a spitball and enemies making moans like they just woke up from a nap. And, to top all of this off, the most challenging part of the game is getting around its myriad game crashing bugs. The game itself is extremely easy, but throughout my play time, I experience several hard crashes that resulted in me having to run the game in Windows 98 compatibility and more often than not still required me to restart my laptop. Mind you, this is something almost everyone with this edition has experienced. 

And yet.

Despite all of those problems.

I still recommend this game. Not just recommend. But heartily recommend it. Glowingly. Enthusiastically. Elatedly. 

See, this game defines more than the sum of its parts. Despite how weak most of the individual elements are, this is still a thoroughly engaging mystery that is, yes, fun to play. And this is thanks in large part to the script. This game would be barely playable if the writing in it wasn't so damn strong. The mystery starts off exactly like Twin Peaks, and yes, while this game does owe a great deal to that show, and there are elements that border on plagirism, it eventually reveals itself to be a separate beast entirely from the beloved cult TV show. It has a knack for building its central mystery expertly, and unlike Twin Peaks, every facet of it pays off wonderfully. Don't get me wrong, I LOVE Twin Peaks and its ambiguity (even the batshit insane Season 3). And that's where the brilliance of this game's story lies- it uses the very familiar setup to tell its own, stand alone, cohesive story where everything ties together in an emotionally resonant and immensely satisfying way. It cannot be understated what a huge impact the script has on this game. The fact that every character is quirky and interesting makes you want to explore the world just to see what kind of strange situation you'll be thrown into next. It almost reaches a Majora's Mask level of marrying its gameplay and story together, and that is something I almost never say. Exploring its world enhances the main story in that you come to know and care for the residents, which only bring the stakes higher and higher. It all leads to one of the most emotional finales I've ever seen in a game, and it's sure to be one that resonates with anyone that sees it through to the end.

And the thing is that, even though elements like the combat aren't amazing, the game is paced in a way that really helps break things up. Just as you might be getting tired of wandering around town, you can go into the game's otherworldly combat sections and spend an hour or so shooting dumb ghosts. And just as those get tiring, you're back to exploring the world, where you can do a few side missions, buy new suits, chat it up with the locals, or partake in one of a few mini games. The ambition on display here is rather astounding, and even though it doesn't always reach what it sets out to do, it's still admirable and interesting.

This game is, in every sense of the word, a deeply flawed masterpiece. It's not always necessarily enjoyable, the production values are all over the place, and crashes are never not annoying. But the story is so strong and interwoven into the very fabric of its mediocre gameplay that it transcends its individual elements and becomes something wholly unique and unlike anything else in gaming. It would be interesting to see what could have been done with a bigger budget, but as it is, many of its flaws only add to the offbeat charm of its cast and atmosphere (including those godawful facial animations). Yes, there are many annoying parts that drag, and it sometimes feels undercooked.

But at the end of the day, if you told me you were forced to choose between something like this and, let's say, Just Cause 3 (a very fun and enjoyable open world game) I would pick this game. In fact, I would pick this as an open world game above most others. There's nothing else like it and it's absolutely worth experiencing, warts and all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198425648425', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1154, 'last_played': 1552827559}
review:
Для начала, игра просто офигенная, смесь твин пикса с налетом японщины и темной стороны города  сх.
Я наверное шаман в 5 поколении, но в бубен пришлось бить только один раз :D 
Ошибки которые возникали и как они были мной исправлены:
1. Нельзя пропустить начальные заставки с названиями компаний, даже не пробуйте тыкать на кнопки, вылетит ошибка, поэтому сидим и 10 сек ждем когда они пройдут, а потом спокойно скипаем видос. 
2. А вот и удар в бубен :D Машины ездили по кругу и в больнице вообще выбивало из игры, сколько бы не старались перепроходить. Заходим в папку стим и в папку самой игры, там ставим у ярлыков совместимость с виндоус ХР и запуск от админа. Всё, вылеты будут ну ооочень редки. Всё это делалось на 10й винде. 
Теперь в общем об игре) Не настолько игра страшна и крива как её хают. Управление тут типичное как например для тех же старых сх, резиков и тд. Единственный момент где у вас из-за управления может погореть одно место, это последний босс. Графений не очень, но это видно по скринами, не думаю что люди ищущие графон вообще в неё станут играть, она тянет скорее своей атмосферой, а как показывает практика, большинство стремных на графон игр, очень душевные) Сюжет не слабо так закручен, а именно это и нужно детективной игре. В конце нападает грусть, это как посмотреть наикрутейший сериал и знать что всё, он закончен)

author: {'steamid': '76561198393423009', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1190, 'last_played': 1551568034}
review: Шикарный сюжет. Харизматичный гг . Все персонажи так же очень интересны. Очень много сюжетных поворотов. author: {'steamid': '76561198010145357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1594, 'last_played': 1699435354}
review:
excellent jeux gaché par des connards car il ne marche pas sur win10 je suis à 2FPS il y a probablement des tutos mais j'en ai plein le cul de faire le boulot de steam putain



incroyable ce jeux!! C'est le seul et unique jeux d'horreur open world avec une ambiance bien glauque qui fait beaucoup penser aux premiers resident evil ou silent hill ou autre jeux d'horreur jap.. Mais avec pas mal de liberté, voiture, l'action et les "zombie" sont super bien animé.. il faut aussi 

gérer la faim, 
la fatigue, 
le temps qui passe, 
la météo,
l'essence et l'état des voitures, 
se raser,
envoyer ses costumes au pressing pour chasser les mouches (littérallement), 
payer un dollard pour téléphoner et sauver, 
mettre les essuis grlace quand il pleut en vue intérieure, 
dormir, 
manger un sandwich ou alors manger avec le shérif et l'adjoint en parlant du chapitre en cours, 
fumer une cigarette pour faire passer le temps, 
un café pour se redonner la pêche,
pêcher pour manger,
plein de quêtes secondaire

et en plus l'histoire est très bien mise en scène... Et ça fourmille de bonne idée.. un magasin ouvre à 9h mais à 8h50 on va voir arriver le géranrt en voiture, se garer et ouvrir le magasin..

BREF ce jeux est étonnant.
La seule et unique chose à reprocher c'est le gameplay au volant et les phases de tir car c'est assez mal fait mais c'est vieux, cela dit il mérite vraiment un super remake!

author: {'steamid': '76561198082879841', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 4780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2719, 'last_played': 1703961206}
review:
[b]Update: 12/17/2019[/b] - I've been playing the Switch version and I must say they did a pretty good job with it. The framerate drops while driving in town but aside from that it is very well done. I would recommend the Switch version over this.. unless you like suffering.

[h1]Review:[/h1]
Deadly Premonition is a genuinely bizarre game. From a technical standpoint it is a mess. Constant crashing, controls not working, audio bugs, you name it - it will probably break at some point. That being said, [b]this is truly one of the best games I have ever played.[/b]

The graphics are nothing to look at, and the controls are less than optimal, but the story is gripping - and the characters are some of the strangest & most interesting you can find in a game. The game just [b]oozes[/b] weirdness. Inappropriately timed jazz, awkward dialogue reactions, a plethora of cheesy lines (especially near the end), as well as weird in-game mechanics and visual bugs. (You will come to love the unexpected weirdness). Initially you WILL have problems getting it to run properly. However, once you do get it up and running, you won't want to stop playing. It's just such an incredibly interesting game that nothing you do in the game feels like a chore. Everything you do in the game is so unique and otherwordly that you will never say "oh boy this again?" Even if you don't play it - watch a playthrough of it just to [b][i]experience[/i][/b] it. No, really, it's [b]THAT[/b] good. [b]It also goes on sale relatively often for less than 4$.[/b]

I've included a quick summary:
[list]
[*]Graphics  ---  Looks like a mud puddle
[*]Sound --- You play it in stereo or you go deaf
[*]Difficulty  ---  Easy
[*]Price/Quality  ---  Get it on sale
[*]Length  ---  30-40 hours
[*]Glitches/bugs  ---  The game is one big bug
[*]Story  ---  [b]Masterpiece[/b]
[/list]

[i]Literally so bad that it's great.[/i]

review:
Legend game but you need to fix this pc version!

Öncelikle böyle güzel bir oyunun bilgisayar sürümünü bu kadar berbat yapan ekibe buradan küfür etmek istiyorum. Çünkü oyunun kendisi gerçekten hayatınız boyunca bir kere tecrübe edebileceğiniz tarzda bir yapım ve bunu yapmanıza izin vermemişler afedersiniz. 

Oyunun kendisininden bahsedecek olursak: Bu problemlere rağmen böyle uzun bir oyunu yarısına kadar oynadım.  Siz düşünün nasıl bir potansiyele sahip olduğunu. Geri kalanını da youtube dan izlemek zorunda kaldım. Grafiklere kötü diyip oyunu karalamak isteyenlere sormak gerek gerçekten dizi senaryosu gibi yazılmış hikaye, sitcom tarzından birden karanlığa bürünebilen büyüleyici atmosfer, muhteşem şekilde işlenmiş birbirinden farklı ve orijinal karakterler ve akıcı diyaloglar hiç mi dikkatinizi çekmedi?

Her neyse uzun yazmak istemiyorum çünkü ben de ilk defa bu pc versiyonunu oynadım. Keşke konsolda oynama şansım olsaydı ama içerisindeki bu kadar hatayla böyle muhteşem bi yapıt oynanmaz hale gelip, kursağınızda kalıyor. Gerçekten yazık.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032373366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3131, 'last_played': 1595356265}
review:
Al netto dei diversi bug che affliggono questa versione su Pc, mi sento di consigliare Deadly Premonition per via della sua trama ricca di colpi di scena e che riesce a tenere alta la curiosità del giocatore fin dai primi istanti. Il titolo è ispirato in molti aspetti alla serie cult Twin Peaks, con numerosi rimandi sparsi per il gioco in cui si alternano fasi esplorative/investigative ad altre più votate all'azione, dove la realtà lascia il posto al paranormale. Graficamente il gioco lascia alquanto a desiderare e sente tutto il peso degli anni; il doppiaggio in inglese è buono con un discreto accompagnamento in fatto di colonna sonora. Deadly Premonition offre un buon numero di ore di gioco (15-20 circa per la storia principale, più le altre missioni secondarie).
Se necessario si trovano numerose guide per risolvere i problemi di funzionamento più comuni, fino ai salvataggi per superare alcuni momenti critici nel gioco. Se lo trovate in vendita con un forte sconto (50% o più) vi consiglio caldamente l'acquisto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010155821', 'num_games_owned': 790, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2310, 'last_played': 1547112028}
review:
[h1] Twin Peaks meets Silent Hill [/h1]
Deadly Premonition is a third-person action game with horror elements.  Personae dramatis of this story is an FBI agent by the name of Francis York Morgan, a gentleman in his 30s, who quickly turns out to be a rather eccentric individual in the most charitable of terms. The player takes control of the character as he travels to the remote city of Greenvale to investigate a possible lead in a case involving a mysterious series of murders. Deadly Premonition is a unique criminal story-driven game. The pacing of the intrigue is slow, it gradually grows on the player over time along with an introduction of the diverse cast of characters that are Greenvale’s denizens. Be it Miss Polly, an old lady who runs a hotel that could fit an army, all on her own, or Mr. Stewart, a crippled mysterious millionaire who goes around the town always wearing a gas mask, having a servant by his side to speak for him. York is by no means the odd one out, bizarre at first, interactions of the player with the others in the city succeed in creating awkward chemistry that encourages the player to get to know them all better. Everything about Greenvale is somehow odd yet in spite of its, often self-conscious, absurdity it puzzlingly manages to fit the pieces into a coherent whole.  Deadly Premonition requires certain patience to fully appreciate. To me the payoff was a sensation of playing through a crime novel. Not an interactive movie experience of a Telltale Studios game, but a proper book somehow molded to fit into the video game medium.

[i] An unexpected error occurred: the review will resume shortly after a technical break, please standby [/i]

No matter how fond of the game you might become, it cannot be omitted that it is an absolute mess from a technical standpoint. Deadly Premonition is a slightly extended version of the game that was initially released on Xbox 360 and only later ported to the PC. Sadly it was [i] that [/i] kind of port which I can only speculate must’ve involved the use of blunt objects first and programming second. Frequent crashes, randomly extending loading times and graphics glitches only open the list. There are numerous threads regarding issues with the PC version of the game often divided into Deadly Premonition not running at all or crashing at a certain point never to load past a cutscene. In my case, it was the latter, after running smoothly all the way up a whopping quarter of the game it simply died on me. Given that DP runs only on a single save via checkpoints there are no means to work around it within the game itself. Luckily the community came to the rescue with fan-made fixes available on the internet. “Patching” did allow me to complete the game, though even then the crash counter went well past 30. While problems with running the game are not a given, it is more likely to misbehave than not. Honest warning. Don’t buy the game unless you are willing to run the risk of putting up with aforementioned hiccups.

[b] Low settings, cutscenes, and driving lessons [/b]
In the end, I resolved to judge the game by its own merits rather than its instability. Thus here we are, at the launcher of the game which offers “settings”, a grandiose term considering it essentially consists of keybindings. Furthermore Deadly Premonition’s initial release took place in 2010 and it wasn’t an eye candy the day it came out. Graphics seem blurry and light is almost blinding on sunny days. What is more every change of the location requires a quite lengthy loading screen.  Mediocre graphics are relevant, as they constitute one of 3 core elements of the game - cutscenes, the others being driving and combat. Deadly Premonition makes heavy use of cutscenes in both action heavy and more leisurely paced sections of the game. Despite action elements being heavily interrupted by cinematics, it doesn’t disrupt the general flow of the game too much. Regardless the game’s overall looks, lengthy clips are enjoyable to watch, as they often present the full scope of oddity that is character interaction. As for open world gameplay,  you might as well end up completing a side quest just to see one.

Ah yes, Deadly Premonition features a fairly vast open world for such a game and mundane driving from place to place will be a vast part of the playtime. There is no quick travel feature and many key locations tend to be in rather secluded places. Several main story sections consist simply of driving around talking to characters accompanying you on the way. Driving around everywhere is a relevant element of establishing the pace of the game and is made fairly entertaining by agent York’s remarkable knowledge of B-class cinematography he eagerly shares with the player. Too bad that driving model is quite terrible, though you better get used to it, especially if you get hooked into the game enough to start doing side quests. There is quite a lot of them and you gradually unlock more as you progress through the game. Some provide little but further insight into the city of Greenvale, while others can get you a better car or a weapon. Don’t take too much time before you start exploring though, with a serial killer on the loose some quest givers might not make it to the epilogue.

[b] Resident Evil wants its camera back [/b]
Combat is probably the most prominent part of the game, though like everything else it has a few quirks of its own. Majority of the time we view York from a third-person camera placed over the agent’s right shoulder. From the very beginning, the player is being assaulted by eerie zombie-like creatures that shamble erratically towards the protagonist. You can either shoot them or run, though you can’t move while aiming. Luckily, York’s trusty pistol is enough to dispatch them and there are better weapons available further down the line. 

Paranormal themes are heavily present throughout the game and Francis York Morgan shifts to a haunted dimension at numerous times throughout the game, having to battle his way through to the evidence at each respective crime site. It’s easy to forget it at times but Deadly Premonition is considered a survival horror for a reason. Enemies are twitching backwards with their backs broken, trying to shove their arms down player’s throat, this combined with distorted music and interiors reminiscent of Silent Hill series, create a genuinely dreadful atmosphere. Unfortunately, combat sections also feature the quick time events rather frequently. While not all of them lead to an instant death, you are likely to load quite a few times within starting chapters of the game alone. Even if the player does survive a QTE, they definitely butcher any sense of unease the game might’ve set beforehand.

[b] "Don’t ask me about Zach, it’s personal" [/b]
Deadly Premonition’s approach to the 4th wall is a thing deserving its own separate mention. It’s hardly a wall but more of a door kept wide open. Agent York himself considers the player his partner, naming you “Zach” and frequently addressing player throughout the game. Examples of which is telling stories addressed directly to Zach or complementing the player on landing a headshot.

In the end, Deadly Premonition truly is an experience filled with mixed feelings. In its insanity, it delivers charmingly absurd characters and tells a thrilling criminal story. At the same time, the plot just might be its only strength with essentially every other part of the game being mediocre or plain bad. Its conflicting nature seems to have developed into something of a defining trait as Deadly Premonition holds Guinness World Record for oddly specific “most critically polarizing survival horror game”. For me, the good outweighed the bad, even with the extra weight of technical difficulties. Frankly, there isn’t quite any other game like this, beside other works of SWERY, and thus I can only recommend experiencing the game first-hand. Make your own opinion, right Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198017601480', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1615690659}
review:
Este juego es muy bueno, entretenido e interesante pero no lo compren para PC. 
La dificultad para apuntar el arma y conducir el auto se pueden dejar de lado, pero tiene varios problemas serios y simplemente no hay una forma concreta de arreglarlos. Desde el tercer capitulo me comenzaron los problemas, para el capitulo 7 estos se pusieron serios. Probe todo lo que encontre en linea y nada sirvio pero con una ocurrencia consegui hacerlo funcionar ya para el capitulo 9 nada funciono y el juego acabo "bugueandose" mucho. Lo descargare de nuevo esperando que al menos pueda volver a jugar los primeros 8 capitulos sin que el juego se congele. Aunque ya estoy cansado de intentar que funcione.

review:
I first played this game on XBOX 360, the first version was more challenging than the Director's Cut. The game graphics aren't that amazing, but if you use DP fix it gets better. The game was intended to launch on PlayStation 2 and XBOX in 2006, that's why the graphics are this way. This version have better gameplay than the first version, that's a plus.

The problem with this game are crashes, that's the worst part. You need a lot of patience with the game.

I like the story of the game, it can be a bit crazy on the end. This game reaaly needs a sequel, on the red room you will se a map of U.S.A. with a lot of marks and some dolls of Forrest Kaysen, meaning that there are other places with red tree.

Worst part about this game is getting it to run stable, this game will crash on you every 30mins untill you find fix that works for your pc even then it will occasionally crash. author: {'steamid': '76561198105058204', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1655480178}
review:
Совы - не то, чем они кажутся...

Ах да, это из другой оперы.

Но и тут потусторонний мир зовёт агента Купера... то есть Йорка в свои лабиринты. 

А в реальном мире, посреди лесов маленького тихого городка с кучей скелетов в каждом семейном шкафу, буйствует маньяк, вырвавшийся из оков городских легенд, прихватив с собой красный дождевик с огромный топор, выходя на охоту в дождливый денёк. 

А агент Йорк ищет в своём утреннем кофе предсказания, улики и намёки и частенько их находит, постоянно консультируясь со своим напарником - Заком (извини, Диана), расследуя убийство юной красавицы.

Местный шериф и его очаровательная заместитель так же под подозрением, как и любой житель городка - семейная пара из забегаловки, где работала погибшая; или прикованный к инвалидному креслу местный богач, скупивший практически весь город; или глава художественной галереи, очень вовремя уехавшая из города сразу же после убийства.

Основной сюжет, атмосфера, персонажи - самое главное, и, пожалуй, единственное достоинство игры.

Деревянное управление в бою; скучная и порой неадекватная песочница (ловить рыбку и выловить коллекционную карточку или патроны в озере); скудное и частенько неуместное музыкальное сопровождение;  а что самое приятное - любовь игры ломать сохранения, тем самым заставляя переигрывать 2-3 часа с предыдущего автосохранения.

Но ничего. Я переиграю, а потом вновь столкнусь с этой проблемой. 

Всё ради гениального сюжета в духе Твин Пикс, только в азиатской обёртке.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093355413', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 2994, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2938, 'last_played': 1561781792}
review:
Definitivamente vale la pena jugar y sobretodo pasar este juego. Es cierto que tiene ciertos bugs, crasheos, etc . Problemas basicos que un juego de hoy en dia no deberia de tener.Pero ¿saben algo?, nada que no pueda solucionarse. Y mas allá del aspecto técnico y jugable, el punto a favor de este gran juego es por un lado su fantastica banda sonora y sobretodo su grandiosa historia. Acabo de terminar el juego por completo y sinceramente vale la pena vivir la experiencia que significa superar este juego.
Misterios, dilemas existenciales, asesinatos, la muerte,  mujeres bellas, casi diosas, destinos inexorables, son solo algunas de las tematicas que encontraran en este titulo

Debo destacar que el guion de este juego es sencillamente sublime, es de esas historias poco predecibles, en donde lo mas remotamente inimaginable sucede, sorprendiendote a medida que progresas en el juego. La trama de este juego es casi como Poesia. Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut sin duda te deja huella como gamer y espectador.

PD: Recalco que posiblemente a muchos de los gamers de hoy en dia les parezca tedioso este juego y con mecanicas casi primitivas en comparativa con otros titulos moderno, sin embargo los animo a jugar esta fantastica obra, realmente es toda una  grata experiencia. Un joya incomprendida. Ojala algun dia sacasen un remake de este clasico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024793915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1722, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1722, 'last_played': 1420412194}
review:
So this is one of the most polarized games in modern history. People find that the graphics, occasional crashing of the game and awkward sound design is too big off a turn-off for them to continue playing, which is fair enough.  However,  the player who stays with the game for a while seems unable to put it down.  The player who wanted something more  than the ordinary AAA gameplay and story will becomes more and more immersed, while constantly trying to remind him/herself of the games faults. 
After about 17 hours you sit there with an weird smile and feeling like for the first time in a very long time, you got a new positive gaming experience (inspired by Twin Peaks no doubt) that you probably will not experience again, ever. Reccomended for the player who seeks to discover a artistic and intense story in a very unique game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118573687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1421536194}
review:
Ignore my playtime, as I previously owned this game on console. That I bought it again on Steam should say something. I can't help but love this game.

Let's get the bad out of the way. As a game, it's terrible. Clunky controls, boring combat, dated graphics, and from what I hear the port isn't great, but can be fixed with mods. If you're here for great gameplay, you're probably best off looking elsewhere.

So why am I recommending it? 

Because this game is BONKERS. If you can get past the rough technical aspects of the game, you'll be rewarded with an absurd, surreal experience with lovably odd characters and a campy murder mystery that you won't soon forget. I'd almost call this "The Room" of videogames, only it's not written nearly as bad. Fans of horror or bizarre stories should definitely consider picking this up, but I'd wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067783657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1604827411}
review:
I first heard about Deadly Premonition via Guinness World Records, where it was ranked as the most critically polarized game of all time. How do you NOT play that game? Well, after starting and aborting it four times over the last six years before ultimately completing it...my personal verdict is that it's well deserving of that record.

Don't get me wrong, I love this game. And I usually fucking hate pros and cons lists, but this game is a rare exception. 

PROS: 

The protagonist is one of the best in all of video game-dom. My personal favorite, actually. He's a chain-smoking FBI agent who has developed an alter ego with whom he openly converses. When the "two" of them are alone, they mostly talk about movie trivia. He congratulates and compliments himself when he hits his targets. Just a fun goddamn character on all levels. 

The side characters are no less interesting. They all have distinct personalities and quirks.

The town of Greenvale is one of the more realistic maps out there. It's sparsely populated by NPC's who keep actual schedules; they could be at home, work, or elsewhere depending on the time of day. There is no fast-travel, and you can't set waypoint markers, so unless you want to pause to check the map every fifteen seconds, it's just in your best interest to memorize the roads. 

The story is fun. 

CONS: 

I've really just got one gripe, but it was the deal-breaker all three times I quit playing: the combat sequences just suck. I have nothing good to say about them. They're repetitive, dull, simplistic, tiresome, and the mechanics suck. They're completely out of tune with the feel of the rest of the game, which is otherwise very lighthearted. Initially, they're somewhat stressful, as your standard-issue pistol is incredibly weak and ineffective. But once you upgrade to literally any other weapon, the sequences become over-the-top easy and just an overall waste of time. Most enemies just come at you at an unmenacingly slow pace. Certain enemies and bosses have patterns that you have to follow in order to kill them. But those patterns are comically simple, and ultimately just time consuming. Busy work.

Every time there's an interesting development in the plot, it's accompanied by a pointless action sequence. Each time I sigh heavily and remind myself that it doesn't matter. Just power through it. Once I got in the mode of just thinking of the combat sequences as commercial breaks, it made them more bearable. 

***

The game also has a few elements that are either really annoying if you're not feeling them, or lovably quirky if you are. Best example is the music. There are only like four music cues in the whole game. I personally found them effective, and kind of thought of the limited playlist as being a nod to Twin Peaks (from which this game draws heavy influences), which also only has a handful of music cues.

Similarly, there are only like five or six stock animations that any given character model draws from. So their mannerisms and expressivity are pretty limited. Similar to the music, though, I personally found this endearing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079694849', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1728, 'last_played': 1544345308}
review:
Deadly Premonition is an open world survival horror that has clunky controls, outdated graphics, awkward sound design, meh gameplay, with a good enough plot to keep you interested. And you know what? It all just works! At face value you would look at this game and think that it's just a survival horror that doesnt take itself seriously and part of that thinking is right. But there is something more to this game, something charming that made me love it.

[h1]GRAPHICS[/h1]
Graphics-wise it is outdated, textures look like it came from the PS2 era with the mouth movement-dialogue not synching, low res textures, and pretty funny animations and special effects similar to a 1950's movie special effects. Yes it is that bad, compared to anything else released during the 2010s.

[h1] GAMEPLAY[/h1] 
Gameplay is pretty much the same as any other survival horror with an overworld-realworld to traverse in to: The MC adventures in the real world and the MC deals with enemies in the overworld when York is in profiling mode. In Deadly Premonition you can play with the open-world feature when youre in the real world; You can do side quests, explore the country-side, drive a couple of cop car models, or pretty much partake in whichever activity you like concerning some of the townsfolk like drink in a bar / buy guns / play darts and much more. I'm warning you though before buying this game that the driving in this game is a chore and is one (if not only) of the more tedious aspects of the game. Cars doesnt have the feeling of weight to them, and cop cars (which are the only cars you can drive) are limited to a speed of 60 mph. And what is an open world game without a shadowing mission where you follow a target not too close or not too far or else you get gameover? 

Combat is pretty basic, it reminds me of RE4 combat without movement when aiming with a firearm. You can press Ctrl to lock on the nearest enemy and it helps out when you're surrounded by a horde of enemies. Melee weapons degrade after a bunch of uses from it. That's about it for DP's combat: nothing new added to the survival horror genre and nothing taken away either. You know what they say; if it's not broken, don't fix it! 

[h1] SOUND DESIGN [/h1] 
This is one of the charms of the game. A lot of the dialogue pokes fun on B movies but a lot of the sound effects all came from generic B movies (from the characters' shook sound to explosion sounds) that is what makes the game hilariously good. Let me tell you though that the music made for this game is one of the absolute best. The whistle theme is one of the comfiest soundtracks ive ever heard in a survival horror. It is so out of place that it actually blends so good with a segment of the game when it comes up.

Story and plot is what made this game. From the quirky characters and funny dialogues, the game has some deep dark undertones accompanying it. There wasn't a lot but a couple of segments really cemented this game as an actual horror game and those few segments alone is so good that it puts the silent hill and resident evil franchise to shame.

[h1] FINAL VERDICT [/h1] 
Past the random crashes, clunky controls, bad graphics, there is a hidden gem shining brightly in Deadly Premonition. I don't want to spoil anything and i suggest you experience one of the best games in history for yourself. "Isn't that right, Zach?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198129138990', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1544273211}
review:
This game fails horiibly as a product. For me, like many others, the game doesn't even launch to begin with. The only reason this game is remotely playable is due to fan-made mods. It is pointless to gush about the story and the themes and the music if the game fails to run at an achievably respectable threshold. The controls are horrible. If you modify them you get input lag in many cases. The camera is wobbly and at an exceedingly awkward angle. It crashes willy-nilly. I have not been able to complete the game because of a recurring crash. 

Put simply, this product does not deserve to be paid for. If you get it for free or obtain it though other means, feel free to sink your time for the experience some users seem to have been blessed with. Otherwise, don't pay and encourage people to push [almost literally] broken products into the store. If you should pay anyone, it's the people who made the mods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198226843724', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3114, 'last_played': 1544189590}
review:
Coffee warned me that many people never managed to finish this wonderful game, but I was most likely 'The Chosen One' and got 100% without a single crash.

[b]Cons:[/b]

1) You can suddenly fall through the textures(I met this bug only once at the beginning of the game)
2) The map resolution is very limited. You're not able to see the whole way and put your markers or remove the old (Spiritual map, for example).
3) Soundtrack. Music is often picked up strangely and because of this you never take what is happening on the screen seriously. Maybe it was intentional. At the end of the game, I started to hate 'Miss stiletto heels'.  
4)  All events are available at a certain time. It's not annoying, but I had some trouble completing the quests for Emily and Michael. 
6)Shooting part. I didn't notice anything off-putting, but for other players it was an obvious minus.
7)  Animation. It's broken and it looks funny, but I didn't pay much attention to it. 
8)  A small number of enemy types. 
9)  Fishing. It's pure random.
10)  Final fight with a dude who had sex with two hot chicks [spoiler]and you hadn't, lol[/spoiler]. The quick time event is not so important for the game, and the creators could just make some epic scene in the best traditions of Devil May Cry 3. But no. Run, Forrest, run.
11)  You'll never figure out  what's in Sigourney's pot. 

[b]Pros:[/b]

1)  York. He is gorgeous, I somehow fell in love with him at the end of the game.
2) Self-Irony and humor. Not every game creators could make fun of their own shortcomings. 
3) Plot. He is very unpredictable and interesting. It's like you're watching a good detective series. The strongest part of the game.
4) Hints in dialogues and objects about the real murderer. You might feel like a real detective, eh, Zach?
5) Cute dogs, sent from heaven by Sheogorath.
6) Driving. It's epic. The creators of Fast & Furious should take note.  
7) Breaking the fourth wall, which was brilliantly explained.

[i]Mr. Francis York Morgan.
It's time to make a conclusion,
No, it's not an illusion,
The port was awful, but we found solution.
Enjoyed the game from the start to the end,
I'll miss you, my coffee maniac friend. 
I'll contend, the game deserves 10 Sigourney's pots out of 10.[/i]

So says Mr. Stewart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452910860', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1543810974}
review: Al que le guste minimamente Twin Peaks, le va a gustar este juego. Tiene mil problemas: El combate está metido un poco con calzador, algunos menúes muy ortopedicos, archivos que se corrompen (ojo con eso), etc. pero asi y todo, la historia es genial, muy lisérgica y la resolucion del misterio tambien. Consejo: Ir haciendo las misiones secundarias siempre que se pueda, porque tienen plazos muy limitados y despues de terminar el juego una vez, no hay mucho incentivo para volver inmediatamente (para mi por lo menos). Es raro y no es para cualquiera, pero tiene una trama excelente y un par de situaciones de investigacion muy interesantes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198284347467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 1691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1691, 'last_played': 1542661942}
review:
Przede wszystkim muszę ostrzec, że port na PC jest wykonany fatalnie i gra się często crashuje. Żeby mimo tego ukończyć grę polecam:
1. Bardzo częste zapisywanie gry.
2. Jeżeli gra crashuje się cały czas w tym samym momencie, to można spróbować przyśpieszyć czas i przeczekać kilka godzin w grze poprzez palenie papierosów - możliwe, że przy kolejnym podejściu gra puści dalej.

Jeżeli mimo tego wstępu nadal czytasz recenzję, to znaczy, że łatwo się nie zniechęcasz i jest spora szansa, że dotrwasz do momentu, w którym dostrzeżesz wartość Deadly Premonition.

Deadly Premonition zaczyna się intrygująco - w małej, oddalonej od wielkiego świata mieścinie - Greenvale - zostaje zamordowana kobieta. Okoliczności śmierci są na tyle nietypowe, że do miasta zostaje ściągnięty agent specjalny York. 
Po dobrym początku zaczynają się jednak schody. Otwarty świat, który oferuje gra wydaje się pusty. Dostępne aktywności wyglądają jak typowe "zapchajdziury", nie wnoszące nic istotnego do gry. Przestrzeń gry zdaje się niepotrzebnie duża, szczególnie, że samochody, którymi porusza się York na tym etapie gry są powolne.

Problemem tutaj jednak nie jest gra, tylko gracz. Wystarczy zmienić podejście do gry i - tak jak w RPG'ach - wczuć się w rolę i zacząć myśleć jak agent specjalny. Skoro została zamordowana kobieta z Greenvale, to jedną z pierwszych rzeczy, które by zrobił, to odwiedzenie domu, w którym mieszkała. Skoro kobieta tu mieszkała, to powinna mieć znajomych - należałoby więc ich znaleźć i dowiedzieć się czegoś więcej o ofierze. Grając w ten sposób, okazuje się, że jednak jest sporo do zrobienia. Okazuje się, że świat tętni życiem, że jest wielowarstwowy.

Wielowarstwowość to duży atut Deadly Premonition. Grając odsłania się kolejne warstwy: globalne - związane z całym miasteczkiem, jak i lokalne - związane z konkretną postacią z gry. Przykład: autopsji zamordowanej kobiety dokonuje lekarz Ushah Johnson. Podczas sekcji zwłok wykazuje on przesadnie dużą inicjatywę. Lekarz lubi gry (stąd wynika, że lubi też rywalizację). Po jakimś czasie od innej postaci dowiadujemy się, że Ushah jest bardzo bogaty. Takie dawkowanie informacji sprawia, że gracz zaczyna dopowiadać sobie resztę, pojawiają się podjerzenia. W Greenvale jest sporo postaci/podejrzanych, a każda z nich stanowi małą tajemnicę.

Kolejnym atutem gry są zadania poboczne. Nie zawsze ich treść jest interesująca, ale za to nagrody już są. Stanowią one remedium na pierwsze wrażenie jakie robi gra. Tu nie ma absurdów typu "1 punkt doświadczenia za ukończenie zadania" (patrz Wiedźmin 3). Nagrody są wartościowe, bo ułatwiają rozgrywkę. 

Reżyser Hidetaka Suehiro (Swery65) z wyczuciem tworzy więzi emocjonalne gracza z postaciami z gry. To jest unikatowa rzecz, rzadko pojawiająca się w grach. Więzi te Swery65 wykorzystuje, jak maniakalny, szalony naukowiec, który chce poznać granice wytrzymałości badanego obiektu. Obiektem tym jest gracz, którego czeka emocjonalny roller coaster z katartycznym, ale smutnym finałem.

Świetna gra!

---
Mój profil kuratora Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33910649/

author: {'steamid': '76561198082490006', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 1543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1543, 'last_played': 1543601953}
review:
После часа дрочки кодеков, совместимостей с более старыми версиями виндоус и прочих драйверов она запустилась! Несмотря на это игра всё равно рандомно вылетает без каких-либо видимых причин.

Поначалу меня подкупила загадочность и абсурдность, даже вспомнил мор. утопию. Но потом началась консольная поебота, я даже не знаю с чего начать, почти всё плохо: тупейший геймплей в стиле алана вейка, невозможность нормально прицелиться, езда на автомобиле с уёбищной физикой, диалоги и сюжет уровня аниме для двенадцатилеток и конечно же открытый мир, который по большей части обман. Да, сначала кажется, что мир не пустой и как будто бы тут есть чем заняться помимо основной линии сюжета, я даже умудрился сделать несколько сайд-квестов, но где-то после третьего эпизода эта свобода пропадает и ты тупо идёшь по бесконечным коридорам, приправленных тупорылыми катсценами, и выполняешь рутинные действия. 

Дропнул где-то в конце шестого. Только что. Не смог убить ласт босса, нужно целиться в мелкий элемент жирной туши, но прицеливание не работает так, как должно, даже после очередных ковыряний в совместимости. И, по всей видимости, даже убей я того босса, мне уже не дали бы возможности побродить по городу и поделать квесты. Наверное, по мнению разработчиков, у меня дар ясновидения, я должен был угадать, что после третьего эпизода свободы действий нет.

Я правда не понимаю, кому это может понравиться? Как это может быть культовой игрой? Бывают хорошие порты с приставок, но это - крепкое говно, и тратить свои нервы не советую.

review:
Мне очень понравилась игра. Если вас влечёт что-то в духе Твин Пикс, то вам сюда. В конце, правда, наинается трэшак в виде битвы с боссами, что было для меня очень внезапно и проходила эти моменты нехотя, но это не портит общего впечатления от игры. Чтобы узнать всю историю, придётся проходить до конца ;) В принципе, рекомендую не стесняться использовать гайды, чтобы потом не хвататься за голову. Почитайте их - поймёте. В игре присутствует довольно информатиная карта, по ней можно блуждать в поисках нужных персонажей - так сказать, почувствуй себя Гарри Поттером.
Ах, да! Наберитесь на всякий случай терпением, поскольку игра местами глючная, гайды тоже по этим поводам есть. Желаю удачи и получить удовольствие от этой кривоватой-криповатой игры, с которой успеваешь сродниться за время прохождения!

author: {'steamid': '76561198317799164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1543355067}
review:
Agréable surprise, contrairement aux commentaires le jeu passe nikel sous W10 et avec un joypad XBox 360.
Beaucoup mieux qu'un merdique et incompréhensible et trop sombre The Evil Within.

ASTUCE :
Si le jeu freeze lors de l'ouverture des missions secondaires quand on regarde la map, pas de panique.

Aller dans le dossier du jeu puis aller sur le DPLauncher.exe et le lancer en mode compatibilité Windows XP SP3.

Le jeu ne freezera plus, mais les fps auront chutés à 15fps au lieu de 60fps.

Pour y remedier pour ceux qui une une Nvidia il faut ouvrir le panneau de configuration Nvidia et forcer la Vysnc (synchronisation verticale) sur le laucnher deu jeu ( ATI doit pouvoir le faire également avec son panel center).

Et miracle le jeu est repassé à 60fps et ne freeze plus du tout.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056117734', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1541653426}
review:
Deadly Premonition. Игра про агента ФБР, приехавшего расследовать загадочные убийства девушек в провинциальный городок. По ходу расследования мы знакомимся с жителями города, их обычаями, привычками. Впрочем, всё есть в аннотации.
Плюсы:
- атмосфера провинциального городка, со своими легендами, обычаями и тайнами,
- саундтрек. Отличный саундтрек как по мне, отлично вписывается в стилистику игры, подчёркивает происходящее,
- сюжет в Deadly Premonition на 10/10. Неожиданные повороты сюжета, моменты, держащие вас в напряжении, много дополнительный квестов (которые, кстати, хочется проходить не только ради достижений) - всего этого хватает.
Минусы:
К минусам я бы отнёс графику, хоть игра и 2013 года, но тем не менее.
Итог: Брать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047509336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1260, 'last_played': 1543046836}
review:
-The PC port is terrible
Game crashes a lot
If you want to play with a controller its a pain just to make it work.
And loadings sometimes take an eternity.

-Gameplay is realy, REALY clunky
You feel almost no impact from any attack with any weapon
QTEs give you very little time to react
Game has poor enemy variation, and most of them are pretty easy to deal with, so there is not much of a challenge
There is quite a few things to do in the open world, but not many of the side quests are interesting to do

-Driving is a problem on its own
It is terrible in every aspect, it takes some time for you to learn how to make turns without flipping your car, the game gives no directions to objectives besides an marker on the horizon with the distance to get there, you pretty much cant zoom out of the map, so you have to trace the routes manualy, and with the amount of dead end streets this game has, its terrible to navigate.

-Graphics are far from good, but I have to say, it has its charm

-The soundtrack is actualy realy good

-And finaly, the story is where the game shines
Characters are realy interesting, knowing more about them is one of the only things that makes side quests worth it.
The mistery is very well made, and it develops in a good pacing.
If you have watched twin peaks, know that deadly premonition takes a lot of inspiration from it. If you like the series you will probably like the story of DP.

I have to say, believe it or not, the pros of the game outweight the cons, if you are into mistery stories with a bit of supernatural. 
With that in mind, I have to say, this game realy deserves a remake, it has material to be among the best, but it just has too many problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097630483', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1542488721}
review:
[h1] Решили поиграть? Не спешите, сначало скачайте DPfix и поставьте совместимость с Windows XP или Windows 98	[/h1]
Японцы славятся своими кривыми портами и странными решениями в управлении, Deadly Premonition одна из таких японских игр. С начала может показаться, что она вышла еще где-то в 2004-2005, но нет, это 2010, а в стиме находится уже доделанная Director Cut версия. Конечно, доделанности вы не заметите, потому что графически она устарела, анимации топорны, а стрельба и того хуже. Но есть кое-что, что всегда привлекает в некоторых японских играх, это сюжет. И правда, если вы фанат или любитель триллеров и, в особенности, Twin Peaks, то повествование затянет вас надолго, возможно, вы даже можете перестать обращать внимание на дубовость всего.
[h1] Порадовало	[/h1]
+ Интересный и продуманный сюжет
+ Дух классических триллеров
+ Яркие персонажи, каждый со своей интересной историей
+ Симуляция жизни, у каждого NPC есть своё расписания дня
[h1] Огорчило	[/h1]
- Плохая графика на момент выхода
- Деревянные анимации
- Танцы с бубном над оптимизацией
- Затягивание сюжета с помощью длинных кат-сцен, в которых ничего не происходит, и некоторых геймплейных моментов
- Странные способы взятия побочных квестов
[h1] Сюжет	[/h1]
Наш персонаж Йорк работает в ФБР и уже какой год расследует странные убийства, в которых постоянно фигурируют красные семена. Очередной вызов приводит его туда, где всё началось. Сюжет и правда интригует, закидывая странную паранормальщину, которая правда не раскрывается в игре вообще, она просто есть и додуматься до ответа можно, но будет ли он правильный? Каждый момент в сюжете немного раскрывает личность настоящего убийцы, игра может даже начать водить за нос игрока, заставив его сомневаться в невинности многих персонажей, но увы игра линейна и вы не можете обвинять кого попало, всё произойдет по сюжету, а вам нужно просто дойти до конца.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1567804477     	
[h1] Геймплей	[/h1]
Причислить игру к сурвайвал хоррор можно только при первом рассмотрение, но потом открываются все возможности и становится реально трудно определить жанр. Тебе выдают открытый мир, в котором можно ездить на машине, у каждого магазина и персонажа есть свое расписание, город буквально живёт на фоне, пока игрок расследует убийство. Если вы играли в Resident Evil 4, то вы примерно должны понимать как тут всё работает. Разработчики видимо пытались скопировать главную механику, но она не очень хороша, чтобы ей восхищаться. Для того чтобы ударить или выстрелить в противника, вам нужно сначало встать в стойку готовности и только потом, после того как вы нацелетесь, можно стрелять. Противники тоже не блещут разнообразием, 5-6 моделек прямоходящих или согнутых зомби, которые могут быть либо с оружием, либо без, также есть типичные ползающие по потолку существа, похожие на девочку из Звонка, которые появляются только в нескольких местах за всю игру.
[h1] Послесловие	[/h1]
Игру можно посчитать испытанием, за которое вас наградят отличным, но своеобразным сюжетом, но как говорится, оно того стоило. Стоило пройти через все баги, вылеты и постоянную смены совместимости.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059773157', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 3204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1700040765}
review:
Сжав свои яйца в кулак, прокачав свою нервную систему благодаря нескончаемо появляющимся членам семьи из доты 2 (которые все про тебя знают) и послушав альбом шамана, я решил, что настало время попытаться в третий раз поиграть в эту игру.

Вообще, стоит начать с того, что это не игра. Это неплохая детективная история и чем больше ты в нее погружаешься, тем больше удовольствия получаешь. Однако от игрового процесса ты напротив с каждым лишним часом игры страдаешь все больше. Играя задумываешься о целесообразности различных "игровых фишек" реализованных тут (но не доведенных до ума) которые мало на что влияют, либо мешают в полной мере насладится действием разворачивающимся на экране.

Кроме истории, больших плюсов в игре нет, все остальное на любителя.

П.С.
Рандомные и циклические вылеты игры в некоторых местах лечатся запуском от имени администратора и установкой совместимости с windows 95, однако из-за этого игра будет очень медленно загружаться и немного подтормаживать, поэтому советую прибегать к данным настройкам только в моменты вылета. Соответственно вы часто сохраняетесь, как только наткнулись на вылете в определенном месте - меняете настройки, проходите момент, сохраняетесь и возвращаете настройки обратно. Больше в эту игру нет способа нормально играть.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992334290', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 302, 'last_played': 1541805211}
review:
I wanted to like this game, given the great atmosphere, interesting characters, and setting that comes from it's surreal horror environment, but the gameplay part of Deadly Premonition is an exhausting chore. Not to mention that the beginning is painfully slow (what amounts to a long cutscene, interrupted by brief moments of gameplay and quick-time events). It's a buggy port, so it requires a handful of fixes (of which are fortunately readily available and easy to install). The combat is a slog, which I think is something the publisher forced onto the devs when this was originally published. Thankfully, they made the enemies much weaker in the Director's Cut, so you can bypass most of them pretty easily. The gunplay is your typical third-person action shooter, with a lock-on system for faster aiming. The lighting in this game seems to be having problems frequently, and there still seem to be issues where the game can crash at certain chapters and corrupt your save (you'll have to download a backup save for that, which is in the included game fixes collection). The driving part of this game is also a chore. You're given a large map (admittedly nice looking, when the draw distance isn't freaking out). However, it can be hard to navigate because your map ROTATES with you, and you can't really view the entire map at once without slowly scrolling through it. What's more, you have to keep an eye on your gas while driving, but the police car you're going to be driving for a while chugs gas like a frat boy on a Saturday night. Nothing like having to stop what you're doing to try and find the nearest gas station. There seem to be a lot of sidequests, so there's that.

Overall, this game definitely earned its "so bad it's good" reputation, but I just didn't feel like finishing past the first chapter. If you have the patience for a slow and janky game that might make up for it with its storyline, this game could serve you (when it's on sale for $3 like it frequently is).

author: {'steamid': '76561198043938050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1628828988}
review:
Well I have to go on record and say I absolutley love this game. The wife and I rocked this game on the ps3 and we were excited when we found out the PC version was a thing. We wanted to have another fun play through of this game whilst also doing a few youtube vids about it for our channel. However those hopes were dashed shortly after I downloaded the game.

We played up to the hospital segment of the game and it crashed, we tried multiple times but it would not continue on from that point without crashing. So I decided to do a complete reinstall of the game but that only made matters worse. controller input stopped working, the frame rate droped to 5 frames per second if we were lucky enough to get pass the opening menu of the game before it crashed. I tried multiple fixes like DPfix. Now DPfix did stop the crashing from happening however the game still had a massive framerate drop that would not improve, making this game impossible to play.  I do not reccomend people buy this game at all on PC. its a complete waste and Rising Star looks like they couldn't care less about some form of optimization in order to make it playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035555903', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1523, 'last_played': 1541491178}
review:
loved this game. many will tell you it's so bad, it's good, but it's not. it's just good. it's rough around the edges, but it's got it where it counts. the story and dialogue are all pretty impressive and the game itself is incredibly immersive. there's new dialogue for characters constantly. it all feels very realistic, leaving you feeling a part of greenvale. just don't buy it for pc. glitches make this game not quite unplayable (at least for me) but they can be a real pain in the ass.

if you do decide to buy this game on steam, here's the glitches i found and how i overcame them (may not work for you). it should be noted i played the entirety of the game in windowed mode and used the dpfix for most of it.

- launcher doesn't work
open the game with the .exe file

- crash on chapter 9, 14, etc 
set compatibility for both the .exe and launcher to windows 98. windows 98 makes the game framey so 
you can save and reopen it normally once you get through the chapter.

- aiming is heavily restricted 
windows 98 mode also fixes this, but you can get around it by pressing ctrl, releasing it while still aiming, then moving the cursor to hit what you need to. it's only reallynecessary in some boss fights and notoriously the very final boss. you can hit the last boss even with the restricted aiming, you just have to spam the ctrl method and get a little lucky.

imo, this game deserves to be played in spite of the glitches. nothing i love more than a good steam game except having to fix it myself :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198071051179', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 3124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3066, 'last_played': 1536153410}
review:
Deadly Premonition — одновременно отвратительная и шедевральная игра. В ней ужасно практически всё. Но давайте по порядку.

Думаю в обзоре на данную игру стоит начать именно с минусов.

- В игре очень плохая графика. Я-то привывык к ней довольно быстро, но она и правда ужасна. Начиная с окружения и заканчивая анимациями.
- В игре отвратительная оптимизация. Если Вы не потомственный шаман в 5 поколении, то лишь удача позволит Вам играть в эту игру.
- В игре довольно таки скудный саундтрек. Готовьтесь слушать одни и те же музыкальные композиции десятки, а может и сотни раз.
- В игре довольно примитивная боевая система, да и разнообразия противников особо и нет.

Но почему же я рекомендую игру, раз у неё так много минусов, причём критических для любой игры? А всё дело в сюжете и атмосфере в целом. Каким-то образом игра цепляет и не отпускает до самого конца. Это одна из действительно немногих игр, которую я прошёл на 100%. Каким-то образом сюжет и атмосфера в целом перевешивают все минусы. Это поистине уникальный случай, напомнивший мне историю с Alpha Protocol, в которой тоже лишь 1 элемент в самом деле вытягивал всю игру.

Пришла пора подвести итоги. Deadly Premonition — это настоящий шедевр, который незаслуженно все обходят стороной. Советую игру всем.

review:
Yeah... it is strange. I knew that back when I bought it (can't remember where though), but I didn't expect such an abomination.
The controls are horrendous. Playing with the controller is only impossible because the camera does what it wants, It is near impossible to look around to see where you are heading to or that there are items or whatever.
Playing with mouse and keyboard is even more akward, besides you can look around normally you have the worst settings for a shooter you could imagine. Even Resident Evil 4 has better mouse and keyboard implementation.
I can't say much about the story, although it starts quite interesting, but I can't play on, it is getting on my nerves too much.
Unfortunately.

Oh and the game looks awful. I don't need the best graphics, expecially for 2013, I just need something I can look at without getting fuzzy. Console resolution, bad Framerate, bad and lazy effects, textures from hell, it is just ugly. Games like Resident Evil 4 from 2004 (!) look and feel better. Even the PS2 version.
And the last thing: There are no settings beyond Autosave (which cant be turned on), Camera (haha) and Aim settings and the other I already forgot. No Audio (this game is awfully loud), graphics, resolution and so on setting. This is by far the worst PC Port I have ever seen. But I don't think the console version is any better (because of the reasons I mentioned.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197967798229', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1589553929}
review:
Love the game but I cannot recommend it unfortunately on PC, maybe on PS3 if you can find it. The port is one of the worst I've seen. Manhunt took me a while to get running on a modern machine but it worked through the whole game when I was done modifying it. 

I've done no less than half a dozen fixes based on Steam community recommendations, Google searches, and PC Gaming Wiki's page on the game and at best can get a couple hours out of the game before it completely crashes with a runtime error message even with the fixes in place. Saving often is recommended but if you are doing chapter replays you cannot save so I have lost 3 hours of gameplay before on a replay. 

That being said, the story is fun, the characters are great, and everything you've heard about it being "so bad it's good" is correct, if you can ignore the crashes (those are so bad they are bad). If you are willing to fight through the bugs there is a solid game there, just be prepared for some tweaking and be a patient person.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081780579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1539460053}
review:
Porting pressoché ingiocabile per via dei troppi crash. Sono riuscito a finirlo, ma le imprecazioni non sono mancate.

Per quanto riguarda il gioco in sè: magnifico. 
È vero: il comparto tecnico è quello che è, tuttavia il gioco offre un'esperienza unica. Una storia - seppur ereditata da cliché cinematografici anni 90 - davvero bella e toccante, con un epilogo profondo, tuttavia non priva di un umorismo spiccatamente giapponese che non guasta mai. La narrazione segue magistralmente la parte interattiva, la quale è fatta di tanti piccoli accorgimenti che rendono l'esperienza coerente e immersiva, sviluppando al massimo le potenzialità del medium. 

Insomma: non è un giochetto per intrattenere e basta, è una vera è propria esperienza (a tratti psichedelica), un magistrale esempio di come dovrebbe essere fatto un videogioco, nonostante i limiti tecnici che si porta sul groppone.
Si tratta di un cult? Sì, va assolutamente giocato.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314257289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1760, 'last_played': 1614887038}
review:
This game grew on me big time. With nearly 30 hours of experience with the game, I finished the game feeling happy and satisfied with my experience. 

I will start off with the one thing people HAVE to know about before considering purchasing this game, the PC port is horrendous, if you have a PS3 or a Xbox 360 I recommend that you play the game on those platforms. The game without any mods installed will automatically runs at 720p with the lowest graphical settings possible, luckily there are mods to fix all of those issues, but this ultimately leads to another serious issue, the crashes. This is the one game I've played where I felt that I had to save every chance I was allowed, because the frequent crashes are unpredictable and can ruin your experience severely. In my first ever playthrough, my game crashed at a specific point in the game, and this caused my save file to corrupt and I couldn't find a fix for it. This game, from a technical standpoint, is a piece of shit in these regards, if any of this stuff is bothersome I would recommend staying away from the game.

Onto the good part, due to the unfortunate crashes I experienced, I had to restart my progress 3 times, and on the third time I was finally given the opportuity to complete the game, and I did just that. The game itself is far from spectacular, the combat is, in simple terms, bad. Why is it bad? Spacebar is the aim button, that's really all I have to say to explain why it's bad, but it doesn't take away from the game too much. What really made me engrossed with this game was the story, the town of Greenvale, and it's various characters. Honestly, the main protagonist of the story, that being Agent Francis York Morgan, ends up being one of my favorite characters in a video game in recent memory. There have been a couple of scenes in the game, especially the "Sinner Sandwich" cutscene which have had me laughing quite a lot, and it's primary because of how interesting of a character York is, and his relationship with Zach being unique and intriguing to follow.

But what's also great about this game is that it's an absurd game. It takes the small town murder investigation trope and adds this weird vibe to the game that makes you want to keep playing. I thought the opening hours of the game were a bit boring for me, but as I kept playing, I grew fond of the game and I became invested in the story. Before I beat the game, I would listen to the soundtrack of the game from time to time, and at the time I thought it was pretty bad. After I beat the game however, I had a greater appreciation for the music as I understood how it was supposed to be taken in and enjoyed, like for instance, there's a song called "Miss Stiletto Heels" which I didn't like in the beginning, but when it was finally introduced into the game, I started to like the song more because I understood the song's purpose. 

Before writing this review, I saw another review that claimed this game to be "The Room" or video games, and I honestly couldn't agree more. 

I wouldn't buy the game at it's current pricepoint of $25, wait for it to go on sale, I think I got my copy for $4 while it was on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273011256', 'num_games_owned': 3038, 'num_reviews': 707, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1538801545}
review:
[h1]Es tan malo, que es bueno; o tan bueno, que es malo(?)[/h1]

Dependiendo de que lado estes... este jueguito o lo amas o lo odias, no tiene un punto medio (en mi particular caso, es de mis favoritos~♥ lo jugue hace como 4 años en ps3 y hoy en dia lo ando revisitando, porque es hermoso xD)

>A grandes rasgos: pues este jueguito es un "survival horror" que no tiene mucho de survival, ni de horror, pero hermosamente guionado donde manejamos a York un agente del FBI que se le encarga la busqueda de un asesino en serie en un pueblito. Llegando a este se encuentra con fenomenos paranormales que le estan advirtiendo algo.

>Lo bueno:
-Pues es un buen thriller de juego
-el gameplay es decente (no es un resident 4 pero se acerca bastante a los survival horrors viejitos)
-el desarrollo y plot twist son un win en este juego.
-es como si jugaras a ser sherlock

>Lo malo:
-No muchos entenderan la grandiosidad de este jueguito xD
-tienes que jugar mucho con tu mando; para configurarlo bien.
-no es de los mejores ports (la version de ps3 le gana por mucho)

[h1]Resumiendo:[/h1]
Pues... no es un jueguito para cualquiera; pero por algo es de culto. Si te fijas mucho en los fallos tecnicos, de movilidad o argumentales en un juego, no lo compres, no es un juego bien hecho... es un juego hecho con las patas, feo cuadrado y apenas jugable pero con todo eso logra tener una historia muy buena y un gameplay decente a la vieja escuela. Ojo igual la historia no es para cualquiera... si creciste jugando silent hill/ fatal frame y leyendo sherlock holmes y demas cosas del estilo psicologico(King) asi como viendo toda la m1erda que Tarantino sacaba...estara aceptable, de lo contrario es un ascote y no le entenderas, como juego es mediocre 5/10 y solo sube su calidad dependiendo  tu grado de cultura. Mi nota personal es un 8/10 porque me recordo muchisimo a sherlock, y tiene esos giros argumentales que solo los orientales saben dar... lo cual es una mezcla retorcidamente buena.

review:
有趣、古怪的劇本，充滿魅力的角色。
有點過時的畫面，搭配風格準確的配樂。
本作有著第一眼就能抓住人的魔力。
實際上，從藝術欣賞的角度來看，的確也是一款怪奇的珍品。

各種系統上的錯誤和問題，帶來的是相當糟糕的遊戲體驗。

奇怪的是，瑕疵似乎也是這遊戲難以分割的構成要素。
僅推薦給就算活動安排很糟糕，仍願意不辭辛勞一睹演出的玩家。
