author: {'steamid': '76561197989290281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 5499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5499, 'last_played': 1504778005}
review:
https://youtu.be/l78s7bK9dpo

As you can see from my playtime, I certainly do like this game. However fair warning - this game has problems. BIG problems of a technical nature. It is prone to crashing, glitchhing and general prefromance issues. 

For some the fixes for these issues work, for others they don't. Some people can play without problem, others get hit with crash after crash. It's totally random as to what experience you will have.

And yes it is also true the combat is pretty average, and sometimes even dull. And yes there are some awful quicktime events thanks to its console heritage. Oh and the graphics were considered ugly even when it was released. Also the driving is bad, and gunplay bugged (use alt tab to get your crosshair working). 

So why do I like it?

Well apart from the obvious 'Twin peaks' homage, the game tries to do a lot, has a great story and good characters. The voice acting is top notch and the atmosphere is excellent. The map is large and nice to explore and the games pacing is great, with plenty of little side missions to achieve outside of the main story. 

 If you can live with the possible technical frustrations this is one of the best story driven games available IMHO.  Becuase of those issues I do recommend that you may want to wait for a sale unless your a major twin peaks fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068556208', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1504746238}
review:
Тот случай, когда написанное в обзоре будет противоречить оценке. 
Рекомендовать эту игру можно только за СЮЖЕТ. Он здесь потрясающий, интригующий, держит в напряжении и дает пищу для размышлений. Вспомнились не только сериал Twin Peaks, но и визуальная новелла Kara no Shoujo (по духу похоже). Возможно, авторам действительно стоило сделать DP визуальной новеллой, потому что играть в нее НЕВОЗМОЖНО. 
Если вы прошли все доп. квесты и собрали карточки, можете смело ставить себе памятник. В техническом плане тут все ужасно. 
Отстреливать врагов - НЕТ. Это неудобно и скучно, хорошо, что есть кнопка автоприцела. И вообще - 90% врагов можно пробежать. Что я и сделала.
Изучать окрестности - НЕТ. Машина ездит по дороге так, будто Йорк мертвецки пьян, а карта сделана совершенно не юзерфрендли. Сориентироваться по ней - задачка не легких, мало того что нельзя посмотреть полную карту, она еще и вертится вокруг своей оси! 
Расследовать убийство - НЕТ. Сбор улик происходит посредством беготни по альтернативному миру [strike] Сайлент-хилла [/strike], отстрелом врагов и унылыми побегушками нажми-вовремя-кнопку-а-то-тебя-зарубят. 
Любоваться видами - НЕТ. Графика вырвиглаз, а про автомобильные покатушки я уже написала. Настроек нет.
Плюс - у меня игра часто висла и вылетала, а на любые попытки исправить положение отказывалась запускаться совсем.
Так все же - почему я рекомендую эту игру? Как я написала выше - СЮЖЕТ здесь решает. Персонажи привлекательные, злодеи по-настоящему отвратительные редиски. Отдельное спасибо за 25 главу - думаю, я не одна, кто порадовался. =D А над концовкой возможно кто-то захочет всплакнуть. У меня вот глаза все еще пощипывает. 
Короче, если вы гордитесь своим терпением и хотите погрузиться в крутую и жуткую историю - поиграйте, если нет - найдите хорошее прохождение и посмотрите его. 
Все правильно сказала, Зак? =)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968851793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1473816854}
review:
To be clear I recommend playing this game, just not THIS version.  I give the dev kudos points for bringing it over to PC, but it's like they just dropped it here broken with no intent of ever fixing it.  There's unofficial patches out there and stuff for the memory but it all honesty it still doesn't really fix the game, it's STILL going to crash and there will STILL be some awkward controller issues.  Either find it on the 360 or th "better" version on the PS3.

Best thing about the game, and the reason you should play it, is the story.  It's really amazing... The town, the people, the main characters, even the murder scenes.  If you like quirky stories like Twin Peaks then you have to at least try this game.  Just know if you're more of a casual gamer don't even bother at all with this version because you'll need to go out of your way to get it to work.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972319820', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1665206386}
review:
You know those games that you see online and think that its so shitty that you need to try it just to see how bad it really is, but after you realize how bad it is, you want a refund? Deadly Premonition is kinda like those, but this time you DON'T want the refund. You want to want the refund, but you just can't do it. Its so bad that you need to play it more. It's like drugs. You know the risk, you try it anyways thinking "Ah, just once wont hurt anyone!" then next thing you know, you keep coming back for more. It is in very few ways a good game(like next to nothing about it is good), but you just gotta keep going. I mean, the game uses the dialog(paraphrasing): "My coffee warned me about this. When I poured the milk in, it said "Tomorrow something will happen that will change your life."". Who in their right mind would continue to play after that?! Thats what I thought as I continued to play. If you want my advice: Run away.

TL;DR: This is undoubtedly the best worst game in exsistance. If you only want good games, leave. However if you want bad games that are enjoyable to play in a strange way, get this.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999162473', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 142, 'playtime_forever': 841, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1699604591}
review:
Edit: As you can see based on the provided information, I had spent 14 hours playing Deadly Premonition and it worked perfectly fine when everyone else was complaining about it. I decided to revisit the game and whatever "updates" they applied to the game completely broke it. It no longer plays in full screen, their controller support doesn't exist and everything runs like shit. I am glad I still got my Switch version, which runs a million times better than this crap. 

This is really something special. Take a mix of B-Horror films, mix in a bit of comedy, creative writing, survival horror, life simulation, life management and open world and  you have  Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut.

You play as autastic FBI agent Morgan as he wanders around, makes weird comments and observations, while talking to his imaginary friend "Zack" (I assume that's the player). While exploring the town of Greenvale, you'll need to keep Morgan well fed, make sure he sleeps enough, makes it on time to his appointments and more. Things like having to shave, clean his clothes or buy new outfits adds just enough depth to make the game even more intresting. 

I have no problems with the controls. Others may be playing with a keyboard and mouse, but the game was clearly designed to be played with a controller, which I have been using myself. It's pretty much your run of the mill tank controls ala Resident Evil, with an auto-aim assist that comes in handy at times. 

I think my biggest complaint with the game so far is the driving segments. Driving in this game tends to be clunky at best and eventually because tedious and frustrating. Some sort of quick travel feature would have been *really* nice for this game. 

The game is clearly showing it's age, it doesn't look nearly as good as modern day games, but what do you expect for a port of a 7th generation console game?

On a side note, I guess lots of people are having issues with the performance of the game. Since I am all too aware of how problematic PC games can be when running on different hardware, I am not discounting other users' problems. But, I must be lucky, because this game installed and ran just fine without any major issues or difficulties. I am unsure if the poor reviews for this game are based around technical problems other users are having, but I simply don't see why it is being judged so poorly. 

In the end, this is a unique, quirky game that has done a fine job at entertaining me and making me laugh and that's all that matters. Play this game, it's a blast.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115648771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1502713999}
review:
[h1]Deadly Premonition: quel jeu ![/h1]
Plusieurs fois repoussé, on a ici un jeu qui a comme base le projet [b]Rainy Wood[/b], un hommage à la série [b]Twin Peaks[/b] et devait être disponible sur [b]PS2[/b].
Donc, on se tape un jeu [b]moche au textures et animations dégueulasses[/b] [i](128 bits power)[/i] surplombé par une édition Director's Cut [b]capricieuse[/b] aussi bien techniquement que graphiquement.
[h3]Pour résumer, le jeu exprime bien l'expression "Ne jamais se fier à la première apparence".[/h3]
Car des défauts, il en as: les éléments de gameplay atroces, les scènes ultra loufoques [i](made in Japan)[/i], les musiques ne collants aux scènes, phase en mode Resident Evil 4 du pauvre etc...
Puis on oublie tous ces détails, et on fini par apprécier cet ambiance et ce superbe scénario: ça y est, vous y êtes accro.

Certains de ces défauts deviendrons même à force des qualités: par exemple la B.O. qui deviendra plus que mémorable vers la fin.

Puis le final tombe avec une émotion des plus fortes ressenties dans un jeu-vidéo:
[i]Deadly Premonition, quel jeu ![/i]

review:
I have mixed feelings about this game. It has a very interesting story, though there are some plot twists I did not like at all. The open world is beautifully done. Some pieces of the soundtrack are gorgeous but other ones are just plainly annoying.

Technically it is a nightmare to play. It crashes a lot and I had to use the save files from another player in order to be able to finish it. Controls are difficult and buggy in some important fights.

Overall, it is a game worth playing, just be prepared to go through several moments of frustration. Back up your saves; pay attention to the recommendations at the forums in order to fix crashes.

Do not buy it at full price, seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198230772968', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1300, 'last_played': 1502812971}
review:
Как бы то не было, дуиаю стоит написать обзор по этой игре:
Не скажу что меня игра зацепила сразу же, но она зацепила где то после 30-минутного прохождения, а именно зацепил сюжет.
[h1]Минусы[/h1]
-Пожалуй минусы заглючаются больше всего в геймплее и в убийствах врагов, ибо порой бывают такие враги, которых хочешь верь, хочешь нет, убивать нудно, скучно, не интересно; впринципе я потом забил на то чтоб их убивать))) ну можно же пробежать мимо них)
-Я читал другие обзоры, и там говорят что есть баги, чтож, я их не обнаружил..
-Ненужный открытый мир: он там впринципе не нужный, порой приходится страдать фигней чтоб там скоротать время, благо есть гостинница и сараи где ты можешь поспать, и скоротать время)) 
-Оптимизация страдает..
-Мыльная графика...

Ну теперь перейдем к плюсам
[h1]Плюсы [/h1]
-Пожалуй самым большим плюсом является очень интересный и интригующий сюжет держит тебя в напряжении всю игру.
-Очень интересные персонажи. (тоже немало важный плюс)
-Достаточно огнестрельного оружия и орудий ближнего боя, не скажу чтовсего много, но есть (рубить интересней чем стрелять xD)
-Прикольне фичи типа, бриться, заправляться, и так далее (забыл еще какие есть xD)
-Диалоги классные, в плане каждый персонаж (из основных по крайней мере) можетподелиться с тобой о своем прошлом
-В нужные моменты саундтрек хорош, но чаще всего повторяется 

[h1]Итог[/h1]

В целом игра хорошая, хорошая не в плане геймплея, не в плане езды на машине, а в плане сюжета, в плане персонажей, игре можно проститьза кривой геймплей, за нудную стрельбу, потому что сюжет просто ....  [spoiler]ВОСХИТИТЕЛЕН[/spoiler]
 всю игру ты будешь думать кто же убийца, но все не так просто, правда Зак? [spoiler] (и да... я немного херово пишу обзоры xD) [/spoiler]

Моя оценка: 7 из 10 (берите эту игру только ради неординарного сюжета)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968783753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2541, 'last_played': 1461644851}
review:
Whole bunch of caveats -- 

First, this is a remarkably unstable / poor port - you will run into a lot of issues getting it to run at all (due to a variety of compatibility issues), and even past that getting it to be stable, sporting a memory leak that will cause crashes after every 1-2 hours of play (unless corrected through some settings).

There's also an aiming issue with controllers that makes aiming up and down beyond a certain range impossible (this gets in the way of playing in only a couple of spots, most notably in the coup-de-grace at the final boss).

All of that can be worked around (PC Gaming Wiki outlines all of the issues and workarounds in good detail: https://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut) but is not super acceptable.

Second, the game itself is not exactly _good_. It's extremely rough around the edges - combat is both annoying and boring, driving is a chore, the enviornments and characters don't look very good (even with some of the fixes/tweaks available), the world is way too spread out for its own good, the 'other world' (combat) sections are over-long for what they bring to the table. There are good quality of life upgrades you can unlock (the radio, infinite weapons, etc) that are a chore to unlock, espccially without a walkthrough, I could go on and on with complaints like that.

With all of that said... I love Deadly Premonition. If you can look past the (myriad) problems, you get bizarre and really endearing characters (especcially your player-character, Agent Francis York Morgan), a sense of style (borrowed VERY liberally from Twin Peaks), a compelling plot full of bonkers twists, charming and dumb cutscenes, and a very unique and interesting open world mechanics. 

If you're willing to put up with a lot to get at something really one-of-a-kind and weird, it's well worth it. 

(Probably easier to recommend the PS3/360 versions, as they avoid many of the technical issues present in the PC release -- although the 360 release lacks the control upgrades present here or in the PS3 versions).

review:
I’m not going to lie, graphics are bad, character movement is stiff and combat is just boring, however the story, the open world and how the many npcs interact with this world, with detailed daily routines that give them life, elevate this game above many others.

The port is bad but not unplayable, remember to install the dpfix and apply a 4gb patch on the executable, by doing this the game will run for about 3-4 hours before it crashes, at least that was my experience. Additionally if viewing ram and vram usage through rivaturner, you will be able to see when the memory leak is about to crash the game and save beforehand.

I recommend it because no matter what system u have available, its worth playing if story is important to you in games, this is a game that will stick with you, that’s why I’m here playing it yet again, 7 years after my 1st run on the xb360.

review: Deadly Premonition - an amazing game of contradiction. Behind the external squalor of the open game world, terrible graphics, clumsy animation and a heap of technical problems lies something amazing - an unusual surreal drama with a multilevel presentation of the plot. And like David Lynch's series, it's hard to judge the story from the usual criteria. The narrative skillfully combines an investigation into the entourage of the everyday world with survival in a nightmare reality. And although they are diluted by a lot of senseless and unnecessary actions, such a game on the contrasts, unusual and eccentric characters create their inexpressible charm with a touch of absurdity. Those who, despite all the difficulties, will look into Greenvale, they risk getting bogged down in the quagmire of intrigue to the very end. Behind the shroud of rain in this town there are many more secrets. Perhaps they are waiting for you. Just walk along the path of red seeds ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198097786166', 'num_games_owned': 1292, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3071, 'last_played': 1500911854}
review:
Наконец-то! – сказал я после полного прохождения [b]Deadly Premonition[/b] и мысленно добавил к 60-ти имеющимся достижениям ещё одно особое – за терпение. В техническом и геймплейном плане всё печально, тут тебе и частые вылеты и разрешение экрана без [b]Full HD[/b], вдобавок кривое прицеливание и много чего ещё. Но обо всём по порядку.

[h1][b]Маленькое вступление[/b][/h1]
Главный герой – специальный агент ФБР [b]Фрэнсис Йорк Морган[/b], агент он не простой, со своими причудами и жутким прошлым. Часто обращается к Заку *в голове*, который по словам Йорка является его другом с детства, однако отвечать и вести диалоги с Йорком он не будет (точнее самого Зака не слышно), например, как это было в [b]Prince of Persia: The Two Thrones[/b]. Иногда приходится выступать в роли этого самого Зака и дать ответ Йорку на его вопрос (в основном, это сюжетные развилки), выбрать один из двух вариантов или вовремя нажать кнопку действия. Что самое интересное, Йорк может заговорить с Заком в любое время, когда ему вздумается, казалось бы, его не засмущала бы даже стоящая рядом группа психиатров. Задумка интересная, хоть и не нова, тут обыграна по-своему хорошо. Этого причудливого агента отправляют на расследование убийства девушки в маленьком городке под названием [b]Гринвейл (Greenvale)[/b]. Название говорит само за себя (зеленая долина), всюду сплошь зелень и горы. В общем-то с этого и начинается история.

[h1][b]Коридорный свободный мир[/b][/h1]
Со стороны кажется, что DP коридорная, но это так лишь отчасти. Здесь имеется достаточно таки большой и не проработанный город по которому можно свободно перемещаться, и здания с коридорчиками (места преступления), в них движется сюжет, в то время как город играет роль декорации. Создателям стоило уменьшить его в размерах в пользу большей проработки деталей. На деле же: растянутые текстуры газона, лесные деревья [Ctrl+C – Ctrl+V] и просто-напросто пустой городок. Свободно путешествовать пешком или на транспорте можно сразу после эпилога, управление автомобилем тут не ахти, на большой скорости и поворотах машина запросто переворачивается, после чего останется надеяться как бы она не взорвалась, иначе штраф и восстановление с последнего сохранения. Ко всему прочему, в игре дают возможность быстрого перемещения с помощью рации в ранее посещенные места. Удобная штука, годится на случай, когда необходимо добраться в другой конец города, только выдается рация за квестовое задание.

[h1][b]Враги как медленно движущиеся мишени для стрельбы[/b][/h1]
Противники ничем особенным не выделяются и никакой угрозы не представляют, да и вызывают смех и недоумение. Вся игра состоит из мычащих болванчиков, которые медленно передвигаются в позе моста в сторону агента Йорка, пытаясь убить железной трубой, огнестрелом или более изощрёнными способами, например, по локоть засунуть руку в рот. Потом появляется баба, ползающая по потолку и стенам, настолько оригинальной показалось она разработчикам, что они решили впихнуть её через каждый шаг главного героя, благо лишь в одной главе. Есть и боссы, в игре они тоже для галочки и особой трудности в победе над ними не возникнет, разве что последний босс заставит насиловать вашу клавиатуру частыми нажатиями одних и тех же кнопок. Единственным значимым разнообразием будет убийца в красном дождевике, с ним и в прятки можно поиграть и в [b]«догони меня топор»[/b].

[h1][b]Видимо за основной сюжет и квесты отвечали разные люди[/b][/h1]
Половина квестовых заданий можно вырезать и игра от этого абсолютно ничего не потеряет. Нет никаких сомнений в том, что если не возить пять раз бабушку с остывающей кастрюлей до дома на безумной скорости или трижды убираться на складе продуктового магазина за спасибо, игра станет от этого хуже. Подобных заданий уйма, и, кому как, а мне они нисколько не понравились, только отвлекали от сюжетной линии. Выполнять их, конечно же, никто не заставляет и на сюжет они никак не влияют, но лучше бы их не было, правда.

[h1][b]Гениальные идеи и прочие радости[/b][/h1]
Помимо квестов, здесь ещё много другого мусорного контента. Разработчикам не удалось выдержать золотой середины, взять все идеи, решить, что будет к месту, а что лучше выпилить. В итоге пичкали всё самое "лучшее", дабы игроки не скучали и потерялись в игре на незабываемые 50 часов к ряду. Именно потерялись, долго придется разбираться куда ехать, как доехать, потом ещё квесты на главы поделены, их можно переиграть, но нельзя сохраняться. Одним словом – боль. И кто же так делает, когда игра на каждом повороте вылеты выдает. Куда интереснее были бы квесты о тайнах города, второстепенные расследования (квесты на покупные карты почти близки к этому) и прочее. Необходимость кушать, спать и частенько менять костюм, дабы вокруг агента не летала стая мух, тоже не лучшая идея. Все это есть в жизни, зачем это в игре, выглядит как какая-то неудачная попытка сделать из игры симулятор агента, по факту же пустая трата времени.

[h1][b]Саундтрек[/b][/h1]
Японцы в написании саундтрека очень хороши, всегда какая-нибудь да композиция врежется в память и будет стоять на повторе в плеере долгое время. Лично выделю три композиции: [b]Greenvale[/b], [b]York and Zach[/b] и [b]The Woods and the Goddess[/b], остальные просто дополняют процесс игры в зависимости от ситуации, но получается это не всегда. Проблема в том, что кому-то в голову пришла интересная идея вставлять радостную музыку в моменты, где по идее должна звучать грустная и в то же время напряженная композиция. В неожиданные (типа страшные) моменты звучит эффект саспенса, такой очень часто в комедии и смешные видео добавляют, из-за этого серьезно относится к ситуации просто нереально, атмосфера сразу смывается в унитаз.


[b]Deadly Premonition[/b] – это хорошая история, именно история, потому что как игру в техническом плане её абсолютно не за что похвалить. Она совершенно точно придется по душе тем, у кого на первом плане сюжетная составляющая, нежели геймплейная, просто выпустили её не в своё время и в придачу с ворохом проблем. Прежде чем начать, советую ознакомиться с руководствами по игре, на первом месте увидите не гайд по достижениям, а как решить кучу проблем, которые разработчики оставили игрокам. Из личного опыта: чтобы полностью пройти мне приходилось часто менять совместимость игры и её лаунчера на [b]Windows XP[/b], затем на [b]Windows 95[/b] для свободного прицеливания, потому что на операционках выше 95 работает только автоприцеливание, на 95 ужасно долгие загрузки и более частые вылеты. Вот так вот приходилось прыгать с одной совместимости на другую, отключать оверлей Стима и ставить оконный режим в разрешении 800×600, вылетать, перезаходить снова и снова. Стоит ли ради сюжетки играть в такую криво собранную игру (или её порт), без каких-либо интересных геймплейных фишек, даже пропуская утомительно-бредовые квестовые задания, решать вам. Также могу сказать точно, что стиль подачи и общая атмсофера DP понравится не каждому, поэтому, прежде чем врываться в этот безумный мир настоятельно рекомендую подумать несколько раз. Тут была бы уместна нейтральная [b](серая)[/b] рецензия, но так как в Стиме такого нет, остается лишь палец вверх за сценарий, на который, по всей видимости ушли все силы и бюджет.

[i]Порой мы не должны играть в те игры, которых вообще не должно существовать. Даже если ради этого придётся потерять отличную историю (с).[/i]

review: Such beautifully weird game: it's like if Ed Wood became a one-man indie game studio. This port is, no exaggeration on my part, the WORST running game I've EVER played. EVER. I haven't had this much difficulty running PC games from 20+ years ago. If you have an Xbox 360, get that version. The Director's Cut makes the combat easier (and it sucks, so that's honestly a good thing) but it's not worth the headache. I installed every fix I could find and still I fought this game for probably half my playtime. Up until the final boss I was screwing around with compatibility settings and .ini files. But the game itself is so good! Get it on 360 if you have one, if not maybe check out a plathrough on YouTube. If you can't stand Let's Plays then buy it here, but expect resistance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037986885', 'num_games_owned': 950, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2371, 'last_played': 1503050470}
review:
[b]За невзрачной оберткой скрывается находка.[/b] 
Дайте Deadly Premonition шанс и получите настоящий атмосфернейший детектив, прокачанный до верха гиковскими отсылками, и расследование с участием запоминающихся персонажей. Не высосанный из пальца сценарий берущий основу в клише. Интрига обрастает деталями в длину и ширину набирая оборот. За образец взят Твин Пикс, порой сюжет не поддается логике. Череда событий тончайшими штрихами игрового пространства и его обитателей будоражат сознание. В конце-концов, сейчас чер-товски приятно ощутить щепетильную "японскую консольность", когда в большинстве новых игр отсутствует духовное наполнение игровой реальности.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1108627506
 [b]Гляньте-ка статистику.[/b] 
Многие, ссылаясь на косяки, плюются, оставляя негативные отзывы лишь поэтому. Здесь кроется причина неоднозначности мнений при оценке игры. Забейте на мелкие недостатки, двигайтесь по сюжету! Чем дальше, тем увлекательнее, детальнее раскрываются персонажи и их истории. У меня, к слову, неполадок-то было... 20 вылетов и штук 10 багов. За всё, на секундочку, 40-ка часовое прохождение. 
Трудности критичны не все, вопреки тому, что говорят! Управление корявое? Не заметил. Где это, здесь-то? Недостатки есть, но на них в DP [u]глупо[/u] заострять внимание. Музыкальный фон раздражает? Палитра тускловата? Выглядит простовато? А достоинства! Их не в пример больше, нежели во многих иных играх, которыми нас кормят все чаще и обильнее подсвечивая зрелищные ракурсы. Потрясающая проработка окружения, героев, обилие интерактивных возможностей, атмосферность, увлекательные ситуации и тонкий изящный юмор.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034766576', 'num_games_owned': 1714, 'num_reviews': 723, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1501091509}
review:
Very mediocre game.
Pros:
Plot
Lots of interactivity
Music
Lots of content

Cons:
Ugly graphics
Zero car physics (with the longest drive scenes ever)
Worst QTEs I've ever seen
Awful voice overacting
Tedious gameplay
Plot is very-very slow
Bad animations, even basic animations

I can't really recommend this game. It feels like Twin Peaks mixed with Silent Hill, but it plays really bad. Face expressions with bad voice acting transform this game into some kind of mockery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130753090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 959, 'last_played': 1490803389}
review:
I really tried. Really. But this game just didn't click for me, despite my love of Twin Peaks, kitsch, camp, and the weird and transgressive in general. 

That said...(VERY MINOR SPOILERS)

...the opening scene had a joke that made me laugh til I cried. It's about Tom and Jerry. Just totally blind-sided me, and it made pefect sense. Dark, twisted, perfect sense.

Sadly that sense of humor seemed to be spread pretty thin going forward, which left the gameplay itself, ranging from terrible to I-wish-we-were-back-at-the-terrible-part-now. 

I may try to finish the story via a youtube let's play at some point, because it did have some intrigue to it -- but as a game this isn't "so bad it's good"...it's just, well, bad.

Score: 5/10 (would be 3 or so, but that joke counts for something)

review:
Extremamente inspirado em Twin Peaks, o jogo não consegue equilibrar muito bem as partes de gameplay que envolvem o subconsciente do personagem principal e o mundo real, chegando a ser um pouco cansativo. Tem uma história interessante, mas é muito mal distribuído na questão de gameplay.
Cerca de 70% do jogo é apenas cutscenes, quando não tem cutscene acontecendo, você está dirigindo ou lutando com os monstros do seu subconsciente, deixando o jogo repetitivo. Não posso deixar de falar da trilha sonora extremamente repetitiva e que não se encaixa muito bem com o que está acontecendo em boa parte das cenas.
Embora seja repetitivo, é muito bom na questão do roteiro.
Se você joga fazendo graça do jogo, é um jogo maravilhoso.

The game was originally supposed to be released on the PlayStation 2 and Xbox 
and even had a trailer, when it was originally called "Rainy Woods", released 
in 2007. But the similarities to "Twin Peaks" was so strong that Access Games 
was forced to change a lot of things which caused a considerable delay and 
even came close to cancelation. 
 
However, the limited budget wouldn't allow them to upgrade everything to the 
level they needed to be for release on the next generation consoles which 
resulted in the many technical flaws the game has. 
 
So the game designer, Hidetaka Suehiro (aka SWERY), decided to focus on the 
story, characters, and the game world which is where the game shines. Many 
game critics have praised the game for its unique world and the characters 
that inhabit it.

review: Deadly Premonition это такой продукт в котором намешено практически все, хотите Гта вот вам езда по городу и открытый мир, любите убивать зомби как в resident evil пожалуйста, головоломки да легко, любите игры только из-за сюжета, тогда вам сюда. Это игра вызывает как и плохие эмоции, так и хорошие, потому что плюсы игры изо всех сил пытаются закрыть её минусы, а их там к сожалению хватает: Плохое портатирование из-за чего игра постоянно вылетает, и приходится часто сохраняться, графика совсем не радует глаз, управление как и прицеливание, так и управления автомобилем. Но всё же она зацепила меня своим сюжетом, и осилев все баги я прошёл ее, поэтому если вы собираетесь проходить Deadly Premonition, обязательно запастись нервами ибо нервничать придется. 8 кружек кофе из 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080924808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1499874996}
review:
'Deadly Premonition' is one of my favourite games, and my first playthrough of it on the Xbox 360 remains one of the greatest gaming experiences of my life. Unfortunately, and as many other reviewers on Steam have pointed out, this port really ruins it. I've installed a recommended fix and followed several guides on how to increase its playability, but these solutions have only been temporary and simply postponed the crashes. 
If you own a console, buy an older version of the game. If you don't, watch a let's-play. This game has a great story, very memorable characters and a unique atmosphere, and I think it would be a shame for any interested gamer to disregard the whole experience due to a third-rate port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003146259', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 2365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2193, 'last_played': 1523551413}
review:
Why does this have a "mixed" rating? It's a masterpiece, does no one realise? This is without a doubt the most underrated game on Steam. Even try Googling reviews or look at the Metacritic page and it's all glowing praise, not sure why Steam users have thrown this timeless classic under the bus. Especially ridiculous since this treasure is often on sale for $5 or even $2. Best couple bucks you'll even spend in your life.
As for the silly complaints about bugs: these issues are easily fixed with the DPfix mod which takes around 15 seconds to download and install. There are other simple adjustments (disabling Steam overlay and cloud saves, running in compatibility and admin mode) which will make it run flawlessly and beautifully in high res.
It's basically a camp, surreal version of Silent Hill 2, except dipped in Twin Peaks references. It's weird and it's good, and there's nothing else out there like it. It's a bit like an art film in video game form and it's rare to see such a wacky premise given the AAA treatment. What's not to love?

author: {'steamid': '76561198105210574', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1125, 'last_played': 1506650306}
review:
I'd love to give this game a good review, but in good conscience I can't. I played this game a few years ago on the xbox 360 and loved it, so I was thrilled to find it on the PC when I switched over to PC gaming. This game, however, is plagued with bugs. Occasionally, the game will crash when playing the opening cutscene. Severe, unhandled crashes can also happen during loading screens. Some very specific events can also trigger crashes (don't go outside at 14:00 during mission 6). Finally, there appears to be a memory leak, as my FPS would slowly drop while I play. The game does not handle high FPS well either, as button prompts will flash and the menu may freeze at a high FPS. Finally, if you play with a controller, the game cannot handle two triggers being pressed at the same time. That means shooting cannot be mapped to LT and RT. And after getting through all these bugs, the truth is the game is just average overall. If you're brave enough to consider buying this game despite these problems, here's some of the pros and cons:

Pros:
+Quirky, memorable dialog
+Unique characters
+Huge variety of side missions, most with a unique reward
+Surprising attention to detail -- grow beard in real time, people treat you badly if you wear old clothes, side missions depend on weather patterns, etc.
+A decent mystery
+A sort of surrealist style
+Fun music (though it sometimes plays at strange times)

Cons:
-A horror game that isn't scary (outside of the constant fear of a crash)
-Terrible driving controls (and you have to drive a lot)
-Combat consists of just putting the cursor at head level and racking up headshots. Imagine playing RE4 except all the enemies come at you one at a time, they're much slower and dumber, and there's barely any enemy variety.
-Pretty bad graphics. I don't mean bad as in outdated, I mean it looks like the 3d modelers and texture artists were still learning their job while making the game.
-The animations are bad, and basically just cycle between neutral, laughing, and scared. The only exceptions are during cutscenes when generic animations simply wouldn't work.
-You can get infinite ammo weapons way too early, which basically makes the entire game way too easy.

To summarize, imagine if you had a book, but someone has defecated between all the pages. The story of this book is pretty good, but you have to get through a lot of nasty s**t to get to it. That book is Deadly Premonition. Now, if you don't like s**t, you'd probably be better off watching a YouTube video of somebody with a higher tolerance to s**t go through it.
9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198048903887', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 4358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4358, 'last_played': 1496052108}
review:
Deadly premonition es un juego de aventura tipo sandbox con elementos de survival horror; encarnaremos al agente especial del FBI Francis York Morgan mientras realiza la investigacion de una serie de asesinatos en el misterioso pueblo de Greenvale.

Sin duda la particular historia y narrativa de éste juego es la principal atraccion para jugarlo, los personajes son divertidos e interesantes, los monologos del agente con su personalidad alternativa "Zach" le dan un toque de surrealismo a la forma de interactuar con los otros personajes e incluso el jugador; el humor del juego va desde lo cómico pasando por el drama y culminando en horror; el gameplay cumple muy escuetamente, el aspecto grafico claramente pudo ser mejor. 

El juego mantiene un buen balance de mecanicas y sidequests para mantenerte entretenido, al ser de mapa abierto se pueden ir pasando las misiones de la historia al ritmo que se quiera.

Claramente es un titulo para los que les gustan los juegos "raros" ya que es una amalgama de muchos elementos mas o menos bien ensamblada, aderezado con un monton de referencias a la cultura pop y una historia genuinamente interesante; curiosamente inspirada en la magistral serie de television de los 80's "Twin Peaks" creada por el célebre David Lynch.

Es conveniente advertir que se necesita tiempo y paciencia para lidiar con los problemas tecnicos que tiene ésta version del juego, aún con éstos problemas te lo recomiendo ampliamente; es uno de esos titulos que reafirmó mi idea de que los juegos son una forma de arte. 

Si tienes la posibilidad de jugarlo en consola lo recomendaría, aún aplicando parches de la comunidad tuve que lidiar con varios crasheos de la aplicacion.

review:
Suicidio:
El suicidio (del latín moderno: suicidium)a es el acto por el que una persona de forma deliberada se provoca la muerte. Por lo general es consecuencia de desesperación, derivada o atribuible a una enfermedad física, enfermedad mental, como la depresión, el trastorno bipolar, la esquizofrenia, el trastorno límite de la personalidad, el alcoholismo o abuso de sustancias. A menudo influyen en él diversos factores estresantes como dificultades financieras o problemas en las relaciones interpersonales. Entre las medidas empleadas para prevenirlo se encuentran: limitar el acceso a los métodos, como armas de fuego y venenos, el tratamiento de la enfermedad mental subyacente o del abuso de sustancias y la mejora de las condiciones financieras. Aunque son comunes las líneas de crisis, hay poca evidencia sobre su efectividad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165250273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1581427967}
review:
Para mi es uno de los mejores juegos de la historia, a quien le guste Twin Peaks no dudaría en recomendárselo 100% debido a que bebe mucho de la obra de Lynch.
El juego técnicamente es mejor que las versiones de consolas, obviamente, pero tiene un problema y es que crashea de manera aleatoria. Sacaron un programa que se llama DPfix y supuestamente evitaba que ocurriese. Lo estuve intentando mil y una veces pero sin éxito, crasheaba de manera aleatoria con lo cual podía fastidiarte toda la partida si no habías guardado. 
Desconozco si a día de hoy lo han arreglado, quizá si ya no crashea es el momento de sacarse el 100% también en PC.
Quizá algo que eche de menos es la posibilidad de jugar en modo tanque, como ocurría en la versión de xbox 360, ya que era muy al estilo resident evil 4 y personalmente me gusta mucho ese estilo de juego.
Almenos esta es la versión director's cut que tiene varias mejoras, entre ellas el manejo de los coches, que sigue siendo paupérrimo, pero se maneja bastante mejor que en la versión inicial.

Aunque técnicamente no te guste, si te gusta twin peaks o alan wake, te lo recomiendo al 1000%, con un amigo fui extremadamente pesado ya que a él le encantaba alan wake pero no le llamaba este juego, y siempre que hablamos del tema me dice: "Menos mal que te hice caso, menuda joya de juego".

author: {'steamid': '76561198044409171', 'num_games_owned': 318, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1683, 'last_played': 1498913212}
review:
I liked this game up until the point when York said, with full and unyielding conviction in his voice, that Forrest Gump was a good movie.

(nah but in seriousness, this is probably one of the more interesting and unique games I've played in a while. It sports plenty of bizarre and memorable characters, and the last hour or so makes up probably one of the best endings I've seen in a video game in years.

My biggest issue with the game, though, is that I feel like it's ultimately too derivative of the media it takes influence of. The obvious one is Twin Peaks, and I actually wanna talk about that for a moment. I'm not a particularly big fan of Twin Peaks, but one of my favorite things about it is how Lynch manages to spin a uniquely nuanced style of surrealism that can create some truly artful and memorable moments (the deer head scene in the pilot is one of the most inexplicably hilarious gags I've ever seen in a television show).

As much influence as Deadly Premonition takes from Twin Peaks, it rarely ever manages to strike the same level of creativity that Twin Peaks has. There's a few good parts, especially towards the end, but the game tends to rely too much on "weird/awkward for the sake of being weird/awkward"-type comedy and overt references to other media (the "pot lady"? really?), without innovating much beyond that.

If I had to give this game a numerical rating, I'd probably give it something like a 7/10. It's a shame that my feelings toward it are somewhat lukewarm compared to others, but I still have a lot of respect for it. It's clearly got a lot of heart, and the fact that something like this was even managed to be developed to fruition (and, even further, released to positive reception) really gives me a lot of hope for the future of video games.)

review:
Hello,

For those looking for an interesting game, this could potentially appeal to you.

While I personally enjoyed what I could get through so far, the amount of glitch and bugs that I have come accross makes playing the game not very enjoyable.

For instance;
- Game crash at startup (Fixed by re-installing some Nvidea setting that are located in the game installation folder)
- Sound glitch while driving (Only way to fix it was to use some old speakers as my current headset made the car sound glitch)
- Frequent freezes during cutscenes (When it happened, the only way I could go through them was to hit "ESC", but then I would also miss all the content
- Random game crashes

While I believe that it might be not be the best game out there, I did enjoy the story so far, but unfortunately, with all the bugs I have personally met, I would not recommend the game to anyone for this reason. 

Thank you for reading!

Refunded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028805305', 'num_games_owned': 983, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 2455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2455, 'last_played': 1498723656}
review:
Взять 80% Twin Peaks, добавить 15% Shenmue и 5% Resident Evil. Тщательно взболтать безумными японскими руками и поставить вариться на очень медленном огне, чтобы игра выглядела как пришелец из эры PS2. Получается Deadly Premonition, где Агент Френсис "Йорк" Морган со своим воображаемым другом Заком расследуют убийство девушки в тихом (на первый взгляд) провинциальном городке Гринвейл.

DP даже по японским меркам довольно странная штука, сочетающая в себе детективный триллер (с элементами фарса) и открытый мир. 

Начну сразу с плохого: в игре ужасное управление, паршивая графика, посредственный геймплей и надоедающее со временем музыкальное оформление (треков очень мало, и они очень часто повторяются, пусть сами по себе и красивые).

Что же хорошего? Прежде всего, необычный сюжет и персонажи. И еще мир. Он действительно кажется живым, пусть и схематичным, да и приставка “открытый” не кажется надуманной. У персонажей есть свое расписание дня. Продавцы в магазинах днем проводят за прилавком, а вечером садятся в машину и едут к себе домой. Владельцы баров отдыхают днем, а вечером открывают свои заведения

Почти у каждого встречного есть для Йорка какое-либо задание, выполнив которые мы получим деньги, полезный предмет и заодно узнаем о городе и его населении чуть больше. Сами жители Гринвейла неплохо проработаны, у многих есть определенный бэкграунд и интересные истории для нас. В наличии даже безумная старушка, разговаривающая с кастрюлей (явная отсылка к Log Lady).

Для расследования убийств нам придется сражаться с потусторонними силами, будучи запертыми в локациях, где по сюжету ищем улики для раскрытия дела. Экшен часть тут откровенно корявая, и если бы ее сократили в 2-3 раза - было бы только лучше. А QTE сцены и вовсе стоило убрать. Вообще, в игре довольно много странных фич. Например, если не бриться, то у героя растет потихоньку борода, если не менять пару дней одежду - вокруг начинают летать мухи) 

Даже с установкой всех фиксов игра любит вывалиться с ошибкой после какой-нибудь кат-сцены. Или вдруг сохранение может испортиться...  Хорошо, что все это лечится установкой исполняемому файлу (DP.exe) совместимости с Windows98\Me, а то я бы ее забросил. Ну и surround sound тут сломанный, приходится каждый раз переключать колонки на 2.0, иначе езда на машине превращается в ад для ушей.

Итог: если вы готовы ухаживать за игрой как за маленьким ребенком, леча все ее детские болячки и закрывать глаза на бюджетность, плохую графику и корявый геймплей, то могу сдержанно порекомендовать Deadly Premonition. Другой игры, которая так своеобразно сочетает несочетаемое, нет, и не факт что будет.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000896253', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 1997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1997, 'last_played': 1498847886}
review:
I'm really divided on this game. Deadly Premonition stars you as an FBI agent investigating a murder in a countryside town. It is intriguing, cheesy and witty all at the same time. An amusing storyline that is quite easy to get into, and is certainly worth playing through.

However, there are so many things wrong with the game; Technical issues are paramount. Enemy hitboxes don't seem to align very well, making combat sluggish. Aiming with weapons is slow and clunky, driving is tedious, with NPCs driving about 15mph even on main roads! 

But the main problem with the game, is even with fanpatches, it just simply isn't stable enough. The game crashes relentlessly, sometimes because it screws up loading an area, sometimes because it decides cutscenes are too much hassle, other times because it just doesn't want to work anymore.

You need to save religiously just to get through the story alone. I've clocked 25ish hours on Steam, however my in-game save file is a mere 11hours at time of writing. That's 14 hours of progress lost from crashes, requiring me to re-load a save and go through it again.

Worth it? Absolutely not. Not even on sale. You need to be a die hard for cheesy detective stories to even bother with this, and I admit, it is a fun and cute story, but you need to put in a hell of a lot of work just to get through it, and for most people, that simply isn't worthwhile.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7956, 'last_played': 1589575660}
review:
I have over 140 hours on this game. I've unlocked all 60 achievements. But I can't recommend this game, no. Deadly Premonition is an amazing experience, chock full of memorable characters and a very enjoyable story but Rising Star Games took no part in the original release other than publishing it in Europe and paying them for this release (rewarding them for creating the Director's Cut) is wrong.
the Director's Cut is a massive downgrade from the original 360 release back in 2010. Rising Star Games (the publisher) decided to hire a contractor (TOYBOX Inc.) rather than get the original developers to create the Director's Cut. Not only did they massively downgrade the visuals from the original 2010 release (many missing effects, color grading completely removed [resulting in some of the ugliest visuals I've seen in any game ever]) but they also added a massive amount of bugs and crashes (memory leaks, unavoidable crashes that always happen in particular sections and much more).
Oh, and if you think the PS3 version is much better, trust me, it's not. While the game crashes less often and isn't quite as buggy as the PC release it rarely runs faster than 20FPS and often drops below that.

In the end, if you really want to play Deadly Premonition you might be able to get past all the crashes in this version and finish the game. But fuck Rising Star Games for taking such a wonderfully unique game and shitting not only all over it but all over its fans as well. Fuck Rising Star Games for ruining Deadly Premonition to such a degree that new players will abandon it after the first 30 minutes after experiencing multiple game crashes or never even try it in the first place because RSG has created such a terrible reputation for the game. If you see the name "Rising Star Games" anywhere, don't buy what they're selling. They don't care about the consumer, they don't care about anything other than getting the most profit out of the least investment. I can only hope someday that someone wrestles the rights out of RSG's grubby little mitts and creates an actual port of Deadly Premonition. But until then, the only way you can experience Deadly Premonition is by dragging out a 12 year old console or playing through the massively inferior version by Rising Star Games and TOYBOX Inc. Here's hoping that 360 emulation happens someday so that this classic isn't lost in the shadow of Rising Star Games shittiness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083246187', 'num_games_owned': 750, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 2630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2630, 'last_played': 1499539804}
review:
Concerning the crashing.

Bugs are one thing, but crashes are an entirely more disgusting beast. The game routinely crashes anywhere from 20-40 minutes of play, which means that in my 20 hours so far it has crashed upwards of 40 times. It can crash at any point completely randomly, so you cannot mitigate this in any way.

Crucially, the game will not let you save during chapter replays, which are needed to complete several side quests, so you will undoubtedly have to redo large sections of the game many, many times to progress.

The DPFix mod you can download online cleans up the graphics and seems to reduce the amount of crashes, but does not completely eliminate them.

Add to this a known game-breaking bug concerning item disappearances that forces you to restart the entire game from the beginning, a wealth of technical issues, long loading times, and poor PC optimization means you should stay far away from this port.

I will say this though: if you aren't much of a completionist and just wish to experience the main story, you can save regularly throughout the campaign and mostly ignore the open world, which will mean that the crashes will affect you a bit less. Having said that, some of the most useful items in the game (including the entire fast travel system) are unlocked through side quests, so they are pretty essential for anyone not wanting to spend too much time wrestling with the game's atrocious driving physics. I would suggest using a guide to seek these few items out early on in the campaign and then ignoring the rest of the filler material. (The side quests are mostly awful anyway: incidental to the plot, hard to find without a guide, and requiring lots of wasted time manipulating the game's time passage and weather mechanics to make certain NPCs appear.)

If you have a PS3, I would still recommend checking the game out on a more stable platform. Or hell, just watch a cutscene compilation online and save yourself the hassle of actually playing the damn thing. It would be disingenuous to call this a "good" game, but no one is expecting that at this point. We all know it's a quirky B-game that is borderline unplayable. My standards aren't high, and I'm willing to forgive how bad the foundation is because the world, story, and characters are pretty interesting.

But the game needs to run. This port, unfortunately, is in a completely unacceptable state and should frankly be pulled from the Steam store.

But as we all know, Steam Quality Control isn't a thing that exists.



*******************************************************************************************************
ADDENDUM: Concerning the story.

Usually when I neg a game, my review gets negged in turn, so thank you for all of the positive feedback.

When I wrote my initial review, it was strictly to call out the technical issues. However, if any of you are still on the fence because you feel like you still may get a decent story experience despite the technical apocalypse, I thought I would write a quick spoiler-free addendum about the plot and give you further reason to avoid the game. This is at the risk of contradicting my earlier statement that the story is interesting, but what we have here is an example of a well-written journey with a flat payoff.

There are many examples in modern fiction where the plot twists can be unpredictable because they are poorly crafted. Deadly Premonition is one such example. You are very unlikely to construct the game's full plot in your mind before the final act's sequence of revelations lays it bare, but this doesn't mean that the game was smarter than you.

Whodunnits are tough to write, since any astute gamer will have processed every character at least once as a potential suspect, and thus actual surprise needs to be very clever. The way this game deflects suspicion is by essentially creating two different culprits: the one you interact with, and the true self.

This is immediately apparent in the voice acting: the pre- and post-twist voices are delivered completely differently, as if the actor had been hired for two separate games. This is problematic because deranged sociopaths and serial killers will usually exhibit some form of their identity when interacting with other people, but Deadly Premonition is straight out of the 90s Scream-style horror playbook - you cannot begin to suspect anybody because the liars so perfectly masquerade as normal people.

Although most characterization is shallow, there is still some really good writing here...for a video game. But dialogue and plot are two different things, and it's in the plot where the game flounders.

It's frustrating because there is no cathartic wide-eyed moment where you realize you've been hoodwinked by clever plot construction. Instead, it's as if characters you scratched off your suspect list long ago suddenly become different people, and the resulting reaction is something along the lines of, "Oh, I guess this person is a bad guy now." In fact, you may wind up crafting more elaborate theories about what's going on due to the sheer amount of mysteries involved, whereas the truth is much less exciting.

It doesn't help that the plot winds up having holes you could fly a 747 through. There are several discrepancies between the evidence you collect and the end result, and many of the clues remain unexplained at the end. Furthermore, there are many tenuous backstory elements that just don't make any sense - unrelated characters portrayed together in scenes without any context to explain their proximity, and a macguffin that serves two discrepant functions.

Psychological thrillers are at their best when examining the characters' mindstates and developing them as complex individuals. Deadly Premonition's one saving grace is that your player character is very interesting, almost to the point where he is able to carry the entire game and lift it from the dregs of pulp fiction. The game's final act incorporates his own backstory and psyche into the plot in an organic way, and it's safe to say that the moments where we are exploring him are where the storytelling is at its best. Unfortunately, it's not enough to hang a 20-40 hour bad game on (depending on the number of side quests and crashes you experience, of course), and the supporting cast of characters do nothing to deepen the plot's complexity. It's a shame - had every character been as well developed as the lead, we might have had something truly special here.

I feel like I could only recommend a playthrough to those who study games as an artform, rather than those seeking to be entertained (i.e. most of us). And even then, I would strongly encourage those few to seek out the PS3 version and avoid the incessant crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995598550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2332, 'last_played': 1511555483}
review:
It's pretty good. Deadly Premonition is one hell of a ride. 

The gameplay is a little generic and clunky. It isn't as much of a problem as the technical issues, a lot of which are alleviated by using DPfix and patching the executable. There are still crashes but none that are insurmountable. Save often. Change your audio to stereo.

If you decide to play this game, I recommend you try to avoid spoilers. The story is the best part of the game. Everybody memes the game as being "TWIN PEAKS THE GAME" and while it definitely is inspired by the show, I believe the game stands on it's own merits.

What follows are a few tips to save you some frustration. There is no hard time limit to do the main missions, you can ignore them and just come back the next day. Try to do side missions 4 and 5 as soon as possible to get [spoiler]fast travel[/spoiler]. All the shops are closed when it rains but that makes it easier to visit characters at their houses. Emily and George are at their houses on rainy evenings ~18:00. Do the side missions, they net you useful rewards.

Come at this game with patience and an open mind - you won't be sorry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018219755', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1496708790}
review:
Positivo:
A história do jogo é interessante e intrigante; tem um mapa grande para ser explorado; side-quests; mundo aberto; tem detalhes realistas como combustível, fome, sono e uso do horário para ativar as quests; imersivo; o jogo e os personagens tem o charme do estilo japonês (humor, sistema de pontuação, estilo de terror, expressões corporais, etc).

Negativo:
O principal motivo para eu não recomendar a compra desse jogo é porque todos os pontos positivos do jogo não podem ser aproveitados em sua integridade por causa dos constantes travamentos somados com o sistema de save limitado, você só pode salvar em pontos específicos do jogo, então se o jogo travar (muito provavelmente vai, como ocorreu comigo e outros vários consumidores, mesmo após a aplicação de patchs não oficiais) você perde todo o seu progresso a partir do seu último ponto de salvamento.

Também tem outros pontos negativos, que eu relevaria completamente para poder continuar a jogar, que são típicos dos jogos japoneses dessa época, são detalhes que desaceleram o ritmo e atrapalham a qualidade de vida do jogador, vou citar só um: Quando você executa uma ação o jogo você perde o controle do personagem e tem que assistir uma animação específica para aquela situação (ex: abrir uma porta), isso é especialmente cansativo em relação a obtenção de itens, pois quando você pega um item você vai para uma tela preta mostrando o item por uns 4 segundos, pode parecer pouco, mas imagine ter que pegar 10 itens no chão ou ter que comprar o limite de pirulitos (20)...

Resumindo, espero que no futuro eu tenha a sorte ou paciência (para os travamentos) de jogar esse jogo até o final, eu realmente tenho vontade de jogar ele, porém do jeito que está eu fico mais tenso pensando na distância para o próximo save do que na história.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998597225', 'num_games_owned': 1985, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 4519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4473, 'last_played': 1561558353}
review:
Специальный агент Френсис Йорк Морган был отправлен на особое задание в небольшой городок Гринвейл, для расследования загадочного убийства молодой девушки по имени Анна. В жертве он находит загадочные красные семена и узнаёт от жителей легенду о  убийце в дождевике, который совершал преступления в дождливую погоду, из-за чего жители городка боятся выходить в дождь на улицу. Эти тайны ему необходимо разгадать, чтобы раскрыть преступление.
Сюжет у игры довольно хорош и качественный. Это самая сильная составляющая игры.
В нём есть непредсказуемость, некие недоговорённости, и даже неожиданные повороты.
Дважды пройдя игру, я не нашёл в сюжете ни одного косяка. А я старался ! 
Диалоги персонажей тоже проработаны на отлично, юмора столько - хоть отбавляй.
Ключевые персонажи в игре живут своей жизнью: ходят на работу, копаються в саду, посещают кафешки, вечером отправляються по домам, а некоторые в ночной клуб.
Причём тут не как в GTA, как только персонаж уходит с поля зрения, он исчезает. Тут они реально занимаются своими делами и их можно отследить по карте, что привносит в игру некую иллюзию жизни. Однако это немного мешает выполнять побочные задания, так как один даёт задание только в дождливую погоду, второй только тогда, когда находится дома и т.д. Но я порекомендовал бы читателю, для полного погружения в игру, да и вообще, чтобы лучше познакомиться с персонажами и заодно посмеяться над диалогами, не отлынивать от их выполнения. Так от прохождения игры вы получите гораздо больше ощущений.

По прибытию в  Гринвейл игроку предоставляется некая свобода.  Можно не спешить выполнять задания, а заняться исследованием города. Если не придти на задание в указанное время, то ничего за это не будет. Можно придти хоть на следующий день, хоть через неделю.
Графика в игре приемлимая, и если ещё в помещениях полно всяких деталей на которые можно посмотреть, то на улице всё гораздо хуже.
Стрельба сделана паршиво, но к ней ещё можно привыкнуть в отличии от физики вождения автомобиля. Какую машину не возьми, то она разворачивается резко, то заваливается на бок. А если хорошенько разогнаться и наехать на какую нибудь кочку, то машина полетит словно брошенный башмак по полу.

Ну а про обилие технических проблем я вообще молчу.
Лучше прочтите руководство одного товарища. Благодаря ему более менее комфортно поиграть таки удалось. Ну и заодно, там же найдёте ссылку на русскую локализацию.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=305880854

В общем Deadly Premonition игра не для тех, кто играет исключительно ради геймплея.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263696547', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1530579370}
review:
Mit is mondjak erről a játékról... Ez egy nagyon különleges játék. Nem a grafikája miatt, nem a játékmenet miatt.. Ezt a játékot a története teszi különlegessé. Ilyen nincs még 1 az egész világon. Nagyon örülök, hogy végigtudtam játszani ezt a játékot. Eléggé érdekes volt, de pont ez teszi olyan különlegessé és egyedivé. Elég vegyes érzelmeket váltott ki belölem: egyrészt örülök, hogy végre vége van, másrészt legszívesebben sose hagynám el Greenvale-t. Amikor elkezdtem ezt a játékot, egy cseppet se gondoltam ilyen befejezésre. Bevallom öszintén, kissé kiakadtam a végén. Ez nem a tipikus happy ending... nem.. Ez a tipikus japán horror ending. Hatalmas csattanóval és lezáratlan dolgokkal. Annak ellenére, hogy gyakorlatilag beletaposott a érzelmeibe, nagyon élveztem a játékot és ajánlom minden igazi gamernek, aki szereti a hosszú horror játékokat. Egy kis pontozás:

Grafika: 10/5
Játékmenet: 10/5 (az autók irányítása borzalmas, a célzás borzalmas)
Zene: 10/8 (sajnos kevés dalt kapott, de azok nagyon jók)
Történet: 10/5 (a vége miatt)

Összeségében: 10/7

Egy dolog biztos: sose fogom elfelejteni York és Zach ügynök kalandjait. Ez a játék az a fajta, ami nagy nyomot hagy az ember agyában és belelopja magát a szívébe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037160996', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 541, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1497678363}
review:
IF YOU WANT TO PLAY THIS GAME, BUY A CONSOLE VERSION

After having played most of this game, sometime back near 2010, I yearned to finish it. Seeing a release on steam got me really excited, so I purchased it without a second thought! Finally! I'll be able to finish this game! I'll see the ending, catch a murder, and eat some of Thomas' biscuits. 

But alas, this game is such a buggy piece of shit, that I barely made it past the first chapter before it stopped working completely. I've uninstalled, reinstalled, verified all the files multiple times, and have even tried patches from the internet. Absolutely nothing works. I am disappointed and heartbroken over the fact that I paid money for a game that I physically cannot play, however, my only regret is that I cannot finish this game.

review:
The story is excellent, you keep wondering about it, sucks you in but then a technical issue gives a slap in your face and you wake up. You cry, you go back in, you enjoy the game, then you are hit in the head with a bug hammer and you wake up. You rage and want to continue but give up because of the technical issues. Bugfest heaven wins again.

As of 31st May 2017 the game (or port) is still not fixed. Random crashes (even with the newest dpfix) and most annoyingly the horrible car screeching noise, which is a game breaker. 

The game would be awesome, dated yes, but still one of the best story wise out there. If only it was fixed though. Don't get in on pc, there is a reason why it costs less than a dollar... too bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004301953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1654, 'last_played': 1559790100}
review: Twin Peaks is an American television serial drama created by David Lynch and Mark Frost. The series follows the investigation, headed by FBI Special Agent Dale Cooper (Kyle MacLachlan), of the brutal murder of a popular teenager and homecoming queen, Laura Palmer (Sheryl Lee).

author: {'steamid': '76561198148715093', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1918, 'last_played': 1495984795}
review:
The driving is awful, the game crashes every 45 minutes or so, and the framerate likes to tank. Despite these issues, it is one of the most engrossing video game expeiences I've ever had. Just like a certain early 90's television series: Deadly Premonition manages a perfect blend of horror, drama, and comedy with a cast of memorable characters and a story full of twists and turns that is far more ambitious than most AAA titles.

If you can get around the technical shortcomings and you,
A. Know who the Log Lady is
B. Are a fan of B movies, or
C. Need something to fill the void left by the exit of the survival horror genre
Then I would highly recommend Deadly Premonition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002968368', 'num_games_owned': 1352, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 1151, 'last_played': 1710220661}
review:
New season of Twin Peaks just came out I feel now it is the time to write a review for this game:

Before they officially make a Twin Peaks video game, this is probably the closest thing you can get as a Twin Peaks game. Twin Peaks settings, Twin Peaks style, Twin Peaks references, and the coffee.

It does have some serious performance issues, but most are fixed by fan-made patches, just a little bit of work it runs pretty good. It is an old game and a budget title, so don't expect fancy graphics, all-star voice acting, etc. It gets the job done, that's it.

This game holds the world record of most critically polarizing survival horror game, thus put it on a weighted score 59. Are you not curious how good or how bad it could be?

author: {'steamid': '76561197960660915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1542, 'last_played': 1690172483}
review:
"I am very particular about my [games]. The very best you have, please."


  A Japanese love letter to Twin Peaks - this is a gaming experience second to none.

  This isn't something that you play because the gameplay is incredible. In fact the worst part of this game in many ways is the "gameplay" itself. Shooting, driving, and moving the camera can all be terrible at times - but it's worth it because you can't help but want to know what happens to Detective York Peppermint Patty next.

   It sinks it's hooks in with it's characters, dialogue, and the way it always seems to ask one more question than it answers. The graphics aren't anything dazzling, but the music (again, HEAVILY inspired by Twin Peaks) is fantastic as it is unusual. You'll know within the first hour of playing if it's right for you - so if in doubt go in bravely with Steam refund at your  back.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124968154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 1552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1552, 'last_played': 1534906822}
review:
This is the most important game nobody played. It's true, virtually nobody played it...and it's also important.

Nobody played it because it has little more than cult status in the world of gaming and in keeping with the tradition of Japanese game development from the mid to late 90s and early 2000s (it actually looks like a game from that time period), it has interesting gameplay mechanics, a bizarre storyline and quirky character presentation, so it's easy to see why SWERY's game ranks right up there with the likes of Suda51 games, such as Lollipop Chainsaw and Shadows of the Damned (please Steam, add these games to your store) or lesser known games like Mr. Mosquito, Incredible Crisis, the Siren series (arguably much more popular but still a series largely forgotten or that nobody really cared about), the Choaniki series, etc.

It's important because of the aforementioned cult status and Japanese quirkiness - they simply don't make games like this anymore, or at least nowhere near as often as they used to. It's also important because it pays homage to Twin Peaks and because it was actually awarded a Guinness record for most polarizing game, meaning that gamer reviews, and especially critical reviews, held it in either very high esteem, praising it for what it was, or utterly trashing it for what it wasn't (a good game) - there was absolutely no gray area by which to even things out.

I believe this was a budget game at the time of its release back on Xbox 360 and then again on PS3 with the exclusive director's cut (so it was $20 or thereabouts) and it's regularly the same price on Steam, except when it goes on sale for 90% off (which frequently happens). If you can look past its many bugs/flaws and very much dated graphical appearance, you're in for an interesting gaming experience that you won't soon forget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027713442', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1706, 'last_played': 1494492876}
review:
Known as the most critically polarizing game in video game history, Deadly Premonition is definitely a game that stands out from the crowd and establishes itself as a unique and bizarre specimen. Borrowing heavily from David Lynch's phenomenal television show, Twin Peaks, Deadly Premonition tells the story of FBI Agent Francis York Morgan who is called in to investigate the murder of a young woman in the sleepy mountain town of Greenvale. Along the way he meets various colorful and unique characters that add more to the allure and mystery of his investigation. 

PROS:
Fantastic story - A very deep and amazing story with many shocking developments and plot twists. One of the best written and presented stories I have ever seen in a video game.
Unique characters - Every character in Deadly Premonition is different and bursting with personality. A lot of care was put into every person's back story and quirks to make each one stand out.
Plenty to do - There are points in the story where you can go fully open world. Inside Greenvale are plenty of side quests and activities to take part in. Some activities you can only do at certain times of the day or before or after particular story events.
Genuinely creepy - The game starts off like a typical horror game, but slowly begins to twist and contort into a more unsettling and disturbing tale.

CONS:
Odd controls - Some of the games controls are a bit sluggish, especially the driving controls. Every car feels like a tank and will randomly spin off the road for no reason.
PC Version plagued with technical issues - If you play Deadly Premonition on PC, be prepared to fight with it. The game has loads of technical problems from random crashing and freezing, to frame rate and graphical errors. It's a miracle if you can get the game to run for more than 10 minutes without it crashing. There are workarounds, but it's upsetting to see how little care went into the PC port.
Maybe a little too weird - Deadly Premonitions charm lies in it's quirky characters and twisting story. A lot of crazy things happen throughout and the narrative can be a little weird for some. Not a game for people who like a more straightforward story.

If you can see past all the technicaly problems with the PC port, Deadly Premonition is a superb action/horror game with one of the best stories I have ever witnessed. If you can, I highly recommend getting the PS3 version since it is more stable and less likely to give you problems.
