author: {'steamid': '76561198029102409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1389425569}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a unique and captivating game that gets a lot of things very right, and a lot of things horribly wrong. You play an FBI Agent who is tasked to investigate an unusual murder in a small town.
Let's start with the wrong. This is the most crash-prone PC game I've ever played in my life. And that's saying a lot, because I've played many crash-prone games. There were several parts of the game where the only way to advance without crashing was to switch to a windowed mode (using Win 98 compatibility). There were other parts where I had to disable all the cores and logical processors of my CPU (except one). There were parts where restarting the computer was the only way.
The graphics are also pretty bad for a game released in 2010. It's locked to 720p resolution, and offers no graphics settings whatsoever.
So what made me like it? The highlights of this game are the story, characters, and setting. These are what kept me playing for over 20 hours, all the way to the end. The voice acting was pretty good too (especially the main character), which is surprising, given how poor the production values are in general.
As for gameplay: it is described as an open world game, which is technically true. However, aside from some boring side quests, there's very little reason to explore the town too much. The gameplay is simple: you go where you are told, get in location X, explore, go through linear hallways, pick up objects, etc... Often, you'll encounter enemies (zombie-like creatures who appear out of nowhere) that you can kill with guns and other weapons. It's never all that challenging, which is a good thing because the controls are so awful the combat would've been very frustrating if it were a real challenge.
The other thing the game does very well (but is underutilized) is that the townspeople go about their own lives independently of what you're doing. They wake up, go to work, then go out to a restaurant or go drinking, then go back home, then sleep. Sometimes, I see some of the characters is an unexpected location, and it's a nice surprise, and gives the town an extra feeling of authenticity. I haven't seen this done so well since all the way back to The Last Express in 1997.
Finally, I always felt that with a ton of tweaks and polishing, this could have been one of the greatest games ever made. But in its current state, it's not even close. Fix the bugs, update the graphics, make the story less absurd (though it was intriguing all the way through, it got way too bizarre for me in the end), and you've got yourself a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053736072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3879, 'last_played': 1497194532}
review:
Dopo anni che uso steam per la prima volta mi sento in dovere di fare una recensione, sì perché l'opera merita e parecchio.
Se sono le somiglianze con Twin Peaks a tenervi alla larga da questo titolo sappiate che non è tutto ciò che il gioco ha da offrire, anzi, Deadly Premonition è un miscuglio di generi, c'è dentro anche l'horror e lo splatter (tra le altre cose). E se non siete fan di Twin Peaks nessun problema, anzi forse ve lo saprete godere di più.
Ma cominciamo dai difetti, altro elemento di cui questo gioco soffre ed è rinomato:
1)LA GRAFICA:
è datata, ovviamente ci sono stati degli intoppi che hanno portato a rimandare continuamente l'uscita del gioco, che palesemente sarebbe dovuto uscire nell'epoca ps2. Ma è un fatto assai trascurabile se non siete nati l'altro ieri, inoltre ci sono diverse scene che anche con questo livello tecnico sapranno a lasciarvi a bocca aperta.
2)LE ANIMAZIONI: 
Spesso ridicole, ma i giapponesi sono soliti metterle, quindi...
3)L'AUDIO:
capita spesso che le voci registrate siano sotto tono o addirittura troppo alte. Anche questo nulla di che;
4)I COMANDI:
Come shooter siamo su uno stile tipo Resident Evil 4. Anche con pad 360 si spara coi pulsanti dorsali (non i grilletti, ma RB e LB), cercare di ottenere headshot col pad vi stuferà ben presto.
5)LA FISICA DEI VEICOLI:
Improponibile, una delle cose peggiori del gioco, e dovrete guidare parecchio in questo titolo. In particolare quando dovrete raggiungere due specifiche località in alta montagna vedrete i sorci verdi;
6)I BUG IN GENERALE:
Crash repentini del gioco (meno male che i salvataggi sono istantanei, quindi non c'è rischio di corrompere il proprio savegame) e dopo metà gioco vi troverete qualche strada in cui gli pneumatici dell'auto finiranno sotto il livello del terreno, portando l'auto a rallentare di molto se non addirittura quasi a fermarsi.
7)LA LOCALIZZAZIONE IN ITALIANO:
Difetto non imputabile agli sviluppatori (non completamente almeno). L'audio è in inglese con sottotitoli in italiano, ma se la vostra conoscenza della prima non vi consente di capire cosa viene detto, la vostra comprensione dei dialoghi nonché della storia quindi, ne soffrirà, e molto. Io leggevo i sottotitoli e al contempo ascoltavo i dialoghi, e vi posso dire che ci sono molti errori, traduzioni che potrebbero sviarvi o confondervi. Addirittura alcuni obiettivi di steam hanno i nomi in spagnolo e una volta in una quest secondaria un paio di frasi erano sottotitolate in tedesco!

Non inserisco l'orologio tra i difetti perché semplicemente non lo è. Vi viene l'orticaria all'idea di avere le missioni a tempo? Uccelli vostri sarebbe la risposta che per prima mi viene in mente, ma qui il fattore tempo è abbastanza relativo. Se arriverete "tardi" ad una missione non la fallirete. Facciamo un esempio: dovete trovarvi in un luogo tra le 10 e le 17, arrivate alle 16:30 e non riuscite a finirla prima delle 17 (come il sottoscritto), non c'è problema. Ci riproverete il giorno dopo sempre tra le 10 e le 17. (Questo era solo un esempio, non tutte le missioni devono terminare in una fascia oraria prestabilita)
Se vi interessa completare il gioco al 100% allora il discorso cambia leggermente. Le quest secondarie sono più difficili in termini di tempo, ma comunque il fallimento "causa orologio" non esiste in questo gioco. 
Vi interessa solo la storia principale? Benissimo, ci sono ben due metodi per mandare il tempo avanti veloce: dormire o fumare. Sì le sigarette non vi faranno accorgere del tempo scorre, letteralmente.

Passiamo quindi alla parte più ardua (almeno da descrivere) del titolo, i pregi:
1)LA TRAMA:
Come sopra, non è solo Twin Peaks. Posso dirvi altro senza spoilerare? A parte che è scritta molto meglio della maggior parte dei giochi, non posso aggiungere altro.
2)I PERSONAGGI:
Tra i migliori personaggi mai incontrati in un gioco. Vi affezionerete a loro e al loro carattere.
3)LE MUSICHE:
Molte (non tutte) sono davvero gradevoli. Ad un certo punto del gioco sarete in grado di comprare dei veicoli, ognuno di essi avrà un brano diverso che partirà quando salirete nell'auto.
4)IL GAMEPLAY:
Fate finta che questo punto sia anche nella lista dei difetti (fisica veicoli e fasi di shooting), ma lo metto anche qui perché in questo gioco si possono fare molte cose. È un mix di generi non solo nella trama ma anche nelle parti giocate. È uno shooter horror, un investigativo, ha qualche elemento di GTA, qualcuno di Silent Hill, e molto altro.
Potrete sapere in qualunque momento dove saranno gli abitanti della cittadina guardando la mappa, potrete spiarli al lavoro o a casa. Potete andare a pesca, leggere fondi di caffé per prevedere il futuro, svolgere quest secondarie, cambiarvi d'abito (se non volete avere nubi di mosche attorno), farvi la barba (o farvela crescere!), completare una collezione di carte (NON LEGGETENE LE DESCRIZIONI, SPOILERANO LA TRAMA!), giocare a freccette, pranzare coi colleghi (o da soli all'albergo), e molto altro. 
5)I DETTAGLI:
Per essere un gioco "epoca ps2" ha molte chicche. Quando supererete un auto col buio, i suoi fari da dietro vi abbaglieranno per un istante, c'è un navigatore "abbozzato" nel veicolo che guidate (palesemente incompiuto: indizio che con più tempo e fondi avrebbero potuto fare molto di più a quello che già c'è, forse?), le auto hanno anche frecce e tergicristalli funzionanti (e voi direte: a che mi serve? Io vi dico che era da Driver che non vedevo le frecce utilizzabili), hanno anche la benzina e i danni da tenere d'occhio, dovete cambiarvi d'abito per non puzzare, farvi la barba (lo so, queste 2 le ho messe anche sopra, ma sono comunque chicche di cui tener conto). L'orologio non è lì solo per le missioni principali, difatto i negozi apriranno o chiuderanno in base all'ora (i locali aprono la sera, mentre il supermercato chiude), dovrete tenere d'occhio i livelli di fame e di sonno del protagonista (soddisfabili in maniere diverse). 

Sei arrivato a sto punto e ancora non t'ho convinto? Beh io in ogni caso mi sono rotto i cocomeri di scrivere. Compra sto titolo e basta. Ciao.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019748056', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 222, 'playtime_forever': 2927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2905, 'last_played': 1493930260}
review:
[b] Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut (2010, 2013) Access Games [/b]
Это определенно игра не для всех. В ней тяжело разобраться, она неприятна снаружи и обладает скверным характером. Техническое несовершенство будет бесить вас практически все время, которое вы за ней проведете. Звуки взлетающих птиц похожи на вертолет или серию выстрелов из духового ружья, а топот детских ног по полу напоминает топот дрессированных коней на параде, цокающих подковами по мостовой. Графическая составляющая отталкивает, а физика управления автомобилями вообще заставляет истерически смеяться. Как управлять этим неврастеническим корытом на колесах?

"Deadly Premonition" позволяет себе вообще ничего никому не объяснять, не подсказывать и плевать она на все хотела. Дополнительные миссии иногда превращаются в форменное издевательство. Вам нужно принести ингредиенты для готовки одному из главных персонажей, Эмили. Но сейчас уже 8 вечера. Дверь дома закрыта. Вернемся завтра после сна на большой кровати в собственном доме. На следующий день в 6 часов вечера выясняется, что должен идти дождь. И вы снова злой отправляетесь спать. После этого, в шесть, во время дождя вы стучитесь в дверь, с ужасом понимая, что несколько часов назад случайно съели ветчину, необходимый для квеста ингредиент. Не беда, сходим в магазин и купим. Однако магазин никогда не работает в дождь, и вам снова нужно вылавливать необходимые условия. Геймпад летит в окно, а "Deadly Premonition" вылетает на рабочий стол.

В этой игре вообще много чего можно делать - спать, есть, бриться, ездить на машинах, рыбачить, курить, вызывать полицейскую машину, менять костюмы под настроение, а когда они становятся грязные отправлять их в химчистку, гадать на кофе, ходить по магазинам, выполнять кучу второстепенных миссий, раскрывающих детали сюжета и характеры жителей города. Вы учитесь всем этим оперировать, использовать правильно и в нужное для определенной ситуации время.
Однако. Стоит только перетерпеть все это, и вы понимаете - внутри скрывалась невероятно глубокая история с уникальным, очень интересным сюжетом, великолепно проработанными персонажами и сильнейшей атмосферой, напоминающей творения Линча, в первую очередь его "Твин Пикс", смешанный с внешностью Наоми Уоттс и Джоэля Осмента в лицах главных героев.

Именно последнее - сюжет и персонажи просто не оставляют выбора между терпеть или не играть. Играть хочется. Каждую минуту вы готовы идти вперед, прорываясь через любые препятствия. Только бы узнать кто же из жителей Гринвейла тот самый маньяк с топором в дождевом плаще, сводящий воедино искусство и убийства. Кто дергает за ниточки и что вообще тут происходит. Шикарный главный герой, с которым вы себя олицетворяете, будет продираться через это вместе с вами, но никогда не опустит нос и не потеряет свое фирменное чувство юмора. Не так ли Зак?
Уникальный проект для людей, которые готовы принять эту интереснейшую игру такой, какая она есть.
[b] Рейтинг - 80/100 [/b]

review:
De verdad, de lo peor que he jugado en años.
Le he dedicado 30 minutos al 'juego de culto' (de culto al mal gusto) y es tan malo que te da la risa. Sólo se salva la historia y algunos personajes interesantes. En TODO lo demás es nefasto e injugable ¿Cómo puede un juego de 2010 ser tan horrible gráficamente y a la vez tener esas animaciones propias de un juego malo de la Play 1? Os aconsejo que veáis la cuarta captura de Steam (la del bosque) a pantalla completa en el PC, y si te atreves en la TV también...
 Ok, puedes olvidarte de los gráficos un poco e intentar no marearte, aunque yo no lo he conseguido y no es broma. Sigues y vas descubriendo sus virtudes:  un control tosco e impreciso y una jugabilidad que te invita a desinstalar el juego. Yo accedí con gusto. 
 Comparado con muchos juegos del año 2000 pierde, no digo ya comparado con juegos de su año como Red Dead Redemption o Mass Effect 2 por ejemplo. 

Un detalle, en los textos de diálogo del juego, el símbolo ¿ es sustituido siempre por Á  

Recomendado si usas una tele de los 80

author: {'steamid': '76561198108766637', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1212, 'last_played': 1492952552}
review:
Warning! This game is nearly unplayable on PC. There are random crashes, freezez, framerate slowdowns over time due to memory leak, locked resolution and a lot of bugs. Even with the DPfix the game performs poorly and is a chore to get running. 

That being said the game itself is a wonderful detective story with well built characters. The script, voice acting and direction of the game is so well done and at the same time so strange and out of this world you'll simply love it.

Other than that the gameplay is sub par, the quick time events tedious and the graphics look really bad especially considering that this game came out in 2013. Music can get a bit boring as there are just a handful of tracks you'll keep hearing over and over again and the audio effects aren't very special.

Personally I think they should just remake this game on another more powerful engine so that it can shine. It is well worth the pain of constantly restarting the game and running with various compatibility options and admin priviledges to go thru the story but I wish I didn't have to.

review:
I don't think that anyone can contest that the core gameplay and graphics are quite lackluster (usually a death sentence for a game), but I found the central mystery as well as learning about the various quirky characters through sidequests really compelling. Enough so that I was happily pushing through.
Unfortunately, this port is really prone to crashing which just got worse as I went on, and what with it being a crappy ugly game, that was just too much. Ah well...

author: {'steamid': '76561198049105851', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 191, 'playtime_forever': 614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1492390946}
review:
This damn game... this god**** game. You ever thought the biggest enemy in a game would be a boss right? Or perhaps a really cryptic level that has no online solution? Well, with this little gem of a game the biggest foe you'll have to face is the actual game itself.

Deadly Premonition was made by SWERY 65, a man whose name must be inspired at least in part by the legendary Suda51 (F***ing rip-off... I think). In this game you play as Agent Francis York Morgan who's been assigned by the FBI to assist in a murder that has occurred in the quiet, quaint, and mysterious town of Greenvale. Along the way, you meet demons, zany town residents, and the most random usable in-game items ever. Really, Morgan? You're going to take some salmon from a demonic locker and eat it to restore your hunger? You disgust me.

The first thing I noticed about Deadly Premonition is that it really wants to suck the c*** of Twin Peaks more than any other game I've ever played. Francis York Morgan acts in a very similar manner to Agent Dale Cooper, there's tons of supernatual dream imagery represented in red, and personalities in the police officers that mirrors the behavior of the police department of Twin Peaks. And... that's fine, I suppose, but between Deadly Premoniton and Twin Peaks, Twin Peaks is clearly the superior form of entertainment for several reasons.

The story in Deadly Premoniton isn't particularly written that well. The over-the-top characters are so ridiculous and unbelievable that it's hard to take anything within the game seriously. There's seriously a guy who rolls around in a wheelchair and his assistant speaks in rhymes after listening to his boss whisper in his ear... every... single... time.. he talks!

The game's presentation also doesn't help it much. The game was made for PS3 and that's what it looks like it was made for... very EARLY PS3 at least. Textures on characters and backgrounds are very basic. And characters animate and gesticulate so robotically and their voice actors put so little effort in that every cutscene is either a blast to watch or  more draining than the sewer great I poured my victim's blood into.

Wait... what?

The game handles... alright. The driving is very jerky and uncontrollable at times, and the cover shooting is nonsensical. You can walk freely but to aim at enemies or reload your gun you have to hold the Space bar- which locks you immediately in one space, leaving you unable to move- and you aim with your mouse. It's very clunky and confusing as to why the designers had such an outdated third-person shooter mechanic in the game. But other than that, the game is pretty responsive. But the driving and shooting take up so much that it really is a drawback for the experience.

Now, of all the things that irritate me in this game, I'd say the biggest offender would be the bugs and crashed. My God, I haven't played anything this bad since... Well, actually Fallout: New Vegas. But that game would still run just find after I'd reboot it. There are several parts of the game that most people on threads complain about equally for crashing. Hell, even one of my favorite let's-players had his game freeze up on him mid-session. If this is such a big problem, why haven't the developers ever released a new patch for the PC port? I got to a point in my game where Iliterally could not progress no matter what advice I took, so I decided to look up the rest of the story online and call it quits.

But despite my qualms with Deadly Premonition... I was still charmed by it (oddly enough). Despite all the awkwardness and irritating crashes, I enjoyed the over-the-top cheesey quirkiness of the game, because it seemed to have a self-awareness to it at least. Does it save it from a thumbs down? Of course not! But I thought it was worth mentioning.

Deadly Premonition is a game with a lot of effort put into it, but executed very horribly. I will warn any potential buyers now, this game WILL crash on you. You will have to fight it constantly to get it to work, and even when it does you'll remain nervous about when it could possible crash again. I think that makes this game not worth recommending. You want some good horror and 3rd person cover shooting? Play Spec Ops: The Line. As for Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut (some cut), I'm giving it a 3/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079519825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1571, 'last_played': 1468899872}
review:
Debatedly one of the Worst-Best games I've ever played. 
By that I mean that this game astounded me from start to finish, both in good ways, and in bad ways. For example, the characters, story and development of everything in the game are among the best I've ever seen. BUT the game can't really run at a stable 60/30 fps, tends to dip randomly after long periods of play and has occasional crashes.

I was lucky to only have the above problems, sound problems, constant crashes, extreme fps issues, things just not working in general among many, many other issues plague this port, and probably most of the original game as well. If somehow, somewhere this game were to be fixed/re-ported I would not doubt this game to be a GOTY contender at all. Even if its kind of culty. And Awesome.

Because the port and everything else are so bad I can't recommend this game. If you want to give it a shot you'll be able to tell in the first 2 hours if your pc can run it relatively well. If so, enjoy this diamond. If not, sorry but its just more dirt to tread on (and return).

A yes no system can't explain this at all... I like the game and would probably say its an EXTREMELY rare (for me at least) 8.8/10. I didn't have enough problems to really hate the tech side of the game, but it is a port. A bad port at that and not something you'd want if it doesn't work...


I can only say a game is the awesome best thing and shit so many times before it loses its meaning. T~T

author: {'steamid': '76561198150140227', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1552393056}
review:
Todos sabemos que el aspecto técnico de este juego está roto. La jugabilidad es de lo peor que hay, sobretodo en la conducción. Los gráficos son horribles para ser un juego de 2010, y los combates, si no estuvieran, sería hasta mejor.
Pero aún así, si eres capaz de dejar todo eso de lado y centrarte en la historia, encontrarás que realmente merece la pena soportar todo lo malo que tiene el juego.
La trama me atrapó desde el principio, y los personajes, se sienten muy reales y están muy bien construidos.
Lo que más me gustó de la historia fue su desenlace. Aunque en cierta medida puede ser algo predecible, no lo es el tramo final de la misma.
En definitiva, aunque el juego esté roto técnicamente hablando, tiene una historia que merece mucho la pena ser disfrutada, y si te atrapa, no te importará en absoluto todo lo demás.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025878022', 'num_games_owned': 1019, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2987, 'last_played': 1491610247}
review:
Единственная сильная сторона этой игры - сюжет. Но и он с изрядной долей изъянов. Хотя игра затягивает и в целом интересно. Но и маразма хватает (без учета мистики, это как-раз понятно).
Игра очень сырая - много багов и вылетов, ощущение что разработчики вообще наплевали на игроков. Наплевать что это порт с PS3 на компьютер, а до этого вообще разработка на PS2. Вообще не волнует - это отмазы. Продаете для PC, так доведите до ума.
Графика просто полный отстой. Я понимаю, что графика это далеко не самое важное. Но есть же пределы какие-то? Игра 2013 года. Сравните этот шлак с Half-Life 2, 2007 года.

Из 10 баллов, моя оценка 7.8 но только из-за сюжета. И еще за оригинальность. Игра очень и очень необычная, характеры персонажей выписаны детально и за них начинаешь переживать. Видно, что над этой составляющей игры разработчики поработали как следует.

Надеюсь, игру переиздадут со временем. Вот это точно проект, заслуживающий Remastered-версию.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135450159', 'num_games_owned': 514, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1490867552}
review:
This game taught me all I need to know about fixing broken game ports!
Ignoring the fact that this is one atrocious port that constantly crashes and is very unstable at the best of times, and has wild fps rates, Deadly Premonition is an amazing experience. Inspired by the series Twin Peaks, it bases itself around a small town where a bunch of murders have happened. You play as Agent York, solving the crimes and uncovering secrets as you go. 

-The game has comedic value; some intentional and others not so much (character idle poses are so stupid they are funny) which gives it some charm and somewhat detracts from the pain of getting it to run. 
-QTEs are a nightmare sometimes, so prepare to die! 
-Car controls are very clunky and steering is on a whole different level. 
-Similar to Silent Hill, there are sections which are nightmarish and a seperate reality from the current part of the game. You find enemies here which you have to fight (or run past if you really wanted to). Combat controls very much like an old Resident Evil title and work well.
-The soundtrack is very unique and fits the game brilliantly

Bottom line: If you're prepared to spend hours spoon-feeding this game into working, it is worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198146300490', 'num_games_owned': 1523, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2287, 'last_played': 1561640664}
review:
WOW! the Story is absolutely amazing! I have probably NEVER seen a storyline compared to it. (probably not even half as good [Spoiler]no longer the case after "Angels with Scaly Wings"[/Spoiler]) The gameplay however..... something between bad and really good, like the dreaded world map that rotates to where the player is facing (the one in the main menu - never saw that..... luckily) while on the other hand doing side quests is actually rewarding! Whether the Rewards are worth it or not is a matter of taste. The whole World feels so alive as well as the characters. Even the side Characters are memorable!

But what of the negatives? Well there are a MASSIVE amount of issues here, which is a huge shame, since this game could be sooooo freaking amazing! here are my biggest parts, starting off easy:

as already said, the map rotation is a heavy pain in the a$$.
Driving mechanics.... OMG..... think your a cool kid for doing a 360 degree spin? thats a joke compared to what you can expect here! if you do 2x complete spins + half a flip by simply driving straight ahead on a flat road and VERY SLIGHTLY move your steering wheel..... yeah great mechanics....
Awful pc port that needs patching (around 30 min) with the game still beeing unstable. (playing in windowed mode via DPfix (mod) drastically reduced crashes at the cost of a grey bar at the bottom - i gladly sacrifice a tiny bit of view for much better stability.) on a side note: i could play 12H straight without crashing, but thats different for everyone
BUT the true Horror i had during gameplay are those FU**ING Quick time events! there are way too much in the game. that crap really ruins the whole fun and in fact is like the only way of dying in this game.

I would totally recommend this masterpiece at 50€ if the said issues weren't present, but as it stands out..... try your luck when it's discounted. or if you don't want a crashy game WATCH A LETS PLAY! it's really a great story!

My score as is: 6/10
+1 for better port
+3 without those freaking QTE's

IMPORTANT!!!! SEAMS TO REQUIRE THE WINDOWS MEDIA PLAYER SET AS DEFAULT VIDEO PLAYER!!!! couldn't get it further than the main menu (seriously) and that's where i watched an entire let's play of the game (also for the first time a complete let's play) just to actually play the game half a year later. :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198065298298', 'num_games_owned': 602, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2168, 'last_played': 1488869472}
review:
This game is by most accounts broken. I had to run it in windows xp compatibility mode. It would crash every other hour. I could only aim in a 30 degree arc that made one of the final battles practically impossible.

And it was worth every minute. This is a game that not only makes an impression but it inspires. It makes you feel a range of emotions and feelings that you didn't think were even possible from a game. It makes you appreciate other games more. It's more than a so bad it's good experience. By the end of I loved it unironically. 

It's a trail to get to that point though. Not for everyone, but I recommend it (though if can get the console version do that instead and save a lot of frusturation).

author: {'steamid': '76561198135584967', 'num_games_owned': 1020, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 865, 'last_played': 1500718159}
review:
I was gonna wait till i finished the game to write a review but i couldnt wait anymore. SERIOUSLY THIS IS ONE OF THE BEST GAMES I'VE PLAYED.
I see that people are having trouble with the game crashing. It happened to me too so you have to be patient though. Just save the game regularly.

Since you can read what the story is about, I'll leave that part (you'll enjoy it if you love Twin peaks and other small town detective stories.) Let me tell you what you can do in this game.

- You can explore the whole town!! It's actually a nice place with many restaurants and bars

- Unique characters (japanese devs always make the most interesting characters)

- Hunger and sleep meter which you'll have to take care of. (lunch at your hotel? or at some diner in town)

- So many side quests to do though it'll help if you use a guide. (Cause navigating in this game is kinda hard)

- In game time which you'll have to keep track of to do some certain quests. (idk why but this game reminds me of harvest moon. The town people walks all over the town. You will even pass by their car sometimes. They have their own daily routine so it helps if you know them too haha)

- Fishing spots

- Filling gas at a gas station

- Weather system (don't forget to turn your wiper on while driving in the rain!)

- The otherworld (This is where most of your main missons take place. Be warned. Ghosts! hold your breath so that they can't see you!)

- Quick time events (kinda hard though)

- Shave or grow a beard

- Change your clothes regularly or you'll attract flies




Cons:

- Enemies are too annoying. They will start spawning everywhere in the otherworld missions. (You had to shoot a lot of them in the prologue before you reach the town)

- Map is hard to navigate. But i guess that makes the game more realistic?

- crashing

- The otherworld missions are too long T_T One cannot stay inside a world where there are full of ghosts for too long.


I guess that's about it. Thank you for making such a great game <3 I really love it. I can't believe i got this game for under $3 !

author: {'steamid': '76561198126135235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 337, 'last_played': 1488048391}
review:
Twin Peaks: The Game on sale for $2.50? Did you hear that, Zach?

While the port is bad, the music is played at the most innapropriate times, and has the SAME EXACT STORYLINE as Twin Peaks, the game is amazing. You can call certain scenes funny but it sweetens the pot if you take them as surreal. I'm not sure if I'm playing a horror game or a paranormal sitcom, but that just makes it all the better. The driving AI for the NPCs is wacky and I like to watch them drive in circles or clip through the forest. I'd say wait til it goes on sale again before buying. What do you think, Zach?

P.S. If you want it to not crash on start-up, don't play in Full-Screen mode.

review:
EDIT: Stuff it I don't recommend this game. Damn quick time events and frustrating quick time events.


Buyer beware: This game is buggy as all hell. It crashes randomly. There is a workaround but you need patience to play it.
 
That said this is one hell of an interesting game the dialogue and characters are unique and strange. Like David Lynch made a Twin Peaks game. One mission has you racing a woman home before her pot cools down. Pot as in soup pot.

The gameplay is pretty bad though. Enemies are more annoying than dangerous. You spend a large part of the game driving around and you get very little clue as to where and when the side quests take place.

Do I recommend it... I don't know. If you have a high **** threshold and enjoy surreal dialogue and obscure plot lines then go for it. If you want your games to look good and runs well the hell no.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218458060', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1561, 'last_played': 1475533980}
review:
At first I was really skeptic on the approach of the game, the music didn't seem to fit in some places, the characters were weird, the voice acting was "eh" and the combat was easy as hell due to the fact that you have unlimited ammo on your main pistol. Until you get to the point where you start playing other characters then the story changes completely, it was a major twist and interestingly well thought out. The only issue I had for this was that on certain points of the game, it crashes a lot and you need to do a lot of tweaks on compatibility and settings but what kept me playing was knowing the true history about the Raincoat killer.

Overall it was weird, quirky, buggy but good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308019923', 'num_games_owned': 1437, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1488470651}
review:
O lo ami o lo odi.
Il gioco ha centomila difetti e scelte di gameplay che ti fanno venire voglia di bestemmiare il calendario, ma è dotato di una sua anima che lo rende unico.
Non parliano dell'aspetto tecnico perché sembra di avere sottomano un titolo per Ps2 tirato a lucido (male).
La storia, però, con le sue atmosfere a metà tra Twin Peaks o una qualsiasi delle pellicole malate di David Lynch invoglia il giocatore ad andare avanti scordando (o meglio: sopportando) tutte quelle scelte tecniche e stilistiche che oggettivamente non funzionano.
Una volta terminata l'avventura difficilmente ci scorderemo di York, Zach e del killer con l'impermeabile rosso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035548829', 'num_games_owned': 882, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2064, 'last_played': 1485954662}
review:
This game was fun. Enemies are pointless though. Toward the end they start just attaching plot pieces together for no reason, it wouldn't make any difference in the story if they didn't in my opinion. 

It was buggy though I had to use DPfix atfirst. Then I had to remove it because I got an Aiming glitch that only works by alt-tabbing out of fullscreen mode. Which with DPfix makes you crash. Instead I downloaded sweetfx and kept the game in 720p. For the crashing I used the CFF_Explorer fix, if it was a really bad crash that happened consistently I used compatibility mode windows98/ME. Problem with that is that It makes your frames drop to the single digits. 

This game is playable if you download various fixes. If you got this game for 2-3$ it might be worth it. However I can't recommend it if you buy it at full price.
SweetFX fix - http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director's_Cut#Improved_textures
CFF_Explorer fix (use dp.exe instead of sims3 in the guide) - http://simswiki.info/wiki.php?title=Sims_3:Large_Address_Aware/CFF_Explorer

review: I've bought Deadly Premonition three times in various formats, and I'll buy it again. I've been playing video games for twenty-four years and this is my favourite one of all time. I bought it originally cause I heard it was a jokey cult game and didn't think it would be good. It took over my life. Have you seen Invasion of the Body Snatchers, Zach? Cause that's me now. I go around indoctrinating more friends into playing this game, because I want everyone to see it. This game and I have a more intimate connection than the one I share with my fiance. I have written more words on Deadly Premonition than the total length of War and Peace (I word counted it). It takes a little while to get into. I didn't fall in love with it at first, cause the start of the game is skewed towards some of its weaker features. And you do need the dpfix.exe to stop it from crashing (it takes a minute to install). You may want to get the xbox or PS3 version instead.... but, my friends, it must be confessed, Deadly Premonition is simply the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022862133', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1437, 'last_played': 1485212293}
review:
Really good game.

A lot of the negative reviews it gets are about the PC port being buggy - I hate to be that "works on my machine" guy but I didn't encounter any game-breaking bugs, there were a few glitches but honestly I found them pretty funny (like people floating outside their cars), and they didn't impede my progress at all. Admittedly it did crash once (and kept doing so at that point), but for some reason putting it in windowed mode fixed it (and I switched back after).

That aside, the actual game is great. Great music, setting, story and characters. Gameplay is a bit wonky but you get used to it. There's also a lot of side missions to let you know more about the side characters and the town, and lots of cool (and useful) things you can find/buy. The only gripes I have are that some sections could drag on for a bit too long, and were quite tedious, like following someone who's driving painstakingly slowly for ages. Also the driving controls are terrible, let's not dance around that. Early cars barely turn at all, and later cars go way too fast and turn too sharply, making them flip over and spin wildly out of control. Lastly, there are extended QTE sequences that are also pretty tedious, and you usually die immediately if you mess up, having to go back and start the entire sequence again.

However, even with all that, this game is one of the few these days that made me actually want to come back and keep playing, and see the story through to the end. The characters felt realistic and had depth instead of being generic flat characters like in most other games.

I don't even know what genre this game would be. It isn't really a horror game, and it's not really a murder mystery either, it sort of combines elements from lots of different genres, and has a wacky humorous theme mixed in with darker elements. It's sort of like a weirder Japanese version of Twin Peaks.

tl;dr I had a lot of fun playing this. It was a great game from start to finish, even with some iffy patches along the way. Contrary to what most of the negative reviews say, it's not "unplayable". It runs pretty well on my mid-tier PC, and has setting adjustment options.

Just try it out if it looks like something you'd enjoy, and don't worry about all the horror stories about the PC port. They're mainly gross exaggeration.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990921513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1780, 'last_played': 1485516109}
review:
I remember picking up that game for 30€ on Xbox360, close to its release, not really knowing what it was all about, discovering the aliasing, the horrible textures, the stiff animations and the myriad of incomprehensible game-design choices. Like, why the hell does the map rotate in the map-menu? It's confusing as hell, you can't find anything because of that. Oh and why do I have to look at it so closely? Why is the game using the music so strangely? It sometimes feels like there are four tracks and it's using some of them in the weirdest moments. Why are does survival/shooting session so boring and tedious, and why aren't they integrated better in the rest of the game? Why is the car so slow and why is the steering angle so narrow?Why...?

You would think that "what the f*ck?" would be a better question to go along the strange nature of the game. But at first, you'll be far too busy questionning every decision made during the development process, to really, thoroughly pay attention to how much the game is up there in its head. You are probably going to hate it for a while. But you are going to stick with it, wanting to come back.

At first, the main character makes you stay. He talks to himself, to you maybe. And you'll want to hear what he has to say when you'll first him talk to you about "Jaws". Then you are going to stay for the plot, ripping off Twin Peaks so amazingly well and with its very own quirks, with a whole new level of bizarre, that you won't even be able to say that it is plagiarism, when it obviously is plagiarism. Then you are going to understand the crappy controls, deal with it, and actually explore the map, talk to every character and learn about there great and diverse personalities, even with the poor navigation help that the game gives you (it's hard to find anything with the game this ugly). And hopefully, you are going to be touched, creeped out and amused (a lot) by the story, amazed by the twists and turns, the gameplay even, not in it's execution, but in its structure and ideas that wan and will works (sometimes not, let's be honest). And hopefully, you are going to LOVE IT.

That's what happened to me. That's what happened to all my friends who enjoyed it. Give it six hours. Give it the time to lead you to the big reunion in the community center. At that point, you'll be far too concern about the plot to let the amazingly low production value steer you away from the game. Hell, you'll probably even enjoy the game despite AND because of that poor production value that, somehow, adds to the game's personality.

I do realize that I shouldn't recommand that PC version because it is really unstable. I only played 11 hours so far and already had a three or four crashes. But hear me out; DPfix for the resolution and windowed without border mode + controller patch from the devs, and you can do this. Save often! If you can't play it on Xbox 360 (the best version) or on PS3 (same but with new cutscenes and a framerate from hell), go for this one. It's not great, but it's just passable enough not to ruin the game (IF YOU SAVE OFTEN).


TL;DR
The cult following doesn't come out nowhere. This one is a giver and a taker. You'll need patience, sure. But once you are in, the game won't let you go and there is a big chance it will become one of your favorites. Unfortunatley, it is a really (really) poor port on PC, but of the greatest diamond in the rough I have ever played. I recommend the game wholeheartedly. And if you can't have it another way, I recommend the PC version...reluctantly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068780649', 'num_games_owned': 2725, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1675035383}
review:
Есть категория игр - "игры не для всех". Попасть в нее игра может по разным причинам: излишняя жестокость, спецефичность геймплея или излишняя психоделичность и непонятность происходящего на экране. 

В Deadly Premonition есть все. Изощренные убийства порожденные больной фантазией маньяка-садиста, до ужаса кривая реалицая геймплея, тонны гротеска, который буквально заливает вашу клавиатуру уже спустя пару часов игры. Но парадокс в следующем - эта игра так отвратительна, что даже прекрасна. 

Слабая графика выдает довольно спорную картинку, которая, однако, отлично передает спокойную и одновременно не здоровую атмосферу маленького тихого городка. Крайняя жестокость заставляет верить в серьезность происходящего и, в сочетании с отличными диалогами, заставляет по настоящему волноваться за каждого героя истории. Сюжет же просто шикарен.

С первого взгляда может показаться, что DP слишком много берет и копирует с других франчайзов (Twin Pix, Resident Evil, Silent Hill и т.д.), однако ознакомившись с игрой поближе понимаешь - DP уникальна. Таких сильных и атмосферных игр еденицы. Не смотря на всю свою внешнюю спорность игра способна подарить несколько незабываемых вечеров, а конец истории на долго впечатается в память любого любителя психологических триллеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999837106', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1797, 'last_played': 1485032150}
review:
Nehéz szavakba önteni azon érzéseket, mely e játék nyújtott nekem a közel 30 órás végigjátszás alatt. De ezt meg kell tennem...

Ez a játék egyszerűen fantasztikus! Osztozom azon honfitársaim véleményén, mely szerint az elejétől a végéig teljesen leköti a felhasználót, s közben élvezi minden egyes percét. Várja, hogy mi fog történni a következő percben, vajon hogyan fogják csavarni a történetet? S ki egyáltalána  gyilkos? Mindezen kérdésekre folyamatosan fogjuk kapni a meglepő impulzusokat, ahogy haladunk előre a nyomozásban.

Ami a leginkább tetszett s egyben meg is lepett, hogy a játék nyílt világú. Ilyen a mostani nyomozós játékokban nem nagyon van, ritka hollónak számít e tekintetben a DP. Egyszerűen oda megyünk, ahova akarunk, mehetünk enni, pecázni, aludni, inni-enni, interakcióba léphetünk emberekkel, illetve a nyomozásunk során gyanusítottnak kikiáltott személyekkel is.

A történet: már bevezetőmben is utaltam rá, hogy olyan, mintha egy hosszabb thrillert néznénk. Érdekes koncepció, de sokak számára ismerős lehet jó néhány eleme a '90-es évek sorozatából, a Twin Peaksből. Itt is kapunk egy FBI-ügynököt, akinek van némi skizofrén hajlama, ahol a nyomozás során igen csak vicces helyzeteket, párbeszédeket produkál. Adva van egy gyilkos, aki igen kegyetlen módon végzi ki áldozatát s ebben örömét is leli benne. Megismerhetjük a kisváros főbb embereit, akiknek fel tudjuk fedni nem éppen makulátlan előéletüket. Mindenki sáros valamiben, ami hozzáad a főtörténetszál megértéséhez és további spekulációkra adhat okot a gyilkost kilétének illetően. A másik legjobb s leginkább megadja a játék ízét az a ,,Másvilág". Mivel egy nyílt világú horrorjátékról van szó, s a nyomozás során ,,elutazunk" e különös s rendkívül sötét atmoszférájú helyre, ahol különös lények, az ,,árnyékok" vadásznak ránk a legkülönfélébb módon. Ez a ,,Másvilág" gyakorlatilag abból áll, hogy a nyomozás helyszíne a valóságbeli méretei teljesen átalakulnak, újabb helyiségek jönnek létre - ezzel megadva egy jelentősebb paráztatási időnek és hangulatnak -, amelyek az eredeti helyszín egy eltorzult, elhagyatott világát festik elénk, ahol nem minden az, aminek látszik. Ezen adalékok szolgálnak arra, hogy a egy-egy nyomot teljes egészében összerakjunk, s kapjunk az adott történetszálhoz egy kis mozaikot, ahol a végén minden egyes mozaikdarabka egy nagy egésszé rendeződik, ezzel megtudva ki is a gyilkos, akit oly hevesen kutatunk s aki rettegésben tartja e barátságosnak látszó, eldugott kisvárost. 

Bár lassúnak indul a történet, kb. a felénél rendesen rákapcsolnak, egy perc nyugtunk sem lesz, amíg meg nem oldjuk az ügyet. A program törődik azzal, hogy a játékos ne unatkozzon, folyton rátesz egy lapáttal a meghökkentő történésekre. Abszolúte nem kiszámítható, hogy ki a gyilkos, az ember folyton töprengeni fog rajta, s minél inkább többet gondolkodik rajta, annál meglepőbben fogja a program ráébreszteni arra, hogy eleddig rossz nyomon járt. A folyamatos csavarok, meglepettséget garantálni fogja, ezt 100%-ig bizton állítom. Nem akartam elhagyni e rejtélyes kisvárost, de sajnos mégis kénytelen voltam. Egyszer mindennek vége szakad...

A zene: kiemelkedő munka, ami egyes jelenetekhez nagyon jól megkomponált. Hangulatos, szívbemarkoló, elgondolkodtató. Tán sokszor ismétlődik egy-egy szám, ám ha az ember folyamatosan játszik vele, idővel rájön, hogy ez a sok számismétlés mennyire jól passzol bizonyos jelenetek, szituációk közben.

Ami a negatívumot illeti... Bár a játék eredetileg konzolra lett tervezve, ami meg is látszik rajta, azt kell mondjam, nagyon szépen kidolgozott s jól irányítható. Talán az egyik legidegesítőbb az a célzás: nehézkesen lehet mozgatni, ami több ellenség likvidálásnál azért igen csak bosszantó. A másik negatívum, hogy az ellenfelekből nem sok van. Többnyire van egy darab, aminek 3-4 variációja létezik. Ám hangulatba, illetve néhány alkalommal az emberre rá tudják hozni a frászt. A harmadik, hogy a játék néha ismeretlen okból kifagy, ezért érdemes majdnem minden lehetséges mozdulatnál menteni.

E hiányosságok nélkül nagyon ajánlom, aki szereti a rejtélyes gondolkoztató, feszültséget mindvégig fenntartó játékot, amely a legvégsőkig izgalomban tartja a felhasználókat. Sűrűn szokott akcióban lenni, 2,5 euróért simán megéri e nagyszerű kaland végigjátszása.

Fontos megjegyzés: mindig igyatok kávét! A kávé megmondja az igazságot. ;)

,,Akkor viszlát, Zach. Köszönök mindent."

author: {'steamid': '76561198081246548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 650, 'last_played': 1484500509}
review:
the first chapters of this game is really a turn off, the gameplay is just horrible, clunky, and awkward. Well actually it's not that bad, but it's one of those games where gameplay is so bad that you just want to skip them and just proceed into the main story. As someone who is not really proficient in action game other than mass effect series, this game is really not for me. 

so yeah, I stopped playing after 6 hours because I couldn't continue and watched deadly premonition the movie 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rJRga7wPzUo

is the story good? honestly I have hard time to judge. this is one of those moments when video games become an art. it is incredibly ambitious despite the lack of budget and you can just how much the game developers took attentions to the details. 

The characters are eccentric and memorable. This game has a lot of plot twists that could shock you. The ending is probably the most happily depressing story I ever experienced since Persona 3's ending.

In short, this is probably one of the most disturbingly unique and funniest horror story with the most depressing and bittersweet ending ever.

I bought this game for very cheap during steam sale. I cannot finish it, but I don't really mind. I hope someday I could continue it again, but I appreciate the writing of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268165916', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 2342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2342, 'last_played': 1484216559}
review:
[h1] Как сделать из девушки Богиню. Большая тайна маленького американского городка[/h1]

Очень многие крутые проекты проходят мимо ПК-бояр, так как остаются эксклюзивами для консолей. Я очень благодарна, что Deadly Premonition решили официально выпустить в стиме. Вас будет ждать мистическое и в тоже время опасное расследование в городке Гринвейл. Главный герой агент ФБР Йорк - сам одна большая загадка. Интересно, кто же такой Зак? Откуда появился шрам над бровью? Если вам нравятся детективы и сложные персонажи, а также вы не боитесь устаревшей графики - это определенно проект для вас!

Плюсы
[list]
    [*][u]Великолепная история[/u], которая будет держать вас в напряжении до самого конца и ответит на все вопросы, накопившиеся во время прохождения.  
    [*]Интересные [u]побочные квесты[/u], которые позволят  больше узнать о каждом жителе городка.
    [*][u]Живые второстепенные персонажи[/u]. Они все проработаны до мельчайших деталей: история, ритм жизни, внешность.  
    [*][u]Открытый мир[/u]. Вы можете в любой момент сесть в автомобиль и заниматься побочными квестами на другом конце карты. 
    [*][u]Что еще вам предоставит Гринвейл[/u]: рыбалка, игра в дартс, стрит-рейсинг, уборку подсобки магазина, гардероб из костюмов на любой вкус и т.д. Да и еще, не забывайте бриться и менять одежду. Если этого не делать, будет наложен денежный штраф и появятся мухи, которые будут виться вокруг, словно вы кусок го...на. 
    [*][u]Запоминающиеся саундтреки[/u].
[/list]

Минусы 
[list]
    [*][u]Графика[/u] на уровне начала двухтысячных. Не так давно я знакомилась с переизданием игры [url=store.steampowered.com/app/312840/][u]Fahrenheit[/u][/url]. Кровь текла из глаз, но я делала скидку на год издания (2004). Здесь же 2010. Возможно, причины кроются в том, что Deadly Premonition выходила первоначально на консолях. Но поверьте, даже несмотря на такой "ужас", сюжет затянет вас настолько сильно, что вы перестанете обращать внимание на такие мелочи, как кривые задники и плохую мимику персонажей.
    [*]У меня игра [u]дважды зависала, раз пять вылетала[/u]. Сохраняйтесь как можно чаще. Так же есть отличный гайд, как побороть проблемы технического характера. 
[/list]

Боялась сказать лишнего в обзоре, чтобы не спойлернуть. Но могу сказать точно, что буду советовать эту игру своим друзьям, как хороший образец  необычной игры. У меня потекла ностальгическая слеза. Этот проект напомнил мне старые игры серии [u]Silent Hill[/u], особенно вторую часть, которую мы все так сильно любим. 

Еще одна интересная детективная история от японских разработчиков - [u][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/358090/D4_Dark_Dreams_Dont_Die_Season_One/]D4: Dark Dreams Don’t Die[/url][/u]. Мой обзор на нее [u][url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198268165916/recommended/358090]вот здесь[/url][/u].

[h1]Огромное спасибо, что дочитали обзор до конца ( ･｡･) ˜ ♡[/h1]
Если хочешь посмотреть, как я прохожу игры, подписывайся на [u][url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3eG5g9nBndjLXwz4UGaMag]мой канал YouTube[/url][/u]

author: {'steamid': '76561197976910489', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1669461674}
review:
I can see why Deadly Premonitions has such a cult following. The game certainly has a peculiar, low-budget charm to it. The combination of Twin Peaks weirdness, Silent Hill otherworldliness, and cheesy TV sitcom-inspired humor is ridiculous...but it works. At least, it works when it's not crashing.

And boy, does it crash! Crashes occur so frequently that I'm often unable to reach another save point between CTDs. I've lost progress so many times now that I really just can't force myself to give it another shot. After 18 hours, I can truthfully say that I made a serious effort to enjoy this game, but I'm done.

Look, I have a fairly high tolerance for the shortcomings of low-budget games; I can generally shrug off outdated graphics, minor bugs, bad voiceovers, clunky controls, etc. But 30 to 40 minutes of gameplay between crashes? Not even I'm willing to put up with that.

I wish I could recommend Deadly Premonitions...I just can't. The story and characters are often highly amusing, but the crashes are not. For what it's worth, if a stability patch ever comes out for this game then I'll happily give it another go and revise my rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133553834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1483552642}
review:
Creo que debo tratar este juego como lo que se merece. Es un grandísimo juego, si estás dispuesto a pasar por alto varios puntos.
Contras: El apartado técnico es para llorar; sufrirás crashes aleatorios, se te bloqueará la partida, etc. (se arregla en 5 minutos buscando en internet). 
              Los gráficos son incluso peores que en Xbox 360. 

Pros: El pueblo de Greenvale es impresionante. Puedes hacer millones de cosas en él; misiones secundarias, avanzar en la historia, pescar, jugar a los dardos, ir a los bares a hablar con la gente, etc.
         La historia es magnífica, con varios giros de guión que te dejarán con el culo torcido.
         Es uno de esos fantásticos juegos, en los que no sabes lo que va suceder a continuación. Puede pasar cualquier cosa; y, os lo aseguro, pasa cualquier cosa. 

En resumen, grandísimo juego, mal port. JUEGO(9/10) PORT(4/10)

author: {'steamid': '76561198250930396', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1546518331}
review: This may be a very good game, unfortunately it is a truly terrible port and virtually unplayable on my quad-core AMD. It is very evident that this is a shoddy effort (i.e. lack of screen resolution options, no key-remapping options) and the game itself, whilst not being graphically sophisticated by today's standards, runs at a shocking, indeed unplayably slow frame rate. Cannot recommend it unless you enjoy broken games that run like ****.

review:
If you're looking for a game with a reasonable or comprehensible story, good graphics and interesting combat system turn back right now and run away. The story of this game cannot be absolutely understood as even the creators don't know what it all actually is about.
Combat system is highly boring and enemies, well ... there are three main types : zombie, zombie with a gun and zombie moving along walls, which you will fight about 10 minutes with, without any sign of challenge or fun.
Still, it's one of the best game I've ever played and I can't tell why, as I think no one who ever played it can. There is something so lovely about Deadly Premonition ... As some may say, it's so bad from almost every point of view, that it's actually awesome.
But for good God do not buy it for full price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053984243', 'num_games_owned': 1268, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1697, 'last_played': 1482625112}
review:
Never in my entire life would I ever imagine giving Deadly Premonition a negative review. This is a FANTASTIC game, but the PC version is butchered beyond belief. It REALLY is as bad as people say. Heed everybody's warning.

I bought it cheap for about 2 dollars before really realizing what I was getting in to. Simply seeing "this is a bad port," wasn't enough to deter me. I've seen these comments elsewhere for games I really enjoyed playing the PC port of and thought, "It can't be THAT bad." But when your game immediately crashes on start up, you know you're going to have a bad time. 

This port is so butchered that somebody (independant from the company) made a patch to try and fix most of the issues that the game has. With the patch installed, I was able to get past the start-up screen. But, it still crashed. 

After much trial and error, I got this shit load of fuck to run in Windowed Mode in Windows 98 compatibiity (fullscreen makes the game crash even harder). Even then, the MAX amount of gameplay I would get at a time without it crashing was about 45 minutes. With that being said, I'm one of the lucky ones who actually got to play it with crashes that I could overcome. And I don't even know if I'd call that luck. 

The crashing isn't even consistant. Sometimes it's during a load screen, other times, it's when you're going to use an item out of the inventory. Sometimes, it's simply right in the middle of walking.. or when you're mid combat. The crashing also seems to intensify during rainy weather. It really ruins the game experience for me when I have to just hope and pray that the game doesn't crash on the next load screen. When I have to constantly say to myself, "Dear god, I hope there's a phone coming up soon." 

Your only hope is to save constantly. But the problem is that you can only save at phones, and if you are doing a Chapter Replay, you cannot save AT ALL. This is a huge problem if you're a completionist, or you want to just go back and do sidequests that are more useful (like the one for the radio). I lost so many man hours because the game would crash during a Chapter Replay, and all of my progress that I just made was gone. 

The game looks okay (graphically), but the frame rate is crappy. Sometimes York will have that "stutter" run because the game just can't keep up. In combat, I wasn't able to use the Grecotch (OP weapon that carries you through most of the game) because I just couldn't land a hit. Even while standing RIGHT in front of an enemy, hitting it from different angles, etc. Hits just weren't connecting, or it was delayed... I really don't know what the problem is. But in any case, every aspect of this game is ruined simply because it functions like garbage. I would have asked for my Steam refund, but it was already past the date in which I could return it, and I had poured so many "play" time in to it just trying to get the thing to work.. disappointing. 

The actual Director's Cut for the Playstation 3 is absolutely the best version hands down. If you really want to play this game, ignore the PC and Xbox versions entirely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044256478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1482081573}
review:
Il gioco ci pone davanti a una grafica mediocre, numerosi difetti audio/video di piccola e media entità, una giocabilità leggermente frustrante in alcuni passaggi e un gameplay a conti fatti composto da poche azioni ripetute, enigmi facili facili e un grado di sfida molto blando senza contare alcuni problemi tecnici davvero gravi (che richiedono il cambio di autorità sull'eseguibile del gioco per proseguire e simili procedure parecchio noiose).

Fatte queste premesse mi trovo comunque a dire che l'avventura che questo gioco può offrire resta una delle migliori  che io abbia mai vissuto.
Seppur con i suoi innegabili difetti DP resta è un vero e proprio cult.
Se riuscirete a passar sopra le sue pecche allora DP non potrà che catturarvi.
I suoi personaggi, le atmosfere alla Twin Peaks, l'enigma che si cela dietro l'assassigno, il protagonista York e il suo amico immaginario Zach, le visioni, la pioggio incessante, la nebbia, tutto è calibrato alla perfezione per farvi immergere in un'indagine di polizia sull'orlo del paranormale.

Vi basterà passare una prima ora a giocarlo per capire cosa può offrirvi. Un piccolo assaggio sarà abbastanza.
Un ottimo contenuto in una forma imperfetta resta comunque un ottimo contenuto.

Se avete amato i classici del passato fare un piccolo sforzo per giungere a compromessi con DP non sarà troppo impegnativo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116939136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 3399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3335, 'last_played': 1482534545}
review:
Due to Steam's character limit, the full review is available over at [url=https://gaolioccasionallyreviews.wordpress.com/2016/12/23/deadly-premonition-directors-cut-pc-review/]Gao Li Occasionally Reviews[/url]

[h1]3/10 A good game, sadly a terrible port[/h1]
For quite some time now, serial killers across the United States of America have been putting red tree seeds into the mouths of young women & displaying their dead bodies in the shape of the Algiz rune (ᛉ), sometimes referred to as the “life rune”. The most recent case in the (fictional) town of Greenvale, Washington is no different. Anna Graham, an 18-year-old teenager dreaming of making it big in the city, was brutally murdered, her tongue bitten out, her carcass disemboweled, & then hung up on a tree. This calls FBI Special Agent Francis York Morgan to the scene. Though an expert in homicide cases, this eccentric investigator, who only confides in his imaginary partner Zach, proceeds to turn the entire town upside down with his outspoken nature & unconventional methods.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=819672935
[h1]About the Game[/h1]
Deadly Premonition is a game with an outright cult following, but also, sadly, a rather problematic PC port. Its initial development started in 2004, but had to be halted in 2007. Eventually, production continued & it was released in 2010. By that time, several of its assets looked outdated, which surprisingly works in the title’s favor. The uncanny visuals, stellar framing, awkward animations, & at times strange voiceover all contribute to a slightly eerie atmosphere, whereas the funny dialogs & outright hilarious sound effects alleviate the mood just enough to not take the game too seriously.

The whole production was also so strongly influenced by David Lynch’s & Mark Frost’s Twin Peaks that it can feel like playing a video game adaptation. The series, like Deadly Premonition, takes place in a small, seemingly idyllic U.S. town where an FBI agent investigates a homicide case of a young girl &, in doing so, unravels a deep & dark secret surrounding the inhabitants while also engaging with ominous entities. In so far, Deadly Premonition, directed by Hidetaka Suehiro, feels like an homage to Lynch’s series, albeit with some prominent Japanese characteristics & tropes.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=808941736
[h1]The PC Port[/h1]
Sadly, the PC port of this cut suffers greatly under several issues, which buyers should know about beforehand. First of all, getting the game to work can be quite a chore & it won’t run on many a machine. I played this on a 32-bit, Windows Vista Home Premium, Intel Core 2 CPU, Nvidia GeForce 9500 GT, 3070 MB RAM, DX 11 & I know that it runs on a Lenovo G50-80E5 laptop with Windows 10. Despite that, Deadly Premonition: The Director’s Cut only has a 1280×720 p resolution with washed out colors. During sunny days in Greenvale, everything looks almost sepia. Apart from that, it occasionally struggles to keep a steady 30 fps. The situation became worrisome when, after fishing out some documents in Ep 3, Ch 17 & heading out to Harry’s mansion, Deadly Premonition started to suffer greatly with the frame rate dropping down & staying around 9 fps with my peer’s Lenovo laptop heating up from a temperature of 41°C (105,8°F) to 105°C (221°F). Verifying the integrity of the game cache, rebooting the game, or turning the machine off & on did not help, & the situation stayed this way up until entering the Galaxy of Terror pub in Ep 3, Ch 20. The only way the story could be continued at that time was to hurry to some objective, save, shut down the game, wait, start playing again, save, & so on.

Other bugs included one where the game had to be restarted, because a key item disappeared from the inventory, one where weapons could not be selected, York walking through a door heading towards Polly’s room in the Great Deer Yard Hotel & falling through the floor, the character of Quint driving be- instead of inside his car & glitching in & out of Richard’s trailer, the game crashing whenever trying to leave the A&G Diner in Ep 1, Ch 9, Nick Cormack’s car not moving during Ep 2, Ch 12, & frequent crashes throughout. One method to reduce the likability of the last one is, of course, to play the game in compatibility mode, but that increases loading times to almost a minute & it does not help against the memory leak, which will inadvertently cause a crash. The game also comes with previous DLC included, but they will often not be activated in-game. Lastly, the PC port is also supposed to have controller support, but has issues recognizing these.
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=817927018
[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Overall, apart from the driving, the crashes, the bugs, & the overheating, I enjoyed most of Deadly Premonition: The Director’s Cut. I believe that, provided readers have a platform where the game immediately works as intended, they will have a good time with this game. The characters are fun, the story overall intriguing (apart from the ending), & the premonitions truly work in the game’s favor. Nevertheless, I cannot, in good conscience, recommend a PC port that is this problematic & that might fry one’s computer. Even though I like it per se, I adviseto stay away from the PC port.

review:
One the most (if not the most) sympathetic and loveable protagonist in any video game i have played so far is Special Agent Francis York Morgan. He is really on par with Special Agent Dale Bartholomew Cooper. 
This game is not beautiful in graphical view, but it is beautiful in its setting and character design, in its story and voice acting.
Just one small tip at the end: Play it as it is and don't use the DP Crash Fix. I played the whole game without any problems, but when i used the fix to get a higher resolution it crashed often and at some point it crashed always in the same situation which made it impossible to continue. So i removed the DP Crash Fix and it worked again...

review: What I was able to play of this game was very interesting.  It borrows heavily from Twin Peaks, but turns the weird up to 11 pretty fast.  I was really interested to see what would happen next, and the story might be really great!  Unfortunately, I wouldn't know.  After fixing a few crashes early on I ran into a repeating crash to desktop that I spent more time trying to fix than I did playing the game, and in the end was still unable to get past.  It's a shame since despite the unpolished visuals, I was completely into the game (until I was staring at an error message on my desktop).  One of the worst ports I've ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995681616', 'num_games_owned': 1613, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1481581376}
review:
I have a lot of games in my Steam library, many of which may never be played, and a lot of them I don't bother playing because the AAA industry tends to make amazing graphics, but dull games.

This game didn't just have bad graphics, the controls were incredibly bad, the soundeffects and voice acting horrifying and the bugs... oh the bugs....

But let me tell you: after finishing I felt this was one of the best games I've played in a while. Grab it with a discount but give it a chance! It definitely worked out for me. It has something you just don't see too often anymore, namely a heart which lies beyond all the crap on the surface.

Do not refrain from purchasing this game, 
even if it seems dull, ugly and plain.

- so says Mr. Stewart.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992689211', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2069, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1998, 'last_played': 1481327190}
review:
The gameplay's terrible, the graphics are outdated and the controllers are stiff and yet this game really grasps and leads you down a bizzare road of it's own making. This ultimately a text book example of a so bad it's good game.

The story and characters are what really draw you in. It's set up as a lazy village grasped by the sudden murder of a young woman in a sleepy village and you as a FBI agent Francis York Morgan, Call him York everyone does must solve the case will dealing with the eccentric cast.

The characters include a effeminate police officer, a mask wearing disabled solcialite with his rhyming assistant and a pot lady constantly worrying about her pot getting cold. Your also are helped along by your imanginary friend who acts as your voice within the game isn't that right Zach?

You also have to contend with the shadow world and there enemies which are creepy but repitive. These sections are unfortnately rather much a slug and it's best to get through them quickly.

While i throughly enjoyed the game I had to lower the score and alas not recommend playing it on the PC as this probably the worst port I have ever played. The game constantly crashed on me in random intervals where there was no reliable fix for the problem. The standard version also didn;t allow for HD resolutions and without lock on it is impossible to play the game as you cannot properly aim in the game.

There are also the problem of some unanswered questions at the end of the game.

While i throughly enjoyed my experience i'd recommend people from staying away from the PC port and playing one of the console versions. It is also why i knocked the score down for this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158994226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 479, 'last_played': 1471115909}
review: The quality of Deadly Premonition, or DP, is a topic up for some debate. If you enjoy gripping storylines, cutting-edge graphics, streamlined gameplay, and a car that doesn't constantly screech at you like a banshee being put through a wood chipper feet first, DP is quite possibly the worst game ever made. However, if you, like me, think that a Video Game is something meant to entertain, DP may well be the best game ever made. So if you find yourself wondering whether DP is right for you, go down to your local diner and ask for the Sinner Sandwich, and tell em' I sent you. You'll feel like you're getting DP'ed in real life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164760643', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1721, 'last_played': 1528805692}
review:
Эта игра вошла в посвящённую играм версию ,,Книги рекордов Гиннесса,, как проект с самыми противоречивыми отзывами . Она имеет статус культовой игры .
Плюсы :
1. Сюжет. В этой игре он сделан для любителей сюрреалистичных и ,психологически, страшных игр . Он очень запутан , в нём очень много неожиданных моментов .
2. Атмосфера. Она очень сильно складывается с сюжетом . И она отлична вписывается в мир игры.
3. Открытый мир . Если эта игра придётся вам по душе , то вы даже после окончания основного сюжета будете проходить дополнительные квесты , собирать коллекционные предметы , исследовать мир , так как это всё очень хорошо вписывается в всю сюрреалистичную составляющую данной игры . 
4. Музыка . Она очень хорошо вписывается в мир игры и придаёт ему некоторую таинственность . 
Минусы:
1. Оптимизация . В этой игре она  плоха . В ней куча багов , у некоторых даже встречаются частые вылеты .
2. Геймплей . Для некоторых он нормальный , а некоторым он быстро надоедает . Так как он , практически , не меняется всю игру . Вы будете на протяжении всей игры стрелять и ездить на машине .
3. Управление . В этой игре на клавиатуре и мышке очень трудно играть . Оно сделано ужасно, особенно езда на машине .
4. Графика . Для того года в котором создали эту игру она убогая и отвратильная . Например в неё текстуры сделали  низкого качества .
Итог. Эта игра для некоторых покажется шедевром , а для некоторых очень плохим проектом . Взвесьте для себя плюсы и минусы этой игры и подумайте стоит ли её покупать . А для это игра получилась шедевром .

author: {'steamid': '76561198012654426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 949, 'last_played': 1480790562}
review:
This game from what I have played so far, is really really good. The story and investigation is interesting and really makes you want to think about what could be right. The port of this is as bad as everyone makes it out to be, but DPFix tool can easily fix a lot of problems and restarting your computer once you have installed it fixes even more. Crashes are pretty rare, but they give a lot of save points so its been fine so far.
Driving in this game is like GTA but even worse control and every surface is made of ice. The talks you have in the car passes the time by pretty well. The game is suprisingly humours while still able to keep a very good feel to the horror parts. 
The level designs are extremely atmospheric and the music in this game is great. The developers reference reality and themselves throughout the game and its pretty nice to catch on to them when they do make them.
The game feels like a PS2 game should, its not something I feel on most games now adays and its really good feeling to go back in time. I strongly suggest this game even with the crashing problems from the port, most problems can be fixed with enough research and the DPfix Tool

author: {'steamid': '76561197970912988', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1417721612}
review:
Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut für den PC ist ein Spiel mit vielen Problemen. Es ist verbuggt, auch in den Konsolenfassungen, von Abstürzen geplagt und die Steuerung - zumindest die Tastatursteuerung - vor allem bei den Quick Time Events, mies.

All diese Probleme werden allerings vom Charme und Charakter des Spiels aufgewogen. Die Story ist toll, die Charaktere interessant, der Mix aus Adventure, Survival Horror und Open World funktioniert sehr gut. Das Setting erinnert auf sehr positive Art und Weise an Twin Peaks. In gewisser Art und Weise ist Deadly Premonition sogar besser als Twin Peaks, da die Story abgeschlossen ist und von vorne bis hinten durchdacht und geplant war.

Würde ich Deadly Premonition für den PC weiterempfehlen? Ja! Man sollte allerdings etwas Sitzfleisch haben, um sich durch die Abstürze und Tastatur-Steuerung (falls man mit Tastatur spielen will) durchkämpfen zu können.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979748860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1480402914}
review:
Without spoiling the game and giving away what makes this so special, I will simply say that Deadly Premonition is one of the most underrated and brilliant video games ever created.  Full applause and credit to the one and only Swery65 for making a game that despite it's major shortcomings (controls, graphics, PC optimization) is the most engrossing and intelligent games out there.  And again without spoiling anything, has the best twist in a story that proves just how important the video game medium is.

If you're even remotely interested in this game, just pick it up.  Especially at such a cheap price ($2.49 as of this review), you'll be getting a game that you can sink hours into playing and days upon days discussing with your friends.  Just be sure to look up some of the user made patches like DPFix to get the most out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021345811', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1434955119}
review: Deadly Premonition is weird. that is true. it's also eerily close in themes and plot to Twin Peaks, a show which the creator of Deadly Premonition claims to have never heard of. The graphics are uncanny valley, the writing seems purposefully enigmatic and strange, and the plot seems right out of an episode of the X-Files while still trying to play itself straight. But these are all reasons why Deadly Premonition is one of the greatest mystery games of all time. Engross yourself in the culture of a small american town as seen through the eyes of a japanese videogame developer. Take control of Agent Francis York Morgan as he reads the future in the clouds of his coffee, and shoots plant zombies while wearing a bright orange suit. Get paid by the goverment for shaving. And most of all, embrace the weird, and you might find yourself seeing the game for the piece of art that it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995256352', 'num_games_owned': 658, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1414398856}
