author: {'steamid': '76561198212783200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1944, 'last_played': 1605834073}
review:
[i]"Я не требую от тебя благодарности за свою неоднозначную помощь. Но я хочу, чтобы ты понял, что иногда для правильных поступков нужно принимать на первый взгляд плохие решения. 


Окей Зак, думаю, грех будет не вспомнить, как мы с тобой когда-то проходили Deadly premonition. 

Помнишь, как мы в первый раз пытались запустить её? Мы сильно  удивились, когда ничего не вышло. Пришлось возиться с ней несколько часов, но я не о чём не жалею. Как только у нас удалось её запустить, игра тут же нас затянула. 

Не могу не вспомнить, как был проработан каждый диалог, и всё это было вперемешку с интригующим сюжетом. Особенно мне понравилось игра Ребекки Винк, она озвучивала Эмили… А Гарри, помнишь его? Его загадки просто сносили мне крышу! Никак не мог понять бредит он или играет со мной. А помнишь, как мы собирали карточки, и проходили побочные квесты? Было здорово, тебе особенно нравились миссии с ездой, а я предпочитал задания замешанных на всяких мини играх. Это был интересный опыт… 

Наверное, именно таких игр сейчас не хватает. Но куда же без ложки дёгтя, верно Зак? Стоит упомянуть, что специальную PC версию сделали слишком лёгкой. Из-за этого экшен в игре стал более простым, однако в компенсацию этому они добавили вырезанные сцены, чтобы расширить сюжет. Это хорошо, но всё же, я бы предпочёл более сложный игровой процесс.
Знаешь Зак, я бы, пожалуй, сыграл в неё ещё раз… Интересно у SWERY будут ещё подобные проекты? Если да то, наверное, не скоро. Буду ждать его возвращения в игровую индустрию."[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198043903124', 'num_games_owned': 517, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1029, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1669868832}
review:
This game runs poorly, even if you install DPFix. It doesn't look very good. It controls poorly. The combat, hiding, and evasion scenes are even poorly designed, before you get to controlling them. I've had it crash several times. I've only played a short bit on PC to see how it would run, after completiting it on Xbox 360, and I've had force-quits multiple times. I've even heard of bugs that can prevent you from completing the game, which is the entire reason to play the game.  

But this game is enchanting. The story and characters, as much as you can say they are stolen from Twin Peaks, are fascinating and engaging. You will likely have numerous fits of laughter as you experience the quirky animations and dialogue. And the plot goes into perhaps even stranger and disturbing depths than Twin Peaks did. It's worth your time to stick with the game, even if the game is not to your liking, because the story is not to be missed.

That said, if a game that has numerous technical issues is going to bother you, then you shouldn't play it. You can experience the story elsewhere, and get most of the enjoyment from watching it as you would playing it, without having to struggle through what most people would consider a negative experience of completing the game's often tedious "dungeon" segments. 

(EDIT: There are more fixes popping up over time, such as CFF Explorer being able to edit the .exe file to improve performance, making the game large address aware to do the same, mods to improve or customize the appearance of the game, and fixes to controller support. Overall, it's not the mess it was 5 years ago, but it's still very rough. And it still crashes, even with every fix you might try. Runtime errors still plague the game, at least for me. Check the PCGamingWiki before you even start it, just to know the amount of problems this port has. I still can't recommend it at full price. Get the Xbox 360 version, or the Switch version, which are more stable. Or wait for a discount to $5 or less, unless you're willing to risk running out of time to refund it if you can't find a fix.)

I would say to absolutely wait for sales, even if you really want the game, and know you will enjoy it. This game goes on sale for as much as 90% off fairly regularly, such that I've purchased extra copies for others on several different occasions in the last few years, so you won't have to wait long to get a deal. I first purchased it for $15, as the original release on the Xbox 360, and didn't regret it one bit, but not everyone will get that same enjoyment, or have the same feelings. I can't recommend it at normal price, but cannot recommend it enough for $2.50-$5. Games like this make the binary recommendation system so difficult.

(EDIT: Changed to "Recommend" because I've had no crashes since implementing fixes.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198092673305', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1426343018}
review:
This is not the best game I've played but it's by far one of the most beloved. The characters are all awkward and charming and they really set this game apart from other games and makes for a very unique experience.

The fighting mechanics could be better and I feel like the game would have benefitted from less combat in general.
If you don't mind trudging through the boring parts to get to experience something fun, bizarre, awkward, and utterly charming then this is the game for you.

The FBI is very invested in traffic cones, for example, and will either deduct pay or award you a bonus for running them over. They also care a lot about your hygiene and fashion choices.
Are you running three days late for an important meeting? No big deal. Go fish for a while and then come back the next day to keep trying to solve a murder.

It's brilliant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014454135', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1501439446}
review:
Es una experiencia alucinante si consigues meterte de verdad en el papel del agente York: dar vueltas por el pueblo, hablar con los habitantes, buscar pistas, seguir in fraganti a los sospechosos y ver qué hacen por las noches, conocer sus hobbys,... todo ayuda a la investigación fuera de la propia historia.

Si buscas un survival de acción, creo que no es el juego adecuado. Tengo entendido que las fases de acción fueron introducidas forzosamente por el estudio por miedo a que no vendiera en occidente si no había disparos, se nota mucho que está metido con calzador, el control es muy malo y da cierta sensación de que sólo sirve para interrumpir la verdadera experiencia de la investigación.

Si hubiera salido hoy mismo, sería un walking-simulator indie y la gente lo estaría flipando, porque ya estamos acostumbrados a juegos que se basan 100% en al narrativa. Pero eran otros tiempos y simplemente se le etiquetó como survival horror, y evidentemente no cumplió en ese aspecto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965135055', 'num_games_owned': 331, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2427, 'last_played': 1421188197}
review:
I mean, the game is objectively bad in many ways. I'm not going to tell you differently. But the ways in which it are bad are honestly what make it so amazing.

The absolute silliness of the plot, yet still manages to be surprising at points. The characters in the town itself whch give you ridiculous ass quests that make no sense. The ridiculously realistic driving simulator that makes the drive between missions actually be like 5 minutes of driving with no other action. It's so good and yet... well.

it's one of those games you have to play through at least once, probably twice, to really appreciate. It's just uhh... play it. It's easily one of my favourite games ever, and I honestly have no idea why.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984850717', 'num_games_owned': 1768, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3059, 'last_played': 1562060127}
review:
Do you like games by Hidetaka Suehiro (Swery65)? Do you like the works of David Lynch such as Twin Peaks? Then BUY THIS GAME.  Then download Durante’s fix DPfix 0.9.5 (or what ever is latest.) This game is the unofficial Twin Peaks videogame you didn’t know you needed in your life to fill that dark void you had since you hit puberty. The world of this game just oozes with charm, character, and intrigue. Sure this game is a terrible port that needed community fixes, but with all of the game’s flaws it still a unique must play master piece that is the truest example of videogames as art that is actually a videogame and not a walking simulator.

-Note
BUY THE DIRECTOR'S CUT - DELUXE EDITION! You will thank me. This game's soundtrack is so campy it should be archived as a musical master piece. You will want the music in the game with you for the rest of your life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046114529', 'num_games_owned': 758, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1551640006}
review:
Deadly Premonition findet größtenteils in 3D mit Sicht über die Schulter statt. Entweder man läuft/fährt während der FBI-Ermittlung durch die Gegend oder man wird in eine Schattenwelt geworfen in der man mit Waffen die Zombie/Geist-Gegner niedermäht.

Action Gameplay ist eintönig, und viele Rätsel wirken wie aus nem billigen Adventure. Die Steuerung ist teils widerspenstig (Zielen mit der Waffe), teils sehr sensibel (Autofahrten).

Die Grafik is unterdurchschnittlich, die Animationen oft unfreiwillig komisch. Gesichtszüge schwanken meistens zw. festgefahrenem Grinsen, arroganter Selbstsicherheit oder erstaunten bis entsetzten Blick. 

Die Musikgestaltung besteht größtenteils aus 4-5 Lieder. Die Hintergrundmusik wechselt meist von einem einfachen Ohrwurm zu einer einfachen Action/Gruselthematik. Es gibt aber auch ein paar besondere musikalische Untermalungen.

[b][u]Warum also empfehle ich dieses Spiel?[/u][/b]

Deadly Premonition hat einfach eine der besten mitreißenden Mystery-Mörder Stories die man erleben sollte. Wer Twin Peaks mag, wird wahrscheinlich auch diese Story mögen (oder sich wegen den ganzen Anleihen die Haare raufen). Die Geschichte ist blutig und geht in die Extreme sodass man stellenweise sogar froh über die grobe veraltete Grafik sein kann.

Die Erzählung hat ihre Schwächen, gerade wenn auflockernde Szenen eingestreut sind wirkt das oft surreal, schlecht übersetzt oder so als hätten die Autoren überhaupt keine Ahnung wie Menschen humorvoll miteinander umgehen. Dies wird durch die Traumsequenzen, Mörderszenen und der generellen Hintergrundgeschichte aber mehr als ausgeglichen.

Gespielt wird in Kapiteln. Je nach Kapitel kann man sich unterschiedlich weit von der Haupterzählung entfernen. Dies betrifft dann das Erkunden von Greenvale und das Einsammeln von nicht gerade dezent platzierten Sammelobjekten. Ebenfalls kann man auch den wenigen Bürgern von Greenvale bei ihrem Tagwerk zuschauen oder deren Miniquests erledigen.

Dennoch schafft es dieser recht einfache Spielaufbau einen nach und nach die Personnen von Greenvale näherzubringen und man fühlt sich immer wieder mitgerissen wenn sich eine neue Erkenntnis im Fall vom Regenmantelmörder ergibt.

Von daher: wenn das Spiel mal billig zu haben ist, greift zu!

review:
Die Story ist wirr und irre, aber ausgesprochen unterhaltsam. Leider ist auch die überarbeitete Steuerung des Director's Cut noch immer grauenvoll, mit Controller läßt es sich aber einigermaßen spielen.

Kurz: Eine kuriose Mischung aus FBI-Mordermittlung und Horrorsurvival in einer Open-World Kleinstadt.

Alle Charaktäre sind maßlos überzogen dargestellt, teilweise komplett durch. Der Ort zieht wohl nicht nur Serienmörder an, sondern auch andere Verrückte. Der Hauptdarsteller FBI-Agent Francis York Morgan tickt offensichtlich auch nicht ganz richtig und unterhält sich nicht nur mit seinem imaginären Freund Zach, sondern auch seinem Kaffe.

Komplett irre Twin-Peaks-artige Story mit fantastischem Soundtrack.

Wer nicht immer nach der besten Grafik sucht, mit einer etwas hakeligen Steuerung zurecht kommt und den nervtötenden Motorensound ertragen kann, dem sei Deadly Premonition absolut empfohlen.
Erkundet zwischen durch mal die Stadt oder geht Angeln.

Wer es nicht scheut manuell einen Patch zu installieren, sollte DPFiix von Durante downloaden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203027865', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2721, 'last_played': 1479046445}
review:
Deadly Premonition,  ¿Qué es?  Simplemente, un Diamante en bruto, cuando acabas de pulir esta joya y que descubres como  evitar,  disminuir o afrontar  los “crasheos” descubres que detrás de la áspera  y burda jugabilidad se encuentra  una de las de las mejores historias dentro de del mundo de los videojuegos  ¿y por qué no? dentro de las artes audiovisuales,  ¿Que si exagero?  Tal vez,  pero desde mi humilde opinión  y experiencia  es uno de los videojuegos con una de las mejores tramas que jamás haya disfrutado porque eso es lo que sucedió que disfrute mucho de este título.

-Lo bueno: todo lo relacionado a la trama, dígase personajes, locación, ambientación  y por supuesto la estructura de dicha trama el planteamiento, desarrollo y desenlace (y vaya desenlace), la música genial el soundtrack.

-Lo malo: 1- la jugabilidad, estrictamente en  el manejo del personaje,  ya sea a pie en vehículo o en combate  bastante rustica por así decirlo.  2- los problemas técnicos, iluminación, sombras  y “crasheos” principalmente.

+Consejo: tus mejores amigos para disfrutar y avanzar en este juego son, los puntos de guardado, la compatibilidad con win 98 y el modo ventana, con esas tres cosas podrás avanzar en la historia si te llegas a quedar estancado.

+Conclusión: a pesar de todo lo malo que puede tener este juego, lo bueno del mismo vale 100 veces más. ¿lo recomendaría? 
R= SI .

A very different game which is strange is a good way. The gameplay is very quirky and sometimes glitchy but somehow it fits the style of the game. Overall it benifits from its unique blend of comedy and "horror". The story and its progression are well done and keep you engaged and coming back despite the other technical issues with the game (crashs and corrupt saves). I would recommend backing up saves every chance you get. In all, I really enjoyed the experience and it has come to be a game that I will never forget. I purchased the game on sale for about $2.79CDN but I would have been happy with paying a little more.

Overall, it is an extremely unique game that is unlike anything I have experienced before. It has made a lasting impression on me that I will not be forgetting anytime soon.

review:
- Horrible port
- Constant crashes
- Wonky and buggy driving physics
- Poor graphics
- Terrible map and navigation system
- The open world is almost completely empty
- Some awful voice acting
- Nonsensical dialogue and writing
- Ridiculous characters and situations
- Combat so derivative and crappy I can see them going "Hmm, yeah, this didn't turn out so great... Let's just add a bunch of easily obtainable cheat weapons as standard otherwise no one's going to bother slogging through this."

And despite (and a bit because) all of the above the game still manages to be utterly charming in that very peculiar Japanese way, it's a bit like Twin Peaks presented in the style of House of the Dead 2, and I sunk nearly 50 hours 100%-ing the game (including many, many restarts trying to work around bugs and problems or replaying sections due to crashes.) Common sense dictates the list above should really have precluded that, but somehow the essence of the game just made me embrace it all.

I don't quite know either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140677599', 'num_games_owned': 1820, 'num_reviews': 203, 'playtime_forever': 1273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1617809776}
review:
This is my first ever Steam review and unfortunately it’s going to be more of a fix suggestion than a review (my review was very long initially but Steam wouldn’t allow me to submit it so I had to chop it considerably). I was able to fix this game (so that it ran) fairly quickly. Here's how I did it:

1. Go to where the game is installed on your PC. For me it's at C > Program Files (x86) > Steam > steamapps > common > Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut
2. Open the redist file and double-click the application called PhysX_SystemSoftware (.msi)
3. Select the Repair option and let it run through completely. 
4. When that's finished, launch the game again. 
NOTE: I should point out that I AM running the game in compatibility mode (Windows XP SP3). For me, this fix worked immediately. I DID NOT download the 4GB patch that's been suggested! I hope this helps some of the people who were having trouble. 

Do I recommend this game? Yes! I can't recommend it enough. In fact, it's one of my favorite games of all-time (I played the 360 version previously).  However, if you are expecting not to have to caress this game softly in order to make it purr – it is probably not for you!

If you are willing to put in a little effort though - I think you will be pleasantly surprised at everything you get out of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066130586', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1569693834}
review:
-"What do you think Zack?"
Достатчно хороший детективный-сурвайвал-хоррор-ипылинкаRE4 (звук блендера который смешивает ебучие жанры так, будто ему есть до этого дело.)
Кат-сцены побольшей части срежисированы на достаточно хорошем уровне, и фри плей пытается быть разнообразным, но получается у него это на один раз.
Доп квестов достаточно много, но пока доберешься хотя бы до одного, это будет убийствено.
Крайные печали этой игры:
-Вождения транспорта, которое такое статичное, что лучше иметь купить тачку и подготовить что нибудь на фон, ибо вас попросят иногда ездить на такие большие расстояния, что лучше убиться сразу.
-Карта игры нереально большая с большим количеством дорог, и при этом нет GPS, и каждый раз когда открываешь карту, оказывается что ты ехал всё это время не по той дороге.
-Может (почти) везде и есть полицейский транспорт, но топливо тратся так быстро, а заправка во всей игра ОДНА.
-Разнообразия квиктайм эвентов и среди врагов нет.
-Дождь всего лишь полу-прозрачная гифка на мониторе и громкостью 50,000 тратилов.
Итого:
Игра, не смотря на минусы, довольно неплохо играется, и чем дальше идешь по следу маньяка, тем ИНТЕНСИВНЕЙ становится игра.
6/10 или 7/10.

review:
"These Steam reviews are making me go to another town in the boondocks again... But this is one of the best games I have ever played... wouldn't you agree, Zack? ..." - me.

"Don't ask me about Zack...." - me.

*longer pause*

"You just take it easy. I'll bring your coffee out in just a moment" - Steam.

"Thank you for making this game available, Steam, but I have to warn you though. I am very particuar about the use of coffee in video games. The very best you have, please." - me

"I understand. I'll be right back with it" - Steam.

*looks with interest*

"Did you see that, Zack? Realistic coffee usage in a video game... This game never fails. Now then, let's get going!" - me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198112740930', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1940, 'last_played': 1414954461}
review:
10/10
che dire...un capolavoro assoluto!
di solito non mi sbilancio nelle recensioni ma questo titolo...bhe è qualcosa di unico.
La storia di "Deadly Premonition" ci vede coinvolti in una indagine in un piccolo paese di montagna in America, dove strani omicidi attirano l'attenzione del nostro agente del FBI Francis York Morgan, caffeinomane dalle spiccate doti investigative.
Subito l'impatto visivo ci fa immergere in un "twin peaks " giocabile...l'estro del personaggio, gli omicidi e i personaggi secondari sono così perfettamente incastrati tra loro che sembra di vivere la storia mentre si sta attaccati ore e ore per sbloccare ogni singolo achievement (cosa non per niente facile).

Ma tecnicamente come lo descriveremmo questo titolo?
è si un open world, ma è anche un survival horror e anche un'avventura grafica...è la summa dei giochi a mio parere!
Certo la grafica è quella di un gioco del 2010 e i comandi sono legnosi (Resident Evil 0 like) ma niente, niente può mettere in cattiva luce questo gioco perchè semplicemente : TI DIVERTE, LO AMI E QUANDO LO FINISCI I DISCORSI DI fRANCIS TI MANCHERANNO.

è un CULT GAME, eccome come definirlo e andrebbe comprato pure a prezzo pieno!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996949424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1479963643}
review:
Nominated for the "Game within a game" Award.

(Review updated 11/23/2016)
I first played this game many years ago on the Xbox 360. I then got it on steam from my better half. 
I started to play it ( back in the day) because it looked silly.. AND at the time it got a review of 1/10 ( that has since been changed to a better score) but the game showed me it was much more than silly voice acting and odd characters. 

This is a wonderful game with a deep story.  VERY campy. Based around a show called Twin Peaks. Yes, there are some issues.  Controller issues, things like that.. but playing the game is worth it even with the small issues.  
This game is not for everyone! As i said it is very campy. Some might not understand this.( or it is not their type of humor) Try to give it a chance you might love it. 

There is a mod out there to make the game easier to play ( more choices for screen size, better map and that)
It is called DPfix 0.9.5 ( http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/?p=438 ) be sure to get the newest one. I gave an older one by mistake and the map was so messed up. 
Watch these videos to see! (I think it was the wrong one for 9 eps.. OOPS!! That was my fault. I am sorry.)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hzdoQgmWeuk&list=PLIhNUXJ4tecf0iG2Jht0dsYiPsOFhMY03


I nominated it for  the "Game within a game" Award because this game has so many things to do in it.  You can fish, drive around and a few other silly things that makes the game a little less spooky without taking away from the gem that it is. 

If you ever liked Twin Peaks.. you might like this game!
If you tried the game and hated it... Give it another chance. Go in excepting nothing. you might be surprised how much you like it. 

If you loved the game, Go check out Twin Peaks. 
F.K. in the coffee. 
Clear as a crisp spring morning!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970345303', 'num_games_owned': 890, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1832, 'last_played': 1479949354}
review:
One of, if not the most divisive video games ever created, there's good and bad with this game. 

To be fair, yes the game suffers from stiff controls, very outdated graphics and animations (even 
when it first released as I understand it was to be a ps2 game originally), but for me, this game
was like falling out of an airplane midflight, only to land safely in a hot tub at the Playboy Mansion
on trampoline night.

To be sure, there's a definite influence from the tv show Twin Peaks (I've only seen the first episode
of the show and can safely make this claim), but the supernatural story, the memorable weird and 
unique characters you can't help but fall in love with, the twists, open world to explore, humor,
atmosphere, and adventure that bleeds its own distinct charm, this is one I'll always remember. 

Highly recommended despite its shortcomings, I would tell everyone to at least give this a try. 
Or at the very least, watch a lets play.

The monkey screaming Squirrels in the opening cutscene should let you know exactly the sort of 
experience you're in for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010162373', 'num_games_owned': 794, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2187, 'last_played': 1474467581}
review:
Short review: It's the Donnie Darko of video games.
(Note: Nominated for the "Whoooaaaaaaa, dude!” Award and not just because it's the first time I've ever seen a squirrel in a video game scream like a monkey, thought that scene definitely helped)

Long review: A very divisive game -- it's quirky, hopping between tragedy and comedy at the drop of a hat, rife with amusing (and in hindsight meaningful) esoteric movie and music references, awkward jokes and some of the most amazing plot twists I've ever seen in a video game. It references Twin Peaks and Silent Hills quite a bit, but the surreal nature, web of intrigue and bizarre metaphysical  discussions that regularly crop up in the game are more like a cross between Donnie Darko, Hot Fuzz and Youth in Revolt. 

- Combat: it was added late in development, and wasn't originally planned. It boils down to third-person over-the-shoulder shooting and melee in creepy "nightmare" levels along with non-combat QTE-smashing chase sequences. Some shooter-enthusiasts might not be impressed, but I actually liked the action levels.
You aren't pressed for resources, since you start out with a pistol with infinite ammo and are bound to find unbreakable or infinite ammo weapons along the way. You can't save whenever, but only in certain places (in combat levels, these are safe houses that are pretty few and far between).

- Open World: a large portion of the game is spent in a sim-like open world, like Dead Rising but without the Zombies. You can go fishing, undertake sidequests, look for collectibles, replay combat levels, or just explore (read: fool around and dig up quirks about the NPCs). There is an in-game clock that you have to pay attention to -- the good news is that you can replay chapters in order to do the things you missed the first time around.
(The sidequests give good rewards and reveal a lot of fascinating backstory, so they're a definite win in my books.)

- Music and Voice work: The VAs are spot-on. There is a lot of dialogue in this game, and more than a few awkward moments, and the performers do a fantastic job in tackling both, in my opinion. The music is pretty iconic. The soundtrack is limited, but the few melodies and songs that it has are memorable and cathartic. 

- Genre: This game is definitely /not/ a survival horror. It is a paranormal mystery and a tragicomedy combined with an open world and shooter mechanics. There are some pretty gruesome moments, perhaps even a few eerie moments, but very little that can be considered proper horror (except perhaps the chase sequences, which will catch you by surprise the first time around).

- Story: There's very little I can say about the story without spoiling it or making it sound like I'm recapping Twin Peaks. Believe me, it is a popular misconception that this game is a copy of Twin Peaks -- it definitely is more than that. 
The basic premise is that you play an FBI detective who has a split-personality and specializes in serial killings. He comes to a sleepy, seemingly harmless American townlet where a prom queen's been murd- okay, I've started describing Twin Peaks. You get the picture. Although the game leaves off on a premise that is basically Twin Peaks, it deviates very early on into a multi-layered network of conspiracy that involves the military, demons, and more than one serial killer. 

- Technical issues: I haven't encountered many glitches, but due to an unfortunate chain of events that had nearly sent the game to development hell -- events that were beyond the studio's control -- the PC port has a serious issue with memory leaks. My GPU was overheating like crazy, followed by crashes and freezing. I got the situation under control with some fixes and patches, and luckily the memory problem didn't get dire until the last few levels. I recommend playing in windowed mode, and leaving open an app that monitors your GPU temp -- if you have the know-how, I also recommend setting up a more rigorous GPU fan profile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971312934', 'num_games_owned': 392, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1387, 'last_played': 1672829271}
review:
[i]The balance of milk and butter you've achieved here... oh my...[/i]

Even though some foibles and abject crashes occur throughout each playthrough, I still highly regard this as an all time personal favorite of mine.
It is hard to pinpoint exactly what it is that makes me adore this game so much. Maybe it is the idiosyncratic nature of each character, it might be the alluring soundtrack accompanying the game or it could also be due to all the different anecdotes spread out in the quirky town of Greenvale.

It's far from being a perfect game but what it delivers is a memorable taste in your mouth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011382353', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1263, 'last_played': 1443621174}
review:
Есть на свете геймдизайнеры с, явно, своим видением того, какой должна быть игра. Swery65 (он же Хидетака Суехиро) явно из таких людей, наравне с Suda51. 

Вышеназванный человек предложил людям мысль о том, каким бы был небезызвестный Твин Пикс, за авторством Девида Лича, будь он сделан в Японии. И вышло очень... по-японски. Но тот дух американской глубинки, которым славился первоисточник, передан здесь превосходно. Ведь в перерывах между миссиями здесь очень уж хочется зайти в кафе, заказать кофе и поболтать с местными аборигенами, а то и помочь им в чем-либо. Конечно, слепого следования по тропам Твин Пикса ждать здесь не стоит, но завязка здесь точь-в-точь, а главный герой - такой же экстравагантный агент ФБР и любитель кофе, как и Дейл Купер. Однако, видение японцев касательно мистики здесь дает о себе знать, не говоря уже об абсолютно трешовой концовке. 

Ах да, я не сказал, что саундрек писал Акира Ямаока? Запишите плюсом к этой игре, он тут просто прекрасный: то нагнетает, то дает расслабиться в поездке по лесам.

Дизайн врагов так и вовсе отдает Тихими Холмами... Но, надо сказать, такое паразитирование вышло очень даже хорошим. И это придало игре какой-то "свой", неповторимый шарм, который не спутаешь с другими играми.

Но, к сожалению, подвела техническая часть. ОЧЕНЬ ПОДВЕЛА. Ведь игру, попросту, невозможно пройти из-за фиксированных зависаний в некоторых местах, а dpfix чинит одни, но добавляет полтора новых, но уже контролируемых. 
 Признаюсь, это один из немногих случаев, когда почти каждые полтора часа мне приходилось что-то менять в конфиге игры, НО ВАШУМАТЬ ЭТО СТОИЛО ТОГО. Не говоря уже о графике, которая даже по меркам своего времени во время релиза на x360/ps3 была, мягко говоря, архаичной.

Для меня Deadly Premonition оказался воистину уникальным игровым опытом (а также опытом редактирования конфигов, да), и если для вас интересность игры превыше графики и всего остального, то вы ОБЯЗАНЫ пересилить эту игру. Она действительно уникальна и необычна, и стоит ваших нервов. Остальным можно поискать что-то менее геморное.

60%-й пальчик вверх для японофагов и любителей треша с восхитительной атмосферой и сюжетом.

author: {'steamid': '76561198182100471', 'num_games_owned': 1062, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2467, 'last_played': 1459594988}
review:
A technical mess of a game but if you just let it simply 'be' this is a game unlike most others out there. The game has a David Lynch inspired cooky story that goes in some surprising directions, the cast of characters are diverse and are fun to interact with.

A great game but also a terrible one. It's like a great B-Movie in that I can't recommend it to everyone but if you think you'll enjoy it you probably will... just give it a couple hours to sink in and come to the terms with the fact that the minute to minute gameplay is nothing to write home about!

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198033508187', 'num_games_owned': 2467, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2047, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2036, 'last_played': 1606589291}
review:
This game legitimately manages to be both the best and the worst experience I've had playing a game.

By default it's locked at 30 FPS and 720p, while crashing constantly.
Installing a fix for this doesn't actually fix the framerate issue causing it to change periodically AND change the game speed with it, as well as cause it to crash MORE.
It's a knock off of Twin Peaks despite SWERY claiming to have never heard of it
It's never getting an actual sequel due to the fact that SWERY has stopped making games to be a buddhist monk (Look it up I'm not bullshitting you)
The gameplay itself is unbearably boring

That said the wack-ass story and crazy characters/writing have elevated it to being one of the most memorable and fun experience I've had in a long time.

It's like $2.50 on sale the fact that only 2 people I know have it (One of which I gave it to) is a shame on all of you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053364379', 'num_games_owned': 1169, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2349, 'last_played': 1456156693}
review:
Deadly Premonition...
Игру можно или любить, или ненавидеть. Возможно, Вы проведете в игре пять минут и отправите ее в корзину, но тогда Вы пропустите одну из самых интересных детективных историй в мире игр.
Несмотря на техническое исполнение времен PS2, корявый геймплей и баги, игра очень ламповая. Временами бесила, но я ее прошел на одном дыхании и не жалею, что потратил на нее больше 50 часов.
Играть в DP или нет решать Вам! Большое количество более детальных обзоров (могут быть спойлеры и другая ненужная хурма) и огромная скидка на распродажах вам в помощь.
P.S. Я хочу кинуть плюсик в копилку этой игры, дабы она получила заветные "Положительные" рецензии.
P.S.S. Советую чаще сохраняться, чтобы не возникало проблем при прохождении, благо точек сохранения в игре предостаточно.

레드 시즈 프로파일이라고 합니다

일본게임이라고 밝히는 이유는 일본 게임 특유의

괴악함이 잘 드러나기 때문이며

검색엔진에 레드 시즈(시드) 프로파일 치면 PS3로 출시된 

원본게임을 해본 유저들의 평을 알수 있습니다.

비주얼이나 그래픽적 느낌은 서양게임 느낌이 물씬나고

일본 애니메이션 틱한 브금이 깔리면 그만큼 괴악한게 없었습니다

특히 브금 만든놈 면상 한번 갈기고 싶을정도로

듣기 불편하면서 힘 쭉 빠지는 브금을 반복해서 틀어줍니다.

ps3를 pc로 포팅했는데 포팅 품질이 최악입니다.

스팀 가이드 란들이, 오류없이 게임하는 법으로 가득 채워졌으면

말 다한거라고 보구요 

4채널 이상 스피커 지원못하고 오직 스테레오만 지원
스피커가 스테레오(2채널)가 아닐시
가끔 앞에서 나올 소리가 뒤에서 나오고, 운전시
타이어 끼이이익 거리는 소리가 반복해서 크게 들림

해상도 720p 고정에 옵션 변경 불가

시스템에 LAV 필터(코덱) 깔려 있으면 삭제하기 전까지 실행 조차 불가하며

외부 툴로 해상도 조절을 하거나, 옵션을 많이 줄수록 잘 튕겨서 왜 제작진이

(비디오 램이 적은 카드일수록 잘튕김

비디오램도 누수를 공유해서 튕기기 전조증상으로 

모델 텍스쳐가 깨집니다. 이거 보이면 1분내에 세이브 하고 꺼야합니다.

스토리파트는 램 누수가 적거나 없다시피해서 명백한 최적화 실패

모든 도전과제 달성하고 엔딩 보려고 선택 버튼누르는 순간 튕...

니가 이기나 내가 이기나 오기로 끝까지 했습니다.



총체적 난국 3

감독판의 추가요소가 서브퀘스트 발생을 막습니다.

여주인공 에밀리한테 스킨을 씌울수 있는데,  

이 스킨이 초반 에밀리 집에서 깰수있는 서브퀘 발동을 막아버립니다. 

서브퀘 발동조건이 비오는 날 저녁, 에밀리 위치가 집안일것 두가지 이며

이떄 에밀리가 집에서 일상복을 입어야 하는데 

스킨을 입고 있으니 퀘가 발동이 안돼는거 같네요

포럼에도 해결책이 없어서 많이 해멨습니다.

결국 스킨 벗기니까 퀘스트가 뜨네요 이뭐병..


이거 찾아내느라 플탐 10시간정도 쓴거같습니다.


ps3와 엑박판 버그..그대로 가져온건 애교

전설의 타바사 라는 낚시 컨텐츠용 퀘스트가 있습니다.

퀘스트 발동후 낚시하는 NPC에게 낚시대를 빌린후

전설의 대어를 낚는 간단한 이벤트지만.


조건이 비오는 밤에 해야합니다.

날씨가 몇몇 챕터 스토리 파트 이외에 랜덤이라 

15일을 지내도 밤에 비가 안오는 경우가 있음

거기다 PC판은 자고 일어나는거 반복하다가 램누수로 튕기면 환장해요

퀘스트 진행중 퀘스트를 안깨고 다음챕터로 넘어가거나

혹은 과거 챕터로 돌아가서 플레이한후 챕터 완료로 세이브 걸면


낚시대가 증발합니다. 퀘스트 완료 불가에요


플삼하고 엑삼유저는 이거때매 2회차까지 했다고 하는데

PC판은 hex 에디터로 사라진 낚시대 띄울수 있어서 다행입니다.....하...

https://www.gog.com/forum/deadly_premonition_directors_cut/your_rod_of_legends_disappeared_here_is_solution

해결책은 여기서.

제 플탐중 30시간은 버그랑 싸운 시간입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136847009', 'num_games_owned': 425, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 2013, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1951, 'last_played': 1479174622}
review:
[h1]Genre: Horror/Third-person shooter[/h1]

After finishing Deadly Premonition I must say that this was a very unique and very interesting experience. Game has a very good atmosphere, and somewhat creepy. I felt kinda odd at the beginning. Characters are very interesting too, and the voice acting is great. As for story, well it's a very interesting and a good story about some detective who comes to a small town to investigate the recent murder. Can't remember the last time when I played the game with such an interesting story. There is a supernatural stuff to the story too, in my opinion kinda more supernatural stuff than it was actually needed, but still good story overall, except for ending which is really bad and stupid. I expected some good closure, but got terrible. As for gameplay, well gameplay is pretty bad and repetitive, but still I found it fun at first. Good enough for this game anyway. While playing with keyboard, you can't aim with the mouse. With default controls you need to press space to go into the aim mode. Driving cars was actually fun and driving controls were fine. There are also a bunch of side missions that you can do in that town. You can fast travel too, however only if you complete some side mission and since I didn't know about that I went everywhere with a car.

Now for the quality of the port. This truly is a bad port. You need dpfix to be able to play the game without most issues. You can get dpfix here: http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/?tag=dpfix You just need to extract this to your game directory, and you can edit dpfix after that if you want. Without it, you won't be able to have resolution above 1280x720 I think. Also problems with crashes etc. I still did have crashes, but only in two episodes. So I just used save files that I found somehwere on the forum to be able to progress, since my game was constantly crashing at the same moments during these episodes. As for performances, I had a few minor issues.

[h1]Verdict:[/h1] Amazing atmosphere, somewhat creepy, very interesting and a good story with some good characters and the voice acting. Pretty bad port, but most issues can be fixed by using dpfix. I definitely recommend playing this game though, since it's a very unique experience and quite the good one.

[h1]Personal rating: 7.5/10[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025488540', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1457, 'last_played': 1479168443}
review:
Let's just get something out of the way here: this port is one of the worst ports I have ever had the displeasure of experiencing. Even after following a lengthy list of instructions and applying the DPFIx, DP: Directors' Cut features a butchered, shoddy port that is prone to frequent crashing, weird speed ups and slow downs, bizarre physics mishaps, corrupted saves, and a really, really weird issue where playing for more than two hours in one sitting can result in some... interesting... consequences for the engine.

And even if the game wasn't completely broken, it still suffers from a myriad of problems. The combat is abysmal. Not only does it feel tacked on, it literally is tacked on, as confirmed by Swery65, who explained that his publisher forced the decision in an effort to garner more sales. The combat is tedious, featuring only two distinct enemies: ones that die quickly with no effort and ones that take up five minutes of your time in pure tedium bullshit. If the combat is supposed to provoke a challenge, it is easily negated by how easily you can cheese the gameplay by acquiring infinite ammo and durability weapons early in the game, but not even instakill weapons can save you from a never ending supply of quicktime events.

Disregarding the gameplay, the graphics are incredibly poor. I'm not one to turn my nose at dated graphics, as some of my favorite games are before Steam was even a thing, yet Deadly Premonition released in 2010, the same year as Red Dead Redemption, Halo Reach, and Mass Effect 2. Going up against these games graphically is a bit ridiculous when the game looks like it came out in... 2006, but whatever.

At this point, you may be wondering why there's a postive thumbs up next to my review, since I've done nothing but trash Deadly Premonition. Well, the truth is that this game is the best worst game I've ever played. Like I've pointed out, there's just so much wrong with DP: DC, and yet, it's an incredible experience. All of the characters are well written and lovable, and all form a cohesive, believable community and setting. Dialogue is as bizarre as it is hilarious, and trust me, there is plenty of writing to enjoy. Weird quirks dominate the scene, such as having every single character follow a routine and schedule based on a variety of factors, and allowing sidequests only when the time is right, and pulling those sidequests away from you if you're too slow to grab them. Additionally, Deadly Premonition has care in weird areas that I've not seen in other games before, like letting you use your turn signal in a vehicle, or having your character be able to grow a beard and shave it regularly, or most unique of all, having your character sleep under the fucking blankets.

Name me one game that lets you sleep under the covers besides Deadly Premonition.

... *Ahem*

All in all, Deadly Premonition is a bizarre, flawed, hilarious, witty, diamond in the rough. It has a ton of bad, but if you're willing to put up with the bad and push through, you'll discover a truly unique experience that no other game will ever deliver quite the same.

review:
[b]WARNING[/b]: This game is buggy as hell, and requires a lot of patience and/or workarounds to play.

[i]Deadly Premonition[/i] -- which may as well be called [i]Twin Peaks: The Game[/i] -- is a great game idea poorly executed and even more poorly ported to the PC from consoles.  Game-breaking bugs (such as disappearing keys) and random crashes (only avoided by playing problematic sections in Windows 98 compatibility mode) will bite you if you're not expecting them, so consulting a guide or walkthrough ahead of each section is practically compulsory.

So... why am I recommending it?  Despite its faults, [i]Deadly Premonition[/i] is so delightfully weird that I can't [b]not[/b] recommend it.  The story is fantastic, the characters are memorable, the murdery mystery is compelling, and the comic relief is hilariously bizarre.

Pick it up on sale (it's often about $2.50) and you'll definitely get your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198179510022', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 546, 'last_played': 1478610892}
review:
Рецензия на данную игру могла бы быть положительной. Я готов был простить ей все: кривизну игрового процесса, устаревшую графику, огромный, но при этом абсолютно пустой и скучный открытый мир, если бы не одно «но» — постоянные технические сбои: зависания, пропажа сохранений, вылеты. Вылеты — ключевое слово в описании этой игры. Случаются они крайне часто — примерно каждые полчаса. Иногда игра вовсе вылетает на одном и том же месте раз за разом — у меня такое было порядка четырех-пяти раз. В таком случае, каждый раз приходится искать решение конкретной проблемы и подолгу настраивать игру, чтобы она просто-напросто запустилась. Все это сильно подпортило мои впечатления от довольно неплохой игры, доставившей мне немало удовольствия.

«Deadly Premonition» («Предчувствие Смерти») — инди-разработка студии «Rising Star Games». Она представляет из себя бюджетную смесь из «Grand Theft Auto», «Resident Evil» и сериала «Твин Пикс», созданного американским режиссером Дэвидом Линчем. Хоть как-то охарактеризовать игру достаточно проблематично, ибо это тот случай, когда проект прекрасен и ужасен примерно в равной степени.

Сюжет копирует мистически-фарсовый сериал «Твин Пикс», созданный в конце 80-х годов американским режиссером Дэвидом Линчем, известным сюрреалистом, уделяющим в своем творчестве особое внимание эзотеричным и оккультным тематикам. Действительно, описывать сюжет видеоигры нет ни малейшего смысла — в чем-то он, конечно, отличается от «Твин Пикса», но в общем и целом следует ему досконально: типажи всех персонажей, сюжетные ходы, манера повествования, атмосфера и место действия взяты именно оттуда. Но не подумайте, что «Предчувствие смерти» — глупая «копипаста». Сюжет — один из главных плюсов игры. Именно благодаря ему вам захочется продолжать играть, раз за разом, скрипя зубами, устраняя проблемы кривой оптимизации.

Атмосфера — второй весомый плюс игры. Маленький провинциальный городок, расположившийся в дали от цивилизации, местные обычаи, люди, знающие друг друга в лицо, таинственные оккультные убийства — «Твин Пикс» ощущается в полной мере. Авторам действительно удалось с головой погрузить игрока в процесс, даже не смотря на устаревшую графику: текстуры, 3D-модели, анимацию движений — абсолютно все графические элементы. Но несмотря на то, что графика в «Предчувствии Смерти» не может похвастаться чем-то выдающимся или хотя-бы приемлемым по современным меркам (игра вышла в 2013-м году), называть ее отвратной было бы неправильно. 

В игре, как ни странно, присутствует открытый мир. Конечно, его попытались разнообразить разными заведениями, которые можно посещать, собирательством, но в целом он пуст и примитивен, состоит в основном из пустынных полей, длиннющих дорог и домов-коробок: как сюжетных локаций, вроде больницы, полицейского участка, заброшенной лесопилки или мотеля, так и дополнительных — для сайд-квестов, которые можно получить у некоторых жителей города. Геймплей же состоит в основном из «боевки» и решения головоломок. Первое позаимствовано из хоррор-серии «Resident Evil», второе — из приключенческих боевиков а-ля «Tomb Raider». «Боевка» крайне неудобная: во-первых, чтобы стрелять или бить оружием ближнего боя, нужно постоянно зажимать «пробел», во-вторых, монстры «лаганутые» — могут перемещаться с места на место, проходить сквозь стены, а подбираются с такой скоростью, что не успеваешь на это среагировать. С головоломками все обстоит примерно также: они либо предельно просты, угадываются за секунду, либо настолько сложны, что для их решения приходиться подолгу бегать по зданию в поисках какой-либо важной бумажки.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970704051', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1479325011}
review:
Une histoire à l'ambiance unique desservie par une réalisation baclée ou l'on suit ( enfin on essaye de suivre ) un agent du FBI schizophrène dans une narration hallucinatoire et surréaliste. ( d'ou le "on essaye de suivre " ^^ )
Heureusement que des fans se sont acharnés pour résoudre les problèmes de réalisation du titre.

******** POUR RESOUDRE LES BUGS ET AMELIORER LES GRAPHISMES ********
Les choses que je vous recommande de faire:

1- Une fois le jeu installé je vous encourage a aller sur ce site ci-dessous pour installer DPfix + improved textures + SweetFX afin de résoudre les problemes de graphismes ( résolution, texture et couleurs ) :
http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director's_Cut

Dans les règlages de DPfix choisissez l'option pour mettre le jeu en fenetré sans bordures à la place du plein écran et dans le launcheur du jeu desactivez le plein écran. Vous eviterez un crash au demarrage et des plantages si vous voulez retourner vite fait sous windows avec alt+tab.

2- Une fois le jeu démarré vous vous rendrez compte que le clavier est inutilisable car le jeu n'est programmé que pour les claviers en qwerty et qu'il est impossible de changer les touches principales.
Donc quand votre jeu est démarré appuyez en même temps sur Alt+Maj et votre clavier passera en mode qwerty. En sortant du jeu soit votre clavier est repassé automatiquement en azerty, soit il vous suffit de refaire Alt+Maj pour changer. 

3- Pour evitez des bugs sonores et notament en voiture faites ceci sous windows ( j'ai win7 )
->clic droit sur le haut parleur en bas a droite a coté de l'heure
->choisir peripherique de lecture
-> selctionner haut-parleurs dans la liste et cliquer sur configurer
->choisir le mode stereo et valider
( Apparement les moders multicanaux font planter le son dans le jeu, ça marche chez pas mal de monde pour enlever le bug mais pas sur toutes les config )

Vous venez de passer 3 plombes à finir votre install , bravo vous allez enfin plonger dans cette histoire hallucinatoire.
N'oubliez pas d'aller mettre le jeu en francais pour changer les sous titres.

Derniere chose , pour utiliser une arme : une fois l'arme selectionnée il faut maintenir enfoncé la touche espace si on veut utiliser la touche pour tirer ou recharger. ( c'est pas un bug, c'est le gameplay ^^ )

Bon jeu !

author: {'steamid': '76561198048759212', 'num_games_owned': 760, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1478459323}
review:
I am honestly very confused by this game. I have no idea if it wants to take itself seriously or not. I can't really give it a description that does justice to how bizarre it all is. There's an FBI agent who solves crimes with the help of his imaginary friend, but you're his imaginary friend... I think? He takes advice from his coffee and the soundtrack likes to play really fucked up sax solos when you fail a QTE. It seems like it wants to go for the survival horror angle but is just so weirdly written and presented that it feels more like a parody that loops back around and becomes terrifying in a drug-addled fever dream sort of way.

All I can really say is give it a shot if it can be picked up in a sale for super cheap (like $5 cheap). It's certainly... something.

review:
To get it out of the way first, the PC port is pretty damn bad, even with DPFix. Unlike the Dark Souls port which was good (no new bugs, old bugs fixed, solid FPS, it runs, etc.), this port is falling apart at the seams. There's old bugs, new bugs, plenty of crashes, and what have you.

However, the core of the game's story, ie: the characters, the setting, the story, the mystery, is just so god damn solid that I was willing to overlook the PC port issues. There's just something to the overall charm of these things that makes it easy to overlook the issues. In fact, some of the issues feel like they add to the game. The janky animations, the poorly balanced voice clips, the comically bad car handling, and some other oddities seem to just fit so well with the game.

Even with all it's issues, this is a great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198156386799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 722, 'last_played': 1478544663}
review:
Начну с того что игра затягивает с первых минут.Я просидел за ней 8 часов безвылазно,так-как за сюжетом довольно интресно наблюдать.Персонажи в игре довольно интересно сделаны,у каждого свой характер и они довольно приятные.

Про баги и вылеты:За 8 часов моей игры я ниразу не увидел ни одного бага,а вылет был всего один,но и тот там где у всех вылетает.

Управление:управление в игре довольно удобное,особенно если вы играли в Residen Evil 4,так как очень на него похоже.
Почему все на него так взъерошились я не понимаю.Один ньюанс с пробелом,он в игре за кобуру и прицел,но менять его не советую,т.к. через минут 20-30 игры он уже перестает надоедать и кажется очень даже удобным.

Графика:Графика в игре очень даже приятная на глаз,правда если вы дегрот который ценит в игре лишь ГРАФЕЕЕЕН с пеной из рта,то игру можете пропустить,т.к. порт с Великой приставки Sony Playstation 3,не поимел каких либо(наверное)изменений с графикой.Но вот люди проделаны просто великолепно,даже больше,анимация лиц достаточно приятная,как и анимация в целом,правда анимка подлагивает иногда,максимум за 8 часов раза 2 только и наблюдал.


В общем игра стоит своих 500 рублей,мне лично очень понравились эти 8 часов.СОВЕТУЮ К ПОКУПКЕ.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109734774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1082, 'last_played': 1449623987}
review:
Right I just want to say I LOVE this game (trust me I'll need to say that before I get into the parts I don't like). I think the story is amazing. It's a very well-written game with interesting and well developed characters. Yorke is wonderfully entertaining especially when you're just driving around and he's talking to his alter ego Zach about 80s movies. A lot of the mini stories are fun and the action is very tense and can be really scary at times. I'm serious this game can be pretty horrifying. I enjoyed every part that didn't involve...well uh... ok...
The controls. 
I've read some other reviews and apparently the console versions controls were a lot smoother but the PC controls leave much to be desired. Yorke kinda controls like a tank (which would be fine in a point and click game) but this is a horror shooter so it's a little clunky and awkward.
The real time events are uh... a little difficult. Now I'm slightly biased as real time events are the bane of my existence but Deadly Premonitions are something very special indeed. In most games the real time event keeps the same pattern so that you can kinda power through it after several tries. This game changes the pattern EVERY SINGLE TIME. So it's a little difficult. Though I feel someone with good reflexes could get through it no sweat, I'm just slow af. 
When you drive you feel like you're driving on black ice though I will admit it's very fun when you drive really, really fast and crash into stuff. 
Also if you're playing on PC be aware this game might crash, several times. It did for me a lot. You can have several days without crashing and it could play smoothly until one day it's like NOPE and crashes on you during a scary part, and oh boy you forgot to save so time to go back into the scary tunnel again with those wall crawlers that take a dozen hits with a shotgun again! 
And yet... after all this... I still love it. It's like Taco Bell, even though it hurts and might even be morally wrong you just keep coming back for more. I really do think it's the characters, story, atmosphere, Twin Peaks-vibe, challenging puzzles and fun shooting segments that keep me coming back. 
I'd recommend it to people who have a lot of patience and want a game primarily for story. Still amazing though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308160696', 'num_games_owned': 1086, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 3391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3391, 'last_played': 1477950885}
review:
Recipe:

3 Parts mediocre Twin Peaks rip off (that's high praise for a Twin Peaks rip off, most don't even qualify as mediocre)
1 Part Silent Hill
A pinch of Resident Evil 4 (NO, NO, YOU GRABBED CHRIS' SECTION FROM RE6 YOU FOOL!!!!!!!)
Enough bugs and glitches to make the game almost need to be called Deadly Premonition Unity
And just a touch of Red Dead Redemption near the end

Honestly, I enjoyed 90% of this game, but no game made in 2013 should need to be run in Windows 98 Compatibility Mode if you want to beat the final boss (who, by the way, is so completely out of place from the rest of this game that it's half the reason I'm not recommending it).  I had to spend most of the time in XP Compatibility, but that still crashed occasionally and prevents you from aiming up and down properly which is needed rarely, but when it's needed it's needed.  When it was crashing or aiming was required I switched to 98 which had enough load times that my hair turned grey.  Occassional... dungeons?... are full of QTE which is thankfully only in those specific chase sequemces.  The driving of any car faster than the free cop car involves spinning 360 degrees if you hit a pebble as 90% of vehicles handle like turbo charged bath tubs.  
On the other handle, I liked the story and characters.  Once I finished with the atrocious final boss I went back and finished all the side quests to learn more about the citizens of Greenvale (hence my 56+ hours of play).  Of course, a bug involving quest items and replaying missions caused me to have to restart the entire game to get the second last achievement and the last one won't unlock despite patch notes saying the issue was fixed.  If you've got the patience and the weird mind this game aims for, by all means play it.  I just can't recommend it with a clear conscience without warning you first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051302495', 'num_games_owned': 2636, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1476754747}
review:
No se si es correcto considerar a este juego dentro del genero de Terror, ya que aunque tiene un tipo de demonios o zombies, no da mucho miedo realmente, en si el juego no se ve muy bien, pareciera un juego de PS2, y aunque no soy muy quisquilloso con los graficos si es molesto los errores que suele tener, la primera vez que intente jugarlo se cerraba despues del menu, desisti y lo desinstale, tiempo despues volvi a intentarlo, afortunadamente funciono, al inicio es un tanto dificil de asimilar, ya que no me esperaba que tuviera una parte de SandBox, pero ese es uno de los puntos a favor, ya que puedes explorar y encontrarte ciertos eventos que te ayudan a entender mas la historia, la cual me gusto bastante, y me fue atrapando poco a poco hasta lograr terminar el juego.

Las mecanicas del juego son un tanto malas, repetitivas y torpes, tardas cierto tiempo en adaptarte, el juego en si es facil, aunque lei en la red que la version original era mucho mas dificil, asi que como recomendacion para aquellos que quieran darle una oportunidad, deberan tener paciencia, la historia vale la pena, y despues de cierto tiempo le encuentras cierto gusto al juego.

Otra de las cosas que me gustaron son las converzaciones que tiene York con Zach cuando conduce, ya que suelen hablar sobre peliculas viejas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030589833', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 2443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1476831020}
review:
This is a really tough game to review.

Imagine a really bad restaurant. It has terrible service, terrible decor, smells bad, looks bad and is just generally unpleasant. It shows no promise at all. And yet....

...They serve about the best main course money can buy.

Deadly Premonition's main dish is it's completely captivating story, which is brought to life by some excellent voice acting. The main characters are really well written; I found them quirky, utterly charming, charismatic and lovable and wanted to know everything about them.

If you have seen Twin Peaks, you will not fail to notice this game has derived A LOT of inspiration from that show. Luckily it does so in an interesting and often suprising way so  never feels like a bland ripoff. Beyond the Twin Peaks influence, it's also pretty obvious the game designer, Swery, likes David Lynch's wider canon of work too, to the point that the game could be mistaken as a collaboration. Being a Lynch fan, that's not a bad thing in my book; I think other Lynch fans will love this too. 

So what's not so good? I'm afraid there are quite a lot of niggles that takes the shine off the Deadly Premonition experience.

Here we go: 

- My experience was massively hurt by technical problems. The game crashed constantly unless put into ME/98 compatibility+admin mode. Alas, this had the side of effect of gradually bringing frame rates down from 60fps to 10fps within 15 minutes of continued play. Repeated reboots were required to maintain a playable frame rate. 
- In compatibility mode, a slew of minor bugs arose, such as gun-aiming glitches, which made the game annoying.
- To unlock the 60fps is required an unofficial hack (called DPfix) is required (grr)
- Graphics are poor  - the palette is washed out, textures rough , and 3D models very ropey at times.
- Driving is really tedious. It takes too long to get anywhere.
- The core 3rd person survival horror game is not very enjoyable. 
- The RPG mechanics (health, hunger, tiredness, inventory management) are completely superflous
- Time lapse mechanic is frustrating. You have to wait around for certain events to happen. Time can be sped up, but the mechanic means that you can end up passing TOO much time and missing your appointment. 
- The game is littered with tedious mandatory mini-games, such as waggling the thumbstick to run away from danger, or hiding from an enemy to escape danger. 
- boss battles are a chore
- not scary in the slightest. (even the bits I think were meant to be scary)
- Dull fetch side quests.
- The game is not challenging in the slightest.
- Production values  are not great. Very rough around the edges. Wonky transitions between scenes and parts of the musical score. 
- Story got so ridiculous it was immersion-breaking. (A mad story isn't necessarily a problem, but there needs to be some sort of underlying internal logic to make the suprises and twists truly matter) 
- no steamcloud

In short, the core game is just not very good. 

That's enough criticism; I don't want to put anyone off from giving this a go, because DAMN, the story and characters and atmosphere are SO SO good....Good enough that I can forgive that massive list of faults.

But would I recommend it to you?

Now, that is a tough question. I have to give a somewhat nuanced answer here. I'd have to ask:

- How tolerant are you of bad ports? This is one of the worst I have experienced.
- Do you like brilliant stories so much you can put up with a subpar game which is very rough around the edges? 
- Do you appreciate great voice acting, atmosphere, superb characters, and perhaps David Lynch's work too? 

If you said to the above go for it. You won't regret it. 

If you veer the other way....stay WELL clear. 

I few things to add: the game is supported by a deliciously quirky soundtrack, and features one of the most charismatic protaganists I have yet encountered in a video game: Francis York Morgan (who is up their with Garrus from Mass Effect for me) 

I LOVE this game, despite its numerous faults, and I can't think of a game so in need of a modern remaster that polishes the rough edges, gives it a nice, glossy coat of paint, and improves the core game so it can be experienced by a wider audience. 

It's not a whole hearted recommedation, but if you can stomach it's faults you are in for an unforgettable experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969207498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2121, 'last_played': 1476241616}
review:
I adore this game. I really do. It has all the mystery and strangeness that Twin Peaks does. However, the real mystery is how to get the game to actually run. I've made it past serveral game breaking bugs by setting it to win98 compatablility, downloading custom .ini files, disabling steam overlay, Yet I still cannot get past the dump to desk top bug on act 2 chapter 12. This is one of the more challenging games I've ever played because it does not want to be played.

Edit: I gave it another chance and I made it thought the whole ordeal. I've changed my review to positive because I love the story and characters so much. The key to getting the game to run Zach, is restarting your computer for every hour of game play. The game with tell you when the memory leak gets too bad, you'll be able to tell. My steam game play time says 37 hour or so. The in game time, which I believe is a bit more accurate, clocks me in at around 17 hours. Play it at your own risk. It is completable, but it sure puts up a fight.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051263984', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1521987519}
review:
Очень уникальная и своеобразная игра. Многое взято из Твин Пикс, но общий сюжет ещё более шизовый. В игре есть большой город с множеством именным нпс, которые живут своей жизнью, это создаёт очень приятную атмосферу, подобного практически нету в играх. Графика и геймплей очень слабые, даже если по меркам пс2 сравнивать. 

Лучшая версия игры только на Xbox 360. Именно её делали оригинальные разработчики, эта версия имеет отличительный фильтр, более приятную графику, камеру и управление по типу 4 резидент эвила и повышенную сложность. Все остальные порты на пс3/пк/свич сделаны полнейшими бездарями. Если пс3 версию ещё можно назвать играбельной, при этом из неё убраны все вышеперечисленные элементы оригинала, а так же добавлены новые баги с вылетами и просадками фпс, то пк и свич версиях всё еще хуже.

При любой возможности лучше в неё играть на иксбоксах, вроде как она доступна на всех новых по обратной совместимости. Play only Xbox version.

Если нравится эта игра, то могу ещё посоветовать Mizzurna Falls, детектив с пс1, где так же есть открытый город и симуляция жизни. Не так давно её наконец-то перевели на английский.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961439760', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 960, 'last_played': 1466382209}
review:
I would have given this quirky game at least an 8/10, but due to hardware silliness, and a bad port...I just don't know. 

I want to LOVE this game. I really do. 

The console version is waaay better. 

I'll base my review on what the game truly is without hardware/software difficulties and bad porting. 

If you are familiar with Twin Peaks or any absurd David-Lynch works, you'll understand this game completely. 

If you're not...just go with it. Yes. It's fucking weird. Yes, York (the main character) is a dweeb. Yes, this town has no basis at all in reality. Just go with it. 

Gameplay-wise...meh. It's really about the weird characters and story. Sidequests everywhere!

Ultimately, I cannot recommend the PC version if you're running any machine newer than like...2007-2009.

If you can get your hands on the xbox360 version. Great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119071342', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3916, 'last_played': 1572901633}
review:
The game is absolutely amazing! The plot is fantastic, while the gameplay is quite obvious and buggy, but the latter doesn't change the emotions you get following the investigation. I recommend the game for all who are interested in creepy detective stories. If you want to enjoy the game truly, please don't pay attention on bugs and some annoying things like following the suspect for about five real minutes - the game is not about that.

I am thankful for all those who were involved into the Deadly Premonition's process. You guys rock.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030781081', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2018, 'last_played': 1475265950}
review:
Game itself is great, this port is horrible.  Those interested should play the original version on the Xbox 360 - it has better, warmer colours and more fitting textures. Directors cut version also adds few things to the game that make it worse than the original. 

This PC port (- even with the DPfix) is filled with crashes, strange framerate issues and other technical woes. Beating the final boss is almost impossible due to the aiming bug that persists trough out the whole game (some might have luck with messing win98 compatibility modes or alt-tabing – I didn’t).

That said, I enjoyed it but find really hard to recommend this version of the game to any one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198285068850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1626, 'last_played': 1650122161}
review:
Its story will get you once you arrive to Greenvale. 

The characters truly have a unique personality, you will fall in love with some of them, hate some others, and sometimes you won't know what to think about certain ones (Yes, Thomas and Mrs. "Pot" I'm talking to you). 
The Sountrack is amazing, nostalgic, you will notice its good tunes from the very beginning. 
I'm not in love with its Combat System, but after you get caught by the plot, you won't care too much about that.

Deadly Premonition it's one of those games I'll never forget and If you're looking for a good story, charming characters and an awesome soundtrack, Deadly Premonition won't disappoint you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113862025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 297, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1474922421}
review:
On sent bien que le scénar est cool et les persos potentiellement hyper attachants, mais après avoir traversé le prologue tant bien que mal (et plutôt mal que bien à vrai dire), j'ai vraiment plus la force ni la volonté d'affronter la MONTAGNE de défauts de ce jeu...

Déjà, quand il a refusé de se lancer les premières fois, ça m'a mise dans l'ambiance : il faut le laisser installer sa petite version de directX, sa petite version de ceci et cela, et même après ça, il ne démarre pas, non : il faut REDEMARRER le PC pour que tout soit pris en compte, et là, il daignera enfin afficher le 1er de ses écrans.

L'écran en question constitue déjà à lui seul une insulte. Non seulement les options qu'il propose d'ajuster sont dérisoires, [i](zéro option graphique je précise - même pas la rez)[/i], mais en plus, le contrôle au pad est inexplicablement indisponible alors qu'un pad est branché. (De modèle ultra courant: XB-360 je précise). Amusez vous à le brancher / débrancher dans tous les ports USB de votre PC, le pad ne sera jamais reconnu bien que l'option "gamepad" soit là, sous vos yeux, à rester bêtement grisée... La mention "support mannette complet" qu'affiche la page du magasin est donc mensongère, et soit vous jouerez au clavier, soit vous irez vous faire foutre.

Boooon. On va jouer au clavier. Mais?? MAIS !!!???!!! Ah! La bonne blague : c'est bien sur UNIQUEMENT en qwerty! Et les touches ne sont naturellement PAS remappables. Ça propose une localisation française, mais ça oublie de localiser les contrôles... Balèzes les mecs. [i](Détends toi Cammy! Pense à toutes ces bonnes évals qui expliquent à quel point ce jeu est trop super si on prend la peine de rentrer dedans! Persévère un peu!)[/i]
Alleeez, je fais donc "Shift+Alt" pour passer en qwerty, et c'est parti. (Déjà 15 bonnes minutes de perdues rien que pour arriver à le lancer, on allait quand même pas abandonner maintenant!)

Le jeu démarre en énumérant à l'unité et sans se presser 5 ou 6 logos inzappables (alors que même un singe aurait eu l'idée de les réunir tous sur 1 seul écran pour faire gagner du temps).
Puis ça démarre enfin, avec diverses séquences d'intro aux ambiances carrément réussies je dois dire. On sent bien que le jeu a un bon "fond" - mais mon dieu, pour la forme, quelle horreur... Les décors et les animations ridicules me rappellent très sincèrement "House of the dead 2" sur Dreamcast. (1998). Mêmes [i]"bruits de pas sur carrelages & moquettes"[/i] que ceux du premier "Resident Evil" (1996), à la différence qu'ici, ils ne sont pas correctement calés avec la marche ou la course du perso. Miraculeusement, les visages des protagonistes sont bien réussis en dépit de l'horreur esthétique grotesque des modélisations plus que grossières couvertes de textures absolument dégueulasses. Techniquement, ce jeu est une honte.
Quant à la trad française, outre diverses erreurs, elle remplace les "ç" par des "é", n'affiche carrément pas les "Œ", et hésite un peu trop souvent sur tout ce qui porte un accent... Ce qui est un peu pénible, même si ça ne nuit pas trop à la compréhension...

Concernant le gameplay, il est rigide au delà du descriptible, et là encore très proche de la maniabilité complètement obsolète des tout premiers Resident Evil. Mais avec en prime une visée beaucoup plus capricieuse malgré la souris (pourtant sensée être mathématiquement plus précise), un système de mise en joue parfaitement désagréable, et une ergonomie aberrante manifestement élaborée par un débile léger...

Bon. On se remotive et on persévère! Les 1ers combats arrivent. Nuls. Y'a pas d'autre mot. Pourtant, je le répète, malgré la réalisation pathétique, l'ambiance est là, qui donne envie...Je traverse donc le niveau avec comme principale ennemie la jouabilité complètement naze. Le level design? Un couloir dont il faudra déverrouiller basiquement les embranchements avec des "énigmes" éculées genre boite à fusible/générateur... Vous voyez le genre.

Arrive le 1er QTE. Je le rate une fois. (Bon). Puis la seconde, puis une 3e (P'tain, mais j'ai pourtant appuyé là où il me dit!) et encore et encore jusqu'à ce que je me souvienne que ce jeu pourri est en QWERTY, et que par conséquent, les touches sur lesquelles on me demandera de taper ne CORRESPONDRONT PAS à celles de mon clavier, et qu'il faudra deviner leur emplacement! ^^
Et là, c'est bon, je décroche. J'ai "joué" une heure et demie, jusqu'à boucler le premier chapitre - j'estime que je lui ai largement laissé sa chance. Je rédige donc cette éval pour vous INTERDIRE catégoriquement d'approcher cette malhonnête arnaque (surtout au prix exorbitant de 25€!!!!)
[i]En tant que "jeu"[/i], Deadly Premonition se fout ouvertement de notre gueule sur absolument TOUS les plans. Et me semble impossible à conseiller à qui que ce soit, même si sincèrement, je crois que je comprends finalement bien pourquoi tellement de gens "aiment" son ambiance malgré ses [u]impardonnables[/u] tares... Raison pour laquelle [b]en revanche[/b], il est certainement bien plus sympa à regarder [i]en tant que vidéo[/i] - ce que je vais d'ailleurs faire sans plus tarder.

Ce n'est pas parce qu'une poignée de talentueux scénaristes/dialoguistes/metteurs en scène assez inspirés ont été se compromettre avec les programmeurs/graphistes/game designers [u]les plus POUILLEUX de la terre[/u] que je dois m'infliger de [strike]jouer[/strike] lutter contre ce misérable étron pour profiter d'un scénar et d'une atmosphère réussie. [i](Et aussi du travail d'écriture sur les personnages - qui semble également être l'un des rares trucs à sauver de ce désastre).[/i]

Donc si tout comme moi vous préférez économiser beaucoup de votre patience (et par la même occase, de votre argent) sans passer à côté de l'ambiance particulière et prenante de cette intrigue, rendez-vous service :
[i]Voici un lien vers une des nombreuses vidéos de walkthrough en version FR - apparemment non commentée[/i]. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TPY8APTMPuM

author: {'steamid': '76561198071094347', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 2483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2419, 'last_played': 1423732116}
review:
I wrote a short "review" a few years ago and i feel i like didn't do this game enough justice it deserves.
What exactly is this game? That is a really good question. If you really want a better review just [url=https://www.destructoid.com/review-deadly-premonition-165168.phtml] read [/url] this. 

This is supposed to be a survival horror game, is it though? It's a murder mystery, you play as York (everyone calls him that) an fbi agent that investigate a serial killer leading to a small town. Once you start this game, you'll know that this game is bad. The story doesn't make sense, the dialogue is horrible, the cutscenes are attrocious, the gameplay are horrendous, the control is the worst. But it is also a wonderful experience that you'll never forget. 

You'll dread the shooting so much with all the bullet sponge enemies, You'll accidentally press the a button and see the 'get out of car' animation a million times. You will also ask questions, a lot of questions. Why is the raincoat killer stopped chasing me after i evade one time? Why is there an old dude on a wheelchair wearing a gas mask? Why is there a jazz playing while i examined a body? Who is whistling that mario theme?!? [i] please get it out of my head. [/i] And also [spoiler] Who is zach? [/spoiler]
Not all of that question will be answered. At the end of the game, the character will grow on you, you'll no longer ask the unecessary question, because it's deadly premonition. 

But if it's all so bad, what makes it a good game, you ask. Deadly premonition knows that it is a bad B-movie and made it their strength. Sure you will be frustated, but that frustation is wiped by the laugh that you'll get. You'll laugh at it, thinking that it's bad, but that's also what makes it so good. It's also possible that you will hate it with passion, that is also fine. Because you gotta have a truly twisted mind to enjoy it. It's a genius of swery.

How exactly are we supposed to enjoy this game, ironically? Unironically? That is a question that will never be answered.
Perhaps the saddest part of this game is this will probably be the one and only that ever comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970447700', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1107, 'last_played': 1703219536}
review: I seem to be one of the lucky few who has not experienced a crash or problem of any kind while playing this wonderfully strange game. The game itself is amazing in its unique way if you can get it to run. I highly recommend it as it's a game that exists in a class all its own. The characters are odd, different from one another, genuine, and full of quirk and personality. The story is intriguing and the music helps heighten the drama and mystery. It's like a really great, really strange TV show that you get to play through. Even the bad parts like the driving mechanics are enjoyable. It really feels like you're in a small town living the life of an eccentric FBI investigator. So, as long as you can get it to run properly, you're in for the weirdest treat available in gaming that I know of. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995967036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1502, 'last_played': 1473250583}
review:
What a weird game.. Terrible PC port; keeps crashing, freezing, lagging with a GTX 1060. Also the gameplay, please, this is so BAD.. Probably the worst driving experience since a while. But.. BUT.
This game is AMAZING, there is something so unique to it. A GTAxSilent HillxTwin Peaks cross over. How could it not be great ? Despite all its weaknesses, I spent an amazing moment with the inspector Morgan and I would definetely recommend it to anyone. You need to play it and to go through the first terrible crashes and weird 2-3 hours of gameplay adaptation. 
Really really great story taking a twist on what seems a Twin Peaks copycat, but it's absolutely not. There is also a very interesting ending, and a truly beautiful analysis not so hard to understand on the player's take.
