author: {'steamid': '76561198121520825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 3890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1655950964}
review:
Oh yeah, Deadly Premonition. There is so much you can say about this game.
First of all: Yes... yes I know the graphics may not be so gentle to the eye sometimes and yes it might be a little glitchy here and there, but to be honest, I dont really pay much attention to that.
I would describe DP as a rare species. Why you ask?

Graphic:
Eventhough the graphic may not be so 21st century and wont kill any big product such as action movie-game 
Resident Evil 6 (which is very bad in its own way), it just wont take that long to get used to it. You only really see that problem during forest scenes when the grass textures are flickering a little. But despite that, come on guys, is graphic really that great? Look at Call of Duty. Great HD graphic, but always the same crap in it. Shoot shoot shoot.

Glitches:
To be honest, the only real glitches I have noticed were spinning cars or my tie running through my body lol. 
The tie get unstuck fast thought and it only happened once. That thing with the car, well, it does weird things sometimes, for example spinning around itself for a splitt second and... yeah. Hehe but these gliches are not game breaking or frustrating, in fact they are really funny to watch and add up to the games humor a little, even if unintentionally. Sometimes they can even work for you.

Gameplay:
Having the two issues out of the way, we only have the major reasons to buy the game left. The gameplay is easy to understand and a ot of fun. Like in Resident Evil 4, you play York in a third person (over-the-shoulder) perspective, when aiming with the weapon you have you have to aim yourself or use the auto aim. Killing ghosties in this game is super fun due to the awesome atmosphere, the creepy enemies, the huge variety of weapons and the amzingly high amount of side quests like investigating old abandoned haunted places. Good thing is, I dont even spoil you things becuase there is so much to do and see in this game that I only scratched the surface. So to sum it all up:

-Easy handling (except for the cars)
-Very atmospheric
-Big town to explore freely
-A lot of side quests
-Very fun battle system
-A lot of very funny and extremly awesome weapons
-A lot of stuff to unlock
-Very well made creepy creatures

Sound:
The music in this game is amazing! Yes it maybe repeat itself a little to often, but hey, its always very fitting and it never gets old hearing these tunes. Especially during action sequences it can really bring you onto your toes, and while exploring something creepy or eary it will please you with a very ambient and... more eary track. To be honest here, it doesnt happen that often that music really melts into the game, at least not in my opinion.

Story:
And now we got to the cherry on top of this very strange cake that is Deadly Premonition.
If you are like me and graphic isnt everything, then you came to the right place. Remember when I said this game is a rare species? Well it surely is. I never saw a game that is a mixture of many things. 
Resident Evil 4, Silent Hill and even a little bit of GTA is in there. Its funny and cheesy, its creepy and serious.
You have to eat and sleep to survive, you earn money, you can do this and that and wow...
But... NOTHING can be compared to the story. This real, at the beginning seemingly slowly starting story, will turn into a big and complicated, and at the end really mindblowing masterpiece! The combination with the music, the way the story tells itself, the whole atmoshpere the world builds around the character Francise York Morgan, the dark and creepy environments and an ending that stays stuck in your throat even days after. Not in a bad but more in a bittersweet way. Heck even if I would try to explain the ending here I couldnt even do it justice, neither would you understand it.
Long story short, the story is one of a kind and frankly said, I never ever witnessed a story like this before... just amazing!

So yeah, if you love very good stories and gameplay such as the good old Silent Hill or Resident Evil games,
you are not so interested in graphics and you dont mind the slightly cheesy dialogues sometimes, you should really give it a try. If the price is too high for you wait for the next sale but, still, people dont really give the game as much credit as it deserves. Out of all the games out there these days, this one is a hidden gem and should at least be played once.
I promise you wont regret it. I already played it on the XBox 360 two years ago and downloaded it again as directors cut a few days ago, and it still give me the chills when I hear the story. It also extended story wise, which makes it even more awesome! 

Sometimes great things come in little packages, keep that in mind.
Deadly Premonition will forever be one of my all time favourites. 

-Blitzz

author: {'steamid': '76561197997844553', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1864, 'last_played': 1444546292}
review:
Все таки осилил.Эта одна из тех игр,которым трудно дать однозначную оценку.Если рассматривать ее элементы в отдельности - все плохо.Если смотреть на все в совокупности,то...тоже все плохо.Единственное,чем цепляет это произведение - сюжет. Он не гениальный,в нем много клише и заимствований(вдохновений),но умудряется держать в напряжение и сохраняет интригу.Увы,единственный и самый жирный плюс.
Минусы же,встречают нас еще до запуска.Лично у меня игра не включалась через лаунчер и не подхватывала геймпад автоматически.Но эти моменты решаемы.А вот,что решить не получится,так это сильные(СИИИИИИИЛЬНЫЕ) просадки фпс и вылеты...примерно раз в час.КАЖДЫЙ час.У издателя был шанс поправить хотя бы техническую сторону игры,но момент был упущен.Жаль.
Коротко об остальных минусах:
- Графика.Обычно,когда говорят "как на пс2",то сильно утрируют.Но не в этом случае.Я даже могу вспомнить проекты с зы2,которые выглядяли симпотичнее.Но мы же не в графику играем,верно?..
- Но эта анимация...Господи,настолько все деревянно.В игре,где весь сюжет подается в катсценах,такая анимация играет злую шутку.Картонные движения персонажей делают из драмы настоящий цирк.
- Второстепенные задания примечательны...ничем.Да,они расскрывают характеры персонажей,но сделаны в стиле пойди-принеси.Да и награда по большей степени бесполезна.
- Музыка.Оказалось,что в игре 25 композиций,хотя мы постоянно слышим 3-4.А игра не маленькая.И очень уж часто музыка невпопад звучит.
- Ну и вишенка на торте.Это геймплей в целом.Тут можно долго расписывать и про геймдизайн,и про управление и пр.,но...Он просто скучный.2 типа врагов(1 из которых,достаточно редкий),3 босса(скорее недоразумения).Лучше бы всего этого не было и была бы просто новелла.

Я прошел,история понравилась,а значит не сильно пожалел,что купил.Но я не буду говорить,что "Это не баги,это фича такая" или "Они художники,они так видят". И советовать бы тоже не стал кому-либо.Только на свой страх и риск.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098558050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1453, 'last_played': 1594696782}
review:
This is one of the greatest games that I have ever played. It will definitely stay within my top 5 games for a long, long time. I plan to at least do a second and third playthrough, if not more.

Before buying, there are 2 things that you must know:
 1. This is the very definition of a cult classic. If you find yourself only enjoying huge budget AAA games and never really straying into anything else, then perhaps this is not the game for you. This game must be played with an open mind, as it is very unique. Also, it is worth mentioning that the game really doesn't pick up until an hour or so into it. 

2. The PC port is not very good. I would only recommend buying it if you have intermediate computer skills, as you are going to have to edit a few files as well as apply a user-made patch, DPfix. 

The story: Simply put, it's amazing. You play as Francis York Morgan, an FBI agent sent to the small town of Greenvale to investigate the murder of a local teenager. The story quickly picks up from here and sucks you in. I wish that I could be less vague about the story, but I risk ruining the game's 20+ hour run. This is the kind of story that keeps you wanting to play the game to see what happens next. It takes many sharp turns and streches across several different genres, including, but by far not limited to: horror, mystery, survival, comedy, and even some romance. I consider myself to be good at predicting storylines in games and movies, but even I could not predict hardly any of this game. It truly kept me interested until the very end. Speaking of the end, you may just shed a tear. 

Characters: The characters in this game are incredibly varied and all have distinct personalities. I will certainly not ever forget any of them. The voice acting is great and really helps to bring the characters to life. 

Gameplay: The driving is pretty awful but far from the worst I've ever played. The pause menu map only shows your immediate surroundings and cannot zoom out, rendering it useless. You'll have to pay close attention and learn the town if you want to get around. While this map issue was mildly annoying, it made the game a little more challenging. The rest of the gameplay is good, but nothing new or super polished. I would recommend using a controller, as the keyboard and mouse control for this game just feels clunky. The game is open world and each character has a routine that they do. This is important to remember, as they may not always be home for you to ask questions. There are some points in the game in which you must wait a certain amount of in-game time before moving on to the next portion of the story. This gives you time to explore all that there is to do in Greenvale, including a ton of side missions and collectible items.

Soundtrack: The soundtrack in this game is great, and very memorable. I love the acoustic guitar song that plays at the main menu and at various points in the game. Each track suits the level that it was designed for, and nothing seems out of place. The only complaint I have is that the music volume levels occasionally overpower dialogue in cutscenes. 

Other thoughts: The game crashed to the desktop about a dozen times during my playthrough. The crashes all occured at set points in the game's story, so they are not random. There are some suggestions to remedy this with a quick search online though. I had luck passing these crashes by setting the game's launcher and .exe to Windows 98/ME mode and running as administrator. I am using an AMD gpu with the latest drivers (15.7.1 at time of writing) and Windows 7 64 bit. 

Bottom line: If you don't mind the possibility of some technical issues and you are a fan of survival-horror/mystery games, by all means, buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996065388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1490, 'last_played': 1511722856}
review:
The curious case of Deadly Premonition.

Rare are the instances when a game comes along that is so horrible, yet so intriguing that you simply can not help but love it.

First, a word of warning. This port is, to be frank, atrocious. I experienced a dozen crashes or more, three during the end credits alone. Furthermore, you need to use fixes to change the in-game resolution. The graphics lie somewhere between badly aged and horrible. And finally, the game mechanics are often stiff, walking on the border between being boring or laughable. Using a gamepad is recommended.

But with that said, what is offered if you fight past these issues is in my opinion nothing short of amazing. A quirky, twin peaks-esque world full of strange characters, weird happenings and charming dialogue, and a story that more often than not is wonderfully over the top.

This is not a game you should play for the gameplay or the visuals - its all about the experience of visiting the small town of Greenvale and its residents. 

Seeing this story through is nothing I regret
Despite it being in perhaps the worst port yet
To Greenvale I think you should travel
So that this mystery, you can attempt to unravel

So says Mr. Stewart...

author: {'steamid': '76561198128464560', 'num_games_owned': 376, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1636061291}
review:
Ja,der Mythos lebt.nach einem Eintrag im Guiness Buch der Rekorde als das schlechteste Survival Horror Spiel und einer Community die sich gegenseitig die Köpfe einhaut wie schlecht dieses Spiel nun wirklich ist,spielte ich es auf der PS3 und nun nochmal auf dem PC.

Und ja,das Spiel ist technisch alles andere als gut programmiert.Abgehackte Animationen wohin man schaut,gegner die mit ihrem schlechten geheule mehr Angst auslösen als mit ihren Angriffen,ein Aiming,direkt aus der Hölle.Die hauptbewegung des protagonisten wenn dieser seine Marke zieht,als wollte er diese seinen Gesprächspartnern dick um die ohren knallen.Es gibt tausende von Gründen dieses Spiel wirklich mies zu finden.Problem an der Sache:Genau das sollte man nicht.Jeder sollte diesem Spiel eine Chance geben.

man merkt das der Entwickler mit einem sehr kleinen team etwas Beständiges aufbauen wollte.Abseits der Technik ist die Geschichte um den regenmantelkiller nämlich durchaus interessant,spannend geschrieben und wird genau so erzählt.Die Charaktere welche man im Laufe der Story trifft bringen Charakter mit.Jeder hat seine eigene Persönlichkeit und als Spieler beginnt man nach kürzester Zeit trotz der macken des Spiel Sympathien für den einen oder anderen zu entwickeln.Man möchte wissen wie es weiter geht,wer eventuell wo mit drin hängt und gerade dieser Charme der tollen Figuren,der teils komischen Dialoge,gepaart mit einer trotzdem ernst zu nehmenden Handlung geben diesem Spiel seinen ganz eigenen Charakter.und das schaffen heute nicht mehr viele Spiele,trotz Budgets von mehreren Millionen Dollar.gerade da man dieses Spiel online oftmals für gerade mal einen Euro bekommt sollte man definitiv mal reinschauen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198093177449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4047, 'last_played': 1443643330}
review:
...
Ты меня слышишь Зак?

Одна из неоднозначных игр, но только из за странного порта.
Нет, эта игра раздражала меня своими постоянными вылетами, которые правда тем или иным образам лечатся. 
Всё остальное вполне терпимо, а на графин всё равно, тем более что он фиксится программой  dpfix.
Но эти вылеты...
Такое ощущение что у игры...Кхм...Раздвоение личности.
Одна личность даёт игре стабильность...
Другая награждает вылетами.
Причём появление этих вылетов совершенно непредсказумо...Для этого даже есть отдельный гайд.
В принципе и на этом закончим.
За портирование игры 4 из 10.

Стоп, стоп, стоп!Зак, ты меня слышишь?Ты что-то недоговариваешь.
Ладно.Приврал я.На этом не всё.
Эта игра...Чёрт возьми она великолепна...Её основной сюжет, атмосфера, проработанность,уникальность и интересность персонажей, а также весьма классные доп миссии сделаны просто...Превосходно?Да, просто отлично.
Игра радует тем что по сути её прохождение не несёт за собой рутину.Каждая миссия в сюжете УНИКАЛЬНА. Тут не найдёшь одно и то же под разными соусами.Поэтому проходить сюжетную ветку вообще не надоедает. Дизаин как городка, так и потусторонних миров просто вытягивают игру..И повторюсь про сюжет, уж он будет держать в заинтересованности от начала до самого конца. (Интрига, Зак, интрига) Но для тех страдает манией исследователя разбросано множество карточек и доп миссий.
Ну да ладно. Доволен, Зак?
За игру 10 из 10.

Автором рецензии предлагается выбрать одну из двух предложенных оценок для игры, исходя из предпочтений и вкусов.Для самого автора (ВНЕЗАПНО) игра стала одной из любимых.

На том и прощаемся.
Меня зовут Йорк Морган.Зовите меня просто Йорк.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120057861', 'num_games_owned': 507, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 346, 'last_played': 1570808814}
review:
Mi sono approcciato a questo gioco con tutte le buone intenzioni ma non è riuscito a prendermi.
Tecnicamente, il titolo pecca da tutte le parti: i comandi sono terrificanti, level design per niente curato, innumerevoli bug e glich (grafici e sonori), animazioni brutte e un sistema di guida penoso...
Per non parlare delle musiche, sono poche e, spesso, sono fuori contesto.
Questo, gioco è, a mio parere, troppo dispersivo: prima di iniziare una missione saremo costretti ad aspettare tanto, TANTO, tempo, il che non sarebbe un problema se dormiamo in uno dei più punti in cui possiamo riposare, la rogna è che la mappa non è piccola (è ingigantita dal fatto di essere, per la maggio parte, VUOTA, oltre ai pochi quartieri che, comunque, sembrano inabitati, oltre a qualche automobile, non c'è anima viva) e i letti sono lontani tra loro, quindi inizia il nostro interminabile viaggio in auto molto frustrante.

Onestamente non so se collocare questo gioco nella categoria investigativa o horror, mettiamo le cose in chiaro: sono una persona che si impressiona facilmente, ma qusto gioco non è riuscito a trasmettermi ansia o paranoia.
I nemici di questo gioco, probabilmente ispirati da Silent-Hill, sono davvero troppo facili da uccidere, in 6 ore di gioco non sono mai, MAI, stato toccato da uno di quei cosi; le armi, tranne la pistola, sono inutili perché grazie a quest'ultima saremo in grado di cavarcela alla grande, tanto le munizioni sono anche illimitate...
Evidenti le ispirazioni a Resident Evil come la cassa degli oggetti presente nei primi 3 capitoli di quest'ultima saga oppure i movimenti del protagonista.

Infine, credo non valga la pena l'acquisto del gioco, oltre ad essere un PESSIMO porting, crasha di continuo ed è troppo dispersivo e a tratti noioso.

Interface in the game you can get used to but this map is total fail. I personally love this game for amazing story and great characters and that joined to my favorit list. review: Un jeu dont l'univers est original et marquant, avec une intelligente touche d'autodérision ; le seul jeu qui m'ait donné, par moments, de revivre les sensations que la série Twin Peaks avaient pu me procurer. Cette originalité fait oublier et pardonner la technique surannée de la réalisation digne d'une PS2 (sans avoir rien contre cette console qui avait ses chefs d'oeuvres) : ce jeu manque terriblement de rythme et on ne peut pas s'empêcher de s'imaginer ce qu'il aurait donné s'il avait été développé par un studio mieux doué.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046101628', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1533, 'last_played': 1443549608}
review:
I love this game. I well and truly love it, it's a beautiful train wreck of a game where you either love it or utterly despise it. I seem to have fallen in love with it from the first time i played it back on my 360, then to the second time on PS3, now looking to do the hat trick by fully completing it once again on PC!

But For the love of GOD as much as i want to i can't! As much as i want to play my favourite game i can't due to the simply shocking port of it on PC. Constantly crashing, unreliable at almost every turn, and most recently when i hit act 1 Chapter 6 and saved outside the Greenvale Community Centre, my save file will not load at all. It shows the loading screen then tabs me out the game saying "Dp.exe has stopped responding"

So i warn you all now, fans of this game it is fantastic and the thought of playing it once again is exciting. But it's an utterly appaling port. Hence why it saddens me to downreview this just for that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962064956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2865, 'last_played': 1442681012}
review:
For all its flaws, most of them coming from its engine, Deadly Premonition does a lot of things right. There is an extreme care for details (at the expense of others) that makes for an unique experience.
An impressive amount of work has been put into each of the characters. They have their routines, and what they have to tell you will change based on where and when you encounter them. Additionally, each of the game's side quests is an occasion to know more about those who live in Greenvale.
As a result, the world feels alive and inhabited, more than the vast majority of the open worlds I played, and I played a lot of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007444517', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3928, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3837, 'last_played': 1438645024}
review:
[h1]Zack, ¡tienes que ver esto![/h1]

Deadly Premonition es un juego raro. 

Primero lo feo: 

	El juego está repleto de errores  -incluyendo uno que puede imposibilitar completar el juego-, los cuadros por segundo son inestables, pasan de 57 a 43 a 18 luego a 60, la jugabilidad es extraña, especialmente la conducción de los autos, los cuales a veces, en altas velocidades saltan y pueden hasta atravesar los objetos, y si no se le tienen parches, tiende a caerse cuando le place al juego, los efectos de sonido a veces se sienten de mala calidad.

	Dicho todo esto, Deadly Premonition es un grandioso juego  si puedes dejar pasar, o arreglar, todo lo anterior, la historia es basada en Twin Peaks, tiene muchas semejanzas con la serie misma, es interesante y con buena concordancia. Quitando todo lo feo que tiene, que se puede volver algo pasable a medida que uno juega, el juego es adictivo, los personajes son memorables, la ciudad tiene vida propia, los habitantes tienen una rutina para cada momento del día, y varios pequeños detalles que son simplemente geniales. Lo recomiendo mucho, pero más por la historia, que por la jugabilidad.

Parches para mejorar el rendimiento y gráficos:
[list]
    [*][url=http://blog.metaclassofnil.com/?tag=dpfix]DPFix (Mejora de rendimiento, permite usar mas opciones gráficas e instalación de texturas)[/url]
[*][url=http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director's_Cut#SweetFX]SweetFX (Remueve el filtro azul del juego)[/url]
    [*][url=http://www.ntcore.com/4gb_patch.php]Asignarle más RAM al ejecutable de Deadly Premonition (Aumenta por bastante la estabilidad del juego)[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198016654400', 'num_games_owned': 506, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1440789028}
review:
When you've been playing the game for about 10 minutes and you're glad it hasn't crashed yet - that's not a good sign. I've played this game for about 4 hours, and I've spent another 4 hours to try to get this game to work. When I finally did get the game to run better (that is not crashing every 10 minutes but every 20 minutes instead), my save file became corrupted and I can't advance in the storyline. And I'm not the only one with these problems. 

It's a shame though, because the game itself is really really really good. The game hasn't been updated for years, so don't expect it to become any better.

Do not buy this game at any price. Do not even accept it for free. If you're really interested in this game you're better off buying the Xbox 360 version or watching a let's play on Youtube. Because this is one of the worst PC ports on Steam.

I'll start with the cons:

- Bugs and crashes galore, be prepared to deal with issues, more so if you're going to use Durante's Dp Fix mod (which is essential).  A great place to start is the pinned "Techinical Support Topic" in the forums if you decide to start playing this game (which is worth it, despite how this critique starts).  This is an issue that I wouldn't blame people for being really upset about but if you have the patience it'll work out fine.  

- No in-game graphic settings, no AA, no resolution settings (defaults to 1280x720)... zip, nadda, nothing.  Unless you use the afore mentionned Dp fix where Durante the modder added the ability to tune various settings in the mods .ini file. 

- Graphics are hit or miss, some areas in the game will leave you scratching your head wondering if the textures were vomited into the game as oppossed to programed. 

Sort of in the middle:

- Some Controls/gameplay:  There is controller support (I use an Xbox 360 wired controller without issue, thankfully...), haven't tried the keyboard and mouse controls.  Control is serviceable, I can vouch that the default settings are actually better than the xbox 360 version of the game, you can react a little faster and aim better with this control scheme. 

- Driving! Oh my...  Picture driving a giant heavy brick with wheels that are smaller bricks.  It's almost hilarious, it's a universe where turning down the street can only be done in small calculated increments. Miss a turn in one the games side races and then marvel at the excrutiatingly slow reverse function complete with the back up sounds of a forklift and the engine power of a small lawn mower. 

Finally the pros!

- The story is fascinating, the characters are eccentric and a joy to interact with. The main character is absolutely fantastic!!  He's funny, smart and a bit smarmy, it's a lot of fun to watch him rattle the towns folk.  The voice acting is pretty good as far as I'm concerned and each character exudes uniqueness, personality or eccentricity.  There are some pretty laugh out loud moments too!  Also helps that I'm a Twin Peaks fan as the game makes no bones about taking direct influence from that material.  
 
- Albeit the graphics are a bit dated, there are areas that have really good art style: like the interiours; the diner looks really cool and each house you can enter has  distinct personality and depth. 

- It's an open world, you are given plenty of time between points in the main story line to explore the town.  Nice details peppered all over the place and collectables to grab.  Lots of side quests that aren't too taxing and also some that add some extra context to the main mystery at hand.   Every interactable character seems to have differenct routines, so you won't always find characters in the same place.  For example: you can observe from the windows on the outside of some homes that have characters in them, one time I observed Emily the police officer, it was about 10pm game time, wearing a blue dress (which I've never seen her wear) and casually enjoying her living room or the time I peeked in on the Ingrams around dinner time, the whole family was there.  The twins appeared to be interacting with themselves while watching tv.  Mrs. Ingram was making dinner in the kitchen and then Keith walked in through the front door (I was there because I decided to follow him from the milk barn, not creeping, observing!!!), he went to the fridge grabbed a beer and sat next to the twins (how's the peeping Tommy... how's the peeping). I thought it was kind of neat because there was effort to make the world feel like it was living around you.  

- Some really tense moments in the game, especially the moments where it turns into screen on screen, your characters perspective and the killers perspective.  Those parts are amazing!

I originally played and finished the game on the xbox 360 and now  i've been compelled to play it again, this time the  directors cut on the p.c.  It's a budget game but get past some of the foibles and  you have a very unique and memorable game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028080098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6038, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5890, 'last_played': 1442932317}
review:
[b]Análisis patrocinado por Sr. Sugus de Piña (Pulmonarro)[/b]

Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut, juego del estudio japonés [b]Access Games,[/b] publicado en Abril de 2013 para PS3 en formato físico y para PC en formato digital pudiendo adquirirse mediante Steam y GOG.com, el montaje del director es una versión exclusiva de Europa y Estados Unidos e incluye mejoras a nivel gráfico y de jugabilidad así como nuevo contenido como escenarios adicionales y un final alternativo entre otros.

[b]Dato curioso:[/b] En japón el juego es conocido como "Red Seeds Profile".

[h1][b]HISTORIA[/b][/h1]
Fancis York Morgan, un agente especial del FBI es enviado a Greenvale, un pueblo ficticio del Estado de Washington, para investigar el asesinato de Anna Graham, antes de su llegada al pueblo York sufre un accidente de coche provocado por la aparición de un hombre con impermeable rojo en la carretera, viéndose obligado a dirigirse al pueblo a pie, momento en el cual descubrirá que algo extraño ocurre en este pueblo; a partir de aquí, empieza un largo periplo para averiguar la verdad que se esconde tras el asesinato de Anna Graham y la historia del pueblo,York contará con la inestimable ayuda del Sheriff George Woodman y los ayudantes Emily Wyatt y Thomas MacLaine, ¿será capaz York de descubrir la verdad con la ayuda de su alter ego Zach?

[h1][b]DESARROLLO[/b][/h1]
[b]Deadly Premonition: Director's Cut[/b] es una experiencia jugable sin igual gracias a la mezcla de géneros que alberga en su interior, principalmente es un juego de mundo abierto (sandbox) en el que los momentos de acción son desarrollados al estilo de los survival horror clásicos, todo ello con dosis de thriller de terror, manteniendo una narrativa excepcional que mantiene al jugador expectante ante el desarrollo de la historia, algo que a su vez se complementa con la interacción con los distintos habitantes del pueblo, cada uno con su personalidad bien definida y papel que desempeñar en la historia narrada.

A continuación profundizaré en su vertiente sandbox, como buen juego de mundo abierto, la libertad de movimiento e interacción es total pudiendo recorrer el mapeado que conforma el pueblo y sus alrededores al completo, ya sea a pie o en coche, hay gran variedad de coches que podremos manejar durante la aventura, cada uno con sus características, y aunque el control no es el mejor, la mejor forma de disfrutar de estos momentos es desde la vista en primera persona, tanto por el recorrido como por la conducción y por supuesto, habrá que estar pendientes de la cantidad de gasolina que nos queda en el depósito para no quedarnos tirados en medio de la nada.

Podremos interactuar con los distintos habitantes del pueblo, ya sea simplemente hablando con ellos para recavar información para el caso, cumplir una misión secundaria (50 en total) o abastecernos de objetos, nuevos coches y armas o simplemente comer y beber; aunque las misiones secundarias no son obligatorias y no influyen directamente en la historia principal, si desvelarán información y detalles sobre ciertos habitantes que complementan la historia principal, así como poder conseguir ciertas armas y objetos que nos serán de gran utilidad durante la aventura. 

La climatología es fundamental así como el horario, ya que depende de estos dos factores la rutina diaria de los habitantes del pueblo, por ejemplo para poder realizar algunas misiones secundarias será necesario acudir a un determinado lugar con una climatología y a una hora determinada, por otro lado, las distintas tiendas y el restaurante tienen un horario propio, lo que ayuda a transmitir el día a día de sus habitantes cuyas conversaciones y actos van cambiando según se desarrollan los acontecimientos de la historia principal.

York tendrá que vigilar su hambre y cansancio, lo que hará que el jugador se preocupe por visitar regularmente tiendas y el restaurante para abastecerse de comida y/o dormir para evitar que York caiga rendido, a su vez entra en juego el ritmo cardíaco de York, el cual va aumentando mientras que corre o usa el turbo del coche que conduce, si llega al límite deberá usar un estabilizador para devolver su ritmo cardíaco a la normalidad; el tener que estar pendiente del estado de salud, hambre y cansancio de York otorga al jugador mayor sensación de inmersión en la historia e interacción con el protagonista.

[h1][b]COMBATE[/b][/h1]
A continuación profundizaré en la vertiente de acción/survival horror del juego, en los momentos de acción, en los que seremos trasladados al "Otro Mundo", nos enfrentaremos con seres conocidos como las sombras que son personas muertas controladas por "...", no pueden ver a los humanos pero si escuchar su respiración, hay dos tipos de estas, desarmadas, que nos atacarán directamente intentando cogernos o armadas con armas de combate cuerpo a cuerpo o de fuego así como su variante más peligrosa y letal que surge de los conductos de ventilación y se desplaza por el techo y paredes; si nos encontramos de 00:00 a 06:00 en las calles/alrededores del pueblo, el "Otro Mundo" hará presencia y las sombras, bandadas de pájaros y perros salvajes gigantes camparán a sus anchas.

En ciertas ocasiones tendremos que hacer frente al "asesino del impermeable", ya sea evitándole al pulsar un botón determinado en eventos "QTE" o huir de él a toda carrera e incluso escondernos en taquillas manteniendo la respiración, momentos en los que se nos mostrará  la visión de York y la del propio asesino del impermeable.

En cuanto al armamento, tendremos gran variedad de armas de combate cuerpo a cuerpo y de fuego, cada una con sus propias características, como son alcance, daño, durabilidad, velocidad de ataque y munición, las encontraremos en los distintos escenarios, al derrotar enemigos o al comprarlas en la armería; mención especial merecen las que obtenemos al completar misiones secundarias, ya que son indestructibles o de munición infinita.

[h1][b]MOTOR GRÁFICO / DISEÑO ARTÍSTICO[/b][/h1]
Access Games se decantó por el uso del motor [b]PhysX[/b] de Nvidia, el port para PC sufre de popping en el paisaje lejano así como de crasheos aleatorios, está capado a 720p en cuanto a resolución y apenas ofrece opciones gráficas que configurar, así como una paleta de colores bastante "fría", prácticamente todo se puede solucionar empleando entre 5 y 10 minutos usando esta guía:

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=218647912

En cuanto al diseño artístico, algo desfasado cuando salió la versión original en 2010 pero aún así, los personajes están muy detallados y la belleza de ciertos parajes del pueblo es excepcional, mención especial merecen las habitaciones "roja y blanca". Los enemigos aunque no son muchos, si cuentan con varios modelos de sombras, igualmente bien detallados.

[h1][b]BANDA SONORA / SONIDOS FX[/b][/h1]
La B.S.O. del juego es excepcional, hay 3 ó 4 temas que se repiten bastante a lo largo del juego, pero encaja perfectamente en cada momento, mientras pesquéis silbaréis, cada coche tiene su propia melodía, los momentos de acción y trágicos son acompañados también por melodías increíbles, todo obra de [b]Riyou Kinugasa, Takuya Kobayashi e Hiromi Mizutani,[/b] podéis adquirirla en Steam como DLC.

El doblaje aunque en inglés es de muy buena factura, en cuanto a los FX, cumplen su función, sin más.

[h1][b]COLECCIONABLES / EXTRAS / REJUGABILIDAD[/b][/h1]
50 misiones secundarias, 65 cromos que conseguir, armas de durabilidad y munición infinitas, poder pescar distintos objetos en distintas localizaciones del pueblo, varios coches y trajes que conseguir y 60 horas de diversión.

[h1][b]VALORACIÓN FINAL[/b][/h1]
Deadly Premonition DC se ha convertido en un juego de culto por su historia, ambientación, carisma de los personajes y mezcla de géneros, ¡¡hazte con él YAAA!! 

[h1][b]NOTA: 9 sobre 10[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198008119266', 'num_games_owned': 1671, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1503776585}
review:
This port is absolutely miserable, and frankly I could have lived without ever getting to experience Deadly Premonition if it also meant never having to experience a port this bad.

I don't think whatever good there is to the game, and there's a lot to recommend, is worth tearing your hair out getting it to work. Even after getting it to run at its best, I experienced myriad problems. One in particular is that, without wishing to spoil, there are moments when the game will pull a sort of picture-in-picture thing where you're seeing the main game camera, and a second camera from another character, and for whatever reason my computer found this the most difficult to manage, and I have a pretty decent rig. I do not have any explanation for why this is so. Garry's Mod has no issues with a similar set-up. Split-screen multiplayer games in general on my PC manage this with no problems. Why, then, does this game have an issue with it? It's a pretty important effect as far as the gameplay goes, why would they code it so poorly?

Rising Star ought to be ashamed of themselves for allowing this to make it to retail, and they should be even more ashamed that they have still yet to make any effort to fix it. Absolutely shameful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025461832', 'num_games_owned': 728, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 294, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1645187618}
review:
Ya iba a sabiendas de que era un juego bastante horrendo en la parte técnica: controles desfasados, crashes al escritorio, ralentizaciones que se arreglan reiniciando el ordenador (¿?)... pero esperaba que después de 3 horas de juego la historia me enganchase, pero de momento es bastante simplona y tarda muchísimo en desarrollarse.

Tiene pinta de que es un juego que solo pueden disfrutar los que encuentren los guiños y referencias a Twin Peaks. El gameplay es monótono y aburrido, técnicamente es un desastre, aunque he de reconocer que las cutscenes están muy curradas para el presupuesto que debió tener el juego.

No es un juego injusto o frustrante, pero es rematadamente lento y la historia no ha conseguido engancharme durante el tiempo que lo he jugado.

review:

review: Well, this game have both very positive and very negative reviews, with the positive praising it's narrative and the negative it's gameplay. They're both right, but in the end, i think that the game falls into the negative side for a couple of reasons: bad PC port with outdated graphics, fixed resolution and no settings; poor and repetitive sounds; poor shooting mechanics; bad map design, because while it's a small town everything it's spaced out; bugs and glitches; and for me the game crashed about 5-6 times. But beside the crashes, the game is completely playable, and i can recommend it for cheap because of: gripping story; interesting NPC's; you can relax, do 50 side-quests or replay chapters; nice soundtrack; plenty of achievements, has trading cards, and full gamepad support (no cloud though). It's a really weird and low budged game, but if you can overlook it's many faults, you may enjoy it if you get it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984219654', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1468871971}
review:
Talvez minha mais dificil recomendação, "Deadly Premonition: Director's Cut" é um ótimo terrível game. Tem tantas coisas dando errado no jogo, mas ainda assim, continuo intrigado, esperando que ele melhore. O game é uma mistura da mecânica de Resident Evil 4 com as técnicas narrativas de Alan Wake (com uma ótima trilha sonora) num mundo aberto ao melhor estilo "Que-diabos-é-isso?" de Silent Hill. A história de um investigador indo para uma cidade do interior para desvendar um misterioso assassinato é genérica, porém interessante. Os personagens são bizarros, os diálogos são dignos de filmes como "Evil Dead: A morte do Demônio" e os monologos do personagem principal fazem altas referências a cultura pop (Viu? Não dá pra definir ao certo se isso é um ponto fraco ou forte). Veja uns trailers, uns gameplays e se possível, jogue o demo antes de decidir pegar esse jogo, mas ainda assim, me parece correto recomendá-lo.

+ Ótima trilha sonora
+ Ênfase no Roteiro
+ Climão de filme de terror B dos anos 80/90

- Gráficos poderiam ser muito melhores, muitas vezes me lembram obras saídas do "Garry's Mod"/ ainda não consegui jogar em resolução 1080x1020
- Comandos no carro te fazem imaginar como deve ser dirigir uma caixa de papelão.
- História demora muito pra andar. Cerca de 3  horas de jogo e ainda tive poucos encontros com inimigos ou puzzles, só cutscenes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067159810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1485637309}
review:
So, let's get this straight: this is a TERRIBLE game. But I love it so much. Now to explain why I feel this way.

Deadly Premonition follows the story of a quirky FBI detective, Francis York Morgan (just call him York), as he and his imaginary friend Zach solve the mystery behind the murder of a young women, Anna Graham, in the fictional town of Greenvale, Washington. It's a classic "who dun it", story, which slowly melts more and more into the bizzare, and stange as you get further along into the game. It should be said, that this game clearly takes HEAVY inspiration from the 90s TV series Twin Peaks, which follows a similar story of a detective unravelling the murder of a young women, which also slowly gets more and more surreal as the series gets further along in it's story. 

The gameplay, and graphics are by far where most concerns arise regarding the game, with shoddy aiming, terrible driving while you drive around the town doing either the main quest, or the various other sidequests,
 bad textures, some character models look like ones you'd see in PS2 games, bad framerate, etc. Some gameplay decisions made in this game can be extremely baffling in how poorly designed they are. These are by far the games weakest aspect, and are honestly sometimes a hassle to play through. But, however I believe the game makes up for what it lacks in its characters, and overall quirkiness. 

I cannot tell you how many times I smiled, or gave a chuckle to the characters interacting with each other, I won't spoil any of these moments, as you should most definately experiance for themselves, but I can say that if the game hits any nail on the head, it is most definately in this aspect. Some may find some distaste in the campy/cheesy/sometimes downright TERRIBLE diolouge in this game, but I personally loved it, and I found myself getting excited when I was playing through the game, and a cutscene would appear, because it meant I would get a chuckle or two out of it. Something should also be said about the soundtrack, as it fits the surreal, quirky atmosphere of the game perectly. The game is also quite lengthy, with various sidequests you can do, in addition to the main story.

Now, many people wouldn't find this justification to buy this game, that the gameplay and graphics completely ruin the experiance, but I would seriously disagree. It seems to me that this game had a lot of love, and effort put behind it, but the game developers skills just didn't match up to what they were hoping would turn out. As I said, some may not like this game, some may even hate this game, but to those who want a different experiance, something that is out of norm, and completely changes the way you would normally think about games, I'd say give this game a go. I've bought this game three times already, on the Xbox 360, PS3, and of course PC, and I haven't regretting buying a single copy. This game will give you a unforgetable ride, which must be played to be believed.  In my opinion, this is without a doubt, the best worst game I have ever played. AND I LOVED EVERY MINUTE OF IT.

review:
OK, this game surely has its problem. It's a bad port, it needs some twisting around from keeping it from crashing, the driving mechanics are objectively bad, and the graphics is surely not top notch.
But this game is a breath of fresh air from all the "this game mechanics work, let's copy-paste it" games, it's extremely original and has a great late 90's early 2000 japanese vibe. It has one of the best horror plot ever seen in video game history, the character development is incredible and i was surely not expecting anything even close to this level. The english production is great, the voice acting is magnificent. The game is an open world investigation horror with paranormal elements, and it's unique in its genre. It's surely a game to try out, sadly the first 15 minutes of tutorial are not representative of the rest of the game and can turn a lot of people off before they get to the real beginning of the game.
I really feel like recomending this to anyone who wants to try something different from the gaming standards we are accustomed today

author: {'steamid': '76561198117396740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1615, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1454235991}
review:
Direkt zum Anfang eine Anmerkung: das ist kein richtiges Review und soll auch gar keins sein.

Warum?

Das Spiel, oder um ganz genau zu sein DIESE VERSION DES SPIELS ist so massiv verbuggt, dass es nur ein einziges Wort gibt, mit dem man es beschreiben kann:

[h1]UNSPIELBAR.[/h1]

[h1]Wie sieht das aus?[/h1] 
Es stürzt an bestimmten Stellen IMMER ab. Diese scheinen von Spieler zu Spieler zu variieren, aber das ändert an der Sache ja nichts. Meist sind es Cutscenes, bei denen das Spiel aufhört zu arbeiten. 
Genauer gesagt schließt einfach das Spiel und man bekommt die Fehlermeldung "dp.exe funktioniert nicht mehr". Im Forum gibt es dafür zwar Anleitungen was zu tun ist, aber NICHTS HILFT (Mir jedenfalls nicht). Ich selbst und ein paar andere haben es auch mit "Ersatz-Saves" probiert,die es zum Runterladen gibt, aber selbst das hilft nicht. 
In meinem Fall handelt es sich um die ALLGEMEIN BEKANNTE Stelle - Episode 2 / Kapitel 09 -, allgemein bekannt weil das Spiel an der Stelle wohl bei vielen Usern den Geist aufgibt. Überspringt man die erste Sequenz des Kapitels (mit Hilfe des Saves), kommt man zwar an der ursprünglichen "Absturzstelle" vorbei, allerdings nur bis zum nächsten Dialog. D.h. das Spiel stürzt weiterhin ab, nur eben an anderer, leicht verschobener Stelle.

Obwohl diese Tatsache allgemein und lange bekannt ist (das Spiel ist ja auch hier auf Steam NICHT neu), gibt es keinen Patch dafür.
Wenn man [h1]Gerüchten[/h1] glauben darf, wurde wohl das Entwicklerteam kurz nach dem Release der PC-Version des Spiels (das Spiel selbst ist ein xbox 360/PS 3 - Port) entlassen. Wahrscheinlich vom Publisher aus, oder wem auch immer ... ist ja auch egal. Es würde zumindest erklären, warum nicht mal solch spielzerstörende Bugs behoben wurden. (Mal ganz abgesehen davon, dass sich der Port wie eine "Early-Access-Alpha"-Version spielt. Außerdem kann man lesen, dass es den Port ohnehin nur gab, weil es von der Community so gewollt wurde [i](siehe "Dark Souls - Prepare to Die Edition, die ja auch nur auf "flehen" der Community für den PC erschien ... mit dem Unterschied, dass diese zumindest spielbar ist, wenn man einen Controller besitzt)[/i] und man entsprechend halt einfach was für den PC zurechtgeklatscht hat, ohne zu testen, ob es überhaupt läuft.

Das  ist auch ein Grund, wieso ich kein "richtiges" Review schreiben kann. Mir fehlen einfach notwendige Infos und mir irgendwelche Sachen ausdenken oder wild zu spekulieren, nur um irgendetwas zu schreiben, wäre hier einfach nur dumm.

Nunja, einige können es scheinbar spielen, viele nicht. Ich kann es nicht. Deswegen 
[h1]DAUMEN RUNTER[/h1]

für diese Version.

(Die Originalversion soll wohl genial sein, weswegen ich nicht das Spiel generell bewerten will ... und auch gar nicht kann, wie gesagt ...)

In diesem Sinne nochmal deutlich:
[h1]FINGER WEG VON DER PC-VERSION[/h1]es sei denn ihr bekommt sie kostenlos. Dann hat man ja auch nichts verloren, außer ein paar Stunden Lebenszeit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046033386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2850, 'last_played': 1533858862}
review:
You know what I love about this game?
Everything.

I show this game off all the time and most people think I'm joking.
I first played this back in 2012.
This is genuinely my favorite game of all time.

The story is like if you took Twin Peaks, translated it into Japanese, had a dude translate it back into English and then had another guy try to read back the lines in Japanese with his only exposure to English having been some late night sitcoms.
Basically what I'm saying is it's amazing, it has so many twists and major plot points that left me stunned.
One of the most satisfying boss fights of all time is against a cross dressing man who flys around calling you a skank.
The characters were likeable and kooky in their own way and were generally unique and not bland archetypes.
Some of the most memorable and funny lines in the world "FK in the coffee" and "The answer is [onion]"
The graphics while lackluster contribute to the off-kilter world of Greenvale.

The only downside is this version crashes all the time and the PS3/Xbox version is slow as hell.
But if you download DPfix it mostly fixes the crashes, except for some very specific ones.
(Hint: Wait for it to start raining before you go in the Town Hall to fix that crash)

This game is pretty swell.

review: This recommendation comes with an asterisk. The vanilla PC version of DP is actually kind of disasterous. There are a handful of game breaking bugs and there's no native 1080. Get this game with the DP fix mod and consider getting color correction mods. That aside, this game is bliss. Don't play it if you're one of those "gameplay is king" people, because honestly the gameplay is mostly inconsequential. However, the script, animations, and overall plot will grab your attention in a way similar to a fantastic B-movie, and it's quite obviously intentional. Swery is like a mixture between Tommy Wiseu, Hideo Kojima, and David Lynch. Cannot recommend this game enough over and above the problems it has.

review: This game is quirky, unpolished and unfortunately very crash prone - but nonetheless a hidden gem in my opinion. Story, characters and atmosphere are simply great. It is an open world mystery thriller with a strong resemblance to the TV series Twin Peaks by David Lynch, which is quite unique as far as I know. Apart from the main storyline there are numerous side missions. Most of them are somewhat hidden, but they provide additional understanding of the world (a North-American small town) and the people within it. After many entertaining hours it was hard for me to say goodbye to Greenvale in the end.

Дважды мне убивала сохранения, что невозможно было пройти дальше (а, качать с интернета - там всё пройдено, и перепрохождение глав идет далеко, не как прохождение вашей игры... как-то так). author: {'steamid': '76561198050385190', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 1290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1290, 'last_played': 1438610468}
review:
Voy a dividir este analisis en dos partes, por que creo que se lo merece.
Serán pues la parte jugable y la historia.

Jugable :

Simple y llanamente pésimo, triste, ridiculo e incluso gracioso que a veces se aprecia.
Los controles son un completo caos, aparte añadiremos la mala optimización, que hace que nuestro personaje parezca loco.
Como he dicho, el juego a veces se parece a un simulador de crash, en mi run de este juego tengo que decir que se me ha crasheado alrededor de 20-25 veces como mínimo.
Los recorridos de misión a misión son la mayoria abusivos, quiero decir, deberemos viajar unos 5 mins en coche y no bromeo.
No es todo negativo, la música es preciosa, música que evidentemente adquiriré a la larga.

Historia :

Pues si DP falla en lo jugable, esto es un zasca, Simplemente en historia este juego para mi ha sido un "no-va-más", totalmente sorprendente este juego ha conseguido enomararme en su historia de manera que MUY pocos juegos han conseguido hacer a lo largo de su recorrido.
Deadly Premonition es el juego que juegas por su historia, por que sí. podra ser complicado en  otros aspectos, pero realmente te sientes realizado e incluso vacío cuando completas la historia y sabes que ya no vas a ver más a Francis ni a Zack.

Jugable : 5/10
Historia : 9,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198036069347', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1450582548}
review:
It's an incredible game, it's simultaneously terrible and amazing (beyond "so bad it's good", you're going to have to take my word for it)
making for one of the most unique, confusing, hilarious, and quotable gaming experiences ever to grace the face of the universe.

So why not recommended then? The port is probably the single worst I have ever had the misfortune of experiencing.
If you pick this up prepare to be greeted with such lovely features such as:[list]
[*]720p resolution lock (Can be fixed by DPFix)
[*]15fps, but only half the time you start the game. Also note it's still running at 60 (evident by some of the camera movement and the pause menu, but the timing is messed up for everything else).
[*]Bad controller support. This game was originally a XBox 360 game, which makes the dev's choice of DirectInput over XInput make even less sense. Editing controller binding happens in the launcher and is extremely limited & finicky (DPFix does give you a few more options through ini files).
[*]Random crashes, the game tends to crash randomly due to memory leaks or just bugs in the game code. There's some ways to lessen the effect but no way to get rid of all of them.
[*]Not so random crashes, some parts of the the game just outright crash and you have to do all sorts of stuff to try to work around them (such as running in compatibility mode for Win98, or rebooting your PC), but even that's not as bad as
[*]Save file corruption, save files can easily become corrupted, causing the game to crash soon after load, and usually in the same spots. Sometimes the only work around is to delete your save and start again. Save often and backup saves often.
[/list]

It's a great game but it's just not worth the money they're asking for considering the state of the port, however if it goes really cheap it might be worth the gamble if you can make the port bearable.
If you are a XB360 or PS3 owner then I highly recommended you pick it up for one of those if you can find it cheap (might need to import the PS3 version however).
If you just want your dose of SWERY then I suggest you go and pick up D4: Dark Dreams Don't Die, which is cheaper and has a good PC port (Unreal Engine 3).

author: {'steamid': '76561198018937335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 134, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1438075285}
review:
La historia es muy buena, el ritmo de la historia es bueno, es lo que debe ser un sandbox de investigación (que aprenda LA Noire), la variedad de secundarias está bastante bien, los personajes estan MUY bien construidos,... sin duda recomendaría el juego a pesar de sus limitaciones técnicas, pero no puedo. Si bien me ha encantado la programación es un desastre. Problemas que he sufrido:

- Primero tuve que ejecutarlo en modo ventana, bajarme un programa para que use más RAM y ejecutarlo como modo administrador para hacerlo más estable
- Guardaba cada vez que encontraba un checkpoint, porque si no se me ha cerrado 30 veces el juego solo no se me ha cerrado ninguna.
- Tenía que estar siempre antento de llevar tabaco (para pasar el tiempo rápido) porque hay misiones que si te las pasas muy rápido, como en el restaurante, se crashea
- Procurar no rejugar capítulos para hacer sus secundarias, porque te pueden desaparecer items importantes
- Ver como 6 o 7 secuencias en youtube porque se cuelga el juego si las dejo, sobre todo en la casa de cierto personaje
- Además he sufrido bugs del tipo de que el personaje no corre bien y tengo que estar dándole al botón de correr varias veces, misiones que no salen en el mapa, la conducción es horrible y a veces el mismo coche gira más que otras veces... es un despropósito.
- Si bien me marca más de 30 horas, la verdad es que son unas 15. Lo que pasa que si el juego iba bien durante mucho rato no lo cerraba para que aguantase más sin crashes

Si sois muy pacientes y estáis dispuestos a soportar todo eso, es un gran juego. Si no huid de él. Otra opción es jugarlo en consola, que si bien tiene un montón de errores, al menos los crashes desaparecen casi todos.

El peor port de la historia sin duda

author: {'steamid': '76561198170076253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1490494813}
review:
Dos años después de escribir mi primer análisis de este juego, el cual teneis un poco más abajo, he vuelto a instalarlo para darle otra oportunidad. Nada nuevo. Cuelgues en los mismo sitios, repetir la misma sección cinco veces hasta que le dio por no colgarse y, finalmente, llegar a un determinado punto del juego, el mismo que la primera vez que jugué, donde el juego colapsa definitivamente y no deja continuar. Para mí esta es la última vez que lo intento, ya que le he metido parches y he intentado mil soluciones que hay por internet y nada de nada.

Así pues NO RECOMIENDO este despropósito de videojuego a nadie.

------------------

Había leído un montón de criticas acerca de este juego, en las cuales te dabas cuenta de que u odiabas este juego o lo amabas. No había punto intermedio. Yo no sabría deciros.

Soy capaz de perdonar su apartado gráfico totalmente desfasado y su jugabilidad arcaica. De hecho el juego me estaba gustando ya que la historia poco a poco engancha. No obstante lo que no soy capaz de perdonar son los continuos cuelgues del juego. No es normal que me tocase repetir cinco veces la misma parte del juego solo porque de repente le de por sufrir un error y colapsar el juego, llegando finalmente a dejar de funcionar en una parte específica del juego e impidiendo continuar la historia.

Si algún día me vuelvo a animar probablemente lo instale y le de una segunda oportunidad. Sin embargo, si estais pensado en comprarlo yo os recomiendo que NO lo hagais, a no ser que esté a precio de risa.

Un saludo

author: {'steamid': '76561197989668621', 'num_games_owned': 627, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 911, 'last_played': 1437368400}
review:
While I enjoy the story of this game I cannot overlook the constant crashes and bugs that abound in this poorly ported title, especially given the $25 USD price tag. 

My game freezes about 5-10% of the time when checking side quests.
Random freezing during loading screens.
Performance issues on a beefy rig when running windowed.
Unable to interact with required doors/objects during certian missions. 
Issues while driving that cause my tires to sink into the road bringing my car to a sudden stop. 

Also, this game is locked to 720p which can be fixed with the dpfix mod but installing that brought about an issue where the game freezes when I tab out. 

If my friend did not want to watch me stream this game I would have already deleted it within the first hour of gameplay. 

TL;DR : Great story, amusing characters in this Twin Peaks inspired game but bugs and crashes make the game nearly unplayable. Not worth the price. 3/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040997872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 857, 'last_played': 1440543776}
review:
Let me tell you something about Deadly Premonition.  The controls are clunky, and driving, being maybe half of the game, is a nightmare. The character animations are awkward and at times terrifying. The squirrels make public-domain monkey noises and the fast travel mechanic (if you get it) is punctuated with a cartoon car crash sound. The voice acting ranges from actually enjoyable to god-awful. Half of the time, the game crashes or won't let me load my saves, and I had to download a patch just to get the game to run at over 720p. 
This might be one of the best games I've ever played.
'Twin Peaks: The Game' is an accurate description for the storyline -- Except York could challenge Agent Cooper one-on-one with how downright charming he is as a character. If nothing else, play for the story and the interactions between the characters; this game has some moments that are truly hilarious, and some that are just completely off-the-wall, and the end has a twist that will make you want to replay to truly understand what's happened. True, you could just watch a Let's Play on Youtube, but in doing so you'll miss half of the true charm. The side-missions, while infuriating, and the long monologues York has in the driving sections are really the cherry on top of this sundae of dysfunctional oddity.
This isn't a game for everyone, but if you do like it, it's like this game was made for you. 
In short: This game is awful. I love every awful moment of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075828588', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 3383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3289, 'last_played': 1437215483}
review:
Итак, приключения в Гринвейле подошли к концу, пора обдумать всё это, Зак.
Это настолько [u]противоречивая игра[/u], что спорить о её достоинствах и недостатках можно часами.
Начнём с недостатков.
[b]УЖАСНАЯ ТЕХНИЧЕСКАЯ РЕАЛИЗАЦИЯ![/b]
Это просто кошмар. Помните самые ужасные порты на пк? ([b]Devil May Cry 3, Resident Evil 4, Dark Souls[/b]). Так вот - у них пополнение. Это один из самых [u]отвратительнейших[/u] портов, что я видел за свой век.  
Давайте по порядку
[b]МЕРЗКАЯ ГРАФИКА![/b]
Ужас! Не поймите меня превратно – но так выглядели игры на запуске PS2. Ещё и настроек нет :(
Убогие модели, убогое окружение, убогое освещение, ужасные текстуры и [u]блюр[/u]. [u]Много блюра[/u].
И ещё бывает фпс проседает. Ну это вообще без комментариев.
[b]ПАРШИВЫЙ ЗВУК![/b]
Качество звука и звуковых эффектов оставляет желать лучшего. Ещё есть проблемы с поддержкой оборудования и баги.
О, да) 
Если вы обладатель гарнитур 5.1, 7.1 – уберите их подальше от этой игры.
[b]ВЫЛЕТЫ![/b]
Это отдельная тема) Игра может идти идеально, а может вылетать на каждой кат-сцене.
Что с этой игрой не так – одному Заку известно.
Всё ещё читаете? Значит, возможно, у Вас хватит терпения оценить эту игру по достоинству.
Поговорим о спорных моментах.
А что представляет из себя игра, если опустить детали технического характера?
[b]Deadly Premonition[/b] – эта такая странная помесь из [b]GTA, Silent-Hill’а, Alan Wake[/b]. Ну и возможно, [b]L.A. Noire[/b].
Играем мы за Йорка – агента ФБР, прибывшего в маленький городок Гринвейл расследовать убийство. И чем может заниматься агент ФБР, прибывший на расследование?
Да ничего особенного – занимается тем, чем занимается [u]обычный среднестатистический агент ФБР[/u]! Ест, пьёт, спит, курит ([i]весьма стильно[/i]), бреется, рыбачит, собирает коллекционные карточки, ездит по чекпоинтам на машине под вариацию песни [i]American Idiot[/i] группы [i]Green Day[/i]…
И тут мы переходим к спорному моменту в этой игре – это игровой процесс.
Он странный. Он кривой. Местами очень скучный. «Зато Сэндбокс!» - Скажите Вы)
Какой к чёрту сэндбокс?! Какая ещё нахрен свобода!?
В игре нечем заняться помимо основного сюжета и дополнительных заданий.
Экшен часть вообще [b]мрак[/b]. В игре есть два типа врагов. Ну ок, 3. Ладно 5.
 «Тени» (Так зовут местный бестиарий), которые бьют вблизи или засовывают свои грязные руки Йорку в [u]рот[/u] (О_О), тени, которые стреляют по Вам с расстояния, ползущие по стенам кикиморы, а также нечасто встречающиеся зомби-псы и птички.
Есть ещё загадочный убийца в красном дождевике, но рядовым противником его не назовёшь – он появляется только по праздникам.
Так вот, по всем этим упырям совершенно неинтересно стрелять, опасности они никакой не представляют, выглядят скучно и вообще такие эпизоды обычно затянуты и ничего кроме зевоты не вызывают. Чтобы не заснуть, запасайтесь кофе) [i]Кофе важный элемент расследования :)[/i]
Ещё есть боссы. 
Мда…
Ах да. Ещё вы будете в этой игре ездить на машине. Много ездить. 
Какая же тут поганая физика… Автомобили ведут себя как утюги на льду. Ездить вам надоест очень быстро.Зато дворники можно включать и выключать и поворотники. ^_^ В игре присутствует быстрое перемещение, но о нём я узнал, только на втором прохождении :( - так что будьте внимательны и не пропускайте сайд-квесты. Облегчите себе жизнь.
Кстати о [b]ФИЗИКЕ[/b]. Вернее про её отсутствие. Уж не знаю, что там обрабатывает [i]PhysX[/i], логотип которого красуется в титрах (наверно поведение галстука на костюме Йорка), но и без того неубедительный мир, с такой физикой выглядит совсем картонным.
В общем геймплей не удался.
Ладно, поговорим о хорошем)
А что же есть хорошего в этой игре? 
Переходим к [b]ПЛЮСАМ)[/b]
[i]Сюжет, атмосфера и персонажи.[/i]
Если Вы сможете пережить всё это мракобесие, дадите игре шанс – то увидите, что медленно погружаетесь в местную атмосферу. Этот маленький городок, полный тайн, манит и притягивает словно свет – мотыльков. Есть приятная музыка. Её немного, но она хорошо подчёркивает происходящее. 
А эти персонажи)))  Каждый персонаж  хорошо прописан, и имеет свою изюминку. А тамошний сюжет припас немало твистов, которые заставят Вас не раз удивиться.
И вот что удивительно – при всей своей кривизне – игра затягивает. Она заставляет проникнуться историей, персонажами, диалогами. Она заставляет задуматься о том, что происходит. Да и не только) Редко какие игры обладают таким качеством. Если вы любите достойные сюжеты, глубокую атмосферу, любите поразмыслить – не проходите мимо. 
Может, Вы сможете найти в [b]Deadly Premonition[/b] то, что искали... [i]Верно, Зак?)[/i]

review:

- Bugdan, hatadan geçilmiyorsa,

author: {'steamid': '76561197969864366', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2759, 'last_played': 1436734430}
review:
How best to put this? 
Tldr version:

Do I like Deadly Premonition?   YES
Does it deserve it's Cult following?    I think So.
Is it a good, GAME?  No
Would I recommend it? 
Only if you are INCREDIBLY patient and have a love for Dark, Twin Peaks style mystery and quirky Humour.

----------------------------------

Firstly the Twin Peaks references are obvious, so if you're a fan, it's already got that to its advantage.
Initially it feels a bit too close for comfort, almost a carbon copy, but Deadly Premonition does a good job of building on its influences and has an engaging and exciting plotline the comes into its own as the game progresses.

The progression of the story is wonderfully executed and I felt genuinely invested in the characters at the end of the game, giving it all the more impact. 
The plot was dark and disturbing, yet light hearted and humourous at the right times and often left a number of potential candidates for the 'culprit', yet left enough uncertainty to make me doubt I was SURE who it was.

This side of Dead Premonition almost outshines all the negatives. The side missions in particular are wonderfully varied and offer a great glimpse into each character's personality and motivations. 



Regrettably, there are often some conflicting design choices where 'realism' and 'gameplay' butt heads.
Side missions often only unlock in certain weather conditions or require you to drive MILES to get to them, and you are hassled by characters to progress the main plot, which will often prevent you from accessing time-limited side missions.

Eating and sleeping appears to be a requirement in addition to health purely to irritate you and give you a reason to spend money on something.

The gameplay also often features a lot of clunky third person shooting sequences with intrusive quick time events thrown in for extra irritation. Although you do adapt to these over time, they did often feel 'bolted-on' to make it more of a "Game".



The nail in the coffin however is that the PC Port is frankly, terrible:

 - Many users find it crashes on startup until you reinstall DP's Physx
 - The Game crashes to desktop very frequently, making saving at every possible moment (and backing up save files) a requirement
- I had a wonderful bug where the handbrake 'Screech' sound of vehicles loops constantly while driving (I hear this is a 5.1 Audio issue)
 - the 'HD' is 720p and only really the core character models have anything resembling a good level of detail

Some attempts at fixing these issues are available from members of the community, but it's just not practical for the majority of users.


I Loved Deadly Premonition. I also hated it.

review: I love this game - the music, the story, and the characters all envelop you in a sense of misplaced nostalgia, whether or not you've seen Twin Peaks (which this game has shamelessly ripped off, but in a "good way").  However, if you have a PS3, don't buy this game on PC.  It crashes with alarming frequency and for me, it is made unplayable by the fact that my save file was corrupted on Episode 9.  Seriously, just get it on PS3.  It's not worth the headache.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983550984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1782, 'last_played': 1436770446}
review:
I actually got a brain aneurysm trying to complete this game while working past the dozens of different crashes, fixes, glitches and coma-inducing gameplay.

There's only so many dozens of times the game can crash on you, only so many hours you can waste trying to fix all the crashes and still say that the story will be worth it in the end.

I've had to run repair on the game's PhysX to even get the game to start. I had to download third-party files to get the game to play without crashing. I had to switch between multiple windows compatibility settings to avoid different crashes throughout the game.

Even then you don't know when the next crash is coming and so help you God you better pray that your last save point was close behind.

I haven't felt this much rage since the last time I played a dota 2 pub.

Fuck this game, fuck the developers.
Holy FUCK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082834459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2687, 'last_played': 1436624003}
review:
Deadly Premonition è uno di quei giochi che ormai sono diventati un "Cult" e che fanno parte di quei titoli unici e inimitabili.
Non conoscevo l'esistenza di esso finchè non mi è stato consigliato da un mio amico, e che dire..., non potevo ricevere consiglio migliore perchè questo gioco è bellissimo, ma davvero molto molto bello!
Posso dire con sincerità che è entrato tra i miei giochi preferiti in assoluto perchè ha tutto, per prima cosa il protagonista è semplicemente "un grande", non ho mai visto un protagonista come questo in nessun altro videogioco, è carismatico, brillante, geniale, divertente, misterioso e onesto, accompagnato sempre dal suo alter-ego "Zach".

La storia è il VERO PUNTO FORTE di questo titolo, è geniale, e grazie anche alle molte scene animate piano piano si riesce a capire cosa stà realmente succedento a Greenvale dato che all'inizio ci saranno tantissimi interrogativi.
Un altro fattore interessante è che ci saranno colpi di scena sempre più incredibili avanzando nel gioco che vi faranno rimanere veramente a bocca aperta e faranno aumentare la tensione al giocatore.

La Longevità è desisamente un altro punto a suo favore, una volta completata la storia principale c'è comunque tanto da fare e da esplorare perchè la cittadina di Greenvale è molto grande e se si vogliono fare le missioni secondarie e collezionare le carte il tempo di gioco aumenta di molto.

Il Gameplay può risultare con qualche difetto specialmente quando bisogna mirare o combattere ma niente di estremamente problematico, ci si fa l'abitudine velocemente.
Una buona cosa è che questo è anche un "Free Roaming" quindi si potrà girare per tutta la cittadina e per tutte le strade e stradine di Greenvale in completa tranquillità scegliendo il veicolo che più ci piace, ed è anche possibile interagire con gli abitanti del luogo per avere informazioni o per fare delle missioni secondarie.

Il comparto Sonoro è un pò scarno perchè le musiche sono poche e ripetute molto, comunque io l'ho trovate carine e per niente stancanti.

La Grafica non è il massimo ma neanche detestabile, si può definire in stile "PlayStation 2", i nemici sono quasi tutti uguali, non cambiano molto tra loro, invece gli abitanti del paese sono molto diversi tra loro ognuno con personalità e caratteristiche diverse.
L'atmosfera è perfettamente intonata con i luoghi e con i personaggi.

Il difetto principale di questo gioco secondo me è che una volta installato esso non si avvia pur premento il tasto "Play" e bisogna fare una correzione su un file per farlo partire, altri piccoli problemi sono dei Crash improvvisi, delle schermate di caricamento che si bloccano, qualche difetto nel Gameplay e qualche errore nella traduzione, ma vi garantisco che tutti questi problemi passano in secondo piano perchè Deadly Premonition è semplicemente unico e bellissimo.

Voto: 10/10
Nota Finale: Il gioco si ispira alla serie Tv chimata "Twin Peaks"
