author: {'steamid': '76561198055824791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1479966134}
review:
I would keep it short.

PC port is terrible, interface is a bit annoying at times, incredibly odd and strange driving, constant crashes and FPS drops.

But it still one of the best games I've played. Intriguing story, charismatic characters and dence atmosphere is what makes the game this great.

About technical part of the game. The following quotes says it all:
"I would drag my balls through 10 miles of broken glass just to play another 20 mins of this game's story. " Steam user jerry. 

If you are willing to fight the glitches and crashes, you would experience everything that makes this game so great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007944263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1790, 'last_played': 1420236788}
review:
Массовому игроку крайне не рекомендую! А вот ценителям интересного сюжета, обладающим железными нервами - стоит попробовать.
Сюжет в этой игре - самый большой, а, впрочем, думаю, и единственный плюс (но при этом - ооочень жирный).
Хотя, персонажи тоже весьма хороши, но реализованы зачастую чересчур комичко, карикатурно, а местами - просто картонно-марионеточно.
Графика - да, совсем не фонтан, но я придерживаюсь мнения, что в хорошей игре графика - далеко не главное.
А вот всё остальное... Всё так, как и пишут в отзывах - управление отвратительное, боевая составляющая реализована ужасно, вождение автомобиля - просто пытка. Фоновая музыка зачастую просто неуместна и раздражающе легкомысленна. Плюс ко всему очень частые вылеты и зависоны (хотя, возможно, только мне так не повезло).

В общем, изнасиловав мозг, преодолев все препоны и вытерпев все мучения, игру всё-таки прошёл, но исключительно из любви к интересным сюжетам и ради того, чтобы узнать, чем же всё закончится (а также благодаря крепким нервам).

Перепроходить её буду (в отличие от многих других игр) только под страхом смертной казни...

review:

No change: crap is crap. Outdated looks, animation is embarassing, textures are bleak... was this a PS1 game? author: {'steamid': '76561198072249311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2309, 'last_played': 1420152097}
review:
Podobał Ci się świetny serial z lat 90-tych "Miasteczko Twin Peaks"? Jak tak, to i ta gra powinna, gdyż widać, że mocno wzorowana jest na tym arcydziele Davida Lyncha i Marka Frosta. Oczywiście nie tylko. Mechanika gry przypomina trochę tą z "Resident evil 4", nie da się nie zauważyć też smaczków z mojej ulubionej serii gier "Silent Hill".
W Deadly Premonition wcielasz się w detektywa FBI Francisa Yorka Morgana, ale mów mu York, każdy tak go nazywa. York przyjeżdża do małego amerykańskiego miasteczka Greenvale, by rozwiązać tajemniczą sprawę morderstwa młodej dziewczyny - Anny. No zaczyna się mniej więcej jak Twin Peaks. W trakcie pobytu w Greenvale poznamy wielu jego mieszkańców, każda postać ma swój unikatowy charakter, każda jest dziwna i tajemnicza. Postacie naprawdę są świetnie napisane, co chwila będziemy podejrzewać kogoś innego.
Gra jest sandboxem, mamy dużą ilość misji pobocznych, bardzo ciekawych z resztą. Dzięki nim możemy bardziej poznać mieszkańców tego miasteczka. Naprawdę przyjemnie mi się je robiło. Mechanika gry, tu mówię głównie o walce, jest trochę sztywna. Przypomina poniekąd tą z wcześniej wspomnianego "Resident Evil 4". Miedzy innymi, gdy celujemy to nie możemy się poruszać. Naprawdę na pierwszy rzut oka co niektórzy mogliby się znięchęcić, ale naprawdę sugeruję by pograć dłużej. Graficznie gra przypomina trochę erę Playstation 2, aczkolwiek postacie są ładnie zrobione to juz animacje trochę sztywnawe, a o dziwo jak już trochę pograłem to mi się zaczęło podobać. Klimat gry jest naprawdę mocny, a sprawa morderstwa z epizodu na epizod robi się coraz ciekawsza. Podczas rozgrywki natrafimy na "Otherworld" co jest właśnie zapożyczone z serii "Cichego Wzgórza", w którym przyjdzie nam mierzyć się ze złowrogimi przeciwnkiami, którzy kojarzyli mi się z Ganados z "RE4". Warto poruszyć sprawę portu PCtowego, cóż najlepszy nie jest. Jest trochę błędów, ale każdy da się naprawić lub sprawić by do nich nie dochodziło. Rozdzielczość jest zablokowana na 720p co pewnie wielu osobom będzie przeszkadzać, ackzolwiek mi nie. Dla mnie to nie ma większego znaczenia. Ostatni element gry o którym chcę wspomnieć to ścieżka dźwiękowa, która jest w skrócie po prostu piękna. Tak, piękna. Naprawdę przyjemna dla uszu i nadająca klimatu do gry. Wystarczy posłuchać chociażby "The Woods and The Goddess", które przygrywa w menu głównym. :]

Podsumowanie:

Plusy:
[list]
[*] Genialna fabuła
[*] Świetne postacie
[*] Rewelacyjna ścieżka dźwiękowa
[*] Klimat
[*] Zadania poboczne
[/list]

Minusy:
[list]
[*] Trochę sztywnawe sterowanie
[*] Bugi
[*] Rozdzielczość zablokowana na 720p. Jak już mówiłem mi nie przeszkadza, ale powinen być wybór. Aczkolwiek można to zmienić za pomocą narzędzi GeDoSaTo.
[*] Kierowanie pojazdem
[/list]

Ogółem grze daję 9/10, naprawdę polecam. Tytuł rewelacyjny i znajduje sę na liście moich ulubionych.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126187836', 'num_games_owned': 1033, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2433, 'last_played': 1419218562}
review:
Un juego que no deja indiferente a nadie; o lo aborreces por esa jugabilidad tan mala o lo amas por esa historia tan profunda y esos personajes únicos.

En mi caso, pasó lo segundo y tengo que decir que es una de las historias mejores contadas dentro del mundo del videojuego, es original y sobre todo te mantiene intrigado hasta el final sacando tus propias conclusiones incluso con solo observar la rutina que llevan día a día los personajes.

Respecto a la jugabilidad, es mala, así de simple,  el personaje se mueve muy extraño, recuerda un poco a esos juegos de PSX o N64 en sus primeras incursiones al 3D, si mueves la cámara al mismo tiempo que al personaje parece que pierde desenfoque, el carro se maneja muy mal aunque conforme avanzas en el juego tienes la posibilidad de conseguir vehiculos mejores, graficamente es bastante discutible, muchos diran que parece de la generación de PS2 (cómo si eso fuese malo) pero los modelados e interiores a mi me parecen bastante competentes, cosa aparte ya son los exteriores cómo los árboles o lo coches pero cómo no suelo fijarme en el aspecto gráfico para evaluar un videojuego pues tampoco presté mucha atención en este aspecto.

Algo que me encanta de este juego es su originalidad, a pesar de lo que se pueda ver en las imágenes, no es un sandbox al uso ni mucho menos un shooter, y el hecho de que de inicio ya cuentes con una pistola con munición ilimitada ya dice mucho de lo que pretende el juego. Puedes andar a tu bola por el pueblo y tienes repartidas por todas partes un monton de misiones secundarias (la gran mayoria de ellas solo aparecen bajo condiciones especiales cómo por ejemplo de ciertos horarios o solo en días lluviosos) , la gran parte de ellas tienen que ver poco o mucho con la investigación de la trama principal y cómo he dicho antes, puedes incluso resolver el misterio de la trama en base a pistas que arrojan las misiones secundarias y las actitudes que tienen las personas del pueblillo. Esto creo que es algo que muuuuy pocas veces se ha visto en otro juegos.

El inicio es ESPANTOSO, no puede haber una peor primera impresión, te muestra precisamente las peores caras del juego que son la faceta shooter, el sonido muy pobre (incluyendo los efectos sonoros de unas ardillas que ya lo vereis por vuestra cuenta), los efectos de impacto tan poco creibles y esos arboles tan feos de los que antes he hablado. Si eres capaz de resistir esa primera media hora de juego, os aseguro que el juego os atrapará con todo lo que viene.

Otro aspecto muy curioso y que desata polémica es la banda sonora, es otra de esas cosas que hace única al juego, la mayoría de pistas se repiten cómo el ajo y en muchas ocasiones te quedas con cara de wtf? cuando de la nada aparece una melodía que poco o nada tiene que ver con el momtno que se vive en el juego. Esto ya es muy subjetivo pero tengo que decir que la banda sonora me fascina, sobre todo el tema The Goddess y el del silbidito que tan famoso es.

En resumen, es un buen juego, un grandioso juegos que suple de lleno algunas carencias con mushisimas bondades, si eres amante de las buenas historias, de las historias originales y de las tramas bien contadas, este definitivamente es tu juego.

review:
Un desastroso y brillante juego.
Desastroso por su apartado técnico: gráficos de ps2, control en general cutre, fisicas nefastas, etc. Vamos en general el apartado técnico suspende.

Brillante por sus personajes y trama: York se podría considerar uno de los personajes mas carismáticos de la pasada generación. No voy a entrar en detalles para no desvelar nada pero sin duda esta muy bien hecho y el resto de personajes no se queda atrás. La trama pues mas de lo mismo, engancha y vicia. También cabe mencionar su estupenda BSO a pesar de que son pocas canciones.

Recomiendo al menos probarlo y no dejarte llevar por el apartado técnico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104392527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 2795, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2785, 'last_played': 1411326083}
review:
This game is likely one of my favorites that I have played within the last couple of years. There are many flaws in the game engine which vary from person to person, but the game was good enough for me to want to push past them. Once I got into the game a bit, terrible things like frame-rate drops stopped happening, and the main bugs were just the physics engine.

As a safety note, as with anything, BACK UP YOUR SAVES. I never had any problem, but many people complain of losing progress or having things disappear after having collected them, so keep backups.

Onto the game elements...

+ Awesome story. It is a bit weird and out there as you get further into the game, but it kept me intrigued the whole way. I love games like Silent Hill, but even if you don't like those, try the game. It's not as crazily demonic as those. A very interesting mystery to keep you guessing.

+ The graphics were still pretty good, except for the glitches. I liked the style.

+ The voice acting was pretty well-done, and I liked most of the characters overall. They had their own interesting pieces to them (oh man, that Cold Pot lady).

- The gameplay, altogether, is actually a letdown, though wanting to see the town and the story held everything together for me. Most of the fighting "monsters" was rather pointless and unnecessary, and just got boring after a while. It makes sense for things like Silent Hill and Resident Evil, and it's usually done in a way where it's not too boring or you can escape if necessary. Here, the fighting is just boring, one-by-one, often forcing you to empty rooms before you can move on.

I still think that the game altogether was great, just getting past the glitches took a while. If you are looking for an off-the-wall, but really interesting, action/drama game, just look into this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048632839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 2303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1965, 'last_played': 1419596262}
review: Difficile da giudicare, se tutto funzionasse sarebbe da 9, ma Deadly è rotto sotto tutti gli aspetti, crash facili specie se guardi dalle finestre (che richiedono pure caricamenti seccanti), telecamera vorticosa post puntamento arma, grafica/animazioni/texture da prima metà ps2, ridicola proporzione delle abitazioni, idee abbozzate, nemici poco vari, zone extra non legate alle leggende, mappa inutilmente grande e una consultazione della cartina assurda e scomoda. Il cibo da raccogliere poi non di rado è infinito e ci sono  parti apparentemente  mancanti tra carte e abitanti, eppure.... devo dire che nonostante tutto l'ho adorato, anzi è quasi entrato tra i miei titoli preferiti. Si finisce con incredibile piacere grazie ai suoi personaggi bizzarri e all'atmosfera generale e questo dimostra che l'anima di un gioco vale davvero più del comparto tecnico.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011946781', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1419467526}
review:
I tried to play the game Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut yesterday. This game originally came out on the Xbox 360 in 2010.  It was recently re-released on PS3 as well as ported to the PC. For years this game has been heralded as an open-world survival horror homage to Twin Peaks: the story involves a quirky FBI agent investigating a strange murder in Washington state. The original version of the game also involved the detective interacting with two dwarves in a red room; maybe homage is an understatement.

Make no mistake the game is terrible. It controls like Resident Evil 4 and has graphics which are about the same - except it was released 5 years later. It was developed by a small Japanese game studio that had a deep appreciation for David Lynch so naturally it has developed a cult following in the states.

Some of my favorite games were developed by Japanese game companies. My wife and I both love the Tales games released by Namco Tales as well as the SMT/Persona games released by Atlus. The key difference here as that both of these companies do great localization - that is, they spend a lot of time getting decent translation of the original Japanese dialogue.

This is pretty important; if you don't do that then a lot of the humor and personal interaction just comes across as stilted and awkward. I have the feeling that this is pretty much the case with Deadly Premonition. I think a lot of folks view the "quirky dialogue" as Lynchian - but considering how poorly the rest of the game comes together it is more likely that this is just bad localization.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044655736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1105, 'last_played': 1469418447}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a difficult thing to describe. Not at its core, but where it counts. Deadly Premonition is essentially Twin Peaks: the Video Game. So much so to the point where in its setting, characters, and major plot points are ripped almost directly from Twin Peaks. You are FBI special agent Francis York Morgan, tasked with finding the culprit behind the murder of a young woman in the small town of Greenvale that has some odd relation to a string of murders happening all across the country. 

To preface this, I will simply say that Deadly Premonition: Directors Cut is one of the sloppiest, messy, and badly done PC ports for a game that is just not good. It has ransom crashes and even though people talk about CTD's (Crash To Desktop), the majority of crashes didn't even allow me to do that. The controls are clunky and the horror bits aren't as scary as they could be. Yet everything is done in such a way that it is just so absolutely amazing in every way. At its core, Deadly Premonition is one of my favorite games to play and is definitely one of my top ten games of all time. The weirdly written character dialogue backed up by one of the maybe 15 audio tracks that the game has to offer (but it's probably going to be Life Is Beautiful, who am I kidding) creates this setting that you just can't put down because you're so invested in the world it paints and the characters that accompany you on your investigation. Also it's just f****** weird in a great way.

TL;DR Even while the game is flawed in so many ways, all of its flaws contribute to an experience that every horror lover/movie lover/lover of David Lynch/person on this planet should partake in. The game is an absolutely amazing work of art that is only $2.50 during sales and totally worth the cash and the crashes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079747447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1403915717}
review: Deadly Premonition is a very strange game. It's a "so bad its good game" and a good game at the same time. To explain; the fighting mechanics, graphics, and driving sections are horribly bad but their so bad that their funny. I never laughed so hard at a game. The standard enemy walks at you backward in an almost crab walk and when you shoot them purple blood comes out. There are a lot of funnier stuff then that but I won't spoiler it. On to the good parts, this game has a amazing story line, likable characters, one of the most epic soundtrack in any game (look up "deadly premonition life is beautiful") and it is truly unpredictable. This is rare in a game. This game is a one of the only "cult classic" games this generation. If you only want to play for gameplay this game isn't for you but if you want a unique, funny, crazy experience. Buy deadly premonition.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084460345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1578519865}
review:
Assicuratevi di trovare un fix su internet (non è detto che dia risultati appaganti a volte non risolve molto) per poter modificare le opzioni grafiche del gioco e migliorarne l'aspetto grafico o diminuire la risoluzione ( e qui parlo soprattutto per chi non ha una buona scheda grafica come me).

Come tutti i port ha i soliti difetti, se siete abituati a:
- problemi di frame rate 
- assenza di impostazioni video
allora, potrete anche passarci qualche oretta.

Per il fix potete trovare una discussione nel forum di steam della versione DPfix 0.9.5, che contiene un link al sito dell'autore del fix, e il link per scaricare il file zip del fix :
[url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/247660/discussions/0/792924953013802599/?l=italian] http://steamcommunity.com/app/247660/discussions/0/792924953013802599/?l=italian [/url]

Come si utilizza il fix DPfix 0.9.5:
- Estraete i file contenuti nel DPfix 0.9.5
- Entrate nella cartella di Steam la mia è installata sotto ( C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam )
- Entrate nella cartella "SteamApps" ( C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\)
- Entrate nella cartella "common" al cui interno troverete la lista delle cartelle dei giochi installati su steam ( C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\SteamApps\common)
- Cercate ed entrate nella cartella "Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut"
- Copiate i file estratti da DPfix 0.9.5 nella cartella "Deadly Premonition The Director's Cut"
- Aprite il file "DPfix.ini" (uno dei file appena copiati) con il blocco note o un altro editor di testo.
- Modificate i parametri contenuti nel file seguendo le istruzioni precedute dal simbolo "#" ( Consiglio di saltare questo passaggio inizialmente e avviare il gioco per provare cosa succede, inoltre alcuni cambiamenti non sono ancora stabili quindi consiglio di cambiare inizialmente solo la risoluzione e poi provare con gli altri ).
- Se dovesse crashare a modalità schermo intero impostate window mode ( il mio a finestra intera non si avvia)
- Avviare il gioco.

Se il fix vi da problemi per toglierlo basta eliminare i file copiati nella cartella del gioco.

Se volete modificare la risoluzione di gioco dovete aprire il file "DPfix.ini" e sulle prime righe modificare i parametri renderWidth e renderHeight. IMPORTANTE: Accertatevi di impostare dei valori corretti, perché altrimenti potrebbe non avviarsi, esiste una risoluzione massima per cui il gioco dovrebbe funzionare.
  
Ho riportato una parte del file con le mie impostazioni grafiche ho settato anche presentWidth e presentHeight a 600 e 480 perché continuava a crashare all'avvio, provate ad avviare il gioco in modalità schermo intero o finestra per vedere se cambia qualcosa nel caso desse problemi (un po' bassine :>)
###############################################################################
# Graphics Options
###############################################################################

# internal rendering resolution of the game
# higher values will decrease performance
renderWidth 600
renderHeight 480

# The display width/height, will be used for fullscreen mode and as window size in windowed mode
presentWidth 600
presentHeight 480

author: {'steamid': '76561197998274419', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1527921151}
review:
I would love to recommend this game, really I would. It has a really nice plot, the minigames are suprisingly fun, the shooting action, while stiff and rather easy, feels pretty rewarding. It plays almost as a homage to Twin Peaks with a little bit of Silent Hill thrown in for good measure, and I absolutely oved it for all of its flaws (it even got me into Twin Peaks)... until the game would not let me pass through a certain point because of a gamebreaking glitch involving the time. And I couldn't go back because there's only one save slot.

The truth is this pretty damn good game can be downright unplayable because of the number of glitches and bugs that just seem to absolutely ruin the game. I'm not talking small things like stiff animation and bad lighting, I'm talking glitches that can literally mean you must restart your game or your computer in order to move on... or have to start from the very beginning. I cannot, in any good heart, recommend this game because it has terrible memory leaks that usually cause the game to crash after about an hour or so. When it isn't that, it is a game glitch that I have read is linked to the in-game clock. In a word, if you're outside at exactly the wrong time, the game will crash to desktop until you smoke to let the time pass ("smoking" in Deadly Premonition is akin to waiting in Skyrim/Fallout/Oblivion, except it requires an item) until the next day or until the crash no longer exists. If you've SAVED outside or if you do not have smokes or enough supplies to last until after you smoke, then you're screwed and you MUST restart your game. If this game had multiple save slots, it could be salvaged by saving in multiple slots, but sadly it does not. Sometimes, I have heard that running the game as administrator or setting compatibility mode can fix these bugs, it is not a sure thing for every player. The game, for as good as it is, is broken.

If you're still willing to try this game, and I wouldn't necessarily recommend against that, you should DEFINITELY be sure to back up your saves whenever it is convienent for you (at least every time you exit the game). You can do this by going to the game directory on Steam and going to the "savedata" folder. If you can remember to do that, and if you're patient, then you should not have any major problems with it.

Barring that, the game is also a pretty bad PC port with very limited graphics options right off the bat. Thankfully, at least for the graphical options, DPFix exists and allows you to change resolution, allows you to alter antialiasing, DOF, etc. It also allows you to change textures and models, allowing for the game to actually enjoy limited modding capability. Related to that, the controls are rather stiff outside a controller, but, for me personally, I could get used to them. If you're not a fan of them, I'd probably get a controller if you can. The controls, from what I have heard, are still not very good on controllers, but they're at least better.

However, if you can get past all of that, the game is a whole lot of good. Voiceovers, especially for a budget game such as this, are actually quite good, although the translation can be a bit stiff at times in the subtitles. The characters, too, are quite memorable, if not stereotypical (although that's pretty much intended). The main character, Agent Francis York Morgan, is actually fleshed out very well as a quirky and sometimes downright schizophrenic special agent for the FBI. Think of Agent Cooper from Twin Peaks except downright crazy sometimes. Dialog is really where the game shines, with very strange characters you can talk to. The game, even though its a horror game at its core, can be very funny with some of the things the characters do and say.

The minigames are actually quite a nice touch to the game. The game's spin on darts is actually kind of interesting, but a bit too easy sometimes if you understand the game. Fishing is a bit boring, but straightforward. Racing is a bit tedious sometimes because of the stiff controls but can still be kind of fun. There are a few other fun bits-and-bobs too, like drinking coffee, that do add to the immersion of the game.

The more horror-related parts of the game, including the shooting sections, can be quite disappointing at times, but other times they can actually be really suspenseful (most definitely including some of the times you encounter one of the antagonists of the game, although I won't spoil more than that). The shooting itself is quite stiff, but sometimes getting a headshot can feel quite rewarding. The enemies are not incredibly interesting or difficult, but can get you unexpectedly at points. However, I will concede that I am a bit biased on this as I have had trouble getting past the 9th chapter for the reasons listed above. You may want to check other reviews for views on this specifically.

The game is open world, although it is not entirely open world like Grand Theft Auto or Far Cry (e.g. you can't go in some of the forests and in specific places). The locations, too, are sometimes a bit vanilla at least as far as exteriors go (the lumbermill, for example, does not look very run down from the outside, especially the bunks and the streets). Exploration isn't a huge deal with this game, although it does exist. Driving also is very stiff and not incredibly exciting, but it gets the job done. A lot of the problems with driving, though, stem from the controls, as stated before.

Sidequests can be hit or miss, in my experience, depending on the quest. Some of them are either fetch quests that don't really have any interesting spin on them (e.g. [MINOR SPOILER] the sherriff's first quest [END MINOR SPOILER]) or really, not even that much of quests at all. However, there are some that do require some detective work and actually do add quite a lot to the game. Definitely worth playing through them, though, in my opinion.

To wrap this review up and summarize the main points:

[CON] The game is incredibly gamebreakingly buggy in some points, with memory leaks that can cause frequent crashing or gamebreaking must-restart-the-game crashes that require you to start again. No extra save slots which causes the latter type of glitches to require a hard restart if you do not manually restart your game.

[CON] Bad PC port with very few graphics options out of the box and poor, stiff controls.

[CON] Shooting, driving, and open-world mechanics aren't the best, although they have their redeeming qualities


[PRO] DPFix can fix graphical and control-related problems to a degrees, and allows for minor moddablity to the game.

[PRO] Very good plot with incredibly interesting characters. The voiceovers, for the most part, are pretty good too

[PRO] Can be very suspenseful at some points and actually cashes in fairly well on being a horror game

[PRO] Decent sidequests and minigames


All in all, for most people, I simply cannot recommend this game to most people in general because the game is very, very, very unstable and very prone to bad glitches and crashes. However, if you're willing to accept its flaws and can be sure to back up your saves incredibly often, then maybe Deadly Premonition is the game for you.

Driving is a bit wonky, especially if you drive the car from using the flare (Compared to the police car, the speed is rather fast as though York decided to floor it.). QTE's exist and they require some quick input. Outside of combat, the game does give players side activities to do.

Also, the coffee says "F.K."

review:
Hey now, don't be confused by all the hype you've heard. This game plays poorly, really poorly. It's unstable and has poor FPS. Mechanically, it's a mess. It took me almost an hour jiggering around with mods and what-not to get it working. Controller support is rubbish and keyboard is almost as bad (somehow more tolerable).

The story itself is hilariously goofy and weird and has often been compared to Twin Peaks. I highly suggest just watching a playthrough of the game, make someone else play this for you. You don't have to pay for it and you don't have to deal with its horrid controls and performance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987097961', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 1638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1638, 'last_played': 1417992357}
review:
CAUTIOUS RECOMMENDATION: In its current state, I can't recommend DP to anyone but the old school PC gamers that don't mind getting their hands dirty with tweaks and fixes to keep it stable, let alone looking adequate. If you don't know what an .ini file is, stay away. Even then, a quality experience is far from assured.

Aside from the abundant technical problems, everything that could be called gameplay is clunky and monotonous. It's absent for most of the game, but the ending ramps it up a lot, which quickly feels like a chore to complete.

That said, the characters and story are worth the trouble for those with the requisite patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998163088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 2212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1885, 'last_played': 1417618514}
review:
Alright, real talk. I don't play Sandbox games, and I played this a recommendation from a friend. I had no idea what to expect, and went in with almost zero expectations. The game, in short, is a mixed bag. It's plagued with coding errors, bugs and is a rather mediocre port. I highly recommend researching into this title to see if your computer can run it and avoid most of the glitches/crashes. I also recommend resetting if you ever come across any glitches or crashes, as this, for whatever reason, fixes a majority of them.

Gameplay wise? It's kind like No More Heroes overworld (with dynamic time and weather) meets closed off extremely easy Resident Evil 4 sections. Actually most of the game is very easy, and saves are sprinkled everywhere (which helps with any crashes so save often). You'll probably spend the bulk of your time in the overworld, driving around the town. You'll interact with the townsfolk (If you've played Xenoblade Chronicles for the Wii, this game also has a system where the NPCs have their own schedules. It's much easier to find people however, and are infinitely more rememberable however) and try to gather information to piece together what's happening. The shooting segments are pretty straight-forward and there's not really any major puzzles or anything to solve. The enemies aren't hugely varied either, once you play a few you got the general gist of them.

Setting and story wise: If you're a fan of the short lived TV series Twin Peaks, the plot's basic premise is very similar: an unothordox FBI agent is sent to investigate the death and murder of a young girl, and finds a lot more. Cast is unothrodox and strange, as they are rememberable. It's definitely a ride, highs and lows. There's some cliches, and big bad is a little too obvious, but ultimately it doesn't detract from the fun.

I bought this for 2.50 and put something like 30 hours into it, so there's plenty of content and the entry fee is very reasonable. This game is definitely a mixed bag, but speaking a gameplay centric kind of player, the story engrossed me and warmed my heart. It was geniunely refreshing to play this game, headaches and all. Bottomline; give it a shot if you think you can run it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072838558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1684, 'last_played': 1666001519}

author: {'steamid': '76561197991644902', 'num_games_owned': 1274, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 6520, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6493, 'last_played': 1625161217}
review:
Resulta dificil recomendar este engendro a nadie, porque la patada en la boca que te pega al empezar a jugarlo es considerable: Gráficos que hace 10 años ya hubiesen dado verguenza ajena, un sistema de combate muy torpedo que te hace volver a la epoca de los primeros Resident Evil, una simulación de conducción que te hace sentir como Michael J. Fox al volante... Y SIN EMBARGO... toda esta ponzoña jugable es capaz de redimirse entregando una experiencia jugable UNICA que no recuerdo haber tenido en otro juego: Un sandbox con situaciones subrealistas, personajes con unas conversaciones y personalidad que hacen que quieras pasar tiempo con ellos, un guión bastante majo con sus giros sorpresa y sus cosas MIEN, y  sobre todo, un HAMOR a Twin Peaks que hace que quieras volver a ver la serie de nuevo, y eso es EXCELSIORT

author: {'steamid': '76561198127564829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 394, 'last_played': 1557595837}
review:
It's hard to recommend this in a normal way, because this is one that you just get it or you don't. I absolutely love it.
And it's not even "so bad it's good", I mean yeah, the graphics and animations and voices and everything are so kooky but it's an open world psychological survival horror thriller where everyone has their own schedules, and you have to eat/shave/do laudry and there's all sorts of weird side quests, some of which can't even be done until you've beaten it a few times, and Francis York Morgan is one of the single greatest video game characters ever. 
I don't know, I mean, I get why at face value some people can't get behind it, but I just really feel like if you actually play it and still don't like it, I mean, I kinda feel sorry for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995749658', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 1565, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1418296032}
review:
Ich wollte dass mir das Spiel gefällt, da ich ein großer Jim Sterling Fan bin.
Habs deswegen ca. 6h auf der PS3 gespielt.

Startet nicht.
Habs nur im Boot-Programm für 3,5h gelassen um ein Review schreiben zu können.

Charaktere sind toll und witzig.
Das Spiel leider nicht wirklich.
Bei meinem Auto ist der Sprit ausgegangen und ich habe keine Ahnung wo man ein neues herbekommt.
War um 8:00 Uhr am Restaurant und das war zu. Keine Möglichkeit die Zeit vorzuspulen (Ausser wieder wohin latschen und schlafen)
Man möchte meinen die Entwickler haben das Spiel mit Absicht schlecht spielbar gemacht.
Dass die Grafik wie schlechte PS2 Grafik ausschaut ist hinreichend bekannt (Auf dem PC soll es wohl Mods geben).
Das Auto fährt sich wie ne Badewanne und bei Rennen muss man auswendig lernen.
Die QTE haben mich echt genervt.

Also nur für echt frustresistete Naturen die mal was Besonderes spielen wollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961952268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1590858407}
review:
Deadly Premonition is an odd one with a cult following. On a technical level it is not a very well made game but as for plot, characters and music it is one of the best "games" I've played in past couple of years. I've never seen Twin Peaks but many say if you've seen that series you'll get notice a lot of elements from it in this game.

Originally I played this on the PS3 and picked up the PC version for £2 or so.

.....It's a terrible port, probably the worst ever next to Saints Row 2. However as with Dark Souls, there is a resolution fix and fortunately for me at least there have been no further problems. In fact I'd say the PC version with the fix is better than the PS3 version due to the framerate (again for me) being 60fps as oppossed to the PS3's horrific sub 30fps in most cases.

If you don't mind the technical issues, it's worth at least one playthrough just for the plot. The game itself is extremely easy anyway so you'll never really be stuck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057849814', 'num_games_owned': 1156, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 1929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1417986327}
review:
[h1]AT A GLANCE[/h1]
(Full review follows below)

[list]
[*] [b]Game Name:[/b] Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut
[*] [b]Original Release:[/b] 2013
[*] [b]Genre Tags:[/b] RPG; Adventure; Story Rich; Sandbox; Open World; Horror
[*] [b]My Overall Grade:[/b] B+
[*] [b]Estimated Playtime (Campaign):[/b] 25-40 hours
[*] [b]Multiplayer Aspect:[/b] None
[*] [b]Recommended To:[/b] Established fans of the genre; Those intrigued by the genre; Strong narrative advocates; Game atmosphere connoisseurs
[/list]	

[h1]REVIEW[/h1]
As you most likely see in the other reviews for this game:  [b]Deadly Premonition[/b] itself is quite enjoyable, but bugs and crashes can quickly sour the taste of the experience.  I, however, mostly enjoyed the game so I wanted to give it a "Thumbs Up."  If you approach the game the right way then you can really minimalize the impact of the crashes.

The game is a moderately open-word survival horror game.  The controls are a little clunky, especially the driving, but I suppose it fits the genre.  The music is whimsical and the dialogue is funny, if not at times very corny... but again the corny lines fit with the genre and the "bad horror movie from the 80s" type vibe the game gives off.  The story is enjoyable and intriguing.  A fun little aspect is that the game does it best to make the small town of Greenvale feel lived in.  That is to say:  each NPC moves around the town depending on the time of day, and the weather—so you may have to search for them accordingly.  The graphics are not very good, but they aren't [i]that[/i] bad.  There is a user-created mod that can improve the visuals.  

As mentioned, the bad side of the game really boils down to bugs and crashing.  Now as for bugs, I didn't really experience any "bugs" when I played, I did experience crashing, however.  But really, it wasn't [i]that[/i] bad.  Here is some advice:  check out the “stickied” thread about troubleshooting.  Make sure to repair PhysX.  I personally did [i]not[/i] install DPfix (which is a user-created, unofficial mod) because it only fixes visuals (which don’t bother me) and it may actually cause more problems than it fixes.  Lastly, be sure to save [i]often[/i].  Like: even if you just saved 5 minutes ago, if you reach another save point, save again.  This way if and when you get a crash, you don't have to replay a ton of gameplay.  This will help make the crashes a minor annoyance rather than a game-destroying problem.

There are also 50 side-quests in the game which actually offer rewards that are valuable in the main campaign—so you may find yourself wanting to do them even if you don’t care about achievements or “completionism.”  Many guides and such will recommend you do the side-quests during chapter-replays... I however, recommend you try to do as many as you can during initial playthroughs of a chapter.  This is because during a chapter-replay you can't save until you finish the replay, which may cause you to lose some progress if you encounter one of the aforementioned crashes.  If you try to do as many side-quests as you can during initial playthroughs, you will be free to save often preventing progress loss.  Some side-quests will require replays to do, simply because of the mechanics… for those I recommend chapter 7, because you can quickly end the chapter-replay, save, and then start it up again to do more side-questing.  Then just rinse and repeat until you’ve done everything… that’s how I did the side-quests and the occasional crashes were endurable.

In summary, the game is good, and worth the experience... in my opinion.  This is especially so if you enjoy the genre, or enjoy heavily story-driven games.  It will require some troubleshooting and some tolerance for bugs/crashing.  If you decide to follow my advice, and do a little planning and save often, the crashes that you will encounter won't set you back that badly, and you will probably enjoy the overall experience of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006559885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 601, 'last_played': 1405266352}
review:
This game is polarizing. You either love it or you hate it. The pc version has a kind of cost at entry, where you have to root out various bugs and hindrances in order to play unaccosted. once you get set up and stabalize it however it's pretty good. This is probably the single greatest example of making good on incredibly low budget. Deadly premonition was originally a ps2 game which was bumped up in scale before being released for the xbox and ps3, this means that it has a lot of the quirk and "jank" that you get from old school ps2 games with a larger scale and length.

Over all Deadly Premonition is an exercise in video game weirdness, the merit of the game comes less from the plot or gameplay and more from "Wow look how weird this guy's character model is when he's smilling" or "pffft that zombies running sideways." Kind of a more eloquent goat simulator.

This games charm is impossible to describe, so for reference go and watch the "two best friends play" of deadly premonition where they will constantly and in detail describe why the game is REALLY GOOD while also looking terrible.

"The Pickles"

author: {'steamid': '76561197990524434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1425, 'last_played': 1417392473}
review:
Deadly premonition is a game that emphasizes in the narrative.  It has a quirky but nice story, moving quickly from serious moments to joking ones in seconds.  It relies in a lot of cut scenes giving a feeling of playing a series like Twin peaks or anything related to that. It uses supernatural events in the story telling, not trying to be 100% real.

Gameplay:

The game is mostly a sandbox where you can do side missions and follow people in their normal lives.  
You may drive cars, eat and sleep.

Establishments and people work at determined hours.  Trying to get at a bar at the morning will be of no use neither going to the store at midnight.  All the missions are for research purposes and they are linear.  When in a mission at a place there are usually spirits/ghosts that roam around.  It somewhat reminded me of Silent Hill. The villain usually haunts those places too and there are sequences hiding, 
running and QTE.

Shooting is inspired in resident evil, where you stay in the same place shooting but this one is strange to handle with K+M. Melee items will break according to use but for combat they serve almost no purpose.  If you are looking for a shooter/combat game this is not the place.

Item management is very bad; you cannot change items from the box to the inventory.  Dropping items will simply disappear. You cannot sell items, only buy.  Almost any action you do grants you money such as shaving, saving, driving long distances.

Time to finish: 24 hours
Around 15 in game playtime

Technical aspect:

The game has a lot of bugs. A really bad port.  You will need to use guides in order to fix the bug but I will simply mention the ones I faced. For a general guide visit 

http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Deadly_Premonition:_The_Director%27s_Cut

First, the game failed to run. I needed the game to be Run as Administrator, add some files to the directories for mods and SweetFX in order to fix contrast.  Driving a lot of time in the open (20 minutes I think) causes the game to crash, this is before the next bug; in a mission it failed and the game crashed, finding a guide led me to use CFF explorer and incremented the memory.  Now it does not crash.

Support for controllers any than xbox 360 is nonexistent.  Using x360ce is somewhat tricky but I could not get it to work so I simply used K+M.

Graphics are kinda bad (this game is from 2010 originally) and it was a budget game ($20 dlls on release).  They look like the first games for the 7th generation (xbox 360, ps3) or late 6th generation (GCN, ps2), whatever you prefer.  expressions for the characters are rendered manually and no motion capture was used.  

Veredict:

3.6/5
Play t if you are willing to play for the story mor than the combat sequences,

author: {'steamid': '76561197995566343', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1727, 'last_played': 1416760531}
review:
Dans le monde du JV, on appelle ça un ovni. Et cet objet volant non identifié qu'est Deadly Premonition n'est pas passé inaperçu. Le bébé de SWERY  provoqué à la fois dégout et admiration chez les joueurs, sans jamais parvenir à trouver un juste milieu. Car DP est un jeu bourré de petits défauts en veux-tu en voilà mais aux (quelques) qualités énormes.

Pêle-mêle on pourra citer un aspect technique digne d'un jeu PS2 mal branlé, un gameplay très rigide et redondant (vous savez, le fameux balais dans-le-cul, avec en prime une accélération matérielle de la souris rendant la visée fastidieuse), des animations complètements datés (mais qui ont le mérite de provoquer quelques fous-rires), une conduite désastreuse, des temps de chargements omniprésent, blablabla.... La liste est longue. Le tout n'a pas été rehaussé par le portage PC, bien au contraire. Bienvenue à la foire aux crashs, en direct de l'Other World! (heureusement un patch existe). Mais alors, pourquoi jouer à ce qui ressemble plus à une mauvaise blague qu'un véritable jeu vidéo ?

Eh bien tout simplement parce que Deadly Premonition est une expérience à faire au moins une fois dans sa vie de gamer, malgré la foule de désagrements que cela imcombe. Ce qui vous attend, c'est un scénario terriblement bien construit et qui, une fois lancé, vous tiendra en haleine jusqu'au grand final. Un savant dosage de mise en scène et de rebondissements, le tout porté par des personnages hors du commun et unique en leur genre, à commencer par Francis York Morgan, le charismatique agent du FBI que vous incarnez dans son périple (et son grand ami Zach, très très très proche de lui (le nombre de "très" n'est pas là pour faire joli)). L'univers dans lequel évolue toute cette joyeuse troupe n'est pas en reste lui non plus, puisqu'il vous sera possible de visiter Greenvale de fond en comble, et même de participer à la vie locale tel un bon citoyen, en allant par exemple manger un sandwich au restaurant, vous raser et changer de vetements à l'hotel, réaliser quelques parties de pèches près du lac, proposer votre aide aux habitants sous forme de quetes secondaires (qui vous rapporteront parfois de jolis récompenses et meme peut-etre quelques informations intéressantes pour votre enquete), jouer aux fléchettes au bar du coin le soir, etc... Mais attention, il faudra veiller à respecter les horaires d'ouverture/fermeture de chaque établissement et certaines quetes secondaires ne sont accessibles qu'a des heures spécifiques de la journée. De même, certaines maisons resteront fermées à des heures tardives ou quand le propriétaire sera tout simplement à son travail. Plusieurs jauges seront à surveiller également : faim, sommeil, jauge d'essence et taux  d'endommagement du véhicule utilisé. En clair, le jeu est un véritable pot-pourri d'idées plutot bien pensées et un véritable mélange de genres. On aime ou pas, mais on ne peut lui enlever ce mérite.

Deadly Premonition est un jeu étrange, repoussant au début (le prologue n'est absolument pas représentatif de la valeur réelle du jeu) mais qu'on se surprend à aimer petit à petit. Si vous pensez etre capable de passer outre les nombreux défauts du titre et que vous avez la patience de laisser le jeu installer son ambiance si particulière, il n'y a aucune raison pour que vous ne tombiez pas amoureux de ce bijou, vous aussi.

review:
Project Monarch the video game. It's actually pretty deep and if you walk away from this game with no impression other than that it was a charmingly inept Twin Peaks rip-off, you were probly playing it wrong.

You'll spend as much time troubleshooting and restarting from crashes as you will actually playing the game, and the controller support doesn't seem to work, but I say it's worth it. author: {'steamid': '76561198019046154', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1492087201}
review:
La versión de PC deja muchísimo que desear, a bote pronto la mejora gráfica en el Director's Cut no es tan relevante, venden humo realmente. El juego está muy bien, esa historia, ese modo de juego tan tranquilo y esos toques humorísticos le dan al juego unas características únicas, además, la dificultad de encontrar por tu propia cuenta las "pistas" para las misiones scundarias le da un aire más detectivesco por sí decir.

¿Contras? Muchísimos, aunque ahora mismo algunos usuarios han redactado pequeñas uías para la resolución de los problemas más comunes que la versión de PC está dando, asi pues el juego se convierte de algo injugable a algo relativamente jugable pese a sus bajones de FPS y demás. La jugabilidad es malilla pese a haber sido mejorada, aunque el juego es único y realmente lo recomiendo, eso sí, procura tener 4 ideas básicas sobre cómo acceder a los archivos del juego porque sino no podrás hacer que funcione ni a tiros.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960342473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 157, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1417375756}
review:
What a port. Theres a german saying "Verschlimmbessert" which unfortunately cant be translated. Disimprove?

Gave this another try since i finally got me an xbox controller for my pc (keyboard+mouse controls like ass) and they switched the controls around and actually made em worse. Great.

Then the "HD" treatment. Some assets (mainly UI) got retouched (looking worse but thats a matter of personal taste i guess) and slapped together with old stuff making for nice eye biting contrast. Some of the 3D Models for the inventory items got a shiny slime filter or something tossed onto them. The resolution is higher but the textures are the same resulting in highres blurryness. Amazing. The original wasnt a graphical marvel but at least consistent. 

Additionally the game seems a litte too fast which actually managed to make me a little nauseous. Last game that did that was Starfox on SNES. Audio is still messed up. Nice shot.

The Thumbs up is for Deadly Premonition and that people who never ever plan on buying a Xbox360 ever ever (its cheap now and theres alot of other pretty good games...) have a chance of experiencing it - even in the warped form of this suboptimal port.

review:
One of the best stories ever to grace a video game.  The game has a few technical issues, and the graphics leave alot to be desired but if you manage to get past these issues you'll find a tremendous story, in my opinion one of the best stories to ever grace a video game.

I'll be honest and say the controls are bad, the graphics aren't really up to par with modern games and you'll more than likely encounter a few technical issues getting the game to run.

Ignore those issues (except not getting it to run, try to find the fix for that) and you'll fall in love with the story.  Just keep in mind the game starts off slow, and you'll very likely want to quit if you get caught up in doing side quest in chapter 2.  Just push forward, trust me, it's worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963259080', 'num_games_owned': 2238, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1417344308}
review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/27632048/]ARCANE RAISE - CURATOR PAGE[/url]

Don't get me wrong, the game itself is remarkably good but the PC port is just insanely terrible and utterly garbage! It's truly one of the worst PC ports in history, imagine a mix of Resident Evil 4 & Dark Souls PTD ports and make it a hundred times worse. It's terrible in every single aspect you could imagine and [B]so broken that it's [U]LITERALLY[/U] UNPLAYABLE[/B]:

[B]Performance[/B]:
Extremely terrible, couldn't be any worse. I can't even find a right word to describe how terrible it is! It barely runs at 10 FPS on a modern PC without mods. Well to be honest, it doesn't even run at all without mods. You'd hard a really hard time even trying to run the game without crashing, not to mention you will have to use Compatibility Mode and reinstall nVidia Physix just to get it to run. [B]You probably have to use MODs just to be able to launch![/B]
And that's not all, Loading times are infuriating, especially the invisible loadings between each cutscene which could last up to 8 minutes! You'll just sit there staring at the black screen thinking the game's frozen but it's actually a terribly long loading! [B]There are countless super-long invisible loading times![/B]
And that's not all! There's one more bonus for you: [B]Game constantly crashes every once in a while for no reason![/B]

[B]You're better off playing it on the console rather than buying this terrible and utterly unplayable piece of crap on PC.[/B]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988485371', 'num_games_owned': 4379, 'num_reviews': 221, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1416851443}
review:
Zuerst: Im Sale für unter 10€ ist das Spiel durchaus gut, aber nicht für den Preis.

Warum ?

Wir haben hier eine schäbige Konsolenumsetzung von Rising Star Games (Harvest Moon Reihe). Inklusive GROTTEN schlechter Grafik. Das ist ansich nicht schlimm, Pokemon Gelb gehört auch jetzt noch zu meinen Lieblingsspielen. Aber hier hat man 2D Feuer zum begrenzen von Gebieten, das ist gerade mal PS2 Niveau (und wir reden von einem 2013er Titel für 30€).

Die Story ist wie ein Gewürfel aus Silent Hill, Akte X, bisschen Mystery aus Twin Peaks und Alan Wake. Leider gabs das alles schon und vorallem besser: Nämlich in den Originalen.

Gepaart wird das von ENDLOSEN Videosequenzen in denen nur wenig gesprochen wird. Japanisches Spiel halt.

Steuerung ist durchaus okay. Waffen ist alles vertreten, sogar das aus Silent Hill bekannt Stahlrohr.

Am Ende bleibt eine Silent Hill/ Alan Wake Kopie die vor surrealismus und morbiden Horror trotzt, die durchaus spielbar ist aber nicht für 30€.

Übrigens: Habt ihr probleme das Spiel zu starten ? Ladet die aktuellen Physix Treiber runter. Neustart nicht notwendig.

Many other reviewers give this a thumbs up because of the game itself, which is indeed fun and unique. But this port is so awful it's definatly not worth the money. Playing it is an excercise in stubborness, and every time you do ANYTHING your first thought is run to a save point before it crashes and I have to repeat that again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968070055', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 996, 'last_played': 1416427986}
review:
Fantastic story and characters with great music. Gameplay is completely busted at moments.
I'd suggest watching a playthrough like the one from Video Games Awesome or Giant Bomb instead of actually playing the game. It's really not worth the hassle to slog through the gameplay.

I groaned everytime there was an action sequence (I counted around 6). The combat isn't really enjoyable, sometimes you needed to fight monsters before you could progress, sometimes they infinitely respawn. The levels could become mazelike and hard to navigate through. At some point you need to do a tailgating mission that takes way too long (5-10 minutes). The bossfights aren't enjoyable because of the combat. The map layout of the town is made by a madman. You will sometimes need to drive to the other end of the town and instead of having a straight line from point A to B, you have a gigantic swerving line (not exaggerated). At some point there is a new mob introduced that's very bulletspongy but you can easily take out with melee. The downside? Your melee grade degrade so fast it's not even funny. There is a sequence where you need to fight four of those monsters in a row and I pretty much ran out of usable weapons at that time. When your health is low, you'll start limping, have fun progressing through the levels like that!

author: {'steamid': '76561198111669594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1431, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1438874004}
review:
เนื้อเรื่องสุดตื่นเต้นและน่าติดตาม!

เนื้อเรื่อง
Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut เกมที่ว่าด้วยนักสืบพิเศษ (FBI) ที่มีความสามารถพิเศษพูดคุยกับผู้เล่นได้ ทำหน้าที่ตามสืบฆาตกรต่อเนื่องมาถึงชุมชนเล็กๆ ไกลปืนเที่ยงแห่งหนึ่ง พ่อนักสืบคนเก่งจะไขคดีและตามจับตัวคนร้ายได้หรือไม่ ขึ้นอยู่กับคุณแล้ว!!

เกมเพล
Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut เป็นเกมผสม คือมีรูปแบบของซิม, Open world, เกมยิง และเกม RPG ผสมคลุกเค้ากันไป โดยเกมจะมีมุมมองบุคคลที่ 3 เป็นปกติ (เว้นแต่เมื่อขับรถ) ผู้เล่นจะต้องวิ่งไปมาจนทั่วเมืองชนบทแห่งนี้ อาจต้องตามคุยคนนั้นคนนี้บ้าง หรือแม้แต่ไปยังจุดนัดพบตามที่ต่างๆ ในเกมบ้าง เพื่อสืบคดีที่เขากำลังติดตามอยู่ และเมื่อถึงช่วงสืบเสาะในที่เกิดเหตุ ตัวเกมจะตัดเข้าไปสู่โลกจินตนาการ ซึ่งผู้เล่นจะต้องพบกับปีศาจที่เกิดขึ้นในหัวของเขา และเจ้าตัวฆาตกรตัวดีที่เรากำลังตามตัวอยู่ เมื่อผู้เล่นผ่านสิ่งเหล่านี้ไปได้ ตัวละครจะสามารถไขเบาะแสในที่เกิดเหตุได้ 

เนื่องจากเกมนี้ไม่ได้ขาย Action ดังนั้นผู้ที่คาดหวังในตัวเกมนี้ว่าจะต้องบู้บ้าเลือดก็คงต้องบอกว่าเสียใจด้วย เพราะเกมนี้เป็นแนวสืบสวนสอบสวน และเน้นการพูดคุยกับ NPC เป็นส่วนใหญ่เพื่อดำเนินเนื้อเรื่อง ดังนั้นจุดแข็งของเกมนี้จึงอยู่ที่เนื้อเรื่องนั่นเอง (Deadly Premonition ดัดแปลงมาจากนิยายชื่อเดียวกัน) และหากเนื้อเรื่องเข้มข้นเกินไป ผู้เล่นยังสามารถผ่อนคลายด้วยการไปตระเวนเล่นมินิเกมต่างๆ ซึ่งอยู่กระจายทั่วไปในเกมได้อีกด้วย

สรุป
เกมแนวคลัสอเมริกัน สืบสวนสอบสวนสนุกๆ ที่คุณไม่ควรพลาด!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115086953', 'num_games_owned': 1375, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1144, 'last_played': 1414757807}
review:
From the very start of the game (albeit after fixing the crash issues) I was hooked.  A survival horror game with elements of comedy, with an open world environment and a charismatic protagonist makes it a cult favorite.  The games story (for a brief summary you are an Special FBI Agent investigation an interesting murder case) gives you a lot of clues and expansive knowledge for the player to deduce and question who did it with so many suspects you'll be sure to doubt your prime suspects, but do not fret as the pieces will fall in place nicely and pave a wonderful intense and dramatic story.  

This game deserves a 10/10, however due to the pc port issues, bugs, and numerous crashes it recieves a 8/10.

review:
Deadly Premonition konsol oyunu olarak çıkmış daha sonradan PC ye devirşirme bir oyun. 

Eğer ki Resident Evil ve Silent Hill gibi oyunları sevdiyeseniz, bu da tam o kalıba girerek "PS-XBOX Devşirme TOP5" e rahatlıkla girer. Açık dünya olması diğer benzer oyunlardan sıyrılmasına neden oluyor. Grafikler, sesler ve oynanabilirlik PC için biraz kötü ama zamanla aşıp hikayeye kaptırınca kendinizi bu fark kapanıyor. Her oyun son teknoloji ile yapılacak diye birşey yok; ki zaten yarın yeni bir teknoloji çıkar o da eskir :)

İndirim de 5 tl ye kadar düştü, denemenizi isterim ama dediğim gibi Resident Evil ve Silent Hill oynamış iseniz seversiniz.

Müzikleri gayet güzel, dediğim gibi her oyuncuya hitap etmiyor. 
Ya çok seveceğiniz ya da direk nefret edeceğiniz bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040064779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1415448355}
review: You know that game, it came out on the PC in 2013.  It was a console port, and a pretty bad one at that.  But there was something about it, despite the stiff writing, the bad graphics, the awkward combat... we still felt compelled to complete it, didn't we Zach?  That sleepy country town was so memorable and all of those characters had just the right amount of charm to reel us in.  I suppose part of the draw was the fact that it was such a unique title, even if it wasn't the best, it stood out and was unashamed to do what it wanted to do.  It was such an amazing ride, wasn't it Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198124173666', 'num_games_owned': 317, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1415744144}
review:
STAY THE HELL AWAY FROM THIS!

Here's a few of my favorite bugs and glitches: 

1. Once you reach the hotel and walk into the cafeteria hallway, the sound will give out this blast of distortion that makes your speakers cry out for a quick death. THIS HAPPENED FOUR TIMES. 

2. During the in game cut scenes, York will light a cigarrette, but somebody fucked up the animation so that when he removes the cig from his mouth, one will be in his hand and another will stay in his mouth. 

3. The inventory menu is like a goddamn minefield for crashes. The game crashed on me at least 3 different times when I checked my inventory for either a medikit, some food or just to see the map. The inventory screen will both haunt and mock you. 

4. During the second part of chapter one, while you're in the hospital and you're about to wrap it up after killing 3 zombies who are armed with shotguns, you just need to walk out of the hospital and then a cutscene will start up and you've finished the section. What's the problem with this ? WHENEVER THE FUCKING CUT SCENE STARTS UP, THE GAME CRASHES. Don't give me this "windows 98 compatibility mode fixed it for me" bullshit. It worked for me sure, except it took 30 fucking minutes to clear a 2 minute piece of game due to the frame rate drop! 

5. Starting the game up in Windows 98 compatibility mode will prevent you from using a gamepad. Wanna use that nice comfy 360 controller you bought for games like this? Well don't worry, you can use the A, B , X and Y buttons. Oh, you want to use the thumbsticks? Fuck you. 

And those are only off the top of my head! I'm sure if I sat down and really thought about it, I could easily come up with 10 more! 

I was really enjoying this game at first, but the bugs make it unplayable. I managed to make my way through almost through the first chapter but then the game would constantly freeze on me whenever I attempted to make my way through to my objective (the manor where the townspeople are to be questioned). 

Many people claim running the game in Windows ME/98 will fix this. That much is true only half of the time. This theory works when it wants to, at other times however the frame rate will drop all the way down to 10 FPS (what's the point then?) .  I searched high and low for an answer to the drop in frame rate and it seems I'm not the only one suffering from this. No answer could be found. 

Seriously, this game is incredibly unique, cool and different. I wanted to play through this so much, but in its current state, it's just unplayable. It'd be nice to get a refund, but considering that the developers don't care about their customers, and trying to convince Steam to test the products they put up for sale is about as likely as the next coming of Jesus, I find this unlikely. 

Again, STAY THE HELL AWAY FROM THIS PORT. If you've got a PS3 or 360 just buy that version, I certainly know I will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041438339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 5890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3317, 'last_played': 1442267654}
review:
Si consigues ir más allá de su envoltorio visual, que según se mire puede ser nefasto, conseguirás disfrutar de una buena historia, que no esconde sus paralelismos con la serie "Twin Peaks" en ningún momento. Yo defino a este titulo como un juego de la vieja escuela japonesa. Una interesante mezcla entre Murdered Soul Suspect, mucho más reciente, y ciertos toques de sandbox al estilo Yakuza. Es interesanta ver al pirado de York, el protagonista y su alter ego Zach, en momentos como al encontrarse con la pirada de la olla, Sigourney...es un pique de intelectos al mas alto nivel.

Tienes 50 misiones secundarias que realizar, algunas repetidas, casi por mera cuestión de relleno, y logros por cada una de ellas. Tienes algunas actividades que hacer, comer, dormir, cambiarte de ropa y mandar a limpiar tus trajes, pescar y encontrar cromos y huesos a fin de hacerlo todo mas ameno.

El problema radica en la falta de esmero de esta versión, y es que si la juegas sin el DPfix, te sangrarán los ojos. A esto le sumamos los muchos problemas que ha tenido la gente para hacerlo funcionar, aunque no es mi caso, y los cuelgues aleatorios que presenta el producto, totalmente injustificados. 

Las partes de acción son, bueno algo mejores que en consola y con una dificultad mas balanceada, o más fáciles según queramos verlo y los enemigos bastante torpes....y no, no dan miedo...

En definitiva es un buen producto a medio hacer en algunos aspectos esenciales, pero promete dar bastantes horas de juego si los pasas por alto y no sufres demasiados problemas durante su uso.

Ya sabemos que los japos hacen buenos juegos, pero no tienen mucha idea sobre PC´s.

¿Lo recomiendo?

Si te gustan los juegos atipicos japos con buena historia y pasas por alto sus muchas deficiencias, SI.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074123705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1415482542}
review:
I mean, to say this is basically [i]Twin Peaks: The Video Game[/i] would not only be far from a unique observation, but also an incredibly surface level impression. Sure, much like [i]Twin Peaks[/i], the goofy and awkward nature of the game only adds to the charm and does nothing to detract the effectiveness of the genuinely spooky elements. The thing about [i]Deadly Premonition[/i] is that it is significantly darker and the awkward quirky-ness is also reflected into the graphics. 

Still, I'm only, like, a chapter in and I know I'll be pouring way more hours into this than I probably should.
The gameplay works sort of like [i]L.A. Noire[/i]. The game isn't as much about gameplay as it is about story. The combat isn't the most important part. The "game" operates much more like an interactive film or television show ("Previously in the investigation" or something along those lines greets you after loading the game)

I suppose my only complaint is that some of the combat sequences seem out of place. The game shines its brightest in the script and characters so maybe the awkward combat mechanics just pale in comparison to the strange town of Greenvale. [i]Deadly Premonition[/i] is probably one of my favorite games out there right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072381855', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 3299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3029, 'last_played': 1597006059}
review:
[b]Deadly Premonition [/b]－  эта игра с первых минут вызвала у меня ностальгию по старым добрым временам проведённых за PlayStation 2. И навеяла воспоминание о прохождении Silent Hill 4 : The Room, по большей часть напоминающую её по геймплею, графике и ещё парочкой мелочей.

Изначально я думал, она будет по типу линейной игры, но нет, после прохождение пролога нам открывается небольшой город Greenvale, полностью открытый для исследования.

Что касается персонажей, то тут все просто отлично. Особенно понравился главный герой : агент ФБР Фрэнсис Йорк Морган, заядлый курильщик, киноман, страдающий лёгкой шизой по имени Зак (в финале всё станет ясным). Эмили, Джордж, Томас, Гарри и другие персонажи, раскрыты превосходно.

Саундтрек здесь неплохой, но единственное что, его мало, поиграв парочку глав его уже можно разделить на весёленький, загадочный и нагнетающий. Который вставляют абсолютно во все диалоги.

СЮЖЕТ! Сюжет это просто бомба, давненько я не играл в нечто подобное. По началу всё кажется ясным, но игра выдаёт повороты, заставляющие менять свое мнение о персонажах и расследовании. Убийство девушки которое переплетается с местной легендой и тайны которые предстоит открыть в корень меняют жизни тех, кто оказался в этом городишке.

Единственное, что могу сказать по минусам это, однотипные и затянутые встречи с убийцей и по мне с боссами перегнули. Кто-то конечно может отнести к недостаткам и "ужасную графику", и деревянное управление, т.к я не грaфoдрoчeр, для меня, это проблемы не составило, что касается управления вполне терпимо. Сюжет и нешаблонные персонажи, вот ради чего стоит сыграть в эту игру.

Оценка : 10\10

P.S Гигантское спасибо, тому человеку, что подарил мне эту игру)))

review:
I was excited to dive straight into what I've heard is a cult-classic with a strange, but entertaining storyline and fantastic characters. But unfortunately for me, I could not get the game to run without incredible lag, like many others have experienced. After tinkering around for a fix, it now just crashes at startup. Your chances of getting this game to work for you on PC seem to be 50/50. You'll have to decide whether it's worth the gamble.

I am hoping the devs eventually get back to this with some bug fixes, but it's not looking good. As it stands, I can't recommend what looks like an otherwise great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029204177', 'num_games_owned': 942, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2066, 'last_played': 1415279244}
review:
Deadly Premonition - это та игра, от которой не ждешь ровным счетом ничего, а она в итоге оказывается настоящим откровением.

По атмосфере и сюжету это что-то балансирующее между Твин Пикс, Секретными Материалами и Сайлент Хиллом.
Геймплейно же самыми близкими будут Dead Rising и Resident Evil. 

Осознавая техническую отсталость проекта (картинка уровня PS 2), авторы решили пуститься во все тяжкие, сделав из игры настоящее попурри. 
Игрок выступает в роли агента ФБР, который разговаривает сам с собой, гадает на кофейной гуще и обсуждает фильмы 80х. В свободное от расследования время Йорк (так зовут гг) ловит рыбу, и всячески помогает местным жителям, будь то фасовка коробок или задания уровня принеси-подай. Происходящее на экране может варьироваться от глубокого саспенса, до откровенного бреда. Так что не удивляйтесь, если в момент обнаружения очередного трупа заиграет шаблонная драматическая мелодия, а потом звуковой ряд и вовсе сменится на звуки босса-новы. 
Под конец все это действо достигает уже какой-то "финчеровщины" приправленной японской гигантоманией. Удивительно, но весь этот винегрет выглядит целостно, подается правильно, и оставляет после себя чувство уникального игрового переживания.

Помимо графики есть и другие минусы: абсолютно сбивающая с толку карта, не всегда приятные QTE и нестабильная работа приложения. Хорошо еще, что чекпоинтов и точек сохранения в игре очень много.

Советую всем перешагнуть через графин, и попробовать этот перл.

На 8.5 антонов из 10 жирафонов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064850410', 'num_games_owned': 770, 'num_reviews': 373, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1415113268}
review:
[h1]Teal Deer[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Developers:[/b] Rising Star Games 
[*][b]Publishers:[/b] Rising Star Games 
[*][b]Initial release:[/b] Oct 2013
[*][b]Genre:[/b] Action, Horror, Humor 
[*][b]#Worth/NotWorth:[/b] #Worth
[/list]
[h1]Exposition, Concurrence and Summation[/h1]
Now, I do recommend this game. Just.. not this version. It's a terrible terrible awful port that put me through the whole rigamarole of legit 'fixes' all the way through to superstition (caused by low probabilities and the very human desire to control the situation) 

I've downloaded and implemented DPfix for resolutions and frame rate issues. As well as for controller support. Though I believe that was a real update. 

The real issue is with random and frequent crashing. I've done everything from running it in compatibility mode with Win98 to using a program called Large Address Aware, allowing for the use of more than 2GB's of RAM. Changing audio to only stereo. It still crashes. I've even broken into superstition pressing L-ALT whilst in windowed mode which I'm sure is accomplishing nothing if not negligible results. 

The characters are so dumb, the animations canned and inappropriate. Awkward pauses between nonsense dialogue and its fantastic.  Plus the main character has a voice in his head that breaks the fourth wall (even more so for me as my name is Zach.. spoopy)

I really tried to finish this game, but this port is so unstable and I've replayed missions and rewatched cutscenes for the last time.

[quote]More here — [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/28295405/]Station Argus[/url][/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198006077632', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 2949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2642, 'last_played': 1415079896}
review:
Deadly Premonition is a fantastic game that I would not recommend to anyone. 

Many comparisons can be made about Deadly Premonition - I myself found the combat to play like RE4, the overworld to faintly remind me of Psychonauts, the time-based mission structure to resemble Dead Rising's own (although major difference being in Deadly Premonition you can just ignore the time restraints and be none the worse) and even the mechanically-driven story setpieces to remind me of Metal Gear Solid's storytelling methods. The near Frankenstein nature of this mish-mash of tones and mechanics will undoubtedly remind you of many products too. 

It's not remotely a serious game, though it does have its serious moments and it benefits heavily from them. The much-touted awful combat becomes merely mediocre if you play it with a gamepad - and you should play it with one. The characters are interesting, the dialogue is brilliant, the story is exactly as mysterious as it tries to be (though in no small part due to its poorly-veiled source material) and even the art direction is consistent and visually appealing, graphical glitches and some aging NPC models aside.

The point is that many people have recommended Deadly Premonition on the basis that "it's so bad it's good". This isn't true. Deadly Premonition is a geuininely good game that has won a cult following despite its shortcomings - I fought tooth and nail to fully complete it simply because I enjoyed it.

But I wouldn't recommend that you play it, because I can't be sure you can.

It took me a good 45 minutes just to get it to start without crashing. Beyond that I was fighting through runtime errors, outright crashes, even the odd Blue Screen of Death - any moment in the game that had me go longer than 20 minutes without a save point was a nerve-wracking nightmare. These aren't some faintly annoying bugs and this game is infamous for its port for a good reason. Right up until the very end my playthrough was plagued by some unseen demon.

For the technologically savvy there is a unique and memorable gem here that has been sadly soiled by its monstrous technical issues. For everyone else, move on. Watch a playthrough on Youtube because it really is worth experiencing, even if second-hand.

review:
This is probably my favourite game ever. 
This is also the worst port I have ever played. 

For a few hours, I thought I was safe from the horrors of the port. I followed recommended fixes, ran it in compatability mode and the like, but it randomly - in full screen mode - being windowed with the rest of the screen black. Then it started crashing, randomly - in the middle of a cutscene, in the middle of a level, in the map screen. 

I paid 2.49 for this and it isn't worth it. 

It really is unplayable. 

Treat yourself and get the XBOX360 version - that I have played through, and yeah, the controls are clunky, but they're clunky no matter what version you play. The XBOX360 version works. I'm planning (when PS3's come down in price) to get the director's cut for the PS3.

Anyway, in terms of the game, this is one of my favourite things ever. Having ran through the game the first playthrough, I'm doing all of the sidequests this time. It is a wonderful, quirky, interesting, strange game. Get it on console and enjoy.
