author: {'steamid': '76561197960272625', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1414311593}
review:
The actual game itself gets a wholehearted recommendation. Though the gameplay is certainly rough around the edges--to say the least--there's an immense amount of charm, humor, and Lynch-esque eccentricities found in the fictional town of Greenvale. Deadly Premonition was never a "so bad it's good" game, but rather a genuinely good experience saddled with a low budget and a couple of design pitfalls. The main issues lie in the combat. The game's director SWERY65 has been on the record stating that the "shooting bits" were not actually a part of the game's original concept. The combat was the last part of the game developed in what seems to be an effort to give the game a broader audience appeal. And it shows. Killing enemies in this game is by no means a dreadful or broken experience, it's just a very barebones and arguably pointless affair--some shallow padding until you reach the next chunk of entertaining story exposition and exploration of the game's quirky world. I'd argue that most people played the Dreamcast classic Shenmue for the exploration, character interaction and investigation segments rather than the just-OK fighting-game showpieces sprinkled throughout. As it follows in Shenmue's footsteps in many ways, Deadly Premonition should be treated in the same regard. Do enjoy the warmth that Greenvale has to offer.

If you can.

The lack of resolutions higher than 720p in this PC port have already been discussed and criticized--and then fixed, by the same dude who made the Dark Souls PC fix. DPFix, however, does not fix the lackluster native controller support and constant crashing. You can go find additional third-party mapping software of course, but as this is originally a console game and advertises controller support on the Steam store page, the exclusion is a bit disappointing. The crashing, on the other hand, is not as immediately remedied. It seems very temperamental and varies from system to system, but across my two Windows 7 and XP machines I've had nothing but instability. I have tried putting the .exe in Windows 98 compatability, numerous restarts, and other tweaks found from various discussion threads. But the game still crashes at the worst, most pivotal moments (like before I can get to a save point) or slows down to an unplayable framerate. The framerate is momentarily fixed by a full system reboot, but the sluggishness and screeching halts always return again and again. I've never seen this kind of thing happen in any other game.

So in a bit of frustration and resignation, I've uninstalled this game and returned to finish the original, Xbox 360 version. But I feel like I'm missing out on the definitive experience. The Director's Cut provides some nice touch-ups, like a better map system, less washed-out graphics, marginally improved driving controls, some extra cutscenes, and an easier default difficulty setting, which basically lowers the sometimes ridiculously high health bars on the various enemies throughout the game. Though there's much talk these days about the dumbing down of modern games--that they're too easy--I can assure you that toning down the frustration in this game is definitely a good thing. Anyone who has spent 30 minutes killing one of the "wall-crawler" enemies in the 360 version should be able to attest. It's attrition, a hurdle, not a fair and invigorating challenge by any means. 

Some people have been able to play this port to completion, sidequests and all. Maybe you're one of them, maybe not. Maybe in a year (or more), the game will be patched up and as nice as the Dark Souls port. Until then, I consider this game an Xbox 360 exclusive (the Playstation 3 Director's Cut port is even worse than the PC version, don't touch it please!).

Buy this port if you like a gamble, Zach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048871968', 'num_games_owned': 1165, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1671, 'last_played': 1388365467}
review:
This is the type of game that will only excite people who get into the characters and story. In concept the game itself is fantastic, but technical flaws narrows the overall appeal to an already niche title. I loved the game, but I feel it's only fair to recommend it with some caveats.

It's a murder mystery with quirky characters. They give the game a lot of heart and fans of the TV show Twin Peaks and 80s pop culture should find some things to love. The juxtaposition of horror and comedy is something special.

Basically this is an open world survival horror game where you drive around and look for clue to further the story. If I remember correctly there are 50 side quests as well. I really liked that many prizes for completing side quests were useful (unlike many open world games). You normally travel by car which is a jarring, experience. The car controls very poorly and has a blind spot where the frame of the windshield is. Opening the large map takes up half the screen and does not display all of the information that the menu map does. As bad as it all sounds, you do get used to it, and fast travel options open up with the right side quest completion. I would say the driving was my biggest peeve.

The combat is familiar to anyone who has played Resident Evil 4 or Dead Space. The controls are a stiffer than expected in the previously mentioned games and aiming is not as easy. There is some required melee combat and all weapons break after a few uses. I was ok with this considering that it's a survival horror game. I never was weaponless during my playthrough. there is not a lot of enemy variation though so be ready to hear "noooo i dooon't want to dieeee!" about over 9000 times.

Though Deadly Premonition still contains a fair amount of jank, it only adds to the wealth of charm within. The end result is a ridiculously original masterpiece that hearkens back to an era where the gaming landscape had more room for wildly imaginative budget games, a far cry from the abundance of focus tested blockbusters that are prevalent today.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967021911', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 3271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1445023569}
review:
The game is nothing short of amazing. The game was heavily inspired by the ill-fated Twin Peaks TV series and draws heavily from it. SWERY65 is not David Lynch but he captures the mysterious atmosphered of a backwater US town perfectly. Don't let the PS2 grade graphics and animations fool you - the game is atmospheric with beautiful soundtrack, interesting characters and plot that makes you sit for hours for no end. The only problems I have with the game are the QTE controls making you look over the whole keyboard for a key to press. That can of course be easily solved by playing with a mouse.

Do this game deserve a playthrough? Yes. You will either love it or hate it, but definetly it's one of the most unique games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983060291', 'num_games_owned': 2781, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 210, 'last_played': 1542908256}
review:
Un "MasterPiece" des enquêtes policières noires et extrêmes. Ici on chasse du foldingue de première catégorie, c'est du lourd. Le tueur se promène en imperméable, le détective reste Zen même après avoir crashé sa Mustang dans la forêt, les références (hommages) au cinéma B/Z sont légions, que du bonheur.

Il faut faire abstraction du game play en couloir, des aides de jeu flashy et d'une gestion d'inventaire quasi laborieuse. A jouer pour [u]l'ambiance[/u] qui réussi à réunir un bon mélange du cinéma B américain, de [i]Twin Peaks[/i] et des prises de têtes japonaises avec les soucis du détail qui vont avec. Le jeu est assez [b]gore[/b] et il n'y a que très peu de concession, c'est définitivement un jeu pour un public adulte. C'est agréable de se retrouver dans un univers très mature avec un rythme qui pourrait dissuader les impulsifs : il faut le jouer cool avec quelques montée en puissance de temps en temps. La bande son du jeu est impeccable et les musiques sont superbes cependant le jeu des doubleurs pour la version anglaise n'est pas parfait.

Le jeu n'est pas fatiguant et le scénario est très bien fait pour permettre de juste couper au bon moment une scène qui pourrait se traîner en longueur. A jouer dans le noir, en sirotant un bon Whisky ou une bonne bouteille de vin rouge (Pinot Noir) au milieu de la nuit quand tout est endormi autour de vous.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985454611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1281, 'last_played': 1387972777}
review: Весьма необычная игра. В ней можно найти много минусов: плохая графика, дурацкие QTE, кривое прицеливание и т.д., однако все эти минусы перевешивает повествование. Начинаясь как аниме-детективчик, вдохновленный Твин Пикс, Deadly Premonition уже в скором времени начинает рвать шаблоны, принося логику в происходящую чертовщину. Если любите игры с сильным сюжетом, где герои заставляют вас сопереживать - это игра для вас. Сама игра скроена по старым лекалам, известным по серии Resident Evil - ходим, отстреливаем монстров, решаем простые головоломки, сохраняемся у печатной маши... эээ... у телефона, да. Только тут еще добавляется сбор улик, примеркно как в L.A. Noire. К финалу однообразный геймплей немного приедается, но твисты сюжета заставляют не обращать на это внимание. Еще нужно предупредить, что игра очень любит вылетать по поводу и без, так что частое сохранение строго обязательно. В общем, если не боитесь трудностей, то Deadly Premonition станет глотком свободы в современном мире простых, шаблонных игр. С учетом всех недостатков - 8.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198040927679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1471, 'last_played': 1489230751}
review:
Twin peaks simulator 2013

If you want to bash Deadly Premonition, just go ahead. There's plenty of stuff here to strike down on. Poor graphics, the ocasionally terrible gamedesign, wonky animations, weird soundmixing, awkward gameplay, the map, bugs and the list goes on. But you would miss out on a truly unique and great experience.
DP is the best FBI-sim/Twin peaks ripoff that money can buy.
The story is the games strongest point, a weird journey that's totally unpredictable and fascinating. The games protagonist is Francis york morgan, a schizophrenic fbi-agent sent to investigate a murder in the small town of Greenvale. He is by far one of the coolest characters i've ever played, and the story and game largely rests on his twisted persona. The relationship with his other personality, Zach, is interesting and in the end truly touching.
One of my favourite things about the game is the contrast between the wierdness, surreal parts and the ordinary mundane small town life. You can just cruise around, doing sidemissions and talking to the people of greenvale. also you can eat lunch, every game should give you the option of having lunch with some of the games characters.
The day/night cycle is pretty slow, so you have plenty of time to hang around.
The dpfix mod fixes some of the worst graphics and will enhance the experience alot. With that installed, just enjoy this game. It's sometimes terrible, other times beautiful, but always worth your while. For fans of Twin peaks and X-files, this is essential.
Don't you agree Zach?

author: {'steamid': '76561198002779721', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 219, 'playtime_forever': 1821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1375, 'last_played': 1631828342}
review:
Wenn ich meinen Freunden versuche Deadly Premonition schmackhaft zu machen, will mir das nie so richtig gelingen. Denn alle Maßstäbe die man sonst so gewohnt ist bei einem Spiel anzulegen scheinen hier irgendwie fehl am Platz. 
Die Grafik ist völlig veraltet, die Steuerung ist mehr als mies, und so weiter und so weiter... 

Trotzdem liebe ich dieses Spiel, ... absurd ich weiß. Aber dennoch hat Deadly Premonition etwas das so vielen Titeln dieser Generation fehlt: eine Vision!!! Die Charaktere und die Story sind so erfrischend einzigartig und voller Tiefgang, dass man manchmal überrascht ist wie weit man in diese Welt eintauchen kann. Greenvale ist ein Ort den man unbedingt mal gesehen haben sollte. Wer es nicht gespielt hat, kann einfach nicht mitreden und verpasst auf jeden Fall einen Meilenstein absteits all der AAA Titel die sich seit Jahren immer wieder selb kopieren und weiderholen!

Одна из лучших игр 2010 или игра , которая,скорее всего, прошла мимо вас.
deadly premonition (я знаю , что мнение нуфага никому неинтересно , но я всё равно его выскажу).
Здесь нужно начать издалека , ибо данный шедевр игровой индустрии можно сравнить с БДСМ, то есть здесь куча минусов , но если вы сможете с ними смирится и преодолеть их, то вы найдёте плюсы , которые перекрывают все страдания и доставляют удовольствия!
Во-первых, это "Внешние отторжение". Дело в том, что всё выглядит ужасно как для своего времени, так и для нашего , и именно на этом этапе отвалятся, ведь многие из нас предпочитают внешнею красоту вместо содержания и их не стоит винить, ибо всё выглядит действительно "непрезентабельно".
Во-вторых, это "Процесс". Он понравится не каждому , ведь он достаточно болезненный ... Да , вы ,скорее всего, в какой-то момент начнёте получать удовольствие от всего происходящего , но всё таки это достаточно тяжело , даже не смотря на попытки не загонят вас в жестокие рамки.
И именно здесь начинается один единственный плюс всего этого , а именно "Содержание". Оно просто прекрасно. Это не просто развлечение на одну ночь, это что-то большее , вы запомните каждое движение, каждое слово , и это именно так, вы получите то, что вы запомните на всю жизнь , а всё что для этого нужно сделать, это преодолеть внешнею неприязнь и стерпеть побои нанесённые в процессе, и я вам обещаю  что вы сидеть в напряжение до самого конца.
И именно поэтому deadly premonition одна из игр достойных покупки.

review:
Это безумие.
Криво все, от управления, камеры и графики до поведения самх персонажей. Абсолютно все.
Это гениально.
Оторваться от игры не возможно, птому что история приковывает к себе раз и навсегда. От начала и до титров.
Это не понятно.
Игра идет по схеме: 20 минут играем, 40 минут смотрим. И не понятно во что играем? Хоррор, квест или симулятор водителя?
Это великолепно.
Спокойно едешь к очередному разговору и веришь кривым моделям персонажей, чувствуя их эмоции и настроение.
Это сплошной плагиат.
Цитаты из "Твин Пикс" прут просто изо всех щелей. От главного героя и второстепенных персонажей до обычного кофе.
Это оригинально.
Другой такой игры просто нет.

Вердикт: если любите хорошую историю или оригинальные проекты строго рекомендую. Если для вас на первом месте геймплей - его здесь просто нет.

review: The production values are last gen, the dialouge is goofy and awkward, the voice acting flip flops between lazy and hammy as hell, and yet...well, somewhere around the second hour this game transformed from a seemingly "me too!" survival horror game to one of the most engrossing open world titles I've ever played. It's been a said a million times, but there seriously isn't anything else like it this gen, and it's more than worth plowing through, if for it's lead character (who is one of the most bizarre and awkward video game protagonists I've ever seen) and it's, despite all odds, more often than not intriguing murder mystery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040912492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1386140808}
review: *15/10, fun for the whole family.* This cultural phenomenon, which will come to define this generation for the next several decades, was most assuredly not inspired by the hit TV show "Twin Peaks" and definitely does not blatantly rip off said show in a hilarious and heartwarming manner. Swery is a tortured genius, and his artistic soul -- tender and tormented -- is laid bare, raw and awesome. It would be a folly comparable to the fall of man to not partake in the seductive madness and ensnaring purity that is Deadly Premonition. If you do just one thing with your life that you can look back on with pride and say, "I did it perfectly" when on your deathbed, let buying and playing this game be that one thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995299097', 'num_games_owned': 1467, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 2934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1611273955}
review:
[quote]Marre de vous faire avoir par les avis de la presse vidéo ludique ? De la complaisance des Youtubeur gaming en échange de cartons de goodies et de collectors dans leurs boites aux lettres ? Alors rejoignez ma page curateur [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/42019176/]Vous ne comprenez rien ![/url] pour des reviews 100% sans filtre ![/quote]


Trouvez lui tout les défauts que vous voulez c'est extra laid, mais Deadly Premonition est a mon sens un des jeux les plus marquants jamais vus, que l'on aime ou que l'on déteste, en tout cas moi je l'aime énormément, et c'est sans conteste un jeu dont je me souviendrais toute ma vie, un jeu qui laisse sa marque au même titre que les mgs.
Et je ne suis certainement pas le seul à dire ça, allez voir l'avis des joueurs <3

Deadly Premonition fait parti de ses jeux TRÈS très rares à qui l'on pardonne toutes ses lacunes, a qui des graphismes pas vraiment au top lui donne un charme absolu, a qui la maniabilité hyper "rétro" le personnalise à merveille, a qui un certain décalage s'il n'était pas présent ne ferait pas ce qui est tellement marquant dans ce jeu. En tout cas, c'est mon avis.
Oui, j'ai aimé ce décalage sonore/situation. Pourquoi faut-il absolument un assemblage parfaitement dans la même veine pour que cela soit cohérent ? Moi j'ai trouvé ça très cohérent, une chose de plus qui pour moi enrichit l'univers si particulier du jeu.
Oui, j'ai carrément adhérer au concept du jeu, avoir des horaires à respecter, les heures qui passent en tant réelles, la météo à surveiller de près, qui, quand elle varie, change quelques éléments du gameplay (on ne peut pas faire certaines missions secondaires lorsqu'il pleut, ou, au contraire, pouvoir faire celles qui ne peuvent être faites lors des beaux jours). Je me suis laissé emporter par un scénario que j'ai beaucoup aimé, que j'ai trouvé excellent et bien amené. J'ai pleuré, rigolé et ai frissonné à certains moments. Je me suis attaché à ces personnages et à leurs personnalités bien particulières et propre à chacun.
j'en suis tombée amoureux.
L'ambiance est tellement.. Je lui ai trouvé tellement de charme, tellement décalée et envoûtante. 
Bref, vous l'aurez compris. Ce jeu, je l'adore.
Les personnes qui osent mettre ne serait-ce qu'en dessous de la moyenne tout ça parce que ça ne ressemble ni a un Uncharted, ni à un God of War, devrait se poser quelques questions sur leur statut de gamer. Parce que quand on est un vrai gamer, on a le droit d'avoir ses propres goûts et ne pas aimer certains jeux. En revanche, descendre un jeu qui n'avait pas les moyens d'être super bien aboutit techniquement mais qui a osé apporté sa propre vision de jeu vidéo, alors qu’apparemment BEAUCOUP de personnes on su passé au dessus de cela et l'aimé tel qu'il est, c'est carrément honteux. Au lieu de se la jouer gamer dans l'âme, apprenez ce qu'est et ce que devrait être un jeu vidéo : quelque chose d'unique, marquant et qui vous fait vivre pleins d'émotions. Et j'ose dire, Deadly Premonition, pour moi, l'a fait.

 Mais ne le regardez avec des yeux de juges, ni jouez pas avec un cahier de charge, profitez simplement de son univers, prenez simplement ce qu'il veut vous apporter.
Et, je suis sûr, que vous l'ayez aimé ou pas, Deadly Premonition est pour un joueur une expérience que l'on n'oublie pas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988763074', 'num_games_owned': 5152, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2288, 'last_played': 1406906925}
review:
Si estabas buscando las 3 B's (Bueno, Bonito y Barato) este es tu juego. Historia de 10, largo, entretenido, más largo aún cumpliendo misiones secundarias, mitad SandBox mitad Survival Horror. Personajes totalmente definidos y estructurados que siguen una "vida rutinaria" en el pueblo dentro del juego en la que tu puedes particiar. Mucha investigación en una historia como pocos videojuegos actuales tienen, variaciones segun las decisiones, momentos épicos, graciosos, tristes. Este juego lo tiene todo y la lastima es no estar más cuidado en su aspecto grafico (problemas de presupuesto en el estudio), por poner alguna pega diré que esta algo desfasado (fué pensado para PS2 y acabó saliendo en xbox360/ps3), la BSO son siempre las mismas canciones y tiene el dudoso honor de ser uno de los peores Ports a PC de la historia. 

Aún así, es un bueno juego y armandote de paciencia puede dar una buena y bonita experiencia. Aprovechad una oferta en steam y pilladlo, es un must have si te gustan este tipo de juegos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028223119', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3147, 'last_played': 1386022991}
review: Well, if you are one those people who can enjoy this masterpiece probably you already own this game, I was waiting for this for a long time I have no consoles so I couldn't play it before, I pretty excited when they announced it for steam, I preordered it without much thought, and when game was released it was pretty much unplayable for me, I can say it was worst port I have ever played, well I don't really care about resolution but when console port has no controller support that's just terrible, not to mention it crashed every 5 minutes or so, so I decided to wait, not long after Durante of NeoGAF famous for his dark souls fix has released resolution fix for this game  and after that some dedicated users made custom icons for controller and somewhat support of for pads via third party softs. Then there was word that devs were planning to release patch to fix all this mess, and they really did after some time. So it's been a month already after the games release till I could play this game but it was really worth the wait, I was already hyped for this game for a long time but it turned out to exceed my expectations like 10 times, and after this patches game was fully playable with no crashes, controller support and thanks to durante with desirable custom resolutions. I played many games this generation but there were only two games that brought me that sense of excitement and joy of gaming that I had only as a child, first game was Dark Souls, and I thought I wouldn't enjoy anything else like that until second DS game was released, well now as I write this I have completed this game 100% and can safely say that it's definitely is in my top 10 games of all time if not in top 5, it just makes me sad that this masterpiece in not  very successful saleswise compared to mainstream 5-7 hour meaningless soulless shooters, but I do hope that as gaming attracts more and more mature audience and is slowly becoming as mainstream as movies, there will be time that developres can take the risks and make games such this one without any fear of failing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003209297', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1386554448}
review: Uno de los mejores juegos que se han creado en muchisimo tiempo, siendo un juego que perfectamente se clasificaria de serie B consigue que nos olvidemos de muchos apartados como los graficos etc... Para meternos de pleno en un pueblo rodeado de misterio y que esconde una historia que nos mantendra enganchados hasta acabarla y la cual jugara con el jugador hasta el final para sorprendernos en muchos momentos. Por si fuese poco una historia increible el juego cuenta con un monton de cosas para hacer como minijuegos, coleccionables, misiones secundarias etc... Ya que no es una historia lineal si no que es un juego de mundo abierto para que podamos profundizar mas en la historia del pueblo y sus habitantes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960282791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 2837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2691, 'last_played': 1385949831}
review: As much as it's ugly, clumsy, buggy, dated technologically and features some dull combat sequences that belong to much older PS2 games, none of its flaws are at all worth avoiding it for. Deadly Premonition features some of the best characters in gaming in the last 15 years, some fantastic and funny dialogue, a moving story, and some of the weirdest atmosphere you'll ever see. Where it fails, it somehow only enhances the experience. And where it succeeds it soars. It's completely and utterl one o fa kind and every gamer should play it on any platform they can find it on, because there's just nothing else like it. When your time comes to a close, you will so deeply miss York, Zach, Emily, Greenvale, and every looney in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050956117', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2543, 'last_played': 1386530160}
review: It's such a good game, unfortunatley a lazy effort on the developers part. At launch there was no controller support, however that has now been patched, but the game itself can still be borderline unplayable unless patched with DPfix (the same person who fixed the Dark Souls port). Even with that patch however the game still suffers from a range of glitches, bugs, crashes and audio/visual problems, still it's hard to not recommend this game. After all it's problems have been sorted out, this is easily one of the best games on Steam, with a good sense of humor and some nice references to certain things in pop culture (such as Twin Peaks), you might want to hold of purchasing it until ALL of the problems have been fixed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053330984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1883, 'last_played': 1500596179}
review:
I played this game years ago, and to this day if someone asked me to name the craziest game I've ever played, or the most annoying game, or most surprising game, OR even one of the best games E-VER - you guessed it. This one right here. 

I've always been a survival horror fan, so it was pretty natural for me to pick this up on the 360 back then. I did not quite get what I was expecting. Deadly Premonition is Twin Peaks meets Silent Hill with many other influences thrown in and brewed into a cup of joe that, well, might be best left to interpretation. The game is not perfect. It's awkward at times, annoying at others, sometimes makes no sense and sometimes makes ALL the sense! (yeah) But in the end, I don't think I've forgotten a single thing about it. That is how it stuck with me.

I admit, at times I sincerely hated this game and thought it was the worse piece of crap ever thrown together - a game that tried to be everything and yet couldn't find its place in a proper, comfortable gaming category. I ranted and raved about it to anyone who would listen - but this game was always on my mind. Did I stop playing? No. I HAD to keep going! And I did. 

I remember the day I finally finished it. I told myself "I will beat this game tonight! I will finish it and then I will never have to touch it again!!!" I believed it was doable. I thought I was near the end... And so I played. And played. And just when I thought it would be over... I was mentally exhausted but I couldn't stop! By the time I reached the end it was at least 3 in the morning, and I just sank down in my chair and looked at the screen to see the credits roll by. But even then I was still thinking about it.

It was a gaming experience I have never forgotten. And now I'm ready to do it again!

Thank you, Deadly Premonition, for scaring me and driving me crazy (and also thank you for letting me figure out who the killer was a little ahead of time because of my own clue hunting effort. That was rewarding). And thanks for keeping me awake and for completely exhausting me with your twisty plotline. For that, you earn a special place on my lifetime gaming list.

review: Просто взрыв мозга! Сложно подобрать слова при описании этого мистического детективного экшена. С одной стороны серьёзный сюжет, даже печальная музыка по-началу настраивают на серьёзный лад, но как только нам представляют главного героя - мы просто перестаём понимать что перед нами. Персонаж постоянно разговаривает (якобы) сам с собой, откидывает разного рода шуточки. Всё это действо напоминает американские детективы 60-70х годов - та же не напряжная музыка, даже "игра актёров" слегка "странновата". Всё бы хорошо, если бы не убогое управление (и поверьте - на консолях оно столь же убого!). Только из-за управления поставлю 6 из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198002873247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1489173321}
review: The game itself is brilliant, a kind of murder mystery in the style of twin peaks, with wonderfully cringe worthy dialogue and amazingly juxtaposed humor and horror elements. The game itself is flawed in almost every way, the controls are weird and tanky, the graphics look like a sega dreamcast, and the audio levels are always off. But somehow, it ADDS to the charm of the game, it's lovable BECAUSE of it's flaws. What makes it so very amazing is the writing. Seriously, this game has some of the BEST character development and scripting I've ever freakin seen in a video game, or anything for that matter. I've never ever before WANTED to kill the villian so bad, and felt so invested in all the characters. Really, the game is lovable and wonderful in just about every way. EXCEPT FOR THIS PORT. I played it back on the Xbox on release and loved it, and I have to say this port makes me want to cry. If you can get it to work properly, especially with DPFix by the guy who made DSFix, you'll have a blast. Otherwise, you'll be lucky to get so far as a three hours in before crashes just cut your journey short.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008784652', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1448, 'last_played': 1412531268}
review:
One of the oddest videogames I've ever played. Despite having virtually no production-value and the lack of polished gameplay, it manages to stand on the strength of its gripping murder-mystery story, its weird and wonderful freakshow of characters and how aware of its own campiness it is. It's an experience like no other that I can recommend solely for that reason.

Only true downside is the PC port. It’s awful. Downloading fan-made fixes and messing with .exe properties isn't much fun. A patch that Rising Star Games promises is on the way may fix this, but for now, just take note.

Overall, even with the shoddy PC job, its one of the most memorable games in recent memory. Highly recommended if you're into games that are a little out-there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978549358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1426004548}
review:
Do you like weird games? Let me rephrase that. Do you like Resident Evil, Shenmue, Persona and Silent Hill? Do you want to play them at all once?

Deadly premonitions looks bad, controls bad and would overall be a bad game if it were not for the brilliant absudity it offers. Moments of tension and mystery are intersped between hilariously bad writing and super cheesy dilogue. Deadly Premonitions is the rare example of a horror-comedy in video games and is an absoloute must play for anyone. The PC port offers a better control scheme than the PS3 version, but it also comes with it's own limitations. Rising Star gave us one of the worst ports of all time. For some reason the game is locked into 720p and though it touts controller compatability it is entire incompatable with XInput controllers, meaning your 360 or logitech controllers will not work without third party programs. There are a coouple fixes from a clever modder to fix the display issues, but otherwise get the PS3 version instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025297073', 'num_games_owned': 668, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1450739702}
review:
The game itself is good. Wierd story, fun characters, full open world city to drive around and explore in, awesome soundtrack... It's got it's fair share of flaws too on technical levels. Visuals won't earn any awards, awkward lipsynching, hilariously bad and long driving segments... All in all it's good.

However, the PC port is plauged with issues. Vanilla, it's default locked at 720p with no controller support and requires some hoop jumping to get it to run at a playable rate. The DPFix mod fixes the resolution and even adds some graphical options, the game still lacks controller support and crashes constantly to the point where I can't get past the beginning of the first driving segment because it keeps crashing as soon as I hit the accelerator button.

It's a good game, but the PC version is plauged with issues, and some things remain annoyances from the console versions, like the map in the pause menu being completely useless.

If you absolutely must get it now, get the console version. Even with framerate issues, it's at least playable. If you can wait, then do so because when it works, playing Deadly Premonition at native resolution at 60 FPS is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966510539', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1385163696}
review:
Deadly Premonition: The Director’s Cut is a strange beast. This horror game plays like resident evil or silent hill, but feels like Twin Peaks. The game is absurd, terrible, weird, stunning and basically the closest thing to art video games will ever be. The story involves an FBI detective who talks to himself and is rewarded with cash for each card of medal he collects as well as any headshots he performs. He loves headshots. You talk to people, like these weird kids and you collect items to use on things, like this fuse box. Lollipops and donuts can recover your health. 

The game takes on a wider open world feeling later on and between missions you return to this home base of sorts, to get more incomprehensible chunks of plot thrown at you. This game is weird to say the least, but I dig the vibe of it all. You certainly don’t know what it will throw out next. Make sure to grab DPfix, from the maker of the Dark Souls resolution fix, it lets you play the game beyond the 720P default.

Watch the video review on youtube in Steam Shots EP125

author: {'steamid': '76561198028711579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 282, 'playtime_forever': 5807, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1027, 'last_played': 1413759414}
review:
This game makes me want to peek through every single window, despite long loading times between peeking in and getting back. It makes me desperately want to finish it despite the crash that forces you to play it in windowed mode. Its town feels alive, with real inhabitants, despite their quirky animations and weirdnesses.

I get lost driving with those horrible cars that veer right, and laugh to myself at the uselessly zoomed in map. And still, everything intruiges me to such a degree that I would call this a once-in-a-lifetime experience that I would never want to be withouth.

There is so much to do and see, that I found myself fainting outside of an ingame diner and woke up after being driven to the hospital. Surprised I realised I had let my loveable strange FBI agent go too long withouth eating.
Similiarly I noticed flies started gathering around me at one point, because I had not changed clothes and sent my worn ones to get washed. I'm growing a beard as the game progresses, as I have not choosen to shave. 

The story is full of twists and turns. Every character IS a character, with motivations, secrets, a backstory... They all seem to have lived their lives up to the point you join them in the game. The side quests, silly as they may be, seem to fit in the world.
Seldom does one come across a game that can make the gamer so immersed, it has the ability to frighten, make one laugh out loud, as well as puzzle and feel sad.

Cult classic: The mystery, the music, the ugliness, the beauty, the people, the humour, the dialouge... This Japanese tribute to Twin Peaks and movie trivia is beyond words. With all it's flaws, it's simply genius.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015710772', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 748, 'last_played': 1710875609}
review:
Gutes Spiel in Silent Hill Tradition mit Anleihen bei David Lynch

Die Steuerung ist ein graus, auch die hin und wieder eintretenden Bugs (Abstürze, Nicht-reagieren der Spielfigur, etc) nerven mitunter, hindern auch den Spielfluss. Woran ich mich weniger störe, dass das Game von Haus aus keine 1080p Skalierung bietet. Fan Mods und patches helfen hier mittlerweile ab. Die Portierung hätte wahrlich besser sein können. 
Auch etwas abgestimmter auf Maus und Tastatur. Empfehlung ist hier in der Tat ein Gamepad zu nutzen (ich mag die Dinger wirklich nicht, mir ist es lieber ich sehe mich mit der Maus um und gehe per Tastatur, da habe ich schlicht mehr Übung drinne)

Allerdings macht das Spiel durch seine ungewöhnliche Atmosphäre alles wieder wett. Die Story ist für ein Spiel ordentlich durchdacht und absurd obendrein, muss man natürlich mögen. Inhaltlich gibt es viel zu tun. Die Gegend will erkundet werden, auch abseits der eigentlichen Aufgabe. 
Die musikalische Untermalung ist teils mit absoluten Ohrwürmern gefüllt und fast jederzeit passend und wertet die ohnehin schon fantastische Grundstimmung des Spiels ungemein auf. 

Wer Lost Highway als Glanzstück des Films benennt, ist hier richtig. Wer Silent Hill hoch und runter gespielt hat, wird hieran ebenso seinen Spaß haben. Resident Evil Jüngern kann man es auch noch empfehlen. Wer japanische Popkultur mag und sich schon so manchen verrückten Kram von denen angetan hat, herzlich Willkommen.
Alle anderen sollten eher einen großen Bogen machen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035059626', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2939, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2939, 'last_played': 1385621203}
review:
Filled with a patent strangeness not unlike that of Twin Peaks, Deadly Premonition provides an incredibly memorable cast of characters and an excellent story that will keep you guessing until the end. The game is thrilling, suspenseful, intense, cheesy, and ridiculous, with the right balance of each. It has relatively low production values, but it's almost endearing, feeling akin to cult B movies. This game has solidified itself as one of my favourites. I have no doubt I will come back and play this game again many times in the years to come, reliving the story and getting to know the citizens of Greenvale all over again. Right, Zach?

A quick disclaimer: This game is a relatively poorly done console port, so at the time of writing, there are some technical issues. I found the experience was greatly enhanced by using DPFix and JoyToKey to play with a controller with better looking visuals. Crashes were rare for me, and I was able to play the game without too many problems, but some others have had trouble running the game. The developers have expressed intent to fix these issues, though, so we will hopefully see an improvement soon.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990501076', 'num_games_owned': 2216, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2189, 'last_played': 1383948608}
review:
It's really hard to rate Deadly Premonition. In one hand it's utterly broken, buggy and sometimes even outdated, but it's also very clever, atmospheric and unique. Basically DP is an open-world investigating taking place in a little town, just like Twin Peaks. But this description just doesn't cut it. It's also extremely bizarre, weird and often creepy. The "side quests" are also very  different from what you're used to, they mostly revolve around getting to know the people of Greenvale, and actually this is how I spent around 3/4 of my almost 40 hour playthrough... just getting to know this town and the people living in it. York (and Zach) the 2 in 1 detective, George the king of the town, Harry the weird millionaire who always wears a mask for some reason... and even though you get to know the characters very well, they still managed to keep the thing that are important well hidden, lurking in the background, just so they can surprise you with it later. The story and the narrative are just perfect. Same could be said for the soundtrack and the voice actors, all top-notch.
All in all Deadly Premonition is a terribly broken, ugly (and despite these) amazing game, which I'd wholeheartedly recommend to all my friends :) This is probably as close as we'll ever gonna get to a Twin Peaks game folks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198092481272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9213, 'last_played': 1387226560}
review:
Шикарнейшая игра, проходил очень давно на приставке. а тут порт пс 3 завезли дополненный 200 нововведений и "подтянутой" HD-

графикой. Графика в игре отпугивает, но берёт сюжетом, кто сомневается тогда попробуйте прохождение на ютубе. Мистика как многие говорят не идёт игре; всё - таки есть шарм который игре на пользу. В игре богатый арсенал интересного оружия и просто барахла для галочки, геймплей сам по себе очень скучный и невыразительный, в принципе геймплей в игре и не нужен так как вся игра держится на сюжете. В мире игры куча отсылок ко многому, даже бурлящая жизнь городка со своими немногочисленными жителями напоминает жителей сериала "Твин Пикс", их интересно послушать и даже повыполнять у кого-то второстепенные миссии, опять же из-за интересных моментов или юмора;просто хорошо прописанных монологов, диалогов с этими персонажами.

Игре очень не хватает качественного перевода официального, хотя бы в виде субтитров, для того чтобы погрузиться в сюжет у кого плох англ.язык. Очень удивительно, то что такую игру невыразительную для многих решили портировать на пк-платформу, хотелось бы побольше на ПК таких игр в которые интересно играть, потому что многие любят играть в игры из-за хорошего интригующего сюжета.

review: Played the crap out of this when it was first released on the Xbox 360. This is often thrown into the pool of "so bad it's good" games, but I absolutely disagree with this notion. This game is incredible. It is flawed, very flawed, but it has character and soul that most games lack in abundance. It's fun, interesting, and it's really an unforetable experience. For best results, watch all of Twin Peaks before taking the dive into Deadly Premonition, which pays homage to Twin Peaks in really charming ways. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197980436972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1668549491}
review:
Deadly Premonition is my favorite game of the entire generation.
It's plot, characters and setting are just that engaging every time you come back you still have a great time.
The story may sound familiar if you have watched twin peaks in that a girl is murdered in a small town out in the boondocks of america and its up to FBI Special Agent Francis York Morgan to solve the crime (Call him york by the way, everyone does) but as he arrives in the small town of Greenvale things are not what they seem 
with strange phenomenon involving red seeds and a legend of a killer in a red raincoat that only appears on rainy nights.
The game bursts and ozzs with personality and charm from the music that plays in the opening menu to the way that York interacts with Zach (his special friend) about b-movies.
The directors cut that was originally released on PS3 boasts a new scenes that expand the games ending and also tell the story in a different way.
The PC version however brings very little to the table by only offering halloween themed suits for York, Emily, The Raincoat Killer and a car skin and even though the game now runs past 30FPS it just doesn't feel right at that speed as it feels to fast...
Another issue is that since the directors cut features reworked movement it feels clunky on the pc without a controller while if it used the original versions tank style controls (which I actually liked) then maybe it wouldn't feel so wierd on PC.
The last issue that I have that wasn't addressed in the directors cut is the timing of certain music I will give you an example You're examing a dead body and this forboding unerving music is playing then suddenly it changes to light hearted jazz I will admit I got a laugh out of it the first time around and this is the only time I can really remember this happening.

All complaints aside
Deadly Premonition: The Director's Cut is a game that you have to own
Everything about it feels right and it was the game to renew my faith that games can exceed the bar in many aspects without needing multiplayer, graphics with volumetric lighting (otherwise known as WANK)
You are a fool to dismiss such a fine game and even more of a fool to insult it
One of the generations top games
100000000000/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014008704', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2563, 'last_played': 1678396987}
review:
I own every release of Deadly Premonition that has come out, and have now completed all versions and earned every achievement / trophy across Xbox, PlayStation and Steam possible. It's easily my favorite game of all time, even though I admittedly picked it up with some hesitation when it first released on the Xbox 360 at $20. I bought this version 7 years ago when it released for my Vista, unaware of the issues of this port.

That being said, this port is god awful. Somehow using Windows 8.1 and no video card, only the integrated graphics, I was able to finish it in it's entirety. I played it without installing the Windows .NET or PhysX that it tries to auto-install on bootup. I did not install DPFix. The port itself is barebones with only the option to customize your controls and use a controller or a keyboard and mouse setup.

I routinely made save backups after reading about corrupted save files, but luckily did not have any corruptions.

I had 2 hardlock crashes where I had to restart the whole system, 8 crashes with errors, and a couple crashes on startup. One time the game just would not start, no errors or anything. I ran the main program as administrator once, and never had the issue again. The crashes seemed random, although during the 'wait after the diner closes' part of the story, I opened the gate, smoked until it closed, and then stepped into the mission circle.

One other part that blocked progress was being stuck in the Milk Barn unable to leave, but I believe this happened on the PS3 version so I remembered to just smoke until it forced me out of the store.

There were problems rendering miscellaneous objects in the main world, but no issues otherwise. It was mostly just fences, parked cars and tombstones that either would not load or load after 5 minutes.

Playing with only the integrated graphics I was averaging about 20 fps, the worst part was the 'running' segments where you have to alternate left and right repeatedly, the last boss took about 5 minutes to even get to the next phase. And the instant kill QTEs were nearly impossible during the Raincoat running segments.

My greatest fear was crashing during the Boss Rush mode, but luckily that never happened.

With all that said, I do NOT recommend this port unless you have no other way to play Deadly Premonition (on PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 or Nintendo Switch). At least with Steam's refund policy as well as the fan patch, you can always try to see if it works for you and if not you can get your money back. I read that using DPFix should rectify a lot of crashing as well as open up display and resolution options, I will try it out when I upgrade my Windows 10 computer sometime in the future.

review:
Pure B-Movie in game form. It is amazing.

If you happen to make it through to the end of the game you find a plot that is seriously messed up. No healthy mind could have thought of something this twisted. You need this game.

As a small side note, this is a straight port so there are no PC options. That means  you are locked at 1280x720 and for some insane reason there is no controller support at all. Luckily the genius behind the Dark Souls Graphic Fix, Durante, is on the job once again. Here's hoping he can get controller support in there too... Of course, with resolutions higher than 1280x720 you will probably need whole new textures for a few in-game items but I think we could see that from a modder in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015327809', 'num_games_owned': 1108, 'num_reviews': 352, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1388463209}
review:
Deadly Premonition can be best described with the old adage, "Don't judge a book by its cover". At first glance it’s a clunky RE4 clone with bland combat  that looks more at home in 1999 on the Dreamcast than a modern console or PC. But if you play past the first area you’d start to see what makes the game truly great and why its become such a beloved cult classic, its writing. DP’s cast is a gaggle of lovable goofballs with all their own weird quirks, most prominent of all being the protagonist, York, who loves spending time shooting the shit with his imaginary friend named Zach about John Hughes movies and The Ramones, divining the future through  the morning coffee, or going around town staring into people‘s windows.  It’s no secret that DP is practically Twin Peaks: The Game and it wears it love for that show and all kind of 80‘s pop culture on  its sleeve. The plot is actually rather good too considering and it actually gets pretty damn dark but it somehow all works because the game’s characters are likable enough for you to care. DP is just a game full of enthusiastic charm and it has a creativity that most AAA games lack. If you can look past the dated graphics and  sloggy combat you’ll find an endearing game in all its honest B-movie cheese.

Be warned though that this port isn’t all that great, but the same dude that patched Dark Souls is on the case and it looks like with his help this will be the definitive version of the game. So if you’re a bit on the fence wait until that comes out before buying it which shouldn’t be too long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046090535', 'num_games_owned': 3884, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1475212929}
review:
If I ever wrote a book with a video game topic the title would be "1 Video Game You Must Play Before You Die" and Deadly Premonition would be the subject. In it you would find countless of analysis of the many citizens of Greenvale, a complete study of the main characters quirks and flaws, how to make your own Sinner's Sandwich and why you always should keep your suit pressed and clean.

Hell, I would probably end up writing a sequel. There is just so much going on in this game that one book simply couldn't content everything that needs to be said about Deadly Premonition. 

There are lot of great games out there, but in my view there is only about 3 games that have ever gone far and beyond and pushed what a game really is capable of being. A game that changes the way you will look at games. A game that makes you realize what a fantastic medium games can be, if it's utilized for more than simply being another entertainment form to ultimately make you pass time. A game that ruins gaming.

Deadly Premonition is all that. It's impossible to describe exactly what it is that makes it such a fantastic game. Most people will only shake their heads and it's like trying to describe a miracle to people who never witnessed one.
